The pack does make use of the high end composite C2 construction for the back material (vs a traditional semi-rigid frame) but without the high quality shoulder straps and pivoting hip belt to support it the C2 becomes more of a weight saver and marketing feature... it is definitely not a back saver because it does not make moderate weight loads comfortable to carry when it is mated to a low end shoulder/hip belt setup.The final straw and ultimate deal breaker for me with this pack is that the water reservoir pocket, while thoughtfully located to allow refilling without opening the main pack body was undersized.  I was unsuccessful at stuffing a 3 liter water bladder into the compartment although a 2 liter would fit fine.  There is also no dedicated hydration port for the water tube, instead there are two zippers for the compartment so that the user can zip them and guide the water tube into the desired position... that's not a bad idea but zippers inevitably move around and open up, so this hiker thinks a dedicated hydration port would have been an improvement.All in all this is a fair pack that primarily owes its fame to being very lightweight at only about 3.5 lbs.  However, the new Osprey Atmos AG packs are only marginally heavier, have a much better suspension and load bearing system and offer some really innovative features such as a dedicated sleeping bag compartment, trekking pole shoulder strap clips, etc.The Arcteryx pack just can't cut it against the competition in this segment.  Instead of taking the hugely successful Altra 65 and downsizing it slightly and offering it for a slightly lower price, Arcteryx have made a budget pack that bears none of the Altra 65 revolutionary features, slapped a $289 MSRP on it and hope that their brand name and the light weight of the pack will be enough to sell it to consumers.If you want a light weight pack with minimal organizational capabilities, do yourself a favor and get a better designed 35 liter pack.  If you really need the space of a 50 liter pack for multi night hikes then do some research and get one of the several other brand packs out there that offer way more bang for the buck than this pack.

After my last purchase, I was invited to choose and review this free package of BulkSupplements Pure Vitamin A Palmitate Powder (50 grams).This is a quote from the Vitamin C Foundation"Vitamin A -Party line is 10,000 IU/day. Here's how they got this: people were given A in large quantities for long periods, like a year or more. It was found that some few people showed overdose symptoms at 100,000 IU/day, while others showed no such at 100,000,000 IU/day. So, they arbitrarily divided the lowest exposure by ten, so that nobody could possibly show overdose symptoms. This was at the time of the "minimum daily requirement"; it gradually became "daily recommendation" and has now inexplicably become the maximum dose. I read today in "Scientific American" no less, that "Vitamin A in doses over 10,000 IU/day is dangerous". This is entirely hogwash, neglecting both the overall amounts and the individual variation established in the original determinations, known factors requiring more (necessity to use night vision a lot, bright light, fluorescent light, TV/monitor exposure, and disease states). Remember being locked in a dark room for measles, so you didn't go blind? That's because measles completely destroys A, to the point of destroying the optic nerve or retina (can't remember which)- something like 100,000 IU/day of A will prevent that AND get rid of the measles in very short order.Among other things, A is essential to the proper maturation of epithelial cells - that's the skin and mucous membranes which line your insides, including the little pipes that make up your kidneys. Without A, they grow too fast, but don't mature; they then flake off, plugging up the pipes. They also don't produce mucous correctly, and thereby fail to prevent bacteria from getting into the membranes. That's how you get colds and such, including virtually all infections. Further, the flaked off cells act as food for bacteria, creating a nice incubator for evil things.Many eye problems are a result of A deficiencyM&M take 30,000-50,000 IU/day; I did too, for a long time, but was still showing deficiency symptoms (ALL my life!). When I found out what was the "basis" for the recommendations, I started increasing my intake. I took 80,000/day for several months until everything cleared up, then went back down to 40,000 - not enough, so I went to 70,000 - OK; then back to 50,000 = not enough, so back to 70,000; will try 60,000 sometime.A is commonly sold in 10,000 IU caps since that's the "maximum" permitted by law. It generally comes with 400 IU of vit D, see below. Should be "from fish liver oils" -FRM (contributor known as gofanu)The following is a list of clinical trials, most double-blinded and placebo-controlled, recorded at the National Medical Library, MEDLINE, as abstracted by GreenMedInfo for Vitamin A:1. I run five 50-second sprints everyday over a rough dirt track timing myself with a stopwatch and so far my knees and ankles are in great shape. I bought this Glucosamine HCL to keep those knees and ankles healthy. Several years ago while jogging, my knees made a lot of noise -  painlessly popping and banging around - not anymore, however. One finger of my left hand had pretty bad arthritis. Now it is OK. I do want to stay healthy. Also, my low back nowadays hurts a little all the time - even while laying in bed. If the glucosamine can help this I will be truly grateful.The Examine website says, "Glucosamine sulfate salts are the best way to supplement glucosamine, with glucosamine sulfate as a close second. Glucosamine hydrochloride is ineffective. N-Acetylglucosamine is not glucosamine and should be considered a different supplement." Later on they say, "No significant benefits [are] seen on lower back pain; all benefits associated with glucosamine are related to the knee."GreenMedInfo, quoted later in this review, says from within a double-blinded and placebo-controlled clinical trial that, "Glucosamine sulfate and glucosamine HCL are equally effective in the treatment of knee osteoarthritis."So, I am a little worried. Next time I might buy the BulkSupplements D-Glucosamine Sulfate Potassium Powder, instead. The price is the same. Still, I expect the glucosamine HCL I have on hand to keep my knees in shape for the next six months or so.The following is a list of clinical trials, most double-blinded and placebo-controlled, recorded at the National Medical Library, MEDLINE, as abstracted by GreenMedInfo for glucosamine:1. Glucosamine sulfate and glucosamine HCL are equally effective in the treatment of knee osteoarthritis.2. Use of glucosamine reduces the risk of lung cancer risk.3. A combination of glucosamine sulfate, sodium hyaluronate, chondroitin sulfate, quercetin and rutin improve symptoms of interstitial cystitis/painful bladder syndrome.4. A combination of glucosamine, chondroitin and quercetin significantly improve the symptoms of osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis.5. Glucosamine extracted from shrimp does not demonstrate allergenicity in those allergic to shrimp.6. Glucosamine improves symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis.7. Glucosamine shows great therapeutic potential in the treatment of degenerative osteoarthritis.8. Glucosamine sulfate significantly decreases the need for total knee replacement.9. Glycosaminoglycans like glucosamine may contribute to improving conditions like ulcerative colitis, Crohn's disease and interstitial cystitis.10. Glucosamine abrogates the acute phase of experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis.11. Glucosamine exerts a neuroprotective effect via suppression of inflammation in rat brain ischemia/reperfusion injury.12. Glucosamine shows promise in treating inflammatory bowel diseases like colitis.13. Glucosamine/chondroitin sulfate has therapeutic activity in dogs with osteoarthritis.14. Chondroitin sulfate and glucosamine sulfate are potent inhibitors of HIV.15. Elderberry, Chondroitin, Glucosamine Sulfate and Olive Leaf have been found to block HIV replication.16. Glucosamine and chondroitin sulfate may treat symptomatic spinal disc degeneration.17. Glucosamine anticancer activity may be due to its ability to inhibit the transglutaminase 2 enzyme.18. Review: Glucosamine is safe in healthy individuals and diabetics.19. Glucosamine has anticancer activity on human hepatoma.Stacks Updated 10/28/15:The morning pre-workout stack (mostly BulkSupplements products at a daily cost of $ $1.12 that I drink thirty minutes before running five 50-second sprints is as follows:1. I have been taking one 12 mg softgel of this Nutrex astaxanthin for a year now. Eight months before that I was taking two or three 4 mg softgels of the Nutrigold brand. I am happy to only have to take a single softgel and the price/mg is much better than any other brand. I am healthy in every way - good joints (although arthritic several years ago), very good eyes and brain, and very good athletic ability - so I cannot tell if astaxanthin is the reason for this - although it certainly must help. I take plenty of other supplements, as well. The only things I am really sure of being due to the astaxanthin is the bright red-tan color of my skin and its absolutely bullet-proof resistance to sunburn.Stacks Updated 10/28/15:The morning pre-workout stack (mostly BulkSupplements products at a daily cost of $ $1.12 that I drink thirty minutes before running five 50-second sprints is as follows:1. I use a flour sifter to thoroughly mix the supplement powders.The following is a list of clinical trials, most double-blinded and placebo-controlled, recorded at the National Medical Library, MEDLINE, as abstracted by GreenMedInfo for Astaxanthin:1. A combination of nutrients [Astaxanthin, Carotenoids, Vitamin C, Vitamin E, Zinc] improves age-related macular degeneration.2. A dietary supplement containing astaxanthin and saw palmetto berry extract decrease dihydrotestosterone, increase testosterone and decrease estradiol levels in healthy males.3. A formula containing calcium, vitamin D3, lycopene, astaxanthin, and citrus bioflavonoids reduces climacteric symptoms in menopausal women.4. Astaxanthin addition improves human neutrophils function.5. Astaxanthin derived from Haematococcus pluvialis improves the skin condition in both women and men.6. Astaxanthin has a positive effect on lipid profiles and oxidative stress in overweight subjects.7. Astaxanthin has antioxidant properties in soccer players.8. Astaxanthin improves oxidative stress in overweight and obese adults.9. Astaxanthin increases blood flow in the eyes as measured by increased choroidal blood flow velocity.10. Astaxanthin prevents in vitro auto-oxidative injury in human lymphocytes.11. Astaxanthin protects smokers against oxidative stress.12. Astaxanthin reduces reflux symptoms in patients, especially in those with pronounced H. pylori infection.13. Astaxanthin significantly improves athletic performance as measured by cycling time.14. Astaxanthin supplementation may have a beneficial effect on muscle damage and oxidative stress markers in athletes.15. Astaxanthin supplementation reduces lipid peroxidation.16. Astaxanthin supplementation results in measurable improvement in the antioxidant status of human subjects.17. Astaxanthin-rich Haematococcus pluvialis extract improves cognitive function in the healthy aged individuals.18. Bioavailability Study: Administration [of Astaxanthin] After-Meal Significantly Improves Availability.19. Safety Study: 6 mg of astaxanthin a day is associated with no adverse effects in humans.20. The antioxidants astaxanthin and vitamin C promoted a significant improvement in the function of neutrophils and in the redox status.21. "Astaxanthin inhibits thrombosis in cerebral vessels of stroke-prone spontaneously hypertensive rats."22. A calorie restricted diet and carotenoids delay the onset of symptoms of lymphadenopathy and proteinuria in mice.23. A combination of astaxanthin and fish oil supplementation alters antioxidant enzyme profile of dental pulp tissue.24. A combination of astaxanthin, Ginkgo biloba and vitamin C is equal to or better than ibuprofen for reducing asthma-associated respiratory inflammation.25. Alpha-tocopherol and astaxanthin have anti-atherogenic properties.26. An astaxanthin-rich red yeast reduces oxidative stress in rainbow trout.27. An astaxanthin extract appears to mitigate the progression of atherosclerosis in the animal model.28. An astaxanthin-rich algal powder improves memory in mice.29. Essential amino acids, omega-3 fatty acids, and an astaxanthin-rich crayfish extract reduces symptoms of cachexia and improves survival in rats with cancer.30. Antioxidant therapy protects against nonalcoholic fatty liver disease.31. Astaxanthin prevents mammary tumor initiation, but may be contradicted after tumor initiation.32. Astaxanthin has a suppressive effect on retinal injury induced by elevated intraocular pressure.33. Astaxanthin improves artery thickness and vascular elastin in hypertension.34. Astaxanthin ameliorates endothelial dysfunction in diabetic rats.35. Astaxanthin ameliorates features of metabolic syndrome in a rat model.36. Astaxanthin ameliorates the redox imbalance in lymphocytes of experimental diabetic rats.37. Astaxanthin and fish oil work synergistically to improve glutathione-based redox balance in rat plasma and neutrophils.38. Astaxanthin and vitamin C protect rats against stress-induced gastric ulceration.39. Astaxanthin and vitamin E may increase the endogenous production of coenzyme q10.40. Astaxanthin antagonizes [reduces] the impairing, depressive effect of acute alcohol consumption.41. Astaxanthin conjugates exhibit cardioprotective properties.42. Astaxanthin exhibits anti-cancer properties in a rat liver cancer cell line.43. Astaxanthin exhibits anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer activity in a rat model of colon cancer.44. Astaxanthin exhibits antihypertensive and neuroprotective effects in animals.45. Astaxanthin from H. pluvialis shows better bioavailability than beta-carotene and lutein and has significant antioxidant properties.46. Astaxanthin has a therapeutic effect in obese mice fed a high-fat diet.47. Astaxanthin has an inhibitory effect on oxidative stress in diabetic rats.48. Astaxanthin has cardioprotective properties.49. Astaxanthin has neuroprotective properties in an animal model of focal cerebral artery occlusion.50. Astaxanthin has radioprotective properties against cobalt-60 gamma radiation induced oxidative stress and DNA damage.51. Astaxanthin has significant anti-hypertensive potential.52. Astaxanthin improves diabetic complications associated with dental pulp tissue.53. Astaxanthin improves endurance and increases the utilization of fatty acids as an energy source in mice.54. Astaxanthin improves lipid metabolism in exercise in mice.55. Astaxanthin improves the sperm parameters and fertility in an animal model.56. Astaxanthin in combination with alpha-tocopherol has an inhibitory effect on oxidative stress in diabetic rats.57. Astaxanthin inhibits liver metastasis of mastocytoma cells in an animal model.58. Astaxanthin inhibits mammary tumor growth more effectively than canthaxanthin and beta-carotene.59. Astaxanthin intervention ameliorates cyclophosphamide-induced oxidative stress, DNA damage and early hepatocarcinogenesis in rat.60. Astaxanthin limits exercise-induced skeletal and cardiac muscle damage in mice.61. Astaxanthin may attenuate diabetes associated coagulatory, oxidative, and inflammatory stress.62. Astaxanthin positively modulates age-associated mitochondrial dysfunction in healthy dogs.63. Astaxanthin prevented hypercholesterolemia-induced protein oxidation and protein oxidation per se.64. Astaxanthin prevents chemically-induced fibrosarcoma cell proliferation.65. Astaxanthin prevents fish-oil induced oxidative stress in the anterior forebrain of animals, resulting in an anxiety reducing effect.66. Astaxanthin prevents fructose-induced adverse changes in insulin signaling and inflammation in obese rats.67. Astaxanthin prevents loss of insulin signaling and improves glucose metabolism in liver of insulin resistant mice.68. Astaxanthin prevents nephropathy in diabetic mice.69. Astaxanthin prevents the increase of lipid and protein oxidation associated with mercury poisoning.70. Astaxanthin protects against 2,3,7,8-tetrachlorodibenzo-p-dioxin-induced liver injury in rats.71. Astaxanthin protects against alcohol-induced cortical spreading depression in rats.72, Astaxanthin protects against chemically induced colonic preneoplastic progression in rats.73. Astaxanthin protects against cyclophosphamide-induced oxidative stress and DNA damage.74. Astaxanthin protects against gastric ulcer formation.75. Astaxanthin protects beta-cells against glucose toxicity in diabetic mice.76. Astaxanthin protects rats against naproxen-induced gastric ulceration.77. Astaxanthin protects retinal cells against oxidative damage.78. Astaxanthin reduces ischemic brain injury in adult rats.79. Astaxanthin reduces oxidative stress in atherosclerotic rabbits.80. Astaxanthin reduces stillbirth rates in animals.81. Astaxanthin reduces the susceptibility to oxidation and potentiates the immunomodulatory properties of fish oil.82. Astaxanthin restores the enzymatic antioxidant profile in salivary gland of alloxan-induced diabetic rats.83. Astaxanthin-rich algal meal and vitamin C inhibit Helicobacter pylori infection in mice.84. Dietary astaxanthin inhibits colitis and colitis-associated colon carcinogenesis in mice.85. Dietary beta-carotene and astaxanthin but not canthaxanthin stimulate splenocyte function in mice.86. High dose astaxanthin compares favorably to the drugs captopril and pioglitazone at lowering blood pressure, increasing insulin sensitivity and reducing restraint stress.87. Retinol-deficient rats can convert a pharmacological dose of astaxanthin to retinol. Astaxanthin has antioxidant properties superior to lutein and beta-carotene.88. Supplemental astaxanthin protects cellular function extending lifespan in the roundworm.89. The carotenoids bixin, canthaxanthin and astaxanthin induce rat lung and kidney xenobiotic metabolizing enzymes.90. Topical astaxanthin administration may be a candidate treatment to limit the damages by UV irradiation with wide clinical applications.91. Treatment of H. pylori infected mice with antioxidant astaxanthin reduces gastric inflammation, bacterial load and modulates cytokine release by splenocytes.92. Astaxanthin and saw palmetto extract decrease the growth of prostatic cancer cells via 5-alpha reductase inhibition.93. Astaxanthin attenuates the UVB-induced secretion of prostaglandin E(2) and interleukin-8, indicating its possible role in minimizing inflammation associated with skin damage.94. Astaxanthin demonstrates anti-cancer activity against liver cancer.95. Astaxanthin exhibits neuroprotective properties.96. Astaxanthin has a protective effect against 6-hydroxydopamine-induced neurotoxicity.97. Astaxanthin has cytoprotective properties against glycated protein/iron chelate-induced toxicity in human umbilical vein endothelial cells.98. Astaxanthin in disodium disuccinate form has antioxidant and anti-inflammatory cardioprotective properties.99. Astaxanthin inhibits NF-'B and Wnt/'-catenin signaling pathways via inactivation of Erk/MAPK and PI3K/Akt to induce intrinsic apoptosis in a hamster model of oral cancer.100. Astaxanthin inhibits oxidative stress and cell death in mouse neural progenitor cells.101. Astaxanthin inhibits processes associated with diabetic retinopathy.102. Astaxanthin is superior to canthaxanthin and beta-carotene in preventing UV-induced oxidative damage.103. Astaxanthin may be an ideal neuroprotective adjuvant agent in Alzheimer's disease.104. Astaxanthin may be effective against oxidative stress-associated neurodegeneration.105. Astaxanthin protects against beta-amyloid-induced oxidative stress in neuronal cells.106. Astaxanthin protects cells against ultraviolet radiation induced damage.107. Astaxanthin protects mitochondrial redox state and functional integrity against oxidative stress.108. Astaxanthin protects neuronal cells against oxidative damage.109. Astaxanthin reduces hepatic lipid accumulation by rewiring the transcriptome in lipid-loaded hepatocytes.110. Astaxanthin reduces iron-induced oxidative damage.111. Canthaxanthin and astaxanthin are inducers of xenobiotic detoxifying enzymes.112. Carotenoids exhibit anti-leukemia activity.113. Carotenoids such as beta-carotene, canthaxanthin and astaxanthin have possible immunomodulating activities to enhance the proliferation and functions of murine immunocompetent cells.114. Marine carotenoids have a beneficial affect on cardiovascular risk markers.115. Review: Astaxanthin in cardiovascular health and disease.116. Review: Astaxanthin shows demonstrable promise for slowing a broad range of age-related functional declines.117. Self-assembly and energy transfer in artificial light-harvesting complexes of bacteriochlorophyll C with astaxanthin.118. The astaxanthin-rich alga Haematococcus pluvialis strongly inhibits colon cancer cells.119. Astaxanthin and a ginkgolide B (ginkgo biloba) suppress T lymphocyte activation in asthmatic subjects.

After my last purchase, I was invited to choose and review this free package of BulkSupplements Pure White Willow Bark Extract Powder (100 grams).The following is a list of clinical trials, most double-blinded and placebo-controlled, recorded at the National Medical Library, MEDLINE, as abstracted by GreenMedInfo for Willow Bark:1. Devil's claw, White Willow Bark and Cayenne all show promise in the treatment of back pain.2. Feverfew and white willow are well-tolerated and effective in migraine prevention.3. Willow leaf extract contains anti-tumor agents effective against acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) and acute myeloid leukemia (AML) in mice.4. Adverse effects of white willow bark extracts appear to be minimal as compared to non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs including aspirin.5. Polyphenol extracts of chamomile, meadowsweet and willow bark demonstrated an anti-inflammatory capacity.6. Willow bark contains phytochemicals which combat human colon and lung cancer cells.

I have been taking half a tablet of this Jarrows Methyl-B12 (500 mcg) for a couple of years now. I take it first thing in the morning and it seems to wake me up. The pills are good tasting and I don't mind that it takes a while for them to dissolve in my mouth. (The good taste even provides a sort of motivation to get up in the morning.) The xylitol carrier, I know, is good for the teeth, so I don't have to brush first thing in the morning. The bacteria in the mouth try to digest the xylitol, a sugar alcohol, but cannot succeed. They keep trying to digest it but end up burning themselves out and dying, instead. Also, when exercising, running sprints in the morning, I know that I am protected against the increased risk of infection, colds, and tooth decay, if I happen to breathe through my mouth and get a dry throat. I do make a concerted effort to breathe through my nose at all times even during the most extreme sprints. If I don't, I find myself mouth-breathing during other times of the day, as well. No way am I going to start such a bad habit. It is helpful to have the Jarrows lozenge in my mouth while sprinting.Stacks Updated 10/28/15:The morning pre-workout stack (mostly BulkSupplements products at a daily cost of $ $1.12 that I drink thirty minutes before running five 50-second sprints is as follows:1. The BulkSupplements website says that this ascorbic acid is exclusively L-ascorbic acid, is Non-GMO, has absolutely no additives, and is certified US Pharmaceutical grade (indicating a very high level of purity). These statements, plus the fact that the price is very reasonable gives me reason to buy it and rate it five stars. I consider this pure ascorbic acid a "find" and I am very happy with it.The ascorbic acid is probably made in China. The "Non-GMO" is a hint as China has little GMO corn. (In just the last few days, Chinese government officials were caught digging up and stealing hybrid corn seeds from a US seed development facility.) Nevertheless, the Chinese are fully capable of doing everything it takes to inexpensively manufacture very high purity ascorbic acid. Yes, the Chinese have extreme environmental pollution including the use of banned agricultural chemicals and a cultural tendency to adulterate food products, but BulkSupplements can just tell their Chinese suppliers, "If your shipping container full of product does not pass our US-based purity tests, you do not get paid." The BulkSupplements "manufacturing" facility in Nevada, I think, only does testing, final packaging, and order delivery.Bottom line: If this l-ascorbic acid passes US-based purity tests well enough to be certified US pharmaceutical grade, then it does not matter where it was grown, processed and purified.Incidentally, it is very easy to purify "single-species" substances like l-ascorbic acid by a process called recrystallization. Ascorbic acid is created by the conversion of glucose, which comes from cooking cornstarch. The raw l-ascorbic acid solution is slowly cooled so that crystals start to form. The lattice surface of each growing crystal rejects molecule by molecule anything that is not l-ascorbic acid. Only l-ascorbic acid molecules are shaped right to fit into the growing crystal lattice. Then, the liquid filtrate containing all the impurities is discarded and the process repeated a few times to get extremely high purity. Whatever poisons, adulterants, lead, mercury, arsenic, herbicides, et cetera, remaining in the final USP-grade ascorbic acid are now completely insignificant. Most BulkSupplements products are "single-species" substances and this is their secret to being able to provide very pure powders at very low cost.

After my last purchase, BulkSupplements invited me to choose and review this free sample of BulkSupplements Pure Vitamin E Powder (100 grams)If you go directly to the Bulksupplements website you will find that this vitamin E is not only natural and contains d-alpha tocopherol, but also contains all eight isomers of the vitamin E family: Alpha, beta, delta, gamma tocopherols, and alpha, beta, delta, gamma tocotrienols.I am very happy to have found this vitamin E. A full spectrum natural vitamin E in a fully mixable powder form at a very inexpensive price is truly a find. This product rates five stars in my book, as do every one of the BulkSupplement products I have reviewed.The only complaint I have about this product, in fact, of all the BulkSupplements products listed on Amazon, is that the product descriptions and the labels are sometimes inadequate. This vitamin E product description is especially bad because at no point on Amazon does it say the vitamin E is natural. (The BulkSupplements website DOES say the vitamin E is natural.) I figured vitamin E this inexpensive had to be the synthetic "dl" variety and for months I didn't want it. (A notorious study reported a few years ago by Consumer's Report Magazine said that vitamin E, normally an antioxidant, turned pro-oxidant at large doses and caused cancer. Later, it was revealed that the vitamin E in the study was the synthetic "dl" variety and that the test subjects were all smokers. Subsequent examination showed that natural vitamin E, d-alpha tocopherol, never causes cancer. However, most antioxidants, including natural vitamin E, at a large enough overdose can turn pro-oxidant reducing the body's total antioxidant store.)Even the Bulksupplements website concerning the label is a little confusing. The thing to do, I think, is to ignore the "700 IU" -- apparently it is just a name (an obsolete name). The conversions are as follows:One serving = 351 mg = 1/8 teaspoon = 246 IU = 820% daily value.(Current FDA daily value is 30 IU.)You can take this serving up to twice a day.From the label:"Other Ingredients:constarch"Free of: sugar, soy, dairy, yeast, gluten, corn and additives."Is "constarch" corn? I would say that BulkSupplements could probably use an editor for their labels (and their Amazon descriptions, too).Most of the BulkSupplements products don't have any additives at all, which is great. I suppose the starch was added (on purpose) to make the vitamin E dry-powder-mixable in a stack, which is how I use it.

Update 4/15/14: Report on the effects of doubling my dosage of DMAE-bitartrate from 700 mg to 1400 mg per day.I bought DMAE Bitartrate three months ago in January and started using 700 mg per day to lighten dark spots on my skin. Since getting no results, I decided last week to double the oral dose of DMAE to 1400 mg per day and apply face cream, as well, (with 3% DMAE added) to my face, hands, and arms. (Since DMAE-bitartrate is only 37% DMAE, it is necessary to add 8% (not 3%) DMAE-bitartrate to the face cream. For a 12-ounce bottle of face cream, this amounts to three level tablespoons of DMAE-bitartrate.) Following is a list of the improvements due to the DMAE supplementation:1. Many websites list the benefits of DMAE (just google dmae dosage), and I reference the hyperhealth website here:"DMAE removes all ... Lipofuscin (a pigment that accumulates in tandem with the progression of the Aging Process) from the ...Heart Muscle, ...Brain, ...Neurons ...and the Skin."This is encouraging, but have to wait and see.2. "DMAE reduces the amount of Sleep required by approximately one hour per night (this effect occurs after six weeks of continuous DMAE use)."Yes! My need to sleep has reduced from eight to seven hours a night. What a welcome benefit.3. "DMAE causes Dreams to become more lucid (vivid)."I am having tremendously vivid and sometimes nightmarish dreams, but I like them. The vividness and awareness during dreams (of what others are communicating and what they really mean, for example) is even greater than that during waking. A scene of the horizon had extreme detail, color, and focus, and I noticed (in the dream) that I didn't have to wear glasses.4. "DMAE may improve Athletic Performance (by improving the body's production of Energy).""... people using DMAE subjectively report increases in their levels of Energy.""DMAE alleviates Fatigue.""DMAE increases Alertness, ...Attention Span, ...Assertiveness, ...Concentration, [and] ...Willpower."I run five 50-second sprints in the mornings timing myself with a watch. These sprints bumped up from three times a week to seven times a week when I started DMAE several months ago. But, I noticed that my times were about two seconds better when I took a nootropic stack (with caffeine)compared to when I did not. In the last week, however, doubling the DMAE, the times, without caffeine, have improved by two seconds. I notice the improvement is strictly due to what I am paying attention to while running. The best performance is when I am asking myself over and over, "Am I running swiftly? Am I in the swiftness groove?" (It is not the questions that are important - it is the response - the answers provided by paying attention to the running and trying harder.) Also, I find myself asking or telling myself that I am not afraid - not afraid of unbearable exhaustion or falling down or passing out. Therefore, pour on the coal and go for it even more, (even if you do pass out).

The following is a list of some of the clinical trials testing the many diverse benefits of curcumin from the National Medical Library MEDLINE as abstracted by GreenMedInfo:I intend to boil this powdered turmeric in water so to improve its absorbability from 1% to 12%.1. A complex of curcumin and phosphatidylcholine is effective in reducing the symptoms of osteoarthritis.2. Bioavailability Study: Piperine enhances the serum concentration, extent of absorption and bioavailability of curcumin in both rats and humans with no adverse effects.3. Curcumin and Boswellia serrata are safe and tolerable and helped to improve the levels of an inflammatory cytokine (IL-6).4. Curcumin and capsaicin might represent an alternative approach to protect against vitiligo progression.5. Curcumin appears to enhance clearance of amyloid-beta in Alzheimer's disease patients.6. Curcumin exhibits anti-pre-cancer activity by increasing levels of vitamins C and E, and preventing lipid peroxidation and DNA damage.7. Curcumin has gallbladder emptying properties.8. Curcumin induces programmed cell death and inhibits proinflammatory prostaglandin E2 production in synovial fibroblasts of patients with rheumatoid arthritis.9. Curcumin ingestion and exercise training improve vascular endothelial function in postmenopausal women.10. Curcumin is comparable to chlorhexidine as an anti-inflammatory mouthwash. Thus, it can be considered as an effective adjunct to mechanical periodontal therapy.11. Curcumin is safe and efficacious in treating major depressive disorder.12. Curcumin is safe in humans up to 8,000 mg/day when take by mouth for 3 months and has chemopreventive properties.13. Curcumin may increase insulin production in healthy subjects.14. Curcumin positively modulates blood lipids and reduces lipid peroxidation.15. Curcumin reduces arsenic-induced DNA damage in human subjects.16. Curcumin treatment is safe and superior to drug therapy in patients with active RA.17. Curry consumption improves cognitive function in the elderly.18. Reduction of atherogenic risk in patients with type 2 diabetes by curcuminoid extract: a randomized controlled trial.19. Review: Curcumin has therapeutic potential in multiple sclerosis.20. Soy isoflavones and curcumin suppress PSA [Prostate Specific Antigen] levels in human subjects.21. Tetrahydrocurcumin may contribute to overcoming multidrug resistance of human cancers.22. Tetrahydrocurcumin protects against radiation-induced lipid peroxidation.23. The anti-breast cancer activity of curcumin may be due in part to its down-regulation of insulin-like growth factor.24. The dietary polyphenols trans-resveratrol and curcumin interact with cannabinoid receptors indicating their potential role in treating obesity and/or drug dependence.25. There is strong evidence to support the use of curcumin in retinal diseases, Crohn's disease and disorders related to the spinal cord.26. Turmeric and curcumin inhibit aflatoxin induced hemolysis.27. Bioavailability Study: Phosphatidyl choline bound curcumin is superior to curcumin in isolation.28. Both curcumin and its metabolite tetrahydrocurcumin exert neuroprotection against chemically-induced neurotoxicity.29. Coenzyme Q10 and curcumin administration improves retinal histology by reversing the pathological changes due to chronic methanol and establish a morphologically normal retina.30. Turmeric extract supplementation prevents UVB-induced skin aging.31. Cucumin and piperine in combination have a potent anti-genotoxic effect as compared to either agent alone ....32. Curcumin (from Turmeric) in combination with Piperine may attenuate stress-induced depression.33. Curcumin (low dose) may have a therapeutic effect in the treatment of prion diseases.34. Curcumin ameliorates aflatoxin-induced lipid peroxidation in liver, kidney and testis of mice.35. Curcumin ameliorates aflatoxin-induced toxicity.36. Curcumin ameliorates arterial dysfunction and oxidative stress with aging.37. Curcumin ameliorates high glucose-induced adverse changes to the aortic endothelium of rats.38. Curcumin ameliorates memory deficits associated with diabetes in the rat.39. After my last purchase, I was invited to choose and review this free package of BulkSupplements Pure Hyaluronic Acid (Na Hyaluronate) Powder (10 grams).I selected this product because I would very much like to reduce the osteoarthritis in my lower back. Also, I already have on hand DMAE (from BulkSupplements) and vitamin C (pure crystals) so I can make up the solution suggested by other reviewers on this site. (My skin could stand some tightening. When I was younger, I could grab a handful of skin on my neck and pull it way out.) I had earlier purchased pine bark extract and astaxanthin to successfully improve the quality and appearance of my skin. Also, have frequent low-grade headaches that may be caused by prostaglandin E2 (inflammatory hormone) production, which hyaluronic acid may reduce.The following is a list of some of the clinical trials testing the benefits of hyaluronic acid from the National Medical Library MEDLINE as abstracted by GreenMedInfo:1. A combination of glucosamine sulfate, sodium hyaluronate, chondroitin sulfate, quercetin and rutin improve symptoms of interstitial cystitis/painful bladder syndrome.2. Hyaluronic acid injections compare favorably to corticosteroids for the treatment of osteoarthritis of the knee.3. Hyaluronic Acid is effective in preventing recurrent urinary infections.4. Hyaluronic acid may play a therapeutic role in treating bacterial cystitis.5. Hyaluronic acid safely reduces pain and urinary frequency associated with Interstitial Cystitis.6. Intra-articular injections of sodium hyaluronate (Hyalgan) were superior to placebo and well tolerated in patients with osteoarthritis of the knee.7. Supplementation with a natural source of hyaluronic acid (chicken combs) improves symptoms in osteoarthritis of the knee.8. Topical tamarind seed extract and hyaluronic acid are therapeutic in treating dry eye syndrome.9. A combination of turmeric, clarified butter (ghee) and hyaluronic acid stimulates gingival wound healing following surgery.10. Hyaluronan inhibits prostaglandin E2 (inflammatory hormone) production in human macrophages.

After my last purchase, I was invited to choose and review a free sample of  BulkSupplements Pure Biotin 1% (Vitamin B7) Powder (100 grams).Update 5/30/14: Biotin can be depleted using alpha lipoic acid (ALA) and pantothenic acid (vitamin B-5). I think this happened to me. I had read "The Four-hour Body," by Timothy Ferriss, who had said you can't overdose on ALA and had recommended 1200 mg per day. For the last three years I have been taking 1200 mg ALA every day.In just the last few days I have read that ALA, B-5, and biotin share the same multivitamin transporter (the MTV transporter) to get these nutrients out of the blood and into the cells. These nutrients compete for uptake into the cells and biotin is usually the loser.The makers of "Juvenon," a mitochondrial energy boosting supplement containing ALA and acetyl-l-carnitine have done research on this problem as it appears that their Juvenon has caused substantial biotin deficiencies in some of their clients (facial rash, loss of the sense of taste, hair, skin, and nails problems). They found that 5,000 or 10,000 (or more) mcg biotin solved the problems. They said that those with serious deficiencies (one out of a thousand clients) probably had some sort of functional deficiency perhaps in the MTV transporter.I bought the BulkSupplements Biotin several months ago and started taking 3,000 mcg per day. Immediately, my hair became much bushier and I had to get a haircut about twice as often. In fact, earlier, I had noticed that my hair and especially my nails were not as healthy as they should have been. I had even purchased silica and a bunch of other supplements but no help.I had been taking a multivitamin, hadn't I? How could I be short of biotin? I checked the bottles of the different multivitamins I had been taking. The most expensive had only 50% of the RDI/DV (Recommended Daily Intake/Daily Value) of 300 mcg per day. Most of the bottles only had 17% of the RDI. The cheapest bottle, the one that I was using most of the time, had zilch, absolutely no biotin at all.The best recommendation I can find is to supplement (RS) ALA with biotin at a 100:1 ratio. This means if taking 500 mg (RS) ALA or 250 mg of (R-fraction) ALA, then need to take 5 mg biotin. At present, I am taking a daily dose of 250 mg (R-fraction) ALA and 5.192 mg biotin (519.2 mg, 0.098 teaspoon, BulkSupplements Biotin 1%).Additional note: There are four so-called "mitochondrial targeting nutrients,"1. Biotin2. (R-fraction) ALA3. Acetyl-l-carnitine4. Niacin, along with all the other B-vitamins, especially vitamin B-5These mitochondrial targeting nutrients can:1. Enhance mitochondrial energy producing functions2. Reduce oxidative damage in the mitochondria3. Inhibit elevation of apoptosis factors4. Improve immune function.

I use a flour sifter to thoroughly mix the supplement powders.I earlier purchased the BulkSupplements Pure L-Citrulline DL-Malate 1:1 Powder (100 grams) and I thought it was great. Who needs time-released arginine and ornithine when you can have citrulline? So this time I bought the (2:1) ratio -- more citrulline, less malate. The GreenMedInfo clinical trials do not differentiate between the two types of citrulline, so I am running the same list of benefits for the (2:1) that I collected for the (1:1).The following is a list of clinical trials testing the many diverse benefits of citrulline from the National Medical Library MEDLINE as abstracted by GreenMedInfo:1. Administration of L-arginine and citrulline to patients improve the condition of heart failure patients with preserved ejection fraction.2. Citrulline and spirulina may have a therapeutic role in the management of sickle cell disease.3. Citrulline malate enhances athletic anaerobic performance and relieves muscle soreness.4. Improvement of ventricular function in systolic heart failure patients with oral L-citrulline supplementation.5. Oral L-citrulline supplementation attenuates blood pressure response to cold pressor test in young men.6. Oral L-citrulline supplementation improves erection hardness in men with mild erectile dysfunction.7. Short-term l-citrulline supplementation may functionally improve arterial stiffness, independent of blood pressure, in humans.8. The administration of L-arginine and citrulline has a beneficial effect on endothelial function in the treatment of heart failure.9. Watermelon juices (and/or L-citrulline) help to reduce the recovery heart rate and the muscle soreness after 24 h.10. Citrulline increases protein synthesis and protein content in the muscle in old malnourished rats.11. Citrulline malate has a beneficial effect on skeletal muscle function in the endotoxemic rat.12. Citrulline/malate promotes aerobic energy production in human exercising muscle.13. L-Citrulline ameliorates chronic hypoxia-induced pulmonary hypertension in newborn piglets.14. Watermelon pomace (rich in citrulline) significantly ameliorates the metabolic syndrome in diabetic fatty rats.15. Citrulline improves nitric oxide synthesis and improves cardiovascular function in a sustainable way.

I use a flour sifter to thoroughly mix the supplement powders.The following is a list of clinical trials testing the many diverse benefits (and detriments) of supplemental calcium from the National Medical Library MEDLINE as abstracted by GreenMedInfo:1. Calcium ameliorates exercise-induced reduction in testosterone levels, which may be useful for increasing overall athletic performance.2. Calcium content in vegetables is correlated with bitterness.3. Calcium supplementation may actually increase the risk of bone fracture.4. Due to the high hair calcium and magnesium levels in patients with Fibromyalgia supplementation with calcium and magnesium may be beneficial.5. Esophageal cancer is associated with high dietary calcium in a vegetarian population and a low level of zinc.6. High dietary intake of seaweed, calcium, magnesium, and phosphorus may be associated with a decreased prevalence of allergic rhinitis [allergies].7. Maternal calcium supplementation during pregnancy reduces dental caries of children at 12 years of age.8. Mineral water rich in calcium, magnesium and bicarbonate improves urine composition and reduces the risk of calcium oxalate formation.9. Taking calcium supplements without food/at bedtime may increase the risk of calcium oxalate nephrolithiasis.10. Vitamin D and calcium supplementation may improve symptoms in chronic periodontitis.11. Calcium, Vitamin D and a Gluten-Free diet decreased bone pain and improved muscle strength.12. A drug named "Medetopect" consisting of apple pectins, vitamin C and calcium phosphate reduces absorption of Plutonium-239 and Americium-241 from the gastrointestinal tract of animals.13. A Western-style diet produces hyperproliferation of epithelial cells in several organs and that the changes can be prevented by increasing dietary calcium and vitamin D alone.14. Calcium and vitamin D may prevent Western-style diet-induced colonic tumors.15. Ca2+, Mg2+, Zn, and Se have an important role in congestive heart failure.16. Calcium may contribute to atherosclerosis and magnesium prevent it.17. Calcium, vitamin D, vitamin A may have a therapeutic role in diseases such as rosacea and psoriasis by influencing the innate antibiotic and immunomodulator cathelicidin.18. Individuals with untreated celiac disease may have reduced bone mineral density associated with deficiencies of nutrients.19. Review of essential nutrients for bone health and their availability in the average North American diet: [Vitamin D3, vitamin K2, vitamin C, magnesium, exercise, boron, calcium, silicon, zinc, manganese, and copper.]20. Calcium supplementation suppresses bone formation in Mg-deficient rats.21. Food and not supplemental calcium increases nutrient levels.22. Higher calcium and vitamin D intake influences bone mass by creating greater density but does not create greater strength as indicated by no reduction in the 3-year risk of fracture.23. Higher calcium intake correlates with increases in osteoporotic fracture risk.24. Higher consumption of milk or other food sources of calcium by adult women does not protect against hip or forearm fracture.

Dr. Mercola on his website has made the following comments on the use of l-glutamine:"The only safe situation for glutamine use is in the vigorous athlete. Glutamine is used as a muscle fuel, so that vigorous exercise will consume most of the glutamine before it can accumulate in the brain. I would still avoid long-term use in high doses. I would caution readers to avoid excess glutamine ...."Dr. Phil Campbell (with Dr. Mercola on his website) recommends taking two grams l-glutamine before running HIIT (High Intensity Interval Training, five 50-second all-out sprints). He says high intensity exercise can deplete the body of glutamine taking up to a week to get back to normal, thereby compromising the immune system in the interval.One time I took the morning stack, which contains two grams l-glutamine but I was not able to get started on the five 50-second sprints. About two hours later, A huge pressure built up in my head indicating a monosodium-glutamate-like headache coming on. I did a ton of push-ups, sit-ups, et cetera, and the headache never came on, although the pressure stayed the rest of the day. I use a flour sifter to thoroughly mix the supplement powders.The following is a list of clinical trials testing the many diverse benefits of l-glutamine from the National Medical Library MEDLINE as abstracted by GreenMedInfo:1. [Intravenous] Glutamine supplementation decreases whole body proteolysis [muscle wasting] in low birth weight infants.2. Glutamine supplementation improves the outcome of hematopoietic [bone marrow] stem cell transplant in children.3. Oral glutamine supplementation decreases resting energy expenditure in children and adolescents with sickle cell anemia.4. Oral glutamine supplementation protects lymphocytes and attenuates gut permeability in patients with esophageal cancer during radiochemotherapy.5. Oral supplementation with a combination of beta-hydroxy-beta-methylbutyrate, arginine, and glutamine ameliorates AIDS virus associated wasting, has therapeutic value in the treatment of rheumatoid cachexia, and reverses cancer-related wasting.6. Supplementation with glutamine during hospitalization for elective surgery and accidental injury improves immune function and reduces the length of hospital stay.7. Supplementation with glutamine may correct the low plasma glutamine levels found in COPD.8. Curcumin and glutamine may prevent or reduce bacterial translocation and oxidative damage in obstructive jaundice.9. Glutamine and arginine supplementation may help prevent necrotizing enterocolitis.10. Glutamine could act as a motility-recovery agent after gastrectomy in humans.11. Glutamine decreases the duration of postoperative ileus after abdominal surgery.12. Glutamine enhances the gut-trophic effects of growth hormone in rat after massive small bowel resection.13. Glutamine supplementation improves the immune response to infection in diabetic rats.14. Honey and glutamine have potential therapeutic effects on massive bowel resection in humans.15. Olive leaf extract and glutamine significantly increase GLP-1 [Glucagon-like peptide-1 (gut hormone)] up-regulation.16. Oral glutamine attenuates indomethacin [prostaglandin-inhibiting NSAID drug] -induced small intestinal damage.17. Curcumin and glutamine may have a therapeutic role in treating intestinal permeability.18. Glutamine prevents chemotherapy and radiation toxicity and may increase the efficacy of cancer treatment.19. Salt cravings in autistic disorders may reveal low blood sodium depleting brain taurine and glutamine.

Almost perfect.This is my second Kindle.  About three months ago, I bought a Kindle reader.  I was very pleased with it despite my preference for paper media.  At some point, I wanted a little bit more versatility.  I wanted the ability to check email and watch videos on my tablet.  So, I placed an order for this model.I ordered the Poetic hardback case at the same time that I ordered the Kindle Fire.  Both arrived on the same day.  As usual, Amazon shipment was fast and efficient, and it beat the time estimate.The screen resolution on the Kindle Fire is beautiful.  I enjoyed watching television shows via HBO Now.  The speakers on the back are powerful enough for most listening situations, however, I was able to improve on the sound quality by using a pair of bluetooth headphones.  Yes, the screen is small.  However, you do have to make a trade-off between mobility and screen size.  This tablet was never meant to replace your television or your computer monitor for watching videos.  This one is for use during those times when you do not have access to a larger monitor.  You can download the videos to the device, so you can watch even when away from WiFi.  You can also get a 4G version, but mine is only WiFi.The Silk browser works fine.  I have not tried to browse Youtube with it, however.  I have not tested this browser to see how well it will play Youtube videos.  I was also unable to find a youtube app from the Amazon kindle app store.For general reading, I think I may have a slight preference for the matte screen of the regular Kindle reader.  However, that is just a preference as I like the reading material to look as close to paper as possible.  The color on the Kindle Fire is lovely.  So there is that to consider.  If I could only have one, it would be the Kindle Fire.The Email app is fine and works quite well.  I set up two email accounts.  One from hotmail and one from gmail.  Both inboxes are easy to use and to manage.  I have not felt the need to download another email app from the store.  The calendar syncs fast and the calender itself is useful to have.  Neither of these apps are feature loaded, but the basic necessities are there.This device is almost perfect.  The price is right, the screen is beautiful, and the unit feels sturdy.  The HBO Now app and service have allowed me to depend on this device solely to access content from HBO.  I no longer need my cable subscription.  I can also rent and purchase movies from Amazon, should I choose to do so.  I have a subscription to Netflix and Hulu but I have not looked for those apps for this device.Why is this device not perfect?  The lack of a second camera kept it from being perfect.  There is a front facing camera to facilitate video chat.  However, there is no camera in the back.  I believe that could be a deal-breaker for some people.  You know, those types who like to take a picture while pretending to read.  Picture this scenario, a Kindle owner is at the beach reading his book.  He sees something that he wants to take a picture of, in a subtle manner.  But, he can't, because there is only one camera.  To take the picture, he would have to face the tablet to the subject.  And that would ruin the stealth.  Of course, your humble reviewer does not engage in those types of stealth photography so the lack of a second camera was not a big deal to him when deciding which Kindle Fire unit to get.Highly recommended, but please note the lack of a rear facing camera.

This is the story of the friendship between Adara and the ice dragon.  It is a tale of loneliness, friendship, bravery, and sacrifice.  And ultimately, it is about love.  Beyond being a terrific story in its own right, does it have any implications for the plot of A Song of Ice and Fire?  The million-dollar question is naturally, “can we use this story to predict what will happen in A Song of Ice and Fire?”  My answer to both questions is that this story has no connection to the  plot of ASOIAF and we cannot really use this to guess what Martin has in mind for the conclusion.However, it is interesting to see the same themes and the same ideas at work.  There is a little bit of Daenerys, Tyrion, Jon, and Arya in Adara.  All four characters have something in common with Adara.  Mother died during child birth.  A childhood filled with loneliness and isolation.  All five have had their lives turned upside down by war.  The Ice Dragon also share the same traits of bravery and loyalty with Drogon and Ghost.  The deep bond of friendship that can develop between different species is also a central part of the themes.Highly recommended.  I bought the Kindle version but perhaps if you wish to read this with your child, the print version would be best.

Excellent product.Every ear cleaner that I have ever used on dogs have worked.  They all did a good job of cleaning dog ears.  However, most of them do not reduce the odor.  There are only two products that I have ever used that removed most ear odor.  One of them is only available for purchase through a veterinarian.  The second one is this Epi-Otic Advanced Ear Cleanser.My dog has long, floppy ears.  I clean his ears once per week, right before he takes a bath.  I take care to avoid getting water inside his ears.  Even so, his ears start getting that smell peculiar to dog ears.  His ears just produce a lot of debris.  The vets find nothing wrong with his ears during his regular check ups.  This product from Epi-Otic has done a very good job of reducing that odor.  It does not get eliminate it completely, but the difference at the end of the week is obvious.Dogs with standing ears, prick ears, do not seem to experience this condition.  It is usually dogs with long, floppy ears.  I suspect it is partly due to moisture and the oils naturally produced within the ear.  In any case, this product has done a very good job of reducing that odor.  It cleans the ears very well and does not bring discomfort to the dog.I put a little bit of the cleaner in a cotton ball and clean the ears.  Afterwards, I give the base of the ear a gentle massage, which my dog just seems to love.  The routine has been working well for five years, using a variety of ear cleaners.  I have used brands from Wal-Mart, Petco, and also brands sold only through veterinarians.  They all work well for cleaning the ear, but this one just has the added benefit of reducing the ear odor.Virbac Labs make good quality pet care products.  It's been a benefit to me, and to my wallet, that they can now be purchased from sources other than a licensed veterinarian's practice.  That was not the case twenty two years ago when I first used their flea control products.  Highly recommended.

Excellent for cats, but there are better products for dogs.There is a very friendly feline that lives in the neighborhood.  Several people have claimed the cat, but she does not like to stay in one place.  I bought this because I noticed her scratching a lot.  I bought this for the cat.  It has been working very well.  Powder is a better method for cats who are scared of liquid spray bottles.  This cat hated getting wet.  So, powder was really the only option.My own dog is on a monthly heartworm preventive that also controls fleas.  For dogs, I think a combination product that takes care of fleas, intestinal worms, and prevents heartworms is the better choice.Highly recommended for cats who do not like getting sprayed with insecticide.  This is also a good choice for a small, indoor dog.

Works great with Rosetta Stone!I bought this product to use with Rosetta Stone.  It works just as well as the original headset that came with the product.  I have had no problems and the installation was easy.  No additional software was needed to make the product work.Rosetta Stone will test the headset microphone each time you start the program.  It will ask you to count to five to test the microphone.  After that, the program will start on your next lesson.Is the Cyber Acoustics headset perfect?  No, it is not perfect.  There are more comfortable and more adjustable units out in the market.  But, they will be considerably more expensive.  I had a Logitech unit that was almost twice the price three years ago.  It was not used for Rosetta Stone, but rather for chat.  That unit was larger, the microphone boom/stalk was longer and sturdier.  But, like I said, it was more expensive at about $40.  After the ear padding on that unit eventually deteriorated, I was unable to find replacement pads.  I bought this inexpensive unit knowing that the ear pads will break down.  Skin oils will get on the unit.  Rather than buy a more expensive unit and then try to find replacement head pads for it, I thought it easier to just buy an inexpensive unit and replace it when the pads wear out.  This is a good unit for the price.  But, it is up to you whether you will think it's a good value or not.  One important justification for a more expensive and more luxurious unit is how often and for now long do you expect to use the product.  How much time are you going to spend wearing the unit.  Rosetta Stone is fairly intensive and you will be spending a lot of time wearing the headphones.  Perhaps you will be less price sensitive than I am and you would rightly decide to spend more money on a higher end unit.  One feature that I do not like about  this unit is the flexible microphone stalk.  It's basically a soft material that you can bend in every direction.  However, I suspect that you can only bend it a few times before it starts to fatigue like a soft length of wire.  I would have preferred a solid stalk.As always, consider your needs carefully and make your decision accordingly.  I see a lot of products getting negative reviews, and a lot of times, it is due to the consumer purchasing a product that did not meet their particular requirements.  If you are not price-sensitive and you anticipate spending a lot of time wearing the headphones, then certainly get a more expensive set.  You can never go wrong buying more quality than you need.Highly recommended for Rosetta Stone users who are price sensitive.

Provides a good explanation of shotgun chokes and what they do.  This book should be for those who have already learned how to shoot a shotgun and simply want to know more about how barrel constriction affect shot pattern.  Knowing your shotgun's shot spread for the given distance that you expect to shoot will make you move effective.  This is because there is a trade-off between increasing the spread, versus maintaining sufficient shot density.  Too little spread can result in a miss, but so can too much spread.  You can change the spread for a given distance by changing the amount of constriction, the choke.  Most shotguns today come with interchangeable chokes, from full to cylinder.  Understanding chokes can help you become a more effective shooter.

Is David Sullivan the hillbilly version of Harry Potter?  No. David Sullivan was created in the mid-1980's, before Harry Potter came out.  David Sullivan is just your typical teenage hero in fantasy novels.I became a fan of the late Tom Dietz after reading "Windmaster's Bane" 27 years ago.  This is the third book in the "David Sullivan" series of novels that started with "Windmaster's Bane".The hero of the story is a teenaged boy named David Sullivan.  The story takes place in the state of Georgia, near the city of Gainesville.  While walking in the woods near the family farm, David Sullivan discovered the straight tracks, which are gateways to the world of the Fairie folk, the Sidhe.  David was born with the ability to see these tracks.Ever since that discovery, David has been living in two worlds.  The human world, and the world of the Sidhe.  Helped along by his great-uncle, Dale Sullivan, and his high school friends, David's life just became one adventure after another since that day he discovered that another world existed apart from his own.In "Darkthunder's Way", the Sidhe asked for David's help.  War is brewing in fairie land and only David and his brave friends have a chance to stop it.  With his trusted friends at his side, David once more enters the world of the Sidhe to start another adventure.The David Sullivan tales are suitable for readers of all ages.  These are short novels that make for good, lighthearted reading.Highly recommended.

Traditional design, but made with modern material.This tablecloth has a fancy scroll design that gives it a somewhat classic appearance.  It does look formal.  However, fear not.  It is made out of polyester.  That means it is resistant to wrinkles and it is also less likely to hold on to stains.My tablecloth ended up being too big for the biggest table that I could use it on.  There is a lot of extra material at the ends of the table and at some point, I may need to have it trimmed.  This specific unit is about ten feet long by five wide.  You can cover a 12 place dining table with it.  The color is off-white, or creme.  The scroll design, the silky appearance, and the creme color will make this a good match for your dining room set if they are made of dark wood.  The material is very light for its size due to the polyester construction.  It feels like silk to the touch.Water spills bead up on the surface, however, I suspect that it is not treated for stain resistance.  If stain resistance is important to you, you may be able to spray this material with a common fabric protector, like the ones made by 3M.  Read the directions on the product carefully, however, as you want to make sure it will not harm your tablecloth.  Treating the material with a stain protector may be worthwhile since this tablecloth may not fit inside a regular size, top-loading washing machine.  Like I said, it is ten feet long.  You will need a front-load washing machine for this.This is the largest tablecloth that DII offers.  You can get the same design and the same color in smaller sizes.  They even have one sized for a round table.  The quality of construction is very good.  This cloth should last a very long time due to its construction and the polyester material that it is made from.Highly recommended.

Provides adequate security for low-threat areas.  What I mean by this is that the product will provide enough protection for your bicycle in areas where the potential thief is likely to be unprepared.  For example, if you ride your bike to school, the most likely thief is another student.  That person is unlikely to carry the tools needed to cut the cable or to pick the lock.  But, this lock is not adequate for use in high crime areas where the thief is most likely carrying bolt cutters and lock picks.Any pair of bolt cutters will make short work of the cable.  The lock cylinder can also be picked by anyone with training.  For high threat areas, use a solid U-shaped lock, with a tubular lock cylinder.  A solid U-lock will be harder to cut.  A regular hardware store hacksaw will have trouble cutting through a solid U-lock.  And, a tubular lock will require a set of expensive and special tools in order to pick.Bear the level of threat in mind, and spend accordingly.  This is a very inexpensive lock that will be more than suitable for your child's bicycle at the elementary/middle school bike rack.  You probably will not send your kid to school on a $2,000 mountain bike, right?  I would not hesitate to use this product to protect a $300-$600 bike that is used in a low crime area.Highly recommended.

This case provides suitable protection for your 7th Generation Kindle.  The front cover also powers the unit down.The bottom piece is hard plastic, to protect the kindle.  The front cover is stiff, but not hard.  It is enough protection for someone who will use the device where one might typically use a small tablet.  However, this case is not padded.  It will not protect your kindle from the impact of falling.Highly recommended.

A fun and economical way to learn to play guitar.I have known people back in college who taught themselves how to play the guitar.  I have also known people who have paid money for guitar lessons and still never got to the point where they could play.  I am not knowledgeable enough about music to say whether anyone can learn through this game or not.  Let me just say that as a complete newbie, I am struggling.  Yes, I am learning very slowly, but there is progress.  The process is very hard on the finger tips for sure!  But the main idea is to not only learn, but to also enjoy the game.  I have a feeling that the reason a lot of people are unhappy with the game is that they are expecting to learn quickly.In any case, please buy this game but keep your expectations reasonable.  No game, no instructor, can give you the gift of being able to play.  It is a combination of your abilities and how much you put into it.  Those also play a role in how quickly, and how well, you will be able to  play.I bought the whole kit for the PS4.  It performs flawlessly, the guitar works great, and the cable is included.  The kit will save you money, since the guitar alone is about $169 or so, here on Amazon.  If you want the game and do not already own a guitar, buy the kit.  If you already have a guitar, just buy the game and cable.

Playing this game is the closest thing to living in Westeros!Have you ever wondered what it would be like to live in the world of George Martin's "Game of Thrones" world?  Short of a time machine, this game is the next best option.Many book readers and TV watchers would like to imagine themselves living in the world that George Martin created.  The man has created a world that is so rich, so dramatic, and so full of life that I know a fan or two who spend more time in it than they do in the real world.  It is a very immersive world.  However, reading about it and watching the show are both passive activities.  If you would like more interaction and a more immersive experience, buy this game.This is an action-adventure game.  You play as a member of House Forrester, a northern family who have been bannermen to Winterfell for over a thousand years.  The story takes place during the War of the Five Kings.  House Forrester was drawn into the conflict when Robb Stark called in his banners and marched them down south to fight the Lannisters.The game is all about political intrigue and some action.  The choices that you make drive the story and the action.  The atmosphere is pretty tense.  You worry for the safety of your character.  The fear that you felt for the safety of your favorite character while reading the books is taken to a much higher level here.  You are in control of your character, and your actions and choices can either bring them to safety or get them killed.  You start off as Gared Tuttle, a squire in service to Lord Gregor Forrester, head of House Forrester.  You are part of the Northern host that is camped outside The Twins, Edmure Tully and Roslyn Frey are about to be married.  The fighting men around you are in a good mood, enjoying Lord Walder Frey's generous provisions of food and alcohol.  While on a chance errand, you notice something peculiar.  The Frey soldiers are all armed and do not seem to be enjoying the free-flowing supply of wine.  What do you do?  Your actions and choices drive the story.I bought the PS4 version.  It played flawlessly, without a single issue.  Highly recommended.

This is an old-fashioned adventure story.  It tells of the African expeditions of two Englishmen who set out to discover the source of the Nile River.  This is the story of Richard Burton and John Speke.  Friends, comrades, rivals, and competitors.  Trials and danger encountered within the wilds of Africa formed their friendship, but politics put them on opposite sides and forced their friendship apart.A lot has already been written about this movie.  It gets a recommendation from me.  Let me just add some facts that have not been mentioned.  This is one of Iain Glen's earlier movie roles.  He plays Lt. John Speke, a career officer in the British military.  Patrick Bergin is Richard Burton, the well-known explorer, swordsman, and author.  Fiona Shaw plays the fiance of Burton.  Note that this is perhaps the only movie in which you get to see Fiona Shaw naked.  Fiona is young here, and her body is beautiful.

This is the must-have consumer product of the holiday season.  If you don't have it, you gotta get it.Another fantastic console from Sony.  Here we are, the 4th generation of the glorious Playstation.  And it is better than ever.  Playstation Now, Sony's cloud-based gaming service is currently on BETA, but so far, it looks good to me.  Games run fine as long as your internet connection is fast enough.  In most case, your typical broadband would be sufficient.  I have not experienced any issues, and I live in a small town where internet service is lagging behind in terms of speed.The console runs much cooler than the PS3.  Its smaller size also mean that you have more options of where to put it.  However, I would still make sure that it gets sufficient ventilation and air circulation.There is really not much more to say about the console.  Yes, it is powerful.  Yes, the graphics are terrific.  Yes, the Playstation desktop, dashboard, or main menu, whatever you choose to call it, is intuitive.  Certainly much preferred to the competition.  The controller charges fast and holds its charge fairly well.  Ergonomics are fine, but in a way, I prefer the previous generation controller.You should absolutely subscribe to Playstation Plus.  Definitely worth it as there are freebies included.  By the way, I am also a subscriber on XBox Gold.PS4 or XBox One?  Choose based on exclusives.  If you do not have any attachments to the exclusives, pick the PS4.  The Playstation Now service is looking better and better every week.  My only complaint is that we do not yet have access to the awesome library of PS One and PS2 games.  Now, this is not something that would be difficult for Sony to do.  They have some of the best engineering minds and the most experienced developers on the planet.  If they want to make it happen, it will happen.  The indisputable advantage that the Playstation has over its competition is that it has the biggest library of legacy games, going back four generations.  I do not want to get into a long discussion of the importance of backwards compatibility.  Been there, done that with the PS3.  However, the ability to be able to continue to play those older PS1 and PS2 games add value to the console.  It also means that any game made for any Playstation system will never be obsolete.  That adds value to a customer's game library.  I would feel better when I have to pay full-price for games if I knew that I will always be able to play them even when the PS10 comes along!!!  Compatibility via the Cloud is probably how this will be handled.  It will eventually happen, I am just hoping that it will happen sooner, rather than later. I have discussed this topic with other gamers and the reason may be is that Sony has not yet decided on the pricing for those legacy games.  Playstation NOW is still on BETA, but it actually runs just fine as it is.  I suspect it may be the pricing scheme that has not been decided yet.Just last night I played "Iron from Ice", an episodic adventure game based on George Martin's "A Game of Thrones".  The game played flawlessly.  There is something for everybody.  And there is more to come when Sony finally makes available PS1 and PS2 games on Playstation Now.  I checked the list of games last night and they even have "El Shaddai" on there.  That game was not a big seller.  If they have that available, think of what they will have in the future.  Can you imagine being able to replay classics such as "The Legend of Dragoon", "Final Fantasy X", and Xenogears on your PS4!  I hope it happens soon.There is a lot of excitement surrounding this console. It does have a headstart in cloud-based gaming with Playstation NOW and we all know that it can only get better.  The consoles are selling out very fast.  As soon as you have an opportunity to make a purchase, I recommend that you do so.  I suspect that supplies are going to be running low as the holiday season progresses.

This is Nastassja Kinski at the top of her game!I first became a fan of Nastassja Kinski after watching "Tess of the D'Urbervilles".  Not only was she a very convincing, natural actress, but she was beautiful.  It really is too bad that her career took a downturn in the mid 1980s.  An actress of her talents should have won an Oscar or two by now.This is a supernatural horror movie, make no mistake.  Blood and gore are aplenty.  However, it is also a movie about sexual awakening.  Before you jump to conclusions, this is not one of those typical 1980s sexual awakening kind of movie.  It is nothing like "Sixteen Candles" or "Fast Times at Ridgemont High".  This is also not a bloody slasher like the Friday the 13th franchise.  The closest similarity that I can think of is "The Howling".  This, in my opinion, is in the same category, as that movie.The movie takes place in New Orleans.  Irena Gallier has reached young womanhood and has come to the city to live with her brother, Paul.  Their parents died when both were young.  Irena grew up in an orphanage.  It has been many years since she has seen her brother, who has made a comfortable life for himself in New Orleans.Unusual for a woman of about 18 years of age, Irena is a virgin.  Unaware of her family's secret, she falls in love with a zoo curator.  Her brother explains to her that they are a race of humans who transforms into panthers whenever they have sex with a regular human.  The only way to revert back into human form is to kill.  Paul also tells her that their parents were brother and sister.  The only way to avoid shape-shifting into a panther while having sex is to make sure the partner is also a "cat people".  He tells her that she will end up killing her future lover.  Irena refuses to accept this and resist Paul's sexual advances.  As her sexuality awakens, her primal nature starts to slowly come out.I do not want to spoil the rest of this excellent movie for you.  Let me just say that the acting performances are superb.  Do yourself a favor and add this cult classic to your collection.

This is a decent apocalyptic themed movie.I have been a fan of the genre, ever since I saw "The Omen" back in 1976.  If you like these types of movies, you should also check out "Revelations".  This movie, "The Seventh Sign" is not as good, in my opinion as The Omen, Omen II, Omen III:Final Conflict, and Revelations.  However, it is well-made and the acting performances were very good.  Perhaps one of the most solid performances from Demi Moore in her career.  Michael Biehn and Jurgen Prochnow also lend their talents here.The end of the world is coming, according to the signs.  River water turning to blood, ice in the desert, and the moon changing colors are all signs that the end is near for mankind.  The premise here is that the supply of souls in heaven has run out, and when the first soul-less baby is born, the destruction of mankind will be irreversibly set in motion.The story takes place in Venice, CA.  Of all places for mankind to prevent the apocalypse it had to be here, right?  Well, you have to be willing to buy into it, naturally.  An exotic setting, perhaps somewhere in old world Europe or the Middle East would have been my preference, but California is what we have.  Abby and Russell Quinn play a young couple who is trying to have a child.  Their first attempt ended in stillbirth.  One day, a stranger claiming to be a linguist arrives in town and asks to rent the couple's garage loft.  Not long after, a mysterious priest starts meddling in the couple's affairs, doing everything in his power to ensure that Russell's client (he is a lawyer) faces execution for his crimes.This is a pretty good movie.  If you have seen those other movies above, and you liked them, you will most likely like this one.

Gets the job done!I have been a user of electric toothbrushes for the past 18 years.  I started out with Interplak and used that for almost two years, until the battery corroded.  I replaced that first electric with another from the same brand.  Eventually, the Sonicare came out and I switched to that brand.  That Sonicare lasted a very long time.  Sometime around late 2005, I bought my first Oral-B.  The Oral-B was one of their mid-end models and it also lasted a number of years.  The nickel-cadmium rechargeable batteries were still working fine, but the charging base got damaged during a move.  I replaced that one with a cheap model, also an Oral-B.  This cheap model will only hold its charge for about 3 brushing sessions before you notice a significant performance decrease and the unit would need to be fully recharged.  As they say, you do get what you pay for.  There are times when you travel and have to take the brush with you.  It  would be nice to have something that will hold a longer charge.  So, I bought this one.  This one is much better than the previous Oral-B.  It uses the same model of brush head but this model cleans more aggressively than the previous one.  So, here we are, my sixth electric toothbrush in 18-19 years of use.  Of the six models, I would say that the only ones that I did not like were the low-end Oral-B and the first Interplak.  All the rest were good at what they were supposed to do.  You do not need to spend 100+ dollars on a top-model like the Sonicare to get good results.  I have found that the key to getting good performance is to replace the brush head often.  Get the name brand brush head if you can.  The brush heads on the Sonicare tend to last longer than the ones on the Oral-B, but they are also typically more expensive.  It is your choice.I can easily recommend this model, the Oral-B Precision 1000, to anybody who wants to use an electric toothbrush.  Spending more money will not necessarily clean your teeth better, in my experience.  What you give up is more features, like UV sterilizing and perhaps additional cleaning modes (like a gentle cycle on your washing machine, some brushes have a mode for delicate users).
