Perfect fit, well built and the small flap on the back works perfect for tucking one of the folding panel under giving a pedestal for tilt viewing.Seller sent it fast .

NOT A VINE REVIEW! I BOUGHT THIS MYSELF 😁I wanted a discret way to visually document encounters with certain people that I might encounter having the ability to record the video and audio without someone knowing I might document the event.I've had over a months experience in carrying this device in my shirt pocket and as it protrudes slightly above the opening in my pocket in work shirts and dress shirts, nobody has ever suspected it was anything other than a common ball point pen.In a few tests runs, I've found it easy to start the recording simply by pressing down on the small button on top of the "pen" for about 3 seconds then letting up.The small SD mini card records the event, and although I have not tried it in a Windows computer I have, it works easily on my Mac. I've been pleased with the quality of the video and the audio is probably the only weak-link in this camera but it works well enough to be understood if recording conversation with someone standing in front of you or in very close proximity.I haven't tried (nor need) editing the footage in something like iMovie because the raw footage is all I am interested in.Please note, this is NOT a Vine Review and I never would nor will review products that I have not purchased myself.

I bought this test to check for pesticides and lead as stated in the misleading information here on Amazon. I opened a small foil package with text "Pesticides Lead" and removed the two smaller packets but they are marked "total hardness " & "nitrate - nitrite" test strips.I already have test kits for hardness and nitrites-nitrates. So I'm very disappointed that I threw my money away on this kit!

I'm using this to track the amount of electricity I use to charge my Chevrolet Volt. I simply tapped into the line I installed feeding 240 volts to a NEMA plug where the external EVSE (charger) hangs on my wall in my garage.This works well to advise how many kilowatts I use for each charge.I'd say my only "complaint" is the manual which probably was written in the UK and refers to electric rates as "terrif".The small box where I read my daily or weekly or instant electric usage can be attached to a wall or other surface using two small screws, but I elected not to attach it to anything so that I can move it around with me as needed. The Bluetooth range seems robust inside my large two car garage. I haven't determined how far the range is for Bluetooth but I'm pleased with how good it performs for my needs.As I track the kilowatt usage, I'm seeing very close to what my Volt is reporting in regard to kilowatts used in my daily use of my car. For example, if my Volt reports it went 40 miles on 8.1 kilowatts of electricity, the Ensupra also shows it required 8.1 kilowatts to recharge my Volt.

My MacBook Air was purchased new 10 months ago and this charger will not work on it. The size is wrong. Way to big to fit the power slot on my computer. My MacBook Air has 4 small pins. This product has a very large plug having a 5 pin connection.

We had a very bad round of surges and spikes over the course of several months and I'm the process, two very expensive Apple Extreme Routers were fried as well as my Macintosh computer and a few other things in our house. Despite all my equipment being plugged into strip outlets that were supposed to offer protection from surges, my stuff was toasted.My nephew is a geek in the military and an electrician and told me to get this. It was easily installed by my electrician and is now attached to the wall in my garage at the service panel. Now the entire house is protected to include my expensive AC (high efficiency Trane heat pump) as well as my Chevrolt Volt that is charged by a 240 volt charger in my garage. We've had a few thunderstorms since the electrician installed this, and no more fried electronics... Although a neighbor told me the last lighting storm here toasted his TV, we didn't have problems.

Wow! Illegal for use on a vehicle here in the United States because the various colors of flashing red and blue resemble the lights of law enforcement and or other emergency vehicles (if you put this on the top of your car, I can guarantee that a cop will eventually pull you over or someone will use a cell phone to report you as an imposter law enforcement vehicle) but I'm using these on the perimeter of my ranch on tall poles to scare off coyotes at night and THEY WORK! In fact, I am buying 10 more.These various colored and flashing lights work great for me in scaring off nocturnal predators on my two ranches here in Texas. I placed three of them on long metal poles (at the top) and the flashing lights have scared coyotes away. I read somewhere that coyotes were afraid of flashing lights so I decided to experiment and darned if these things work for this purpose. The lights are VERY bright when you look at them from directly behind the light source (thus the reason they resemble emergency vehicles and police cars) and since putting them up on my ranch, I don't even hear coyotes much less see their tracks near where I keep my goats and chickens and other livestock.I originally wanted one of these to use on the top of my car thinking that at night in the fog, they would give me an extra margin of safety, but they flash so fast and the red-amber-blue combination are so bright and flash so fast that it made my car look like a state trooper. If the lights flashed slower and were one color (maybe like the flashing lights we see on the back of large trucks that haul gasoline) they might be more accepted by law enforcement, but as the lights are now, they look too much like state highway patrol or local police cars.

I ordered this fruit cake for my father-in-law who is in assisted living.When the fruitcake arrived at my house, I removed the tin box from the cardboard shipping container so that I could gift wrap it for Christmas for him. Moments before I placed the fruitcake on my counter for wrapping, I thought it would be a good idea to examine the contents of the container, and I removed the cover to look at the cake. As I stood there, looking down at this wonderful specimen laying helplessly before me, I succumbed to the incredible and succulent aroma that came upon me and in which became mingled with my olfactory receptors. Sadly, in a moment of weakness, I found my hands grasping for a knife in which to slice through the cake in order to take a small "test" sample. My weakness grew as did my hunger and to make a long story short, I very selfishly devoured the cake as the glutton I turned into and I will seek forgiveness from the Pope and beg for leniency as I hurriedly order a new cake to have shipped directly to my father-in-law whom I know will be filled with glee as I was, in sampling this incredible baked item that was such a joy to consume.Say what you will or might want to say about fruitcakes, but this one was wickedly wonderful and those folks down in Corsicana, Texas make some mighty bodacious and fabulous fruitcakes. I have never-ever tasted one that was even this close to totally wonderful. (Maybe I died and went to Heaven and I don't need to contact the Pope?)(UPDATE, 1-2-2015... I FELT SO BAD FOR MY FATHER-IN-LAW - HAVING DEVOURED THE ABOVE MENTI0NED FRUIT CAKE, THAT ON CHRISTMAS EVE AS I WAS VISITING HIM IN HIS APARTMENT IN THE ASSISTED LIVING CENTER I USED THE AMAZON AP ON MY IPHONE AND ORDERED A SECOND FRUIT CAKE AND HAD IT SENT DIRECTLY TO HIM, INSTEAD OF BEING DELIVERED TO MY HOUSE. WE JUST GOT OFF THE PHONE WITH HIM AND HIS FRUITCAKE ARRIVED EARLIER IN THE DAY, AND HE IS IN "HOG-HEAVEN" AS WE SAY HERE IN TEXAS...)

*******(UPDATE... 3-5-2015  I bought an Arlo Home Monitoring System, ironically from NetGear - and the Arlo is the total opposite of my experience with the VueZone - which I understand NetGear purchased from another company that went out of business... The VueZone is lousy, the Arlo is great... and in fact please look for my review of the Arlo.)********I bought the VueCam system and while it was a quick and easy instal and the app worked really great on my iPhone 5S, I was never-ever able to receive email alerts as advertised. For ten days I tried to get the email alert working (even trying my alternate email address) and nothing worked. The support from NetGear was disappointing. Two calls to their phone support people in India was an exercise in frustration. And although the people in India were polite and courteous, taking to them on the phone sounded like they were sitting in a bar and using a speaker phone. I could hardly understand them. Even before getting to talk to them, it was horrendous calling their toll-free number and then wading through the voice prompts and deciding what number to press.After several test runs in broad daylight and in low light conditions, the cameras (even though both were set for motion detect) never-ever gave me a single clue that something (me, even riding past the cameras in a large Kubota RTV) and I sent the system back for a refund.The resolution was poor but I could have lived with the low quality image, just to see if someone had forced open a door or broke a window. The fee they wanted for the privilege of using their "service" while annoying, I was willing to pay just so I could have peace-of-mind.Too bad, because I was VERY impressed with the iPhone app but very disappointed in support. NetGear has lost me forever as a customer because of the very lousy after-the-sale support (or lack of it I should say...

(UPDATE 10 days after I bought this.... I am sending it back to Amazon for a full refund. NetGear support is pathetic, both through email answers and especially through their phone technical support located in India. I spent 45 minutes today on the phone to a very nice young woman in India (who sounded like she was in a noisy sweat-shop) and although she was courteous and polite, after giving her all my information to include a ticket number that NetGear gave me (and info how to get email alerts, which didn't work and which I had set up properly in the first place...) The lady in India gave me a new number to call 1-888-638-4327 where I again had to wade through recorded voice quizzes and then passed along to another person in India (also a nice chap, sitting in what sounded like a bowling alley.) The background noise is so bad that it is difficult to hear these people... Email alerts DO NOT WORK thus making these cameras useless as a quick way to know if your home has been broken into.)PROS...**** Cameras are very small and easy to place nearly anywhere because they attach by a magnet to a small base that sticks on a wall, a pole, a glass surface or just about anywhere. The magnetic base allows the camera to swivel and tilt (by hand) and this allows to get the exact camera angle you want.**** Included in my two-camera system was an outdoor housing that prevents rain from getting into the cameras. This too is "svelte" and it's small size makes it easy to locate in tight spots.**** Once you establish an account (for viewing) it's VERY easy to get into your account to see your cameras from any internet connection. It worked well on my iPhone 5S and several of my Mac computers.CONS....***** I hate to even mention this as a "con" but the image quality is just a tad low resolution, but it is good enough for me to easily see if a door or a window has been compromised, or if tools are missing from an interior building.**** No sound, but no big deal for me because I simply need to see if a window/door has been breached and sound isn't really needed nor do I need to talk to my dogs.**** No pan or tilt and again not critical for me, but I can see how this would be an advantage for many people.**** Short battery life for the tiny cameras. Batteries are about $2 each (the cameras take two of them) and they last about 14 days it seems.**** Email alerts never worked for me despite having the cameras set for motion and verifying that my settings were all correct.**** Phone support is located in India. Wait times are WAY TOO LONG and despite having spend 45 minutes on the phone with them in India on two calls, they never resolved my problem. While the phone reps in India were polite, courteous... the background sound made me think they were housed in a bowling alley next to a railroad station.Other notes...You get several options when you establish your account which include a free account for viewing, but the freebie wasn't as feature-laden as I wanted and I elected to purchase their "Two Locations - five cameras" option.

I bought this bracelet out of concern if I ever was pulled over by a policeman and needed to get out of my car, I didn't want him/her to think I had been drinking (I walk like a drunk because of my MS).  And I once was challenged by a fully enabled person when I needed access to a handicap space... The idea of wearing this bracelet seemed to fit the bill, so to speak, as a way to add validity to my MS ailment.After wearing it for 5 months, the one small insignia that reads "Multiple Sclerosis" fell off. It is not much more than a decal that I recall from my youth, that we placed on toy models we built when I was a kid.I found the bracelet easy to size (removing a link is a no-brainer) and the bracelet was always comfortable and easy to put on and remove, and it never changed color nor did the metal stain, but the small emblems on the bracelet are easy to lose. Now I simply have a bracelet with the "medical ID" showing on each side and no specific emblem for my actual medical condition.This bracelet is $40 delivered here on Amazon but I bought my replacement for $27.75 delivered through "E" bay.  MS is such an expensive disease to treat, so save your money and don't buy it for $40 from this seller!

(EDIT 12-13-2014...  Look at all the one star reviews that have been submitted December 2014! This seems to suggest that their camera is coming out of their factory with a defect rendering it useless.)When removing the package and opening the small instruction booklet, I was excited to read it and see the installation process seemed easy and straight-forward. You plug the AC power supply in to a 120 volt outlet, plug the other end into the camera, flip the small slider switch to "on" and then the camera starts searching for a WIFI signal.After sitting near (and far) from my Apple Extreme router, this camera was NOT able to find it. I tried several times, placing it anywhere from 20 feet away to 20 inches from my fairly new Apple router (which has performed beyond my expectations and which EVERY other device can find.) I brought the camera home from my office and decided to try to see if it would find my other router, let it set for nearly two hours, tired rebooting my router while the camera was turned on, did't work. I even let it search all night after I went to bed and the next morning it still was not able to find my second router. Then I tried to unplug the camera and power it up and see if it could reboot and find my router, but to no avail.Their app won't even open on my iPhone 5S, it just spins, I suspect because the camera can't find my router.I went to the company website to look for an FAQ that might explain what to do when the camera can't locate the WIFI and the website doesn't  even have an FAQ "can't find the router" or "what to do to connect to a wireless router." (The FAQa are pretty much worthless anyway, you should look at their website before you consider buying this camera...)It seems to that with more and more 1 star ratings being added so quickly as of late, this product must have a manufacturing flaw that is rendering it inoperative. Look at all the recent one star ratings and it's obvious this is a flawed piece and is buggy as a  10 day old hot dog that has been laying under the ball park bleachers.Please note that I returned this for a refund.

Vastly superior to what I've bought from a local fabric shop. This material has a nice backing that black velvet I've used in the past didn't. I used this to make a small cover on the dash of my car to conceal some wires that go to my dash cam, and the black material has also helped cut down on glare from the top of the dash too.

My dad in 1983, bought a GMC Vandura that he gave to me in 1993. The van (having a 6.2 liter diesel engine) refuses to die and now that my father is gone, I'm too sentimental (and too stupid) to let go of this van and I drive it on errands when I need to haul something bulky.Several months ago, I discovered my tanks leaking. I felt like the captain of the Exxon Valdez when I saw this large pool of diesel in my barn. It was leaking so bad, it reminded me of when my burro takes a leak.  I was worried that I'd have to start calling wrecking yards to find a tank for a GMC van having been on diesel (these are rare).I ordered this on Amazon and when it arrived I took my van to our local shop and gave him the repair kit. They removed the fuel tank in order to properly clean the exterior surface (and to see if there might be additional problem areas) and they scuffed the surface where the only leak was found. The repair did the trick and is working like a charm and I suspect my dad is up there looking down on me and saying "good job son, that van will run another 10 years longer...)

I bought three of these DEFECTIVE clocks (one for myself, two as gifts) and here is what I learned... this clock I bought as a replacement here on Amazon WORKS GREAT http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00IOZBU48/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o04_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 and the clock from bigmouth toys is a pile of junk.Cons....*  Impossible to program in order to get the actual time left on Obama's exit date. I tried to set the time, my brainy wife who breezed through college in 2.5 years tried it, the geek kid down the block tried it and none of us could get the countdown timer to work. I can fly my airplane at night in a thunderstorm by myself, but I can't get this to perform to show the actual days left in the current Emperors reign. We all got a countdown that was many months to years off. The geek kid down the street got the same "out-of-office" date my wife and I got and it was nowhere close to when our next president will assume office.* In order to install the two double "A" batteries to run this, you nearly have to have the skills of a brain surgeon in order to get the batteries in. On one end, there is a delicate spring where the battery must be inserted and the other end presses on the opposite terminal. It is difficult to get this feeble spring to correctly mate-up to the battery. And when you are lucky enough to get the first battery in, you have the same problem with the second battery which is a little easier, but still a delicate "operation."  The spring can easily be damaged beyond repair... remember, this is a flimsy gizmo made in China.Pros...The words "last day" is cheerfully printed on this timer to remind you, indeed Obama is a "short timer" and thus despite the non-functional aspect of this "countdown timer" I'm keeping mine and giving the other two as gifts, just for the "hoot-factor."

Several years ago I started seeing annoying TV commercials (hey, aren't ALL tv commercials annoying now?) for "toe nail fungus" products. I had never had any problems with toe nail fungus nor even heard of it until the TV commercials started. Well, "welcome to the club of sufferers" because three months ago I got this ailment and I no longer laugh at the commercials.I live on a ranch and about a year ago, I bought a pair of shoes called "Muckers" because they allow me to walk in mud, muck and wet grass without my feet getting wet. I liked the shoes so much that I started wearing them nearly all the time, however since they are made of a rubberized material, I suspect this is what caused my toenail fungus (fortunately only on one big toe) and I realized that the shoes were probably the culprit.I bought two each of these BATTOP UV Sanitizers and have made the following observations.#1. They easily slide into any shoe I own.... and I like the fact they don't need to be plugged into a 110 volt outlet.#2. The AAA batteries that power these little jewels run a long time and don't need to be replaced very often.#3. UV light is an excellent way to kill virus and germs, and in fact a company has just developed a small robot that can go inside of hospital rooms using UV light to sanitize hospitals, and they advise the UV light is also killing the ebola virus!These small lights are very easy to use. Just insert the batteries into the product, press the small button on the top for three seconds until the light comes on (don't look directly at the light, just slide it in the shoe and when you see the soft blue illumination, release the button and allow the device to slide in all the way to where it comes into contact with the toe area... and the light will stay on for about 10 minutes.My wife (although has a "day job" and doesn't need "muck shoes" is happy I found these germ killing lights and has told me that my shoes no longer have "that aroma" they once used to have (not that I can smell much myself) so I suppose if this has passed the "wife's nose test" that indeed, the lights are like a little Army and have gone on the warpath killing all that nasty stuff that was once lurking in my muck shoes!

We have three vehicles and in order for this fan to be placed in the window of any vehicle, you must cut a rubber liner supplied with the fan and slide the rubber liner along the top portion of your car, van or pickup glass window. The fan is supposed to butt-up against the rubber, then your window is rolled up so that the rubber liner can slide into the window channel (typically felt or rubber itself) and the problem is, that no car window is squared off or straight. Most windows have a gentle curve as they slope down from near the roof line to where your rear view mirrors are located on the bottom part of the window on the outside of your car, van or pickup.One previous reviewer stated this fan didn't work on his car and I can see why now. The rubber "gasket" supplied with this product is neither long enough nor flexible enough to follow the natural slope of ANY window. Thus my reason for sending the fan back for a refund (less than $10 for shipping I will have to eat) because Amazon gave me "Sorry, it's not our fault this didn't fit" which is total bull.Sadly, the fan seems quite robust and in full sunlight it kicks out some serious "wind" from the two small fans.The instructions on a piece of paper that come in the box are written in Chinese, but the box also has instructions and drawings inside the lid that easily explain how to install and use the fan, but the fan can not probably be used on anything other than a vehicle that has square or perfectly rectangular windows. I wanted to add a photo showing the natural curve of my driver's side window and how their material can not accommodate the curve, but it looks like Amazon now longer allows for videos and pictures... But, the person who wrote the review about his Prius and the difficulty with the rubber strip, I think you can get the idea that the rubber strip is just a bad way to try and seal off the window along the juncture of the window channel (frame) and the glass itself.

I've built and flown two airplanes and decided, this would be an easy project for me in order to repair the glass on my wife's iPhone 4S.The product arrived and I was impressed by the fact that so many small tools came with the kit. A set of instructions seemed well laid out, however in bold letters on the face-page of the instructions, the makers of this product advise do not proceed without first going to their web site that has a video showing the replacement of the screen and all the steps you'll need to follow.I went to their website and watched the video in the entirety and again a second time, following each step along the way. The first thing I decided, you must have the eye sight of a brain surgeon to see the small parts (screws) and the patience of a watch maker, but that is NOT why I rate this with one star.Their video showed what they said was an iPhone 4S, but when the removed the back, their iPhone 4S in no way resembled our iPhone 4S. The vibrator motor displayed in their video, wasn't even seen in our iPhone and several screws inside their iPhone 4S were not anywhere close to where metal covers were located in our iPhone. I tossed in the towel and went out and bought my wife an iPhone 5S and was done with the kit.Long story made short, for about $30 more, you should be able to find someone in your town who is in the business of replacing iPhone glass. It will be faster and less frustrating this way, and you'll even save on the shipping.

I didn't have big expectations for this trinket and wanted to use it one time for a party, however it failed to work right out of the package. It is extremely flimsy in every aspect of how it is designed and assembled and the build-quality is beyond abysmal.The wiring juncture (allowing the wiring harness to be plugged in from the control box to the light) is very fragile and if you plug the harness together and then need to unplug it, part of the plastic can come off and you have a mess of wires having raw ends. That being said, this device failed to work even BEFORE I pulled the harness apart. I was going to repack it and send it back to the vendor to get a refund, but the expense of mailing it back and the time needed out-value the refund I would receive.This is typical made in China, "use once and throw it away" quality but in my case, I wasn't even to use it one time. It's sad that we Americans tolerate "quality" like this where we are willing to spend money on cheap and poorly made trinkets from China and soon the trinkets are broken and then tossed away into the garbage, and with this product, it was worthless right out of the package.

If you read any review about this or any machine using ozone to clean a CPAP machine and someone says they like the way it makes their CPAP smells after a cleaning, be very suspicious of the review. One or two people have stated "it reminds me of the fresh air after a rain storm..." and it is not a pleasant aroma that this machine emits and produces inside your CPAP equipment.The process used in killing bacteria and germs is a very unpleasant smell (actually a stench) and it can be smelled into the next room when you use this machine. As other users have stated, the build quality is bad. The top lid on mine did not seal properly. This device takes up a lot of room, is cumbersome and difficult to use. I went back to using liquid cleaners and gave up on this product and I'll never use an ozone cleaning device like this again for my CPAP.

This replaced a very bulky Panasonic machine that was larger than two loaves of bread and as heavy as a 1973 Ford pickup... (well, almost as heavy...)This monitor is easy to put on, and the display is very easy to read and is soothing on the eyes. It features a memory which is also very easy to pull up, should you want to see what previous tests of your blood pressure have been. A simple "start" button is located on the bottom right had corner of the screen area. I like the relative small size of this blood pressure monitor because it is easy to tote inside a travel bag and store in a small drawer. I'm very hapy with this purchase I made here on Amazon.

I've owned this for a year and dislike the remote feature having the provision for 2 users, adding some confusion if indeed it is showing the reading for the right person.This device is large and takes up a lot of real estate on a table top. And, the readings never seem to correspond what my simple wrist unit shows, which is always closer to what I get when visiting my doctor.Long story made short, it is complicated, large, ugly if you leave on a table and if you actually have storage space in a closet, it takes up space there too and you have to lug it around.

I've worn Rockport for several years and still like them a lot, but WOW these Cole Hann shoes (my first pair) are incredible. They fit well, are light on the feet and although I don't know what country they are made in, they appear very, VERY well made. They are easy for me to put on and pull off. and the comfort is perfect.

I have several military surplus (MEP) generators that operate on 24 volt systems (two each 12 volt batteries) and charging the batteries was a pain because I had to disconnect the harnesses and charge one battery at a time. This charger allowed me to charge both batteries as they are fastened together in (I thing it is called "series") and it worked so well, and overnight I bought a second one. It has held up in a couple of gentle rains, and I simply leave it on my MEP generator where it functions as a trickle charger now.

I had a black Vietnam Veteran cap (made of poly material) that I wore for a while, but even in winter here in Texas, my head felt like it was being baked. This new cap that I bought from Amazon is much cooler to wear (cool as in my head does not cook underneath as it did with the black cap) and I like the fact that it is a little more subtle than all the black caps that are available these days. This cap is made of cotton and breathes better than my black poly cap, thus the comfort level is wonderful. The cap fits and rides well on my head and is easily adjusted to make it even more snug on days when the wind is really howling. The velcro strap in the back of the cap is so much better than the plastic adjustable strap with holes on the black cap I have. As a result, this new cap is more comfortable and a lot easier to make a snug fit than caps having the plastic "snap-in-the-hole" method of adjustment. This cap arrived very quickly in a sturdy box and was pristine and undamaged when it arrived.

This is to be a Christmas present for my wife. She lost her original cross last year and I hope this one will please her.The necklace and cross look like they are well made and although I can't really be certain they are NOT made in China, they do look like German quality we have long associated with goods coming out of Germany.Please note, when my cross arrived, I was surprised to see the two etch marks on the surface of the cross. For lack of a better choice of words, I call these "etch marks" and I don't want someone reading my review to think they are flaws or scratches, but they are placed into the piece to add some sort of intrinsic value to the cross. I was just surprised because I did not see these marks on my iPad mini when I placed my order, and I suggest anyone wishing to order this cross first examine the image of it on a much larger monitor.

I'm very happy with this case as it does a very good job of protecting my LG 800G. The case still makes a comfortable fit in my shirt pocket and doesn't interfere with my ability to use the apps or in making or receiving calls.There are 2 very minor issues... they are so minor I probably shouldn't waste your time on them.#1. The indentation on the top of the case that engages the "on/off" button is a tad stiff and it makes it hard to turn the phone off. I find I have to use something like a dull screwdriver to make this button work, but I have arthritis and the average person might not have an issues with this.#2. The case is so snug, if you use one of those thin protective screens that apply to the face of the phone, the case can "bubble up" the edge of the screen. This might not be a problem during warm weather when the plastic case is more pliable, but for me... I saw just a little bit a clearance issues here.Otherwise, the fit and finish, the price and seemingly protective ability of this case for the LG 800G was a great purchase for me and I am satisfied with the product.

I was forced to buy a TracFone because my Apple iPhone 4S was rendered useless due to a defective product made by LifeProof (long story, no time to explain here, but see my review of "LifeProof case" elsewhere here on Amazon.Although this LG phone can't compete with the Apple iPhone, it has been a wonderful back-up for me. The audio is clear, it is easy to use for sending a text message (unlike a neighbors phone that is difficult for sending texts) and the LG800G has worked in a couple of places I didn't think my Apple iPhone had "bars" in.The LG 800G easily fits in my shirt pocket and is unobtrusive. The touch-screen requires just a tad more pressure than my iPhone, but I learned quickly to hold it better and be a little more forceful when pressing icons and the QWERTY screen.It blows me away how long the battery holds a charge. I once left it turned on for nearly a week and left it in my car, forgetting about it... It was still holding enough "juice" to make calls. This feature alone makes it worthy as an emergency phone during prolonged power outages, unlike my iPhone that has to be charged every night.

I purchased a pair of these through Amazon to prevent my pant legs from being totally saturated in spiny needles from Cat Tail Cactus. I have been working on getting some new land I bought into "shape" and each day when I went home, the small cactus needles (nearly invisible to the eye) were causing me much pain.By wearing my new Plastic Snake Leggings on several outings, they prevent the small cactus needles from catching onto and in my pants from my boots all the way up to the front of my knee.I have found this product easy to put onto my legs and easy to remove. I have not noticed that they make my legs any hotter, but I probably can expect this when summer rolls around. Even if they do make it seem hotter, I'm delighted that I no longer find hundreds of tiny hair-like cactus needles in my trousers. They also do a great job of keeping mesquite thorns from puncturing into and through pant legs. I suspect I'll never have to worry about rattle snakes again when walking through tall brush and grasses either.I am happy with this purchase.

We live in a nasty, NASTY part of Texas having a clay-based soil that sticks like Gorilla Glue to everything. It has been exasperating trying to wipe and scrape the muck off after a rain.I've tried wiping my boots and shoes off using everything imaginable, from old files to pocket knifes, sticks, twigs, old carpet scraps... you name it.I found something that worked fairly well for about two weeks (made of bristles on a twisted wire-bed) but it didn't hold together and was soon in the trash.This boot scraper (I bought on Amazon) arrived right before a soaking rain came and I was eager to see how it performed. To my amazement, it did a very good job of removing the clay muck from my boots before walking into my garage. It scrubbed not only the bottom of the boots, but along the sides. It didn't seem to do a great job of removing clay from the toe end of the boot though, but I was so happy at the way it got the muck off the bottoms and sides, I'm thinking about ordering a second one to place outside of my barn.The boot scraper will not drain water though, so after scraping my boots on it two times, I had to dump the water and muck. I guess in a way though it's good that the tray holds water in the event someone decides to place this just inside their door to their home. For me, I'm happy to scoot the boot in this contraption...

(UPDATE 2-22-2012... ABC News aired a report tonight stating that Master Locks is pulling out of China! Hip-hip hurray... Now, when this lock is made in an American factory here in the USA, you'll see the quality go back to the longtime quality that Master Locks was famous for...)I've used Master locks since I was a kid in grade school back in the 60s. The name "Master Lock" until today stood for quality, dependability, safety, durability and ruggedness.About 15 years ago, I purchased 5 of the "set your own combination" padlocks made by Master for use on gates here at my farm and for tool boxes. These locks have stood the test of time outside in bad weather, dust, Texas heat, hail storms, ice, rain and snow and are still giving me great service to this day, which is why I ordered 5 more for tool boxes, gates, sheds etc, here on Amazon.My new Master Locks arrived this morning, 12-7-2011 and I was eager to change the combinations from the factory setting of 0-0-0-0 (as I have done in the past with my original MADE IN THE USA Master Locks) to the same combination as my older Master Locks. As I examined the locks, I noticed they were no longer housed in a bright brass case, but now came in a regular steel case that was spray painted a dull black. I can only imagine after being outside on a gate, or a trailer, the insides would turn to rust, unlike the old Master Locks that have real brass cases.When attempting to set the new combinations, one of them would NOT allow me to re-set the combination from the factory setting of 0-0-0-0. Two problems (that I can determine) why this lock would not allow this...#1. The small "key" for resetting the combinations that now comes with the lock is so thin now, it is not durable enough to twist inside the access hole to re-trigger the tumbler. The cheap key bends when attempting to turn it 90 degrees. Those darned folks in China, now they are even skimping on this little key! A few years back when these were made in the USA, the re-set key was stout enough to use for chipping ice. These days, the key must be made from re-cycled aluminum foil or something.#2. The rotary wheels on the new locks, do NOT click into place on the back of the lock (like my old Master Locks) where the numbers are suppose to align-up with a indentation where you dial the numbers. The "slop" in the action on these new locks is so bad, it's probably the reason the tumblers won't set when attempting to rotate the key. I spent half and hour trying to set the combination on three of the locks and I gave up. The tolerances are not as good with the Made In China Master Locks as the fit and tolerance as my old reliable MADE IN THE USA Master Locks.This is the first time in my 5 year relationship with Amazon that I am returning a purchase. Up to this time, everything I've ordered has been acceptable.These new Master Locks are no longer made in the United States (by craftsmen, like my older Master locks) and when I inspected the packages this afternoon, I confirmed my suspicions where they came from.After nearly 50 years of being a loyal Master Lock customer, I will probably not ever buy one of these poorly made locks from them again. I'll be looking for locks made here in the USA or at least Taiwan.I should have known when they switched from a durable brass housing to a cheaper thin-walled steel case that looks like it was spray-painted with a can of Krylon, that the executives of Master Lock decided "cheaper is better." And indeed, "cheaper" also means "ADIOS Amigos," it was nice knowing you Master Lock in earlier years, but not now.

We live in a rural area on a farm and although my house sits 1,200 feet off the highway, it nearly shouts "COME ROB ME" to travelers going up and down the road. Our nearest neighbor is too far to see our property and despite having dogs here on the farm, I wanted something that would visually communicate "we are at home" at night, when we were really gone, for days (and nights) at a time.This device emits illumination inside my living room (or any room I want to place it) and from the outside, it looks like someone is inside watching TV.  I've actually done surveillance (as a licensed private investigator here in Texas) and have written in reports and synopsis that residences where surveillance has been conducted, "revealed television set was on, inside the house."  I was even able to tell what TV station the set was on... long story and you don't need the details...To me, as I set this device up inside my home and went outside to monitor the effectiveness of this device, IT LOOKED REAL TO ME!This tiny unit flashes illumination inside the room and colors change (from greens, to white, to blues and others) and it perfectly imitates a television being viewed. The trick is to place it so it illuminates a wall or drapes and make certain it can't be seen by a passerby.It was so convincing to me, I ordered a second one to put in my 5th wheel RV. Now, when we are gone, it looks like someone is not only inside our home watching TV, but it also appears we have guests staying in the RV...I am delighted in this product... It probably costs a few pennies per day to run, it doesn't heat up the house (like if leaving the real TV on) and it cycles off automatically when the sun comes up in the morning.

It's dark and large and scares my dogs when I wear this contraption on my head but WOW, I like the fit and comfort despite my critters thinking Darth Vader just landed in the yard and is "coming to get us..."I needed a replacement respirator for when I spray pesticides and spray paint and especially when shredding turf on my farm. Several months ago, I was shredding with my big tractor and 14 foot wide mower and I didn't have my old respirator on because I hated wearing it. It restricted my vision, was uncomfortable and was getting rather tired.In the process of going through some rough spots on the highway right-of-way, I must have shredded something having fiberglass particles in it. My eye became so irritated, I had to make an emergency run to an opthomologist where she found several shards in my eye and was able to remove them (the pain was incredible!) and the very next day I ordered the 3M 6900 full-face respirator. I have used this product on 6 occasions and LOVE the comfort but especially the superior vision it affords over my previous respirator. One of the reasons I went with this is because I have never found any product made by 3M not to exceed my expectations.This respirator has a feature (if you purchase as an option) to allow for prescription lenses to be wore underneath. It was too pricy for me, so I called my eye doctor and ordered several sets of disposable contact lenses to wear underneath. They (and my 3M 6900) are serving me well as I shred, paint and apply herbicides... I'm very happy with my purchase.  "May the Force be with you..."

In early October 2011, I purchased an iPhone 4S and I take my previous iPhone to have the screen repaired in order to give it to my niece. The technician recommended a LifeProof case at Best Buy and he said that probably would have that would have prevented the glass screen on my old iPhone from breaking. While he is making the repair to my old iPhone, I go to Best Buy and purchase the LifeProof case for my new 4S.All is well with the new iPhone and LifeProof case. I notice it takes a little more pressure to make the apps work through the LifeProof screen but no big deal, I quickly adapt.A couple of weeks later, my wife and I take a flight from Dallas/Fort Worth airport to Savanna, Georgia and we return home a week later.  I didn't use my iPhone 4S for making calls while we were gone, except to use the mapping apps while in Savanna.It's now the first week of November, and as I use my iPhone 4S for making calls after the adventure in Savannah, the audio is muffled. People I call are complaining that they are hearing their own voice being echoed when they talk back to me. Some of the calls I place to people, my own audio is so distorted that people can't understand me. I suspect a problem with my new iPhone and I Google "iPhone 4S distorted audio", iPhone 4s audio echo" and I find numerous sites where people are complaining about their new iPhone 4S having audio clarity problems as I have experienced. I call Apple and they arrange to have my iPhone 4S sent back for warranty repair.  A few days later, the replacement iPhone 4S arrives, it checks out fine and I place it back in the LifeProof case. All is well for a number of days, the iPhone works fine. I make a quick trip to Colorado, return home and the next day, I call a business in a nearby town. The person says repeatedly "hello, HELLO" and then hangs up on me... I call my wife at work and while she recognizes my number on her iPhone, she can't understand me because my audio is so garbled.I call Apple and talk to them about the garbled audio and I advise them this replacement phone only holds a charge for  a day. Apple graciously sends me an overnight box to return my iPhone 4S. A few days later, the 3rd iPhone 4S arrives and the battery on this 3rd 4S runs nearly two days... I'm a happy camper with two days use on the 4S.  I place the 3rd 4S back in the LifeProof case... everything works out fine.  A week later, the dreaded audio feedback, garbled audio returns. I call Apple and ask them what my problem is. This time the Apple rep suggests the problem is with AT&T.I am so frustrated at this point; I purchase a TracFone and use it until I can make the 100-mile drive to the AT&T store and advise them Apple suggests the problem with my terrible audio is on their end. The store manager directs me to one of her reps (a savvy retired Air Force guy) and I explain my problem to him.  He takes one quick look at my iPhone 4S and says, "Here's your problem. The LifeProof case!"  He tells me to go outside and to call him on his phone. Sure enough, he can't even understand me. He motions for me to come back in and he removes the LifeProof case asking me to go back outside. I call him again and the audio on both sides is crystal clear.  PROBLEM SOLVED...I go home, get online to LifeProof and advise their case had been causing severe audio feedback and echo problems (and I am not the only customer affected...) and I advise I have just changed my 5 star review I left on Amazon to a 1 star review. She advises that they are "no longer" marketing LifeProof cases through Amazon. Had you purchased your case at BestBuy, we could have replaced your case with a new one."  She never offered me any explanation, did not offer to exchange my case and I was stuck with this defective product they flooded the market with.LifeProof (in their wisdom) gives this "corrective fix" to customers in regard to their inherent defective cases... "Blow hard into the microphone for about 3 to 4 seconds.  The sufficient effort require(d) is akin to blowing a candle out.  You could also pretend you were blowing up a balloon by sealing your lips over the hole and then blowing."  Well, many people are tired of having to blow into their defective LifeProof cases several if not dozens of times per day (Google for yourself and especially on MacRumors)LifeProof didn't do a good job at designing this case. Their "fix" didn't work for me... many 3rd party accessories, such as chargers and audio docking devices DO NOT work with their case. Many people complain that the screen on the LifeProof makes it more difficult to work apps... I'd strongly recommend researching though Google or Bing what other customers have to say about this case. It seems to me that LifeProof "GOOFED" when they were designing this product.In hindsight, It seems that any changes in barometric pressure, or changes in altitude (such as when I went from 1,400 feet at the DFW airport to sea-level in Savanah... and even when going up and down in an elevator) can trigger the problems associated with pressures inside the LifeProof case. If the pressure changes, it seems that audio from the person you are calling gets "funneled" back into the mouthpiece on the iPhone and creates this "echo" problem that many people experience when they are talking to someone having a LifeProof case on their iPhone. I even concluded that changes in temperatures can trigger the audio problems. It seems the problem is worse in colder weather than during warm temperatures.The LifeProof case is very sexy looking. It fit nicely in my shirt pocket and was much more comfortable than my new Mophie case that I bought to replace the LifeProof (however the Mophie has an internal back-up battery and thus the reason for the extra bulk in my shirt pocket compared to the slender LifeProof case.) Please also be warned that LifeProof advises that the gaskets that make the case waterproof will be rendered useless after you have removed your iPhone from the case "50 times." So, if you are having to pull your iPhone out of the case in order to make it work with docking stations and chargers that the LifeProof case CAN NOT ACCEPT, soon, your LifeProof case is no longer waterproof.If you are happy to constantly blow onto the case... if you can live without your 3rd party accessories that you have for your iPhone that are NOT compatible with the LifeProof case... and if you don't have a problem with something called "pillowing" associated with this product (I never had that specific problem) you might actually like the LifeProof case... but for me, their "service after the sale" and numerous problems with this case (that ate up the biggest part of my $100 bill) isn't worth the grief and aggravation. And it looks really silly when you are at an airport or out in public, blowing into your iPhone in order to make the LifeProof case "happy."

0:31 MinsI've been using electric gate openers on my farm since 1997. My first "batch" of gate openers was marketed as "GTO" whom I suspect is or was acquired by Mighty Mule a few years ago.I currently have 4 each Mighty Mule 350 gate openers on my farm. From my experience, they seem to last only as long as the warranty is valid.  I figure these must have a computer chip that automatically makes them go defunct about a week after they have been in service for a year. My latest issue is the opener that gives access to our yard (from a livestock pasture) has for no reason started opening and closing on it's own. (The video I'm showing with my review was shot on my cell phone... I just happened to be walking form my barn back to my house when I saw the gate opener going nuts. It opened on it's own for no reason and then started closing a couple of feet, and then jerking backwards to close, then opening a few feet and closing. This process continued for more than ten minutes. Sorry for the lousy video, it was a spur of the moment thing.)One of my dogs got out in the middle of the night because the Mighty Mule started opening and closing on it's own in early September. Here it is nearly October and the Mighty Mule is still going nuts, despite turning it off for 24 hours hoping it had a software issue.  We live 1,200 from the highway, so we know this isn't happening because of someone else using a remote control, and none of the other gate openers are going nuts (at the moment, but as soon as they are a year old, based on 14 years of experience, they will die or go "nuts" about a week after they have been in service for exactly a year.I guess it is just best to figure the gate openers cost $1 per day and at the end of the year, you buy another one. They don't seem to have any competition, so you are basically stuck with the company who makes the Mighty Mule.From now on, each time we leave our yard and our farm for even short durations, we are forced to get out of our vehicle and turn the power switch off to ensure our gates just don't go "bump" in the night allowing livestock or pets to escape, or thieves to enter our property.

I buy a lot of shoes on line and know that I have a standard size 9.5 W foot.  Sometimes the width can get a bit tricky,  as some shoes are narrower or wider than others.  But I'm always size 9.5. That is why I was so surprised with these shoes - the width was fine,  but the length was definitely too short,  my toes were high up against the tip of the shoe and it was not comfortable at all.  I tried them on in the house and then returned them immediately.  I agree with the person who said they were a good utility shoe,  but I was hoping for a little more line/elegance when I got them,  but they were just as clunky as the landsend shoes I get - which are far more comfortable.  So I will hesitate to buy Vaneli on line again until I get a better sense of their sizingAs always,  Amazon makes returns effortless and smooth.

I like the brand Propet,  I've bought them before and I'm a standard size 9.5 W with them.  I liked the look and the stone color a lot.  Unfortunately,  while the toes were comfortable and wide enough,  the back of the show was oddly lower than normal and worked more like a slipper than a shoe,  slipping on and off as I walked.  This would only get worse as the leather got looser,  so despite the great price,  I had to return them.  As always,  Amazon returns were effortless.  I buy with confidence now that they offer free returns on shoes.

This is a hard book for me to rate.  It's certainly not easily forgettable - which is saying something,  seeing how many books I read a year.  But it's not a comfortable read or a comfortable relationship that is created.  There are spoilers in this review.I actually think that Daniel,  the sleep deprived,  sleep walking,  sleeping killing protagonist was actually too crazy,  and I worried for Bel,  Joe Bellman,  the young local cop who might/wants to save him.  This is one of those angst ridden tortured romances but Daniel couldn't always distinguish reality from his sleep walking escapades and he felt fragile and damaged to me.  Joe Beman (Bel) was a good young cop,  not exactly hiding but not publicizing his gayness.  They meet when Daniel sleep drives himself to danger and Bel gets him out of it.  I was interested while I read it and thought about it afterwards but I wouldn't classify this as a romance,  and the violence in it is also disturbing (and non consensual,  though not between the lovers)  I think Daniel needed a lot more work on himself and perhaps a stint in a psychiatric hospital would not have gone amiss.

This is a great Matzo,  I love the crispness and the slightly burnt flavor.  But this price is ridiculous.  I usually get it for around $7-8 a box,  so this is almost twice the price!  If you buy a set of 5 boxes from Amazon you can get it for $40,  which brings it back to $8, far more reasonable.

I have sensitive skin and like this cleanser as it is very gentle but definitely leaves you skin feeling cleaner.  This is the third one I've bought,  it travels well,  doesn't leak (though I still put it in a zip lock bag when packing it) and is mild enough for daily use.

Great first book! So good I can't quite believe it's a debut novel.  I liked everything about this book,  from the main characters,  their internal thoughts,  their connection,  to the secondary characters and the descriptions of college and small town life.  Daniel Mulligan is on his job interview at some tiny non descript town when he runs over a dog and then the real adventures begin  (not to worry,  no dogs were killed in the making of this novel)  Rex Vale is indeed a king of man,  solid,  real and trustworthy.  I loved their interactions and connections.  I liked their back stories and friends.  It was so good it was hard to end and I hope we meet them again in some other book of hers.

I've read a lot of Cardeno C and s/he has written some of my all time m/m  favorites.  However this book was frankly... boring.  It lacked the intensity that Cardeno usually brings and it was both low key and also hard to believe at the same time.  For someone who was close enough to Jesse to inherit his diner,  Tanner didn't seem to know much about his life,  and seeing Mike was one of his closest friends, he didn't know much about his home life.  I didn't like the age differences,  didn't like the story development,  didn't feel engaged with either the quiet shy Tanner or the more beautiful macho Steve.  Really it read like an outline rather than a fleshed out story.  There are many excellent Cardeno C books out there,  this one you can miss

I read another Alexis Hall and just loved it - For Real  so went looking for more and found this.I didn't mind the beginning or even the attempt to show an East end accent,  which annoyed some other reviewers.  I liked the writing,  Alexis Hall writes well. But one of her characters did something I found unforgiveable and it was hard for me to continue with the book afterwards.  There are repercussions,  but I just couldn't like Ash afterwards.

I have sensitive skin and eyes and don't like creams with sun factors in them.  This is very reasonably priced (it cost $10 more at my local pharmacy) and goes on easily,  goes in well,  doesn't just sit on the surface of my skin.  This is my third bottle of it and my skin likes it.  It doesn't bother my eyes or make my red skin redder and it does make my skin feel more hydrated.

Bought it on impulse during an Amazon cyber sale.  Don't know if I would go for it at full price,  but discounted it feels worth it.  I've tried a few thickening/hair loss shampoos and most have been a dud.  My hair does feel thicker and definitely has more volume after I use this so that's a plus.

Pocky's are essentially like a straight,  fine textured  pretzel half dipped in variously flavored chocolate.  They are very moreish, it's easy to devour a whole box without realizing it.  I'm just not a huge fan of green tea and here found the green tea flavor distracting.  If you like that flavor,  you may well love these.  I've eaten other Pocky sticks - I love the strawberry and the chocolate and they have lots of other flavors (banana chocolate is also delicious)

Mary Calmes either hits it out of the park or simply misses for me - and this was a miss.  I didn't fall in love with either the characters or the situation and while I read it from beginning to end (an automatic 3 star rating for me) I doubt that I will reread it,  which makes it a fail for me.  She's written some of my all time favorites but I would recommend starting with another of her books.

I haven't read a conventional sweet romance in some time,  and a friend recommended another book by this author,  but this one was free,  and so I downloaded it first.I really liked the reality show setting,  the 1885 vibe and how hard it all was.  I liked the other characters and I enjoyed the primary romance.  My only gripe was that that the good doctor was really too perfect,  and the ex boyfriend really too evil.  So while the side characters felt real enough - with a pinch of romance dust,  the mains were too black and white.Small SpoilerI didn't like the ending - I felt everyone got too extreme,  either too perfect or too awful and I stopped believing in it for a bit there. However,  this  is well written book,  and on the basis of this I would read more by Rosalind James.

Funny and cute,  a nice spin on super heroes,  villains and minions.  Based on this I would look for more by Alex Gabriel,  I really liked the writing and characterizations,  and the basic scenario was just so juicy and clever,  it was fun to spend time in this world.definitely worth taking a punt on,  spent a few happy hours with this book.

I always look forward to a new Lucas Davenport book.  I love his voice,  his friendships, his point of view.  The only negative is that he is so familiar to me after 25 books, some of which I have reread,  that he can be too familiar - there are no surprises with him.  These hard boiled twisty crimes which are often horrific and with very high body counts are starting to feel a bit like cozy mysteries to me.  Of course if you've not read the other 25 books,  you would find this a crazy statement.However,  I feel that Sandford is also suffering a bit,  which is why Lucas is so over his position at the BCA.  Indeed,  the majority of the book is not even set in Minnesota.  Also while his characters are aging,  they don't really address this enough,  and that could be a very lively theme in the forthcoming books (I definitely want this series to continue!)  What happens to the cool 35 year old cop when he is 50 plus.  There has to be a different point of view,  and that is the elephant in Lucas's house - he needs to have a case where he confronts his own aging and allows that to be part of the story,  otherwise it's sharply written and engaging while we read it,  but not truly memorable afterwards.Maybe I am expecting too much,  but some of the earlier books really lingered ( Shadow Prey is a personal favorite) and some of these later ones I devour like popcorn,  but then forget as soon as they are done.  I want one that lingers again...

I have made myself a promise that if I order shoes on line and they aren't amazing I will return them.  These fit just fine in terms of length and width,  but a good walking shoe can make you feel like you are walking on air,  and these most definitely did not.  There was not enough arch support or sense of cushioning and I also have weak ankles and there was no sense of stabilizing there.  They fit like regular shoes but not like athletic or walking shoes.  So I tried them on and wore them in the house but then realized that if I tried them on in a shop there was no way I would buy them,  so just because they were already in my home,  doesn't mean I would keep them.  So I returned them the next day - Amazon has a very easy return format.  I've already received an email from amazon saying that they have received them and that I am refunded.

It's lighter and prettier than I thought it would be and mysteriously goes with everything I own - a happy find.  Has a nice Spring feel to it.Took a bit longer to come,  but well within it's due date - just don't expect it within 2 days,  it's coming all the way from China.
delicious crunchy high protein snack - deals with any cravings for chips without the guilt.  Happy to have in the house.

Actually taste like a gummy,  no weird vitamin after taste like some have.  Because it tastes like a treat - but it's not sickly sweet,  got a nice bit of tartness to it -  it's easy to get everyone to take it and easy to remember.  We reorder the second we got low,  it's a staple in our household.
We love the flavor and like the easy packaging.  We live on this stuff,  especially in the summer.  I like it because it makes it easier for me to get my liquids in.

I got this as a freebee and am sometimes suspicious of such books, but this was well written and charming.  It's not a new conceit - boy has to go on 5 dates because his sister has bullied him into it -  but Amy Jo  Cousins makes it work and I really liked both characters and their connection.  Will look for more by Cousins.

Disappointing.  I love Mary Calmes and own and reread most of her books.  This one felt phoned in.  The characters knew each other for a few years, so it wasn't precisely whirlwind, but they neither of them felt three dimensional or real.  The Japanese Takeo was a cipher,  and the hero,  whose point of view we saw the most,  was kind of bland.  There are much better,  more emotionally engaging Mary Calmes books out there,  this is for die hard fans only,  and maybe not them either...

I find that with Cardeno C I either completely love the characters and situations - and indeed I've reread several of their books many times - or it just doesn't work and leaves me flat.  This was one of the flatter books for me.  Maybe the time line didn't work,  or the characters.  I'm not even sure why,  I just wasn't engaged.  I've read it once,  but haven't reread it at all,  hence the 3 stars...

we have a lot of phones in the house so everyone needs to have theirs in a case so we can tell them a part.  This is an ideal case for someone who doesn't really want one - it's very thin and non invasive,  but it still manages to distinguish and protect the phone.  It also looks elegant, and my son is happy with it.  It's also smooth and doesn't catch on anything, which as it lives in his pocket most of the time,  is a benefit.

these bars were recommended to me.  I love variety assortments, because it gives me so many options.  I didn't love these bars as much as my friends did.  They also mentioned zapping them in the microwave for 30 seconds to get a warm brownie affect. They are low in sugar and have a good amount of protein,  so I would recommend them on that level. I didn't mind the flavors but the texture didn't do it for me - they are kind of heavy and doughy and a bit dry or conversely too oily.  I didn't crave them or want them, but when I ate them, they worked.

well,  I don't love it,  but my puppy surely does.  We have bought lots of chew toys to no avail  - he still prefers shoes and Tupperware.  However this one is different, he actually takes it out of his toy bowl and plays with it all by himself,  and if we offer it to him, he takes it happily.  I don't know why this bone is different from all the others,  but this one is definitely a favorite.  He's been gnawing on it for maybe 3 weeks now and it's still in good shape - so he likes it and it has some longevity.  I call that a win!

My puppy chewed my expensive leather case and I had to replace it. This one does not look or feel like the real leather one did,  but it's a cheerful color and protects the phone well.  I love the credit card holding facility and won't get a phone case that doesn't hold one now - it's so convenient,  most of the time it's the only wallet I take with me.

This is a very inexpensive shoe which fit really well,  those cross straps make it super comfortable and easy to wear,  but I have to say that it looks like a cheap shoe (which it is!)  but I wouldn't wear it out at night or to an event.  Strictly a casual /day shoe. But you would walk miles in them - so that's a big plus for me and my finicky feet.

Rich and sweet chocolaty coffee protein drink.  I've tried countless protein drinks and really,  taste is such a personal thing,  so it's hard to grade on that,  but this one just worked for me - it feel richer and more robust than other chocolate protein drinks I've tried. A friend of mine who didn't know it was a protein shake tried it and liked it on flavor alone, and that felt about right to me - it's a great taste and that it has so much protein is a good bonus.  I've had it for lunch a few times and now and it carries me for a good 3-4 hours,  before I need something else...  Happy find.

Didn't work for me. Tiffany just felt like a poor man's Stephanie Plum to me, and following her every thought and moment just didn't engage me.  I have to finish a book for it to get 3 stars and I didn't finish this one,  so 2 stars it is.

This product could not have arrived at a better time. I just moved. These scissors have been used for: opening boxes, breaking tape seals, opening those terrible vacuum sealed plastic packages, cutting fabric, screwing a flat head screw....you name it, these have been my "go-to". I am keeping them in my tool box. Excellent product!

So far so good. I would like to give this a little more time to see "noticeable" improvements before I review so I might update my review again at a later date. I have very sensitive skin and most eye creams irritate my eyes. This does not. It goes on smoothly, without an odor and does not irritate or make my eyes water. I really like this and will buy it again.

Keep in mind that they are 100% cotton, so they wrinkle! Be prepared to either take out of the drier still damp and smooth out wrinkles or iron. The only queen bed in the family belongs to my 11 year old son. He reports that the sheets are soft & cozy. We live in hot temperatures so the 100% cotton helps keep us cool at night. I would buy these again. Maybe not for my own bed but definitely for my guest & son's bed. Side note: the fitted sheet did not have very deep pockets so I am not sure how it would do with a pillow-top mattress.
0:54 Mins Great for Scotch on the Rocks ;) Excuse the redneck garage refrigerator.

Everything you Need in one bundle. Excellent products:1. The handle has an excellent feel and is comfortable2. The brushes are very sturdy & a good quality3. Great for hair mats & everyday maintenance4. I highly recommend
4 Stars.

I love this product and find myself traveling with this bag on all my short trips. It fits my iPad, kindle and some misc papers, folders very well and securely. AND because it is called a "sling" and not a "man-purse", my husband also will use this bag for when he needs to carry additional items or for short travel trips. It's excellent and I highly recommend it!!

Worked Great for Ice but the silicone tray was flimsy and hard to carry to the freezer with water in it. BUT what I really love this product for is making gummy lego candy!! It's perfect ;)
I had to modify them by cutting down the heel but then they worked perfect!

2:34 MinsYou will love all the blogger's recipes that are highlighted in this book: mattbites, steamykitchen, southern plate, whiteonricecouple, glutenfreegirl, norecipes, katheats, picky-palate, dinnerwithjulie, ourbestbites, weelicious, simple recipes, andresrecipes, coconutandlime, laurasbestrecipes...just to name a few!!Fun book ;)
3:08 MinsI love books that get kids & families playing OUTSIDE!! A great book to celebrate the start of warmer temperatures...

Many different styles, lots of color & great advice from some very talented decorators. Take a look at my video-I flip through the pages to "give you an idea" of what the book is about. Enjoy ;)

I just received these headphones in time for the Thanksgiving break. They are getting lots of use between the hubby's football games blasting & my son's xbox. I have enjoyed catching up on several of my shows using my iPad and drowning out all the other noises in the house!I normally use Bose headphones [...], so my comparisons will be based on this:1. These headphones are heavier & have an 80's retro feel to them2. They are bulky and will not be great for travel3. There is a nice extension cord that allows for longer or shorter lengths depending on your device (arm wearing or for laps etc.)4. They block out outside ambient noise (thank goodness!)5. Gold plated jacks for higher quality6. The ear muffs sit a little tight & square on your ears7. There is amble padding on the top of the earphones for comfort on your headI think I like the Bose headphones better because they deliver everything these headphones do but come in a better design for travel etc.My 2 cents! Good luck shopping ;)

Nothing bad to say. Love this case. Feels good to the touch, does not get dirty, light weight. Product is exactly as described! No issues.
These glasses broke within a week. My 7 year old was not being rough or hard on them. A very cheap product. Save your money.

This was a much needed product!! I am "room mom" for my son's 2nd grade class, so I am continually doing little projects to hand out to each student. What would you do if you could go back in time?  Would you change anything?  Brock Matthews has that experience via his dreams.  He begins to have a nightmare involving his deceased father for five nights in a row.  He visits his best friend who gives him a book on lucid dreaming which claims that the dreamer can learn to control his dreams and thereby stop the nightmare from occurring.  Brock reads the book, finds it intriguing and gives it a try.  What happens next…well, you’ll have to read the book to find out!Brock’s life, in addition to his nightmare, is falling apart.  His world famous coffee company that he runs with his brother is on the verge of bankruptcy, his wife is very distant and aloof and at his high school reunion an old girlfriend makes an appearance and an impression on Brock.  Brock also has some guilt over the way his relationship with his father stood at the time of his father’s death.  In addition, he has always felt his father loved his brother more and has been very competitive with his brother in just about everything.  He and his brother have a lot of tension in their relationship.  What if he could change things?  Brock has always viewed himself as a Christian, and he is sure he knows God’s plan for him.This was a very interesting concept of redemption and healing.  I’ve read other books by this author and really enjoyed them.  The regrets about the past and the wishing for a “do-over” in some situations really rang true for me.  I liked the faith elements in the story as well as the realistic struggles Brock encountered.  The emotions evoked from grief to laughter were something else that engaged me in the story.  I’m looking forward to the next intriguing story from the pen of this author!

The setting of the story begins in Chicago right before Christmas.  A wonderful 86-year-old lady named Joy wants to spread Christmas joy along route 66.  Miranda, a young divorcee just returning from visiting her sister, sees Joy packing all these large tubs with names on them.  Soon, before Miranda knows what hit her, she joins Joy on the ride, learning to drive an RV.  Hopefully, Joy will see life come into Miranda’s eyes again.  You see Miranda has no members of her family living close by, Joy is moving, the house is in foreclosure and Miranda has no job.The novel then leads readers on a heartfelt journey into some of the lives of various people who connected with Joy via her website.  Throughout the tale readers are reminded of ways to share joy with others and not to be as self-absorbed as society tends to live life.  I loved this elderly character and her heart to take one last trip before entering an assisted living facility near where her two grown sons live.Joy is a character whose actions challenge us to think outside the box in creative ways in giving away some much of what we have been blessed to own.  Above all, the greatest gift Joy gives is of her time, energy and looking for those who need to be reached by listening to their stories with a heart of love.  Lastly, though Joy’s plans didn’t quite go the way she had planned, she trusted the Lord to do that which would glorify Him as well as touch many people’s hearts and lives.This is a very heartwarming story that I hope you will read and share with others.

Here is a devotional that doesn’t spew platitudes, but encourages women in their walk with the Lord.  One devotion I read wasn’t just about prayer, but also placed a letter of Paul in its historical context.  Read the Scripture portion placed underneath the title for the day’s devotion.  Use whatever version you are comfortable with, then there is space where women can write thoughts, prayers, questions, etc.Personally, I would have liked to see more thought-provoking writing beyond the couple of minutes that it takes to read at its current length.  I would suggest not writing in the book as the ink might bleed through the pages plus the advantage of using a notebook means no shortage of room to write what the Lord places on your heart or whatever you wish to express to Him.Use the devotional at a moment to reenergize your Spirit or in the times you’re able to sit, being still to know He is God!  These books are a great way to start having regular moments with the Lord or can spark study into a topic or book in the Bible at a deeper level.  God Bless!

Prince Malachi at the age of 21 is forced into an arranged marriage by his father when his brother refuses to marry the girl whose father saved the life of their father.  Malachi meets his bride at their wedding ceremony and soon discovers she is no more interested in marrying him than he is in marrying her.  However, he will obey his father and he promises Jessabelle he will be a faithful husband.  At 19, Jessabelle has never even been on a date and now finds herself married to a royal prince.  She is thrust into the public eye and a royal family when all she wants to do is blend into the background.  She is not comfortable in her marriage or her position as a royal princess.  Will she ever get over her insecurity and feel a sense of belonging in this royal family?A mere three weeks after her wedding, her father dies.  Jessabelle is still trying to adjust to being a wife and now she grieves for her father.  Her mother died when she was a young girl, so now she feels all alone.  Her husband is incredibly kind and respectful of her.  He supports her any way he can.  Jessabelle begins to have an inkling of what love might be like, but is far from letting down her emotional walls to let Malachi into her heart.While I enjoyed this book, I wish I would have read the author’s other series about other members of the royal family as I felt I was missing some background on several of the characters that appeared in this book.  Events and relationships were referred to that I didn’t know about.  This didn’t detract from the writing or the plot of this story though I would have liked to know these details to enhance my reading experience.  Prince Malachi was a wonderful prince and Christian man with a great deal of patience, compassion and empathy for his new bride.  He was so gentle and loving toward her; he treated her as precious to him, but also reminded her that her identity came from God not man.  I liked getting to know Jessabelle and see her grow into her place in the royal family.  The relationship development between Jessabelle and Malachi was also very touching.  I’m looking forward to future books in this series.

When I learned who the author was of Sky Lantern I knew I wanted to read it as Matt writes with lots of heart and soul.  I knew nothing about sky lanterns until I saw them in a few movies and my curiosity was sparked.  What is shared is a story of a young lady who lost her father to cancer and part of her way of expressing her heart was writing a simple note and sending it off on a lantern.I believe that God, who is in control of all things, made sure the lantern came down in Matt’s yard.  He is a father of three daughters.  Matt places an open letter on his blog, hoping to connect with the girl who sent the lantern.  Anyone who wishes to read the letter that sets the adventure in motion can read it online.What is so astounding is the number of people that were touched and encouraged when Matt set out to meet with the girl.  When you get the book, plan on being touched deeply in your soul, heart with possibly tears in your eyes.  Anyone who has lost a family member or friend or known someone who has will want to see what acts of kindness can do to peoples’ hearts and lives.  Along with that, I think the book shows the strong bond between parents and children and to nurture that relationship until the end of their life!  Seize the moment and make the most of the time God gives you to build trust, love, a godly legacy and good memories!

The story is definitely a heart-tugging, attention-grabbing, emotional rollercoaster kind of novel.  The main female character is named Tammy.  She finds her marriage falling apart, single-parenting is more than a challenge, her work as an organ procurement coordinator fulfilling and she seeks to speak the gospel message to her clients.Nick is a divorcee who loses his firstborn son in an accident, which is how his and Tammy’s paths cross again.  They had not seen each other since high school ten years ago.  Nick is dealing with grief and an ex-wife who is keeping their other son away from him as she blames him for the death of their first son.I found the themes of prayer, leaning on the Lord, forgiveness, trust and more very refreshing to see in the tale.  The author shows us through other minor characters what unforgiveness, bitterness and other unresolved feelings can do to an individual as well as having a rippling effect on others.Another aspect of the story that brings the aspect of reality to it is that resolving issues and dealing with emotions takes time.
