From the Anasazi of the American Southwest to the Natchez of the gulf coast of Mississippi and many other sites, Ancient Native Americans built homes, hunting camps, and even towns like Mesa Verde in southwest Colorado.  This guide tells the brief history of these sites, how you can visit them, who runs the sites now and what there is to see.From the National Park Service to private organizations these sites are available to the public to discover and learn about the Ancient Native Americans who though have been gone for thousands of years, but left their mysterious cultures, buildings, and artifacts for us to learn from.  Some of these sites are small and not much is left in artifacts, but others left thousands of artifacts and buildings.  Some of these sites still remain a mystery of how they were originally intended and all of these sites have still not given up all that is there for us to learn from.The author has broken down the sites into the following:-States that have the sites-Attraction:-Hours:-Admission Fee:-For More Information:-Then the history of the site, how it was discovered, the main sites to see within the parks and sites:-How to get there:This is a great book that is highly recommend to have if you plan to see any of these sites.  The book was published in 1994, so I am sure that many facts have changed about the sites and what there is to see and do, but still, this is a great book to take if you want to discover these fascinating Ancient Native American Sites.  RECOMMENDED!

Texas is a Strong, Tough, and Independent state, it is the LONE STAR State, and many unique and fascinating people have made it become a "legend" not only in U.S. History but in World History.  In this excellent book the authors tell about a few of the Strong, Tough, and Independent women who have made Texas legendary.  These short stories (1 to 2 pages) highlight the fascinating history of these women who come from different background and have made different yet important contributions to Texas.  These women highlighted the different historical eras of Texas from Colonial Spanish Texas to the founding of the Texas Republic, to today, and from entertainment to pioneers to the grocery business, and from different ethnicity and cultures these women though had the same characteristics Strong, Tough, and Independent, these women were and are fascinating and the authors tell their story excellently.  The women highlighted in this book are:-Rosa Maria Hinojosa de Balli, Adina de Zavala, Clara Driscoll-Lady Bird Johnson, Barbara Bush-Florence Butt (the true founder of the great HEB Grocery Chain), Mary Kay Ash-Katherine Anne Porter, Tanya Tucker, Molly Irvins-Katherine Stinson, Bessie Coleman, Kara Hultgreen-Barbara Jordan, Governor Ann RIchards-Mildred (Babe) Didrikson Zaharias, Barbara Jacket-May Owen, Sarah WilliamsSarah Tilghman Hughes, Marrie Reynolds Garcia-Frances Battise, Helen GrovesThese women were politicians, entertainers, pilots, First Ladies of the United States, Senators, and much more.  The saying that is popular is "behind every good man there is a woman", let me say that "behind every good state there are many GREAT WOMEN who have made it great!" and this fascinating read (brief at 113 pages) shows the GREAT women that have made Texas legendary!  Published in 1996, some of the women in this book have since passed away (Ann Richards, Barbara Jordan) and some passed away long ago, yet their contributions have lived on, especially in Texas!  A RECOMMENDED READ!

TL Murphy in "Kelly's Heroes: The Irish Brigade at Gettysburg" gives a brief overview of the heavy fighting by this hard fighting brigade during the battle of Gettysburg.  The Irish Regiments from Pennsylvania, Massachusetts, and New York were in some very bloody and fierce fighting at The Wheat Field when they fought the regiments from South Carolina and Georgia during the afternoon of July 2, 1863.  In this brief read, the author tells about the formation of the regiment, the officers, enlisted men, and commanders that formed this famous brigade and some brief history of the previous battles the brigade fought in.the Irish Brigade was still a force to be reckoned with when they were thrown in to support Sickles' collapsing line on the afternoon of July 2.  One of the memorable moments of the battle came as the men of the Irish Brigade knelt while the Brigade Chaplain, Father William Corby, stood atop a boulder and pronounced general absolution to the men.They then attacked into the Wheatfield, charging across into the Rose Woods and the Stony Hill. The Confederate advance was temporarily halted just a it threatened to overwhelm the entire Union position, although the brigade was flanked by Confederate Reinforcements advancing from the Peach Orchard and forced to withdraw back across the bloody Wheatfield.The monument is a Celtic cross supported by a granite base, standing 19’ 6” tall. It was sculpted by William R. O’Donovan, a former Confederate soldier who fought at Gettysburg. The front of the cross is an ornate bronze ornamented by a 2nd Corps trefoil, the numbers of the three New York regiments, the Seal of the State of New York, and a harp flanked by eagles. At the foot of the cross lies a lifesized Irish wolfhound, symbol of honor and fidelity. The monument was dedicated on July 2nd, 1888.Mr. Murphy also tells about the dedicaiton and how Father Corby says "what happened to the rest of the men?" which brought many tears from the veterans and Father Corby couldn't speak for several minutes.  An emotional dedication for the hard fighting veterans who attended the dedicaiton.This is a great brief read that tells about just one of the many battles the brigade fought in.  Included are photos of some of the men of the brigade and what happened to them during and after the war.  A great read that is a brief summary of the Irish Brigade fighting during Gettysburg.  Recommended!

This book is a photographic history in time of the farms, fields, homes, and families of Gettysburg.  The emphasis is on the land and structures that existed in photos after the battle took place up to the early 20th Century.  As author Tim Smith noted, many of the structures in the old photos have long since disappeared and much of the photos of the fields show them completely different than they are today.  This is a great reference for researchers, historians, and future authors who want to have photos in their essays, reports, articles, and books that could add to their work about the battle.  The emphasis is not really on the battle itself, but photos of how the land and structures were in the battle.Again, this is primarily for researchers, future authors, and historians who want a reference to how the area look during and the years right after the battle.  In the back of the book are permission forms to fill out and send to the Adams County Historical Society if you want the photos in your publication.  An interesting photo collection overall.

Naval Proceedings, a monthly magazine published by the U.S. Naval Institute is an excellent magazine where senior enlisted sailor and Naval Officers submit articles on the current state of readiness of the U.S. Navy and its allies in Naval Warfare. Officers and Senior Enlisted submit truthful and factual articles about areas of the Navy and its tactics in its current state. A majority of the articles criticize with factual details on deficiencies that the Navy doesn't address or address properly. From morale, technological deficiencies, out of date naval warfare philosophy, and other issues that are "dead on" correct. I admire the people who submit these articles that either blame or praise the Navy and its way of "doing business".One thing to point out though is that you won't find articles submitted by junior enlisted sailors. These sailors know that if they submit an article or report in Naval Proceedings that they face the risk wrath of the chain of command if they submit an article that is critical of the Navy. They don't have the "power" of being immune from "the powers that be". Even though they are as intelligent, in some case much more intelligent, than their chain of command in the Navy. It is a "brave soul" who can criticize with facts, resources, and documentation and submit it to those in the Naval Community. Some officers and senior enlisted realize that there career could be in jeopardy, yet they have the passion and dedication to point out flaws in the Navy System. Naval Proceedings is an OUTSTANDING magazine and I recommend it to those who want to know about the "current state" of the United States Navy and its allies.

H. Joaquin Jackson, Texan, Lawman, and a Texas Ranger wrote this fascinating read as a sequel to his first book "One Ranger".  Ranger Jackson in his first book wrorte about his life growing up in Texas, joining the Marine Corps, becoming a lawman after the Marines and then joining the legendary Texas Rangers.  In the book, he described the tough standards and training it took to become a Texas Ranger and the men who made the Texas Rangers legendary.  Ranger Jackson in the sequel tells more stories about the infamous men he had to deal with, not with "Texas Justice" but with following the law. Ranger Jackson in his long career with the Rangers met many great lawmen, dealt with some very "tough hombres", honed his detective skills at the FBI Academy, and described the actions it took to chase down and arrest some very bad murderers, cattle rustlers, and strike agitators, just to name a few.Ranger Jackson reminiscences about the experiences it took to maintain justice on the modern Texas/Western frontier, and each story is a page turner.  He also talks about the dogs that became part of his family and how they impacted his life and family.  Ranger Jackson's family (wife and sons) describe their living and loving a Ranger and how life wasn't always easy to say the least.Ranger Jackson is a lawman who could of easily fit in with the Texas Rangers of old.  He is tough, straightforward pulling no punches, knows the land, how to track not only lost cattle but outlaws, how to act with an iron hand yet be compassionate to the innocent victims of bad crimes, and is humble in how he became a Texas Ranger we all can admire.In this great book a few of the chapters are:-La Heulga: The United Farm Workers Strike of 1996-1997- By the Light of the Rustlers' Moon-  My Own Good Ole Boys: The FBI National Academy- Sadistic Deaths in the Desert: The Frome Murders- A Man Not to mess With- To All the Dogs I Loved Before- The Deadly Duo: Lucas and Toole- The Hunt for Alfredo Hernandez: a Muy Mal HombreThere are more chapters in this book that are just as fascinating to read.  Ranger Jackson is a Ranger that you do NOT want to get on the bad side of, and the exact type of Ranger that you want to protect yourself and help you find justice on those who did wrong.  He retired in 1993 from the Texas Rangers and started his own investigative company that he is the head of.  When Ranger Jackson retired, the Texas Rangers did indeed lose a lawman of the "old school", a tough, straightforward, hard as nails Texas lawman, but his great legacy lives on and inspires those young men and women who want to become a legendary Texas Ranger.  As Tom Selleck said Ranger Jackson has "a life well lived", I definitely agree and am an admirer of this great TEXAS RANGER!  A great read!

Clay Coppedge the author of this great read published most of the stories in the Country World Newspaper and the Texas Co-op Power Magazine.  The stories are of the "bigger than life" legends, history, and people that made up and still make up the legendary Hill Country of Texas.  Various stories about the places, people, and history of the Hill Country has made for a fascinating read.  From the Germans who settled near Fredericksburg who wisely made peace with the Comanches, to Jim Bowie and his famous knife, Sam Houston and wanting to move the capital to Houston, which MANY Austinites did NOT appreciate, to local landmarks such as the history of Enchanted Rock, to the story of the famous little town of Luckenbach are part of the many short stories in these chronicles.  The chapters in the book are:- Part I: A Forbidding Land- Part II: The Good, the Bad, and the Witty- Part III: From Dinosaurs to Polo- Part IV: Texas OriginalsWithin these chapters are great short stories that will give the reader a greater appreciation of the unique and varied history of the Hill Country and the people, places, legends and history that truly made the Hill Country the famous and wonderful place it is today.  Kudos to Clay Coppedge in finding the stories, traveling the Hill Country, and publishing this excellent book!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

John Michael Priest has written an excellent history of both the Union and Confederate Armies and their action during the Battle of Gettysburg where he describes the actions of both armies on the battles last day, July, 3, 1863.  Mr. Priest has given us the actions of the soldiers, regiments, brigades, and commanders of both armies and what they were doing.  He doesn't get "bogged down" in detail and keeps the action vivid and lively.  It is suspenseful and easy to understand what the soldiers are doing to be ready to go into battle.Most everyone who has read this book already knows about the Battle of Gettysburg and the history of the three days of the main battle on July 1, 2, and 3, 1863 so there is no reason to go over the specifics of the last day's action and especially Pickett's Charge.  For those of you who don't know much about the battle and the famous Army of Northern Virginia's charge into the Army of the Potomac, then this is a perfect start for you.  Mr. Priest in this excellent book, puts the reader in "the thick of the action" from the start you learn about the men (from Private to General) who were dramatically and permanently affected by the charge and the battle.  You learn that many had loved ones at home both north and south and were waiting for their safe return.  Sadly, for so many this never occurred.I won't give details or the outcome, most of you already know how it was unfolded and what the overall result would be.  Let me say though that Mr. Priest is to be commended for his fine work on the battles last day of July 3, 1863.  It is a fascinating read, it is easy to understand (even for a reader who doesn't understand the war or the battle), it is a great refresher for those Civil War "enthusiasts", scholars, and historians.  It is a book that I will use as a valuable reference in the upcoming years, and it is highly recommended for those who want to know more about the Battle Of Gettysburg, the Army of Northern Virginia, main battles of the Civil War, and great stories of the brave men who fought at Gettysburg.  A great read!

Thomas S. Terrell of Kerrville, Texas found the letters of his great-great Uncle Virginius E. Pettey who enlisted in the 5th Texas Infantry of Company E (Hood's Texas Brigade).  In 2005 Mr. Terrell published the letters in the Kerrville Daily Times as "Letters From Home" for the next six months, and latter these articles became the book "The Boys From Brenham".  Pvt Pettey, from Brenhem, Texas was an eager soldier to fight for the Confederacy and Texas and wrote letters home to his family describing the enthusiasm and excitement the "local boys" was experiencing when they first left for war.  Meeting new men from different parts of the Lone Star State and from those throughout the south, this young soldier saw many new and interesting things as he traveled to Richmond, Virginia with the rest of his regiment to form Hood's Texas Brigade.Pvt Pettey soon discovered that "army life" was not just a grand adventure, it was filled with tedious camp life duties, some of his friends and fellow soldiers soon fell ill with disease and sickness, and soon would discover the viciousness of battle.  In these letters you see the steady transformation of the grim reality of war and battle.  Private Pettey was a close observer and would write a series of fascinating letters of the war that the Army of Northern Virginia fought in.  These are the same experiences that thousands of southern and northern men would share in their letters home to loved ones.  These are a fascinating read and reaffirms to modern readers that the war was not glorious but that it was a grim reality faced by the hundreds of thousands of men who fought for what they believed in.These letters became treasured and were kept by Private Pettey's family down through the ages until Mr. Terrell shared them with the local newspaper in 2005.  These are a fascinating read and are another glimpse into the war of 150 years ago.Private Pettey was a proud soldier of Hood's Texas Brigade and fought bravely with his fellow soldiers and friends in the early battles of thewar.  Private Pettey charged in the front rank of Hood's Texas Brigade as it broke the line at Gaines' Mill.  A month later, during the Brigade's victorious assault at Second Manassas (Bull Run), he carried the colors of the Fifth Texas until he was mortally wounded.  He died on the field of battle on September 1, 1862.  His last words were recorded in a letter written by his sergeant.  These are his last words:"Tell my friends that I have died for a good cause, and that I am perfectly willing to die for I have served my country faithfully".Mr. Terrell has edited an excellent book based on his great-great Uncle's letters and he also has provided photos Private Pettey and other family members.  It is a book that is highly recommended to all who are interested in Hood's Texas Brigade, the early battles that the Army of Northern Virginia participated in, those who are interested in the daily lives of the soldiers who fought in the war, and Civil War History.  A great and tragic read.

In Texas, the graveyards are a telling sign of the culture that surrounds these cemeteries especially the early ones.  Terry G. Jordan in 1982 published this interesting book based up the travels of the "back roads and hidden trails" that led to these fascinating cemeteries.  He encountered the Anglo-American, Black, Indian, Mexican and German Cemeteries that are throughout Texas and most are dated back to the founding of the Lone Star State after the Texas Revolution.Many of these cemeteries are a reflection of traditional culture that was in the area and carried over from Europe or Africa, or Ancient Native American Influence and customs.  Through photographs, maps, and drawings he illustrates Texas graveyards and beliefs behind their creation.As stated in the inner leaf, "Texas Graveyards is important in preserving a Texas legacy endangered by changing customs, rural depopulation, vandals, and the erosion of time."  Since its publication 32 years ago many of the graves and cemeteries have either fallen further into disrepair or have disappeared altogether.  That is why this is an important book for Texas History since it is illustrated with many photographs of graves and cemeteries that are no longer existing.  Let us hope that over the last 30 years that people have been able to save and preserve many of these graves, tombstones, and cemeteries not only for the sake of the descendants of the people buried, but for our own cultural heritage of the many cultures of Texas.  A very IMPORTANT and HISTORICAL book that is highly recommended to anyone interested in the history of Texas and the many culture the great state has!

These filters are just as great as the classic Brita filters. Same size in width and height as thd classic filters. These newer designs have larger but less holes for water to filter through, and there is a microscreen that prevents carbon from coming up. The bottom is exactly the same as the classic filter. These new filters work just as fast and just as well as the classics.

The bottles are easy to clean, easy to open and close and stay closed, and are BPA free. Each bottle holds 2 oz or 60 ml, and there are easy-to-read markings on one side of the bottle. Each bottle has a cap that pops on/off easily, and stays on when closed. The nipple is a nice and soft plastic, and the clear nipple also removes from the plastic white piece for easy cleaning.  These 9 oz bottles are 4" in height and slightly more than 2.5" in diameter. Bottles are made of nice hard plastic, with just a slight bit flexible/squeezable, while also remaining lightweight. Recommended replacement of the nipples is every 3 months for proper hygiene. These work great and are comfortable to hold thanks to the slight curvature of the bottle.

The bottles are easy to clean, easy to open and close and stay closed, and are BPA free. Each bottle holds 9 oz or 260 ml, and there are easy-to-read markings on one side of the bottle. Each bottle has a cap that pops on/off easily, and stays on when closed. The nipple is a nice and soft plastic, and the clear nipple also removes from the plastic white piece for easy cleaning.  These 9 oz bottles are 6.25" in height and slightly more than 2.5" in diameter. Bottles are made of nice hard plastic, with just a slight bit flexible/squeezable, while also remaining lightweight. Recommended replacement of the nipples is every 3 months for proper hygiene. These work great and are comfortable to hold thanks to the slight curvature of the bottle.

Corel VideoStudio Pro X8 runs smoothly, is properly organized, and easy to learn. There is a trial available from Corel on their website so you can try it out. For additional information, visit the Corel site videostudiopro.com and click on FEATURES to see the new features in this Pro X8 version, and what features have been enhanced.  Tools for learning how to use the software is also available.I've worked with various video editing programs throughout the years including Windows Movie Maker, Sony Vegas, Premiere Elements, Premiere Pro, Premiere CC, and a few others that are no longer made. Corel has done a great job of improving their VideoStudio series and this version runs smoothly.  It's easy to import files from your drives, or from DV devices (like a Mini DV camcorder or newer camcorders).The 64-bit version install takes about 30 minutes (on a Windows 7 Home PC with a AMD Quad Core processor and 8 GB of RAM). During the install, right after the Serial Number entry, don't click install yet and go to the OPTIONS tab and uncheck any of the three options you don't want installed (Product Updates, Quicktime, Flash).  After the install, the program work quickly and without any hiccups. One minor thing that bothere me was the previews of every option (for titles, transitions) plays automatically. Not sure how to turn these off.It's easy to add things like titles, transitions, and remove things from the timeline. Like other programs you can work on the timeline or storyboard.  If you've worked with any video editing program mentioned above, the layout of VideoStudio is similar.NOTE: There is a variety of support for different input formats and also output formats, but the MXF format (used in Panasonic Pro camcorders) is NOT supported in VideoStudio.  You have to convert the files to WMV using a separate program or use another program that works with MXF files like Premiere CC. There is a supplemental program included that works similar to Windows DVD Maker. You choose the files/clips and choose one of the preset designs for the DVD menu and navigation, set the title and music, and you have an instant DVD that makes you look somewhat professional.With any of these video editing programs, for me it's always about how smooth it runs, how easy is it to find tools and use them, and the formats supported. Video-editing is a very time-consuming process, so the editing program needs to be fast and smooth, and this Corel VideoStudio Pro X8 does it well.  Currently, I still prefer using Premiere CC since I'm used to that program, but Corel VS is comparable to Premiere Elements but has more features than Elements. I will be spending more time with Corel VS Pro X8 to see what it is fully capable of.

This is a fantastic learning toy that is easy to use, allows mental development of children (and adults), and runs smoothly.Be careful when opening the box, as the top portion slipped off mine, and the robot slipped out and fell about 2 feet onto a carpet. So, to avoid that, be careful when holding the box and removing the robot from the box.  You can use this with Android devices and Apple devices. Start by downloading the GO app from the app store. Switch the Dash robot to ON (ON button is a small white circle on the back right between the neck and wheel), and then start the app. The app will search for the robot and should connect easily within 10 seconds. After it connects, to select the robot it has found, on your device press and hold the center button to make the connection between Dash and the device (in my case iPad). It will then ask to update (if necessary), but in order to update, you need to connect Dash to a power outlet using the included orange USB cable. The mini-USB connector on Dash is on the back left side (opposite the ON button).  Once Dash is receiving power, run the update on the app. My Dash was already pre-charged and I didn't need to charge it, but I think USB connection is required just as a safety measure when running the update. The USB provides power and the updates are sent from the device to Dash, and the updates should only take 30 to 60 seconds. Then you choose a name for Dash.  After setup, a video plays and the robot interacts while it plays, blinking lights and playing noises, and moving around a bit.  It's exciting to see young kids get excited by the simple interactions from Dash during the video. You can search for additional robots anytime in case you have other robots in this series.Also included are two building block connectors that attach to Dash's ears. The building block connectors work with LEG, KNEX, and other similar types of building blocks.GO App (main app): The app now lets you control Dash as you please. The GO app is the main app, but there are three other separate official apps (all free)  that you can download to increase the interactivity with Dash. The GO app is simple to use. The left side (yellow tab) allows you to move Dash in any direction.  I get about 90% to 100% precision on the movement of Dash, and Dash moves smoothly over flat, smooth surfaces (non-carpeted).  Dash can move on carpet, but much slower, so it's best to use non-carpeted surfaces. You can adjust the speed of Dash's movement from four levels, 25%, 50%, 75% or 100% full speed. Dash moves slowly at 25% and medium speed at 100%.  Most children will enjoy 25% and 50%, and most adults will enjoy 100%.  Also on the left side (blue tab), you can set the brightness of the twelve LED's around Dash's eye.  And you can also adjust which LEDs should be lit, and this allows complete control. You can choose just one LED, or alternative LED's, create a smile using bottom four LEDs, etc. On the right half of the screen the green tab allows you to move Dash's head around in any direction (270 degrees). The blue tab allows different sounds and interactions. There are six sounds (siren, tires screeching, horn, cow, elephant, dog) and there are three pre-programmed commands that Dash will do. The first command is curious, where Dash moves around slowly making curiosity noises. The second command is panic, where Dash moves around quickly and breathes a sigh of relief. The third command is dizzy, where Dash spins around three times, getting dizzy, and shakes his head shaking the dizzy away and makes noise. Most young children will love these simple movements. The third tab on the right lets you set the color of Dash's ears and of the triangle on Dash's front.  You can choose any color from the ROYGBIV spectrum, and the ears and triangle both have separate spectrums allowing for different colors. The GO app provides all these basic commands. There are three other free apps that allow for even more fun. Dash was fully responsive from using the app 30 feet away.PATH app: This is a separate free download. It lets you design/draw a path, and Dash will follow that path. The games require you to put sound and light interactions in the path in the app, and Dash will react when he reaches those in the path.  This is a fun learning tool for young children and shows some of the potential that Dash can be used as a learning tool. This is a basic learning app.BLOCKLY app: This is another separate free download that lets you develop algorithms (set of instructions). This is a more advanced learning app. You have a list of commands, and you drag and drop them, choose different options for each, and then run it (just like a program), and Dash will go through and do all the commands in the list/program you made. It's very simple to use, and very easy to learn. I'm a professional programmer, and this is an absolute blast for children to learn this step-by-step way of thinking. I loved this app the most.XYLO app: This is also a separate free download, but it requires the Dash Xylophone (sold separately). The xylophone comes with arms that attach to Dash's shoulders, and he interacts and plays the xylophone using the commands from the Xylo app.  I don't have the xylophone and was not able to test it, but I did run through the app.Overall, this is an excellent learning tool. Every child is different, and different things will hold their interest. Some may be fascinated by Dash, and others will ignore it. But it has potential to teach things while having fun. It is durable, made of strong plastic, and it was 100% responsive during all my tests. Even from 30 feet, Dash was still fully responsive to my commands on the iPad.

One side is a matte finish, and the other a glossy finish. This screen protector is made for 13.3" screens. The size is 12 and 3/8" wide x 7 and 5/8" in height. It has a nice sturdy thickness to it, but is still flexible. You get one screen protector and 8 adhesive pads.  There are recessed points on the protector that show you where to put the pads. Peel a pad off the white paper, place it on the protector, then remove the thin top layer of plastic on the pad. Once the four pads are placed, attach to your monitor/laptop.  It does a great job of preventing viewing from the side. As others have mentioned, it depends on how much spacing is between your LCD screen and the keyboard when you close your laptop. So, it depends on the design of your laptop. The adhesive pads are thin. The adhesive will last a few times if you have to remove the screen protector and put it back on. Once the pads wear out, you'll need to find an alternative way to stick the protector on. The protector is excellent, the adhesive pads are just ok.

This is a great Plush to play with. However, the learning features of it are very simple and basic, and average. The George plush is 16" in height, and 8" wide (6.5" when arms are not at his side).  The plush is very soft and very huggable and squeezable.  The age is 1+, and it makes a great plush for them. But for the learning features, I recommend the age of 3+.Features: 1) BUCKLE: on his right shoulder strap, the buckle is attached to his clothes, so it won't separate from the doll unless you cut it off, so it's a good safety feature.  For children 3+, it may be easy to remove the strap from the buckle, and get the strap through the buckle.2) TIE: under his neck, nice enough for small hands to learn how to tie a shoelace.3) BUTTON: on his left shoulder strap, it stays buttoned/locked when buttoned.4) SNAP: on his right leg, it's a metal button snap that most of us grew up with. It does require some strength to open and close it, so recommended for children 3+.  The pocket is a small, but functional pocket.5) VELCRO: on his left leg, it's a same-sized pocket, also functional. The velcro opens and closes easily.The plush is made in China, and is hand-washable. The Curious George logo on the front is painted on. And lastly, the clothes do come off, but there is a small amount of stitching on the shoulders. You can remove it to get the clothes off, and let your child play dress-up.

I've purchased multiple cards in the Online Game Code format. I usually order them through my laptop or tablet.  The checkout is easy, no tax, and the code is revealed instantly after I agree to the terms. This is a great way to add funds to my Xbox account so that I don't have to use direct payment using a credit card through the Xbox marketplace. This code now gives you dollar amounts , since points were abolished a year or two ago, so it's a one-to-one exchange. The points system in place a few years ago was just horrible.

Requires Center Brace in tank. Comes in 2 pieces.  I will write a full review with all measurements soon. Just wanted to let you know that this is two separate pieces and requires a tank with the center brace.

Rating 4.5 stars.The hand grip is textured and provides excellent grip and is 4" long (perfect for small, medium, and medium-large hands. Large and X-large hands may want a bigger hand grip). The build quality is great, and feels durable. The twist locks for the extensions could be of better quality. They feel of a cheaper plastic and should have been thicker and better quality. The rubber covers are great and cover the ports entirely. The pole does have some weight to it, mostly from the thick rubber used in the hand grip.  The aluminum allow is strong but lightweight. The included screw screwed in easily when attaching my GoPro. You can attach other devices too, but they will need their own adapters to be mounted properly.In the package, the extension pole is in the front, but there is a small flat box next to it in the hidden area that contains a 6" USB cable, a 3-ft USB charging cable, and the screw to lock in a GoPro camera.  The pole is 30" long when fully extended. When fully compacted, the pole is 19.5" long.The built-in rechargeable battery has a capacity of 5200 mAh, allowing up to 10 hours of recording time on a GoPro. The wrist lanyard has a snap lock to adjust for tightness around wrist. The hand grip is excellent. It is definitely textured, but soft, and the ridges are deep for excellent grip. You may start feeling the texture in your hands with prolonged use.  The charging port for the built-in battery is covered by a rubber cover, located two inches above the hand grip. There are also two USB ports, both covered by rubber covers, at the top right under where the GoPro attaches.The 6" USB cable attaches to your GoPro and plugs into one of the USB ports under the GoPro mount area. The 3 ft USB charging cable plugs into the port near the hang grip.  There are three tiny holes containing LED lights under the charging port that tell how much power remains. You can easily check by pressing the power button located under the LED lights. The LEDs should be easy to see and tell if they are solid or blinking. If it is hard to see them, pull the rubber cover up or down so the holes match up.You can charge the battery by plugging the USB cable into a computer (make sure the USB port on your computer provides enough power for charging (most do)).  Or you can plug the USB cable into an adapter that plugs into the wall and charge that way.  According to the manual, the pole is also compatible with 5V AC adapters (5V/1A requires up to 6 hours charge time, and 5V/0.5A requires up to 12 hours charge time).

Rating: 4.5 starsThis is a great case/keyboard combo for the iPad Air 2.  The cover should be a little thicker, but it is thick enough to provide adequate protection. When closed, the screen will be very close to touching the keys of the keyboard, and while it won't activate or do anything, it is best to use a screen protector, or place a thin wipe cloth between the two, just for that extra protection.The case snaps onto an iPad Air 2 perfectly. There are only two tabs at the top that snap onto the iPad, but it holds it in place. The bottom area is 10"W x 7" L (the keyboard uses 4.5" L and the top portion of the bottom area uses 2.5" L).  The top portion of the bottom area is where the iPad will rest (shown in the third picture).  Because the keyboard is smaller than normal laptop keyboards, it will take a few days to get used to the smaller size.  The keyboard is 10"W, with each key being slightly smaller than 5/8" W (a laptop with 14" screen has keys that are 6/8" W).  It's just like moving from a PC keyboard to a laptop keyboard. But once you get the hang of it, the keys are very responsive, they are just slightly raised, and the keys presses are mostly quiet. In a quiet room, someone can hear you type from across the room.There is a 15" USB to micro-USB cable included to charge the keyboard. The micro-USB plugs into the keyboard. The interior of the case is smooth rubber. The exterior of the case has an ultra-smooth but textured feel. The red tab in the picture is a loop to clip your stylus into.  Regarding the placement of the keys, I had used other keyboards before that were similar to this, so I had no problem adapting. If the keyboard has key placement different from what you are used to, it may take a few days to get used to.  This case is built well and is a single piece, with the keyboard portion being a plastic piece that is glued on. All the cutouts are there for the iPad Air 2.

I use a few different supplements in powder form and this one is great. I also have the Vega Protein and Greens.  The powder in this Vega All-In-One Shake is a soft powder, similar to all-purpose flour. It dissolves easily in water, mostly, and tastes good.  No complaints about the taste. Initially I started with a tablespoon in a glass of water. And then added a second, and then a third to find my preference in thickness and taste.  The NATURAL flavor taste is a very mild grass-like taste. The water turns a very light green. It's a mild taste and I use it alternating with the chocolate flavor.  The CHOCOLATE flavor is like a dark chocolate taste, of medium strength. The powder is darker and has a stronger chocolate taste than the Vega Protein and Greens Chocolate powder. I've been mixing a tablespoon of this All-in-One (for vitamins and minerals) and a tablespoon of the Vega Protein and Greens (for amino acids).They provide decent nutrition, taste good, and mix instantly (mostly). The label recommends adding the powder to any non-dairy drink (so no milk), and I only add to water.  Other nutritional drinks offer different vitamins and minerals, so determine your nutritional needs.  There is no sugar added, the drink still tastes really good. The other powders I use are Pro-Complex, and Vega Sport Performance Protein, but I don't mix those with this.

This book is excellent.  It can be used as a fun activity book, as a supplement, or even as a primary in home-schooling. It's that good. Perfect for giving your child a head-start before they enter pre-school, or as a supplement while they are in preschool. The illustrations are done in the same drawing style and design as the classic books most of us grew up with.  There are short stories, learning tracing with simple shapes, tracing and writing letters and numbers, shapes, and other fun activities to keep learning fun. That's what makes this book so great. It's fun on every page from the illustrations and simplicity of it that will help children stay focused. There are also letter flash cards in the back of the book the book that can be cut-out. There's also number flash cards (up to 10). At the end of every section there are Achievement pages, and there are 100 stickers in the back (12 are achievement stickers and the rest are animals, food, items, and Curious George's face in the classic style).  And there is a final completion Certificate in the back when the child completes the book.  The organization of the chapters and learning process is excellent.  The dimensions of the book are 10.75" H x 8.25" W x 0.75" D (thick). When you register, you can obtain an electronic version of the book so you can print certain activity pages multiple times, like the letter and number tracing pages to fine-tune writing precision.

I love these blades, and also the Bosch Icon blades. Both are excellent blades.  They have lasted at last a year or more over the last decade. I installed them on a 2000 Camry LE, and a 2010 Camry SE, and the 24" and 20" blades fit perfectly.  This 24" blade is just 2 mm short of 24", and same goes for the 20" blade.INSTALL: Installing the blades is a breeze for hook assemblies. Not sure about the other two types. The instructions for the hook are decent, really easy for anyone who's done it before, but if it is your first time, have someone show you how to do it.DESIGN: The wiper blade assembly is curved when not installed, composed of a single rubber blade and five plastic segments holding the blade. When the blade is installed on a windshield, the curve of the blade is made flat, and this means that the pressure required will keep the blade on the windshield and provide clean, smooth wipes.MAINTENANCE: If blades stop wiping cleanly and smoothly, lift them up, and place them gently back onto the windshield to allow for a better seating.  But, while you have them up, be sure to wipe down the rubber blade ever 2 to 4 weeks to keep them working like new.  You'll notice how much dirt builds up on the blades.  Wipe your windshield too.I've used other brands too, like TRICOFLEX and RAIN-X.  The Bosch ICON and INSIGHT have plastic assemblies that are slightly heavier, bigger, and wider/thicker than the TRICOFLEX.  The TRICOFLEX worked okay for me.  The RAIN-X wipers worked well for me, but not as good as the Boschi ICON or INSIGHT.  Others may have different experiences, but these are what have been reliable for me.

This is a nice magnet set. You get one of each letter, in a wooden case. The cover of the case is a thin piece of plastic that slides away, and it holds all 26 letters, tightly though. Sometimes you will need to remove some letters, re-position them, and try sliding the cover again. The case measures 10.75" W x 4.5" H x 1.25" D.  Each letter is 2" in height, and 1/8" in thickness. The entire back of each letter is magnetic, but the magnetic layer is thin.  While the magnetic layer is thin, they do stick well to magnetic surfaces and stay stuck. It appears to be the right amount of magnetic strength. Children 3 years and older should be able to remove the letters off a magnetic surface easily. They can also be pushed around on a magnetic surface. The magnetic strength is strong enough to hold the letters up, which are also light to begin with, and not fall off a vertical surface.  The letters are light, so even if they fall on a child's foot, they won't feel any pain.  The corners/edges of each letter is smooth.  The handle on the case is made of the same material used for backpacks, but it feels like it will tear away after some use.  The handle quality and design could be better.  And lastly, the product is Made in China for anyone wondering where the toy comes from.

SCENT: The scent is a pleasant, slightly strong smell, but not overbearing.  I use one spray on my lapel, and it stays strong for several hours. Even 12 hours later, the scent was still there, not as strong, but still noticeable.  I really enjoy the scent. Other colognes I mainly use are Davidoff Coolwater and Ralph Lauren Romance.  A secondary cologne I use is Nautica Blue. I really love Coolwater and Romance, as both have strong smells like this Lacoste L!VE cologne.  This Lacoste is slightly stronger than Coolwater.  The Nautica Blue is much milder.BOTTLE: The bottle is a cube, roughly 2.5" on each side (for the 3.3 oz/100 ml). It's dark blue glass.BOX: The box comes in an outer box shaped like a bag with handles. It is also made of cardboard and has ribbon handles. The product is made in the UK.

Thanks to the next-gen hardware, the setting and landscapes of Paris is amazing, as is the massive scale.  Animations are smooth, the detail impressive, and the crowds are full.  Movement is really good and responsive. Graphics draw deep into the distance and still look detailed. The character can be upgraded, and that's one of the best parts of the game. There are so many different choices and paths to go down when upgrading.Some of the levels can be frustrating, like in the stealth missions, where your character won't do what you want him to do, especially when you need to take cover.  The story can get boring for some missions, but others are very enjoyable and engaging. The pick-pocketing skill is removed from this game, and that was one of the more fun things to do in prior games.  There are definitely some bugs/glitches in the game where you will get stuck and have to restart the mission.Unity is a good game in the series, but it's not as good as the prior games in the series. Black Flag, the prior game in the series, plays a lot better.  If you've played the other games in the series, Unity isn't anything special. If this is your first Assassin's Creed game, it's a good game, but definitely check out the other games in the series for better stories, characters, and action.The single player is fun, but it becomes even more fun when playing the 2-player or 4-player multiplayer. You are required to work as a team to complete the missions. I only played the two-player multiplayer a few times, but I loved every minute of it.

These are standalone alarms. They DO NOT connect to a main console (and cannot call out and cannot notify your phone). They work independently of one another. This pack contains three door/window alarms, and a larger keypad door alarm.  They are made for dry, interior locations. They run on batteries. If you are not home and the alarms are triggered, they will sound a loud 120dB siren that can be heard outside and is very uncomfortable inside. The build quality is medium quality, but they do work and are reliable. They are an inexpensive alternative to home security systems (which include a console).  Because these are standalone alarms and are NOT connected to a console, they CANNOT call you or notify the police. They are just a siren. Useful for when you are home.  And when you are not home, they will make a loud noise to bring attention to your alarmed area. The Keypad Door Alarm and the three window/door alarm sensors DO NOT work together. They DO NOT communicate with each other. Each of the four alarms works separately.A) Keypad Door Alarm - requires three AAA batteries (not included), in the back, behind a screw. The keypad accepts a four digit code that you set. You can choose either the CHIME setting (alert) or ALARM setting (siren).  You can also choose a delay for the alarm so you get 45 seconds delay for exit after entering code, or 30 seconds for entry to enter the code and disarm the system. The sensor can be mounted on either the left side or right side of the keypad. Mounting screws and plastic anchors, and double-sided tape is included. The tape is thin and I would prefer if it was double the thickness. Size of the keypad alarm is 4" H x almost 2.75" W x 1.25" D.B) Three window/door alarm sensors - Each alarm requires four LR44 batteries (all 12 batteries included). The LR44 batteries are the small button/cell batteries. Check availability and pricing on them for future replacements. The batteries are in the front, under a slide cover. The siren is loud when the alarm is triggered, but it is possible to pull down the cover and remove the batteries. So be sure to put them out of reach when mounting. These are light and are attached to the wall/door using the double-sided tape. The tape is thin, and I would have preferred if the tape was double the thickness.  Size of each of these alarm is: 2.5" H x 1.25" W x 5/8" D.  The sensor has the same H and D, while the W is 1/4".

These are a great, inexpensive way to add security protection, and a great alternative for an alarm system.  These are Stand-alone alarms, meaning they DO NOT require an alarm system. They will not work with a security console either.  Each alarm works independently of one another.Each main piece contact is 2.5" H x 1.25" W x 0.5" D in size. The thin piece contact has a width of 0.25" and the same H and D measurements as the main piece contact.  The contact (thin vertical part) can go on either side of the main contact. This provides convenience in being able to position it almost anywhere.  The alarm is loud enough to be heard across the hall for apartments, and in other rooms of a house.You can choose either an ALARM or a visitor CHIME as the setting. The Alarm will sound a loud alarm if opened (great for when you are sleeping or away), while the Chime will make a nice single sound to let you know when someone opened a door (great for while you are home).  It's easy to switch between the OFF / ALARM / CHIME modes. There is double-sided adhesive pads included , and they work, but I think they should be thicker to provide better and lasting adhesive (depends where you place your contact/alarm). When the contacts separate more than 15mm, the alarm sounds until the contact meet again, or until the alarm is disarmed. With the CHIME setting, it will make a single sound and turn off.Requires 4 x LR44 batteries. They are included in the pack.  Make sure you can purchase additional batteries from somewhere if you plan on using these alarms for a long time. There is a 90 Day Limited warranty.

The quality is excellent. This isn't a liquid oil, but it is a solid form of the oil (up to 76 degrees F, which is the melting point), which can be easily scraped/shaved easily out of the bottle with a spoon. The bottle comes fully sealed with a foil cover inside, and because it is solid inside, there is no chance of it spilling when the oil is a solid. There are a lot of advantages of this coconut oil, and they are the Non-GMO and Non-Hydrogenated claims. The bottle is also a non-BPA container.It also have many uses. You can eat it directly with a spoon and it tastes great. You can use it in cooking since it has a neutral scent and flavor, and used in cooking up to 400 degrees. It can be used as a replacement for butter. It can also be used for skin care and hair care as a moisturizer, or lubricant for shaving.  The label says it is a Vegan product. And there is no refrigeration required. But it is bottled in a facility that packs peanut oil (in case you are allergic).The coconut oil is a product of the Philippines, manufactured for Nutiva.  It is made from dried organic coconuts. I tried to add photos, but it's not possible for this item, so i'll post the nutrition facts here:Serving Size: 1 Tbsp (15mL), Servings per Container: 30Calories: 130, Calories from Fat: 130, Total Fat 14g (22% of Daily Value)), Sat Fat: 13g (65%), Trans Fat: 0g, PolyUnsat Fat: <0.5g, MonoUnsat Fat: <1g. And these are all zero:  Cholesterol, Sodium, Total Carb, Protein

This is a medium-sized printer that works great as a general printer, scanner, copier, and photo printer. The printer measures 17.5" W x 6" H x 14.5" D.  The printer has a black matte finish, and that's a good thing to prevent any fingerprint marks. The buttons have a plastic feel, made of medium density quality plastic.The LCD screen on the front measures 2" W x 1.5" H. It is very clear for text and images, nice high resolution for a small screen.  The scanner bed is 8.5" x 11.5", great for scanning letter size documents. The scanner lid also raises to accommodate thicker objects.The USB and power connections are in the back, all the way to the left. The power cable is 5 ft 2 inches long, non-polarized 2-prong plug.  A USB cable is NOT included, so you need to buy one if you want to directly connect to the printer. The printer also allows for a Wireless network connection.  It's fairly easy to setup the printer, it just requires some time cycling through letters to enter your network name (SSID) and password.  The software that comes on the CD is decent. I like Canon software for printers. It's straightforward and works reliably for me.  Once the printer is connected to your wireless network, any device on your network  can print to it, whether it's tablets, smartphones, laptops, or desktops.There are five ink cartridges included: Cyan, Yellow, Magenta, Black, and Pigment Black (for photos).  The current price of ink cartridges are $35 to $40 for the 4 pack single size color cartridges (CYMB), and same price for the 2 pack of double size Pigment Black. The sample pack of paper is five sheets of 4" x 6" glossy photo paper.From my experience, when using any of these types of printers for printing photos, the cartridges will be empty after maybe eight to ten 8 x 10's, or twenty 4 x 6's. Depends on the photos and the colors in the photos.Note: There is a piece of orange tape in the back, that holds the roller tray. Remember to remove the tape so you can push the roller left to unlock to remove any papers during paper jams.

This is a really great program that runs smoothly.  It comes with 3 licenses.  But there is no CD. It's a card with a serial number on the back. Using your active Internet Connection, log into the address given on the card. Enter your serial number, email address, and password (create new or login to existing account). You can extend your existing subscription or create a new one.The Auto-Renewal is not required, even though it seems that way. Just click the X if you don't want auto-renewal when the subscription expires. Download the McAfee software. Install took about 7 minutes on a Core i7, start to finish. Since it downloads the latest software, there's no updates to apply.DATA PROTECTION Features: INcludes ONLINE BACKUP feature and SHREDDER features. For ONLINE BACKUP, you have 3 licenses to use, each offering 1GB of online storage. Unlimited storage is available for the current price of $60 per year.  The process is straightforward, and an easy step-by-ste process. You can work while it runs the backup.As for the SHREDDER, choose the folder you want to remove permanently, and shred it.There are PC and Home Network Tools.  You can get a view f all the devices connected to your home network. Useful tool for seeing if others are connecting to your network or if you have devices connected that you forgot about. You can also setup a schedule to have the scans run.There are also Parental Controls that allow you to set a password and settings for browsing the Internet. You can produce Parental Reports that let you see if anyone "tried to visit blocked websites or attempted to go online during a restricted time." That's straight from the program.I mainly use Trend Micro, but this McAfee program runs very smooth, very quick, and is not in the way at all. I used to use McAfee long time ago, but it wasn't as good at blocking attacks, but now it's really good.

These are very average claws. They aren't bad, but there isn't anything good about them. They look great from the picture, but don't fit so great. I have medium size hands for a male. The blue gloves extend past my elbows, and is 16" from wrist to past my elbows near my bicep. The claws extend about 14".  My hands did get sweaty within the costume gloves.  Now the issue with the fit. The claws connect into a piece under the glove. That piece should sit on top of your knuckle area. But it doesn't sit properly where it is supposed too, so the claws dangle over instead of being straight extended.  Maybe if I wear thick gloves underneath for a better fit, but my hands would sweat even more.  These are okay for a short time, but after a few minutes I wanted to take them off and leave them off unless someone asked to see them on.The claws are also very close together, they are touching in mine.  So it looks awkward.  The colors are accurate though. The blue is very nice and the claws are silver and a hard plastic. The cloth material is decent and seems like it will last a few years.

This is a fantastic scissor for home and office use. Cut through paper, card stock, thin cardboard, felt, and fabric with ease.  From the point to the rubber handle end, it is 8" in length. The steel blade portion is 3.5" long of the 8".  The handle is 3.5" wide, and covered in gray hard plastic, and the orange part is rubber, It just cuts so smoothly. The blades are molded into the handles, so they won't come loose.  The titanium bond is all around the blade, and it definitely helps the blade last longer. I have another Westcott Titanium Bonded Scissor, and it's been working flawlessly for three years.Note: This is a strong scissor, but not meant for cutting the plastic blister packs that some items come in. You need utility scissors for those.

Item: Maidenform Women's Flexees Shapewear Firm Control Camisole.It works. The version I am reviewing is the FIRM control version, and it provides decent smoothing.  There is another version ULTRA FIRM if you need more smoothing. The material is really nice and durable. The material is 70% nylon and 30% elastane. The interior has a slightly textured material to grip to your undershirt (or body), and the exterior is smooth to allow for any type of clothing to sit easily on the camisole. It looks and fits exactly as it looks in the picture. The camisole is a single piece, but it is stitched in the center under the chest. The top portion that sits on the chests/breasts, is a single layer and provides some smoothing/compression. The portion from the bottom of the chest to the bottom (waist) is two layers, providing even more smoothing/compression. This does a great job of smoothing if you have someThe straps also adjust for taller women. Depending on your activity and what you are wearing underneath, the camisole may shift/ride up a little. This is great for everyday use, for work, weekends, outings, evenings, but it may or may not be great for exercise depending on the intensity of your exercise.

This is a useful device. It works, is reliable, and does a decent job of notifying people around you. I think the alarm could have been slightly louder. The current 100dB is loud, but I would have preferred if it was even louder.The device comes in an easy to open plastic clam package.It is 3" long (or 3.125" to be exact).  The width is 1.75" at its widest, and 1" at the top. As for the thickness, it seems to be about 1" thick at its thickest. It is very light, about the same as six quarters with the battery installed. A CR2 battery is included, along with the 6" strap.LED LIGHT: The white LED light is on the front (top) of the device. The center gray button works the LED light. It's nice and bright for illuminating items within a foot, like the car door lock, etc. The LED will light dark areas 10 to 15 feet away with a medium amount of light, and provides a low amount of light for objects 20 feet away.  If someone looks directly into the LED, it is strong enough to temporarily blind someone for a few seconds, but it's not powerful.PANIC ALARM: The strength of the alarm is 100 dB. It's loud when you are in a silent area, whether outside or inside, possibly to 100 feet, and maybe even 200 feet depending on the area. If there is noise constant noise around you, the alarm may be noticeable to people near you, but maybe not people who are 100 feet away. The red light also blinks and does provide additional notification that it's an emergency.  The red LED light should be brighter and more noticeable. The button for the alarm should be more prominent. It is the third button, the one under the gray button.  During an emergency, during panic, one may end up pressing the round gray center button instead of the panic button under it.  Turning the alarm on and off is easy. Press and hold one second to activate, and press and hold for two seconds while it's on to turn it off.There are two additional alarm options, separate from the PANIC alarm. The INSTANT ALARM and DELAY ALARM can be armed using the top button.INSTANT ALARM: Press and hold the top button to arm, you have 20 seconds to set it at its location, and then it arms. Any movement will activate the alarm instantly. Great for putting in stationary purses, luggage, anything that you want to make sure isn't moved, and notifies you instantly if it is moved. The alarm will sound for 3 minutes and then turn off and reset it back to being armed as you had set it.DELAY ALARM: This is useful for putting on doorknobs. Set the alarm, place it on the doorknob, and it arms. When the door is moved, the device has to swing to detect movement, so a door opening very slowly may not trigger it. When the door swings open, the device LED blinks rapidly, and you have 20 minutes to disarm it. Just hold the button to disarm it. If it is not disarmedin 20 seconds, the alarm sounds. The alarm will sound for 3 minutes and then turn off and reset it back to being armed as you had set it.

The paint job on each figure is quite good.  No paint running or splotches. Each figure has weapons that can be held in their hands. The two big figures are decent overall.SPORTS CAR (CAR) Measures 5" front to back x 2.25" wide x 1.25" H.  The wheels don't sit flush, so they don't move smoothly, but they do move when pushing the car on a hard surface.(ROBOT) When transforming from car to robot, some of the pieces (arms) did pop off their joints. They are ball joints, and I was able to pop them back into place like it never happened. Figure measures 5.5" H x 4.5" W x 2" D (at the feet)  and 1" D (at the body.  The shoulders and elbows move at the joints, the knees, feet, and the leg joints at the waist move.(OVERALL) The figure is a 4 out of 5. What I didn't like as the plastic thinness, and the feet don't sit flat on the ground.  It's a decent figure overall.MOTORCYCLE (CAR) - The back wheel doesn't spin or touch the ground in car mode.  Motorcycle measures 2.5" front to back x 1.25" in height x 0.75" wide.(ROBOT) Measurements are 2" H x 1" W x 0.75" depth.(OVERALL) The figure seems so plain and boring as a figure. It is a small figure, so I didn't expect much. It does stand by itself. Arms and legs move, but there are no elbow and knee joints since the arms and legs are single pieces. Head does not move. Hands do not move. 2 out of 5 for this figure.AMBULANCE (CAR)- The wheels move smoothly most of the time, sometimes one of the wheels doesn't move. Paint job is quite good. As a car, it measures 4.25" front to back, 1.75" wide, and 2" tall at its highest point.(ROBOT) As a robot, it measures 5.25" H x 3" W x 2.5" front to back. The robot stands by itself. Transforming it from car to robot was kind of difficult. Even though the transformation process is provided step by step, it's not completely clear, and trying to find the exact points to lift, turn, or pull out is not easy.  It took about 10 minutes to transform the first time. As a robot, it stands by itself and stays standing after positioning it properly.(OVERALL) The overall quality of the figure is decent. It's made of light medium thickness plastic. For a figure this size, it seems to be okay. Arms and Legs, Hands, and feet all move.  Joint as the knees and joints at the torso where the legs connect all move. Shoulders and elbows move at the joints.  4 out of 5 for this figure.

The build quality of this toy is excellent.Both the tail rotor and top rotor spin smoothly and easily. They are both excellent quality and are locked into place. They should stay in place as long as the child doesn't use a lot of force to pull it out on purpose. The colors are pleasant and the same as the photo. There aren't any pointy edges, and it's made of medium thick plastic. Children should have playing with it, and it should last as long as they aren't throwing it around. The bear pilot fits into the front, in the cockpit, and while stay there as long as the helicopter is flown straight and level. The bear will move left, right, or forward if the helicopter is flown at an angle. Sometimes the bear fell out when it was flown as an angle.HELICOPTER: The helicopter is 9" from front to back. It's 5" W and slightly less than 6" tall. The weight of the helicopter is light enough for a one-year old and older, but meant for children 2 years and older.PILOT: The bear pilot comes out of the helicopter. It's made of thick plastic, but hollow inside. The bottom is open. The bear is 2" tall x 1.5" W x 1" D (at head) (and 1.25" D at feet). The ear is nicely molded and has some nice details. The weight of the bear is is light.

When I first pulled this out of the box, it came as is, unwrapped, with just the product tag. It's a very simple design and toy.  It is 6.5" from front to back, 4.25" tall, and about 4.25" wide. The colors are the same as the product photo.  The toy is made in the USA, and made of recycled material, with a 2 recycle number (HDPE (high density polyethylene)). Number 2 plastics are one of the safest plastics. The material is hollow, but the shell is somewhat thick. It is durable. Each of the four wheels spins independently. It rolls better on carpet than it does on flat surfaces. One of the wheels does get suck sometimes for a second or two. The top of the elephant has a handle for kids to carry it easily. It is very light and children who are 1 year old will be able to lift it, but keep an eye on them and make sure they don't hit themselves by accident.It's a fun, simple toy. It's durable.

Great song from the 80's. Sound is clear, everything comes in clearly. It's 6 minutes and 12 seconds long. I recently watched the movie again, and the series again. I'm not going to compare the film vs. tv series, but this song is one of the best from the 80's.

These tablets do work. They come individually wrapped in foil.  Each tablet is about an inch wide and melts in the water like effervescent tablets (think Alka Selzer). They do correct the pH balance, but I don't follow the directions completely. I like to break the tablets up into four pieces, and then drop a piece once every hour or two to provide a slow change for my fish.  My fish have not experienced any problems with these tablets.  Because of my method, I can't get it exactly to 7.0, but my pH is definitely better than it used to be after using these tablets.

This is a great case. The interior main area, with blue lining, is really well padded to provide exceptional protection for any lens. It can accommodate lenses that are smaller than 8 inches tall and 3.75" in diameter. This case provides a safe place to put a second lens while changing a lens. You cannot fit a DSLR camera in the case. Only lenses.  One of the pictures looks like it has a DSLR, but I couldn't fit my T3i or 5DM2.EXTERIOR: The dimensions of the case are 9.5" H x 6.5" W x 4.5" D.INTERIOR: The dimensions of the interior are 8" H x 5" W x 3.75" D.When unzipped, the top portion folds over to present an additional area to store a lens while you are replacing a lens.PADDING: The padding inside the main area (blue lining) is excellent. Nice and thick. However, the padding on the top (the portion that folds over) could use some more padding, similar to how thick the bottom is, especially when placing a lens in there during lens replacement.The shoulder strap is 40" long and comes with plastic connectors with metal clips. You can see it in the pictures. This is an advantage because most fully plastic clips always break over time.  The shoulder strap also has a nice thick padded area that makes it very comfortable when it sits on your shoulder for long periods of time.There are two mesh pockets, one on each side, 4" x 4" flat, made of breathable mesh.  The zippers are durable, medium-thick quality. Overall, this is an excellent case. You cannot strap it to your belt since there aren't any slide-through connectors. It only has the top handle, and the shoulder strap for carrying.  I guess if your belt was a small belt, less than an inch in height, you might be able to slide your belt through the connectors meant for the should strap.  The top handle is nice and thick and good quality too.There is also a nice weather protector cover which stretches slightly and covers the front, top, and bottom of the case. The back of the case, which rests against your body is left open.  There are velcro straps to secure the cover around the connector clips of the shoulder strap.  The quality of the weather cover is a light-medium thickness, and medium durability.Lastly, be careful when opening the box with a box cutter to prevent cutting the case. The case comes in a plastic bag in a box and the case fits in the box snugly.

I love the taste of the Rich Chocolate Boost. It tastes good, it provides vitamins and minerals, and energy in case I want to supplement a meal, or just have it as a snack. I do feel hungry again in 2 hours, but sometimes, that's all the time I need to continue doing whatever I'm doing until the next meal. The bottles are clear plastic, wrapped in an opaque label. The inside of the label is completely black to keep the contents safe from light. Each bottle is 8 oz, made of strong disposable plastic, resealable, and is 5.75" tall and 3.25" wide. the 24 pack comes as two 12 packs.I usually drink it at room temperature and love the taste. I've been drinking Ensure and Boost for a year now. You can put it in the refrrigerator, but not the freezer, and if you open it and don't finish it, it should be finished within 24 hours.Boost is Gluten-Free, and suitable for individuals with lactose intolerance. But they are not for individuals with galactosemia.  Each serving size (1 bottle) contains 20 grams of sugar. It does seem high, but cut sugar out of your other meals/drinks. Each serving provides 10g of protein.There are NO artificial sweeteners like sucralose, aspartame, or acesulfame potassium like some Ensure bottles contain. Boost does use corn syrup and stevia leaf extract as sweeteners. If you are drinking Boost for the first time, you may notice the taste is just okay. You do get used to it. Any drink that is loaded with vitamins and minerals usually has an off-taste. But to help the taste, they add sugar and chocolate. But that means the sugar content is 20g. Compare this with your all other drinks you consume in a day to see how it compares.

First thing I noticed upon opening the box was the pleasant smell even while the rolls were still in their plastic wrap. It's not strong or overbearing, and it's completely mild and pleasant. The tissues are indeed soft. They break apart easily in water unless you layer them. They leave little to no residue.  Each sheet measures 4" x 4".  They appear to be just a slight bit smaller than the other brands of rolls I have, about 1/8" shorter. The sheets have a pleasant floral design. They are soft enough for wiping your face or nose.

This air stone is is 1.5" in diameter, and 0.5" thick. It lets out a lot of air bubbles, kind of like an effervescent tablet (like Alka Selzer) dropped into a glass of water. The stone is heavy enough, but I can't seem to get it to lay flat on the bottom. I have a flexible tube attached to it, and it just doesn't want to stay down even after trying to bury it under gravel.. It stays vertical or diagonal, but not flat. Because of the very high amount of bubbles it creates, I have to split the air or decrease the air going to it. It's too much. it seems to be a good quality stone and will last for a long time. There is very little gravel or dust from the air stone. I soaked it in water for a few hours and tested it in a water bin before trying it out in my aquarium. Once I put it in, the fish were interested in it, but scared to go through the bubbles since it was powerful. They go through the other bubble wall I have since it outputs a lot less bubbles (10" x 2" piece), but this this stone creates a lot of air bubbles in a 20 gallon long tank, and the fish will look at the bubbles but not get near it.

This definitely does let out a good amount of bubbles. When I first got it, I soaked it in a water bin for a few hours. Then just lightly scrubbed it with a regular toothbrush. After connecting to an air tube, I could only get it to let bubbles out when it was vertical or diagonal. Nothing came out when it was flat. I lightly brushed it again and then it started letting out air in about 33% of its length when it was flat. So I put it in my 20 gallon tank. laid it flat at the bottom, and it was working fine. I upgraded my pump to a double air-pump, and let one of the outputs directly to this air stone. Now about 75% is creating bubbles after about 3 weeks of use. I see a small amount of bubbles being created in the remaining 25%, but a very small amount, like the size of a pen point. So for me, about 75% works now and it creates a nice bubble wall that the fish love to swim through, play in, and just let the bubbles carry them up.  Make sure both ends are tight, and test it in a water bin first before placing in your aquarium.  Scrub it a bit with a light toothbrush if nothing is coming out.  And make sure you are using a strong pump too. If you split the air, it may not be getting the maximum of air it requires.  It is heavy enough to stay at the bottom, but I did bury it under some gravel to hide the plastic.

Item: Black and Decker TO3250XSB 8-Slice Extra Wide Toaster OvenThis toaster oven works well, looks great, and cooks evenly using convection technology. Convection technology has been around for a long time now, and the way it works is it uses a fan to blow around the hot air to keep moisture in the food. It works well, includes some accessories, and does a good job of cooking evenly using convection. The fan is what is noticeable when the oven is on.  While it's not loud, it not quiet either. It's enough to let you know the oven is on if you are in the same room.Be careful when opening the box to prevent the top of the oven from being scratched by your boxcutter/scissor. There is a one inch clearance between the top of the oven and top of the box, so use a small blade to cut the tape on the box.  When using the oven, it does get hot all over, the front/back, sides, top/bottom, so don't place anything on top of the oven or next to it when in use.Dimensions (Exterior): 11.5" H x 22" W x 15" D (roughly 2" in the back of the oven extrudes, included in the 15").  Of the 11.5" H, the feet are 1.5" in height and do a good job of raising the oven from the ground.  This is very important since the entire oven gets hot and shouldn't be touched.Dimensions (Interior): 6" usable height, but trays should be shorter in case contents rise. There is more space vertically, but they are used up by the heating coils. 16" wide. 10.5" D.  While the 10.5" D extends all the way back.PLUG: The grounded three-prong plug comes out of the bottom of the oven, near the back right. The plug is only 23" long (less than 2 ft).ACCESSORIES: The included CRUMB TRAY fits the bottom interior completely. It slides in and removes easily. If you bend down and get eye-level with the bottom of the oven, you'll see the gap where the crumb tray slides in/out without opening the glass door.The BAKING TRAY is 13.5" W x 7.5" L.  The depth is 0.65".  All accessories are medium-grade quality and medium thickness. They appear to be made of thick aluminum.The RACK is what the trays will rest on. The rack sets in near the bottom of the oven, but it can be put in at the top too for BROILING. The rack sits about 2.5" under the heat coil if you put the rack at the top.GLASS DOOR: The glass doorpulls down and stops when it is perpendicular to the oven (90 degree angle).  It only has two positions, fully closed or fully open.The glass door gets very hot when cooking, so never touch it.  The handle is 1.5" away from the glass, so you can easily and comfortably pull the handle to open/close the door. It will be comfortable with people with medium sized hands. I'm a male with medium sized hands. If you have larger/thicker fingers, it may still be comfortable, but you may also be getting closer to the glass then.KNOBS: The look and quality of the knobs are nice. There are three knobs: TOP is the main knob, where you can set the oven temperature, or the BROIL or TOAST option.  The MIDDLE knob has the STAY ON option (required when using the oven and temperatures of the top knob), and the timer options.  The BOTTOM knob is specifically for the toast timer. The range is wide and allows you to get the precise toast level you want.OVEN: To use the oven, set the middle knob to STAY ON, and then set the top knob to the temperature preferred. It took 4 minutes and 30 seconds to get from a cold oven to 350 degrees internally. You can also use the middle knob to set the TIMER. The oven works convectionally, meaning the oven heats up , but is aided by a fan to blow around the hot air to keep the food from drying out and keep moisture in.TOAST: To make toast, set the top knob to TOAST. Then set the bottom knob to the desired toast level.TIMERS: The sound of timer clicks counting down is noticeable from within the same room, but the completion ding can be heard in an adjacent room.

The blade is 8" long, and 1.75" wide near the handle. The handle is 5" long, and 1.25" wide. The blade is 1/16" thick at its thickest. The blade is ultra sharp out of the box. It cuts anything easily, even thick corrugated cardboard. The handle is made of soft rubber, but not flexible, and it is rounded so it fits easily in your hand.  It fits perfectly in my medium-sized hands (male) to cut anything easily and be able to apply the right amount of pressure. The handle is nice, but it is a basic, plain handle all-around. Personally, I would have preferred some grip marks or something to make the grip even better. It won't slip out of your hands, and the grip is good enough to make sure of it.I own various knives, but I'm probably an intermediate user. I don't own any high-end of professional knives. This knife is useful in cutting fruits and vegetables throughout the day.  I don't use this knife on meat since I have a different knife for cutting chicken.BUILD: The blade seems strong and barely bends. Bends side to side only a very small amount with force. So that's good. The blade is securely placed in the handle and does not move.  The knife is very lightweight. It weighs 4.7 oz, which is roughly the weight of 24 quarters. The blade is very light, and most of the weight comes from the handle.When using this knife, it should always glide smoothly. Never apply a lot of force. If it doesn't slice easily, then the blade needs sharpening. If you apply too much force, the chance of slipping increases greatly.

These Chia seeds are fantastic. The bag contains 100% Chia Seeds (Salvia Hispanica), product of Mexico. They don't have any taste. The bag comes filled to the top, is resealable, and it reseals well. The seeds are extremely small, and great for mixing into anything. The serving size is 1 tablespoon, but I use 1 teaspoon, and add it to a glass of almond milk or regular milk, and drink it right away. If you let the seeds sit in a liquid for a minute or two, they will start to swell up and double in size, and they develop a gelatinous exterior similar to tapioca (in bubble tea), but they are much smaller in size. There is no need to grind them up since they are very small to begin with. You can add them to anything.
