No refrigeration is required, and it should be stored in a dry place.I wanted to post a picture of the back but could not find the option, so I entered the data from the back of the bag below.Nutrition facts from the back (for 1 tablespoon):  Omega 3 ALA 2.4g (150% Daily Value) and Omega 6 LA 0.8g.Calories: 60 (35 Calories from Fat), Total Fat: 4g (6% Daily Value), SatFat, TransFat, and Cholesterol is 0g.  Polyunsat fat is 3g and Monounsat fat is 0g.Total Carbs: 4g (1% DV), Dietary Fiber 4g (16% DV). Sugar and Sodium 0g. Protein 2g, Calcium 65mg (7% DV), Iron 1mg (4% DV), Magnesium 41mg (10% DV), Potassium 80 mg (2% Dv).

I've used glue traps before and they do work. One morning I found a mouse trapped in the glue, couldn't move at all, and it started panicking when I started getting close to it. In order to remove caught pests, just use a long handled utensil and wipe the pest off into a garbage can or however you dispose of pests.  These glue traps can also be used for catching various bugs.These trays are somewhat light, and weigh 3.35 oz, about the same weight as 17 US quarters.The glue is very sticky. I touched it with my finger and it was stuck to my finger.  The two trays come facing each other, without covers.  The glue is so strong that is stays put even when the tray is upside down, and doesn't move.Each trap is 9.5" L x 4.5" W and has a thickness of 3/8".  The glue is filled up to half of the trap thickness, so it has about 3/16" thickness of glue. Great for catching mice, and most rats. Larger rats may be able to drag the tray with them.There are a few points that stick up within the trap where you can put your bait gel or peanut butter. I use these in combination with the plastic teeth traps, and the glue traps always work. All mice and most rats will be stuck in the glue, unable to move. A few larger rats that don't get all four feet stuck in the glue may be able to drag the tray.The glue traps are also effective in catching anything else besides mice and rats: snakes (smaller ones), cockroaches, scorpions, spiders, bugs.  Because the glue doesn't run and stays in place, you can hang these traps vertically if necessary, to catch lightweight pests.Once the traps are full of pests, either throw away the whole tray, or wipe everything off and whatever glue remains can still be used to trap more pests.

I'm not a fan of these old fashioned kind of traps. These are effective, but there are better traps out there. This mostly does what it's supposed to do, catch mice.  These traps are lightweight. One of the traps was 0.75 oz. The other was 0.65 oz. That's light. The same weight as three quarters (0.6 oz) or four quarters (0.8 oz).  It depends on the size of your mice and strength of your mice and how they attack the bait piece. In order to release a caught mouse, you need to pull the U-bar back, so your fingers may touch or get very close to touching the killed or still alive pest.The entire trap is 4" H x 1.75" W x 3/16" D (thick).  The bait block, which looks like cheese, is made of plastic, and has a small area to apply gel or peanut butter. Trying to set the trap does take a few tries to get it right. Sometime the pin just doesn't want to stay in the lock. But it does set, and once it does set, it stays that way until the bait block is triggered. And it's not completely sensitive as to undesirably trigger as soon as you put it down. You can move it around once the trap is set without it triggering. Once the trap is set, it requires very little weight on the bait block to trigger. It snaps quickly and will crush anything there.  The trap is durable and will last. The materials used to make it are good quality materials.These traps did work for me, and did catch a mouse. I use these as a third option in combination with the glue traps and the plastic teeth traps (heavy duty traps).It depends on how the mouse attacks the piece. If the bar gets the neck, the mouse dies instantly. The body or tail, it may be able to drag the trap away with it.  I don't normally use these kinds of traps because of the difficulty in setting, the light weight, and possibly having to touch the trapped pest when getting rid of the pest.

This is a fantastic faucet. Easy to install using the included instructions with full diagrams.  Looks great, functions smooth. Such a beauty to look at.  Everything needed to install is included. What you need to provide is your own screwdriver, wrenches, sealant, and thread seal tape. A stopper (drain plug) is also included. There's also an anti-vandal option that holds the stopper in place to prevent someone from taking it.NOTE: This faucet includes a deckplate for a single hole faucet replacement. If you current have three holes, you need to purchase the separately sold three hole deckplate: Moen Item: 147204.Build and Movement: The entire faucet has a thick, solid build. Very high quality. It has a glossy look, but it does collect fingerprints, so be sure to wipe it down to keep it looking bright and glossy.  The handle has some nice weight to it and requires a little effort. It's not loose, but it has the right amount of resistance. The handle is about 1/4" thick. The head swivels halfway to the right or left for cold or hot.Measurements: From the deckplate, the faucet is 6" in height, slightly less than 1 and 3/4" wide and same amount deep (1.65" wide and 1.65" deep).  The handle is 3.75" long. The spout extends 3.25" long.  The hot and cold hoses are 26" long.The design of the spout is completely level to the faucet. If you have this faucet level, after you turn off the water, a little bit of water may go under the spout. If the faucet is just a slight bit at an angle forward, this shouldn't happen. It doesn't have to be at much of an angle. It may not be a problem for some even when it is installed at level.

These mouse traps are quite effective at catching mice. The trap is 4" long, 1.75" wide, and slightly less than 2.25" in height.  The whole trap is made of hard plastic. The teeth are molded into the plastic. It's very easy to remove the bait cup from the bottom of the trap, fill it, place it back in, and set the trap. Once the trap is set, it stays that way. It's perfectly sensitive to whenever anything steps onto the trigger tray. It snaps instantly and will do a great job of catching mice and anything else that tries to get the bait. And on the plus side, it's not overly sensitive, meaning that it won't snap while you are putting the trap down in its location. It will only snap when something steps on the trigger tray. These traps should last a while since they seem to be well-made.As for the weight of these traps, they weigh 1.45 oz each. That is just slightly more than seven quarters (1.4 oz).  So, depending on how big your mice are, they may be completely killed by this trap, or they may be hurt but still be able to drag the trap a little bit. It depends on where the trap's teeth fall on the victim. These traps worked for me.

This soil is excellent. But understand what you are getting. The bag is very light, and it's because the soil density is not dense at all. It's very airy. It is similar to the Miracle Gro Seed Starting Potting Mix, but just a tiny bit more dense. Because of the airiness of the soil, water flows freely through it, and drains out. It will hold and use the water it needs and the rest drains out.  Because of the Miracle Gro in the soil, plants will grow bigger and faster. The bag is only 1 cubic foot, so it will be used up very quickly.  Sometimes the plants will grow much bigger without flowering or producing fruit, and sometimes the plant will produce fruit fast than usual. So consider mixing this soil with regular soil in either of those instances and to extend the quantity of a single bag.

This is a really good canister for storing ingredients, whole, powder or liquid.  It is definitely airtight, and provides a clear view of its contents. It is 1.5 Qt of space inside, with about 1/4" room to spare between the top of the lid. And it's lightweight at 14 oz (or 0.88 lbs or 400 g).  The bottom portion is only 6 oz (or 0.37 lbs) and the lid is 8 oz (or 0.51 lbs). The instructions do say that these containers are intended for dry food storage.  They can't be microwaved, but they can be put in refrigerators and freezers. Due to the changes in temperature, the change in air pressure may cause the lid to lift. Make sure you understand that if you plan on using it in hot or cold locations.The measurements of the canister are (without lid) 5.5" H x 6" W x 4" D.  The lid adds about 5/8" in height.  There are feet on the bottom, which are protrusions from the bottom, so they are made of plastic (no rubber grip so the canister will slide easily if you need it to). But these feet recesses are not on the inside. The interior bottom of the canister is completely flat.As for airtight, I filled my canister with water, locked it, and turned it upside down. No water came out.  So it's airtight. The lid interior is made of plastic and a rubber gasket that seals the lid to the canister. Push down on the top button to lock, and push again to unlock. Easy to use, and smooth pressing.SIZE: It is indeed 1.5 Qt, with just a bit of room to spare (about 1/4" or 0.25") between the top of the ingredients/powder/liquid and the bottom portion of the lid.  QUALITY: The lid is made of plastic and a brushed steel layer (layered onto plastic it feels like), which gives it a nice look.  The canister is made of a medium thick plastic, clear plastic, but with a gray color. And it is very lightweight.  The canister can be squeezed in barely, and it feels like it would not break if dropped from low heights.  It will break if you dropped it from maybe 10 feet or higher.CLEANING: If you need to clean the lid, the pieces of the lid do separate to allow for proper cleaning. Twist the lid to separate. You can remove the plastic piece and the silicone gasket. The silicone gasket is dishwasher safe, but all other parts must be handwashed.

Item: Now Designs Apron, BlackThis apron is made of heavy-weight 100 percent cotton. It feels kind of like canvas for a painting, but is thin enough to move easily. The quality is really good and durable. The fabric absorbs water instantly (and other liquids of same fluid viscosity). The water doesn't bead at all, just gets sucked right into the fabric.  The black color is indeed a dark black. There is a center pocket that measures 11" W x 6.5" H.  The top (neck) to the bottom (legs) measurement is 32" in height. So the pocket is about 1 foot above the bottom, and should sit right at the waist level.  The 28" width of the apron is at the waist level and below.I'm 5' 8" and the apron extends about 2 inches below my knees when worn properly and comfortably for me. The neck strap is stitched to one side and open on the other. It's open to allow for custom fit. There are two metal rings that you can tie it to. Looking at the picture for the white apron, it's unclear to me how to properly loop/thread the strap in. Maybe I need to loosen the ring and thread the strap through there. But what I did was just slide it through the two metal loops on the other side of the apron near the chest and it stays. You can also stitch it permanently. The strap does seem to stay when single threaded through the loops, and it definitely stays when double threaded through the rings.

Winix Air Cleaner does an excellent job of cleaning the air. I own a smaller Winix cleaner and that one is still working. This Winix Model U450 is a large unit. It measures 26' H x 19" W x 11" D. There's a handle in the back to allow for carrying, but it is kind of a heavy unit for an air cleaner at about 15 to 18 lbs. The power cord is 6.5 feet long, two prong plug. Compared to my older model, the Winix PlasmaWave 5300, which I bought four years ago, this U450 model is bigger in size, nearly double. The air vents are about 1" wide and cover the entire sides from top to bottom. The air outlet grid is bigger too. The CADR is roughly 300 to 340 for smoke/dust/pollen.  And for the amount of air moved, it has a rating of 300 CFM.  This unit is excellent at cleaning the air. I own a less expensive Winix 5300 and a similarly priced Rabbit Air cleaner and this U450 model does a great job of cleaning the air all day long, and instantly if necessary.SOUND and SPEEDS: There are four speeds to the fan. When it's on QUIET, you can barely hear it, even while sleeping. So QUIET mode is perfect for sleeping. And when the light sensor detects darkness in the room, it will dim the light panel. The light panel is minimal to begin with, but the blue light from the LEDs may be bothersome to some people in a completely dark room.  I keep it on QUIET all day long when I put it on manual mode, but even when it's on AUTO mode, the unit usually has it on QUIET.  The MEDIUM speed is a good speed for cleaning the air if you know you have pollutants in the air. The sound of MEDIUM is noticeable from across the room.  The HIGH speed is definitely noticeable from another room. It's definitely a fast fan speed. I don't ever use this speed. And then there's TURBO. This is ultra fast and the noise of the unit working to pull air in and release it is noticeable from two rooms away. I don't ever use this speed neither.FILTERS: The filter comes in one piece, as three parts attached together: the washable prefilter (screen), the TRUE HEPA filter (weaved filter paper with thickness of 1"), and a washable carbon filter (honeycomb grid). The three pieces snap together and should be placed into the unit at one time. The screen and carbon grids last forever and can be vacuumed and washed. The HEPA filter can also be vacuumed and washed, but it only lasts for a year (or more depending on use) until the filter paper looks too dirty to reuse. Check the pricing on replacement filters. For my old Winix, I usually went through one HEPA filter every two years. The filter assembly only fits one way, so if the two notches on the side don't line up flush, you have the filter assembly upside down. As for front to back, the screen is in the front facing you, and the carbon grid in the back facing the fan.PLASMAWAVE: This technology can be turned off if it bother you by holding the AUTO button for three seconds.  Same to turn it back on.  According to the manual, the PlasmaWave technology sends out OH molecules to combine with the hydrogen of airborne particles. The result is water molecules.  It only lasts for a nanosecond and you won't see or feel any water. And this technology DOES NOT produce any harmful ozone like the older ION technology cleaners used to.  Personally, I turn it off because I can feel something going on, and it makes me feel weird when I'm in the room. That's just me though because the other people in my house don't seem to experience anything.  Same goes for my other Winix and my Rabbit Air purifiers.For this purifier, the handle is in the back and because of the weight, the unit tilts forward when transporting. In my unit the filter inside moves forward. After placing it back down, I have to open the lid, and push the filter back into position. It only takes a few seconds, but consider transporting with two hands so it doesn't tilt forward.

Item: Belkin N300 Wall-Mount Wi-Fi Range ExtenderThis extender really works. At first I had some trouble setting it up, but I figured out my mistakes. It sets up easily and definitely extends the signal.  First, this unit is small. It measures 2.5" H x 2.5" W x 1.5" D.  It plugs into an outlet at the edge of your Wi-Fi network coverage area.  You will want to try a location in your coverage area that is 75% away from your wireless router.  If that doesn't work, then move it to 50% away from your router. The instructions are included in a PDF on a CD, and they are easy to understand. So far, this has been working without issues, and the signal is constant and reliable.My instructions on how I set it up:1) Using a laptop or wireless device, connect to your wireless network. Go to where the signal is only half a third of the full signal. Make sure you can use the Internet at this location.2) Plug in the range extender at a nearby outlet. It requires about twenty seconds to startup and then it will flash blue & amber alternating.3) Using the laptop/wireless device, connect to the wireless network called Belkin.setup (which is coming from the range extender).  Let it connect. It took a minute to connect, and even when I thought it wasn't connected, I just continued to the next step and it worked.4) Go to an internet browser and type in belkin.range to get to the setup process. It should bring up the setup screen in a few seconds if everything is connected. Choose your wireless network from the list, or if you don't broadcast your SSID like I do, then click on hidden network and specify the information there. After you enter your SSID and wireless network password, it should connect and complete.At the location I tested, I was getting 2 of 5 and 3 of 5 bars for my wireless signal. After installing the range extender, I get 5 of 5 bars, full signal. Using speedtest, Without the extender, with laptop at 75% away from the router in my coverage area, I went from 1.25 Mbps Download and 1.5 Mbps Upload speeds (using speedtest), to 11.5 Mbps DL and 5 Mbps UL.  Just as a frame of reference, when wired to my router, I get speeds of 18.5 Mbps DL and 5 Mbps UL using a cable modem and provider. And I'm using a 300 Mbps Belkin router, but I won't reach 300 Mbps for Internet traffic. When accessing other devices within my network and transferring files, I am able to get 200 and 250 Mbps speeds.The plug of the extender is a two-prong plug, both prongs the same size. And my range extender is not concave like the picture shows, but completely flat. The unit will not block both plugs. If you plug into the top outlet, the bottom outlet remains completely open to use.

I have two of these Intermatic timers and both are easy to use and reliable. My first timer is about five years old now, and I've been using it about twelve times a year for a day or two each time, sometimes for a week during vacations, and it still works. My timer stayed in my outlets securely and never fell out. All my outlets are seven years old.  All lamps connected also stayed securely.The timer is made of hard, durable plastic. There are two sets of ON/OFF trippers (not three like in the picture), made of plastic, but they do the job well.  While the markings on the dial are half hours, the trippers can be set at any 15-minute interval due to the available slots.  The timer measures 3" H x 3" W x 2" D. If you put it in the top outlet, it will block both outlets, but if you plug into the bottom outlet, it leaves the top outlet open for use.Instructions are very simple.1) Set the trippers at desired ON/OFF times. If you use both sets of trippers, you can do two completely different times of day/night.  Green tripper for start time, red tripper for stop time.2) Set the time of day by spinning the dial. The time of day is location at the top center of the dial.3) Connect your lamp or device to the outlet on the side of the timer.  The outlet is a 2-prong outlet with one prong bigger than the other. Make sure your lamp or device is switched to the ON position before or after plugging in, because when the timer switches to ON, the lamp/device will receive power supplied to it.4) Plug the timer into an outlet, and you'll hear a light ticking noise that signifies the timer is working. The plug on the timer is also a two-prong plug, with one prong bigger than the other. If your outlets are positioned correctly, the timer will plug in correctly (in an outlet, the left prong is usually the bigger of the two).There is an ON/OFF switch on top of the timer which will automatically turn ON/OFF based on the trippers, but you can use it as a manual override if you want to turn it ON/OFF regardless of the tripper locations.Always test the timer and your lamp/device the day before. You don't want to have a non-functioning lamp/device or the timer not work. But these timers are reliable. I've been using the same Intermatic times for the past five years.RATINGS: 125 VAC, 60 Hz;  15 A Resistive, 1875 W Tungsten, 15 A Inductive, and 1.3 HP motor load.

Went through half of the pack, and no issues at all with any of the discs. None of my drives write at 16X, so I usually burn at 8X or 12X, and I also run the verification process during the burn, and there are no errors. I've accessed these DVD-Rs a year later and the data was accessible without problems.  I also use these in a DVD Recorder connected to my satellite DVR, and they work  flawlessly. These are definitely consistent. The top of the DVDs have some area where you can write with a permanent marker.

Let me first say that Mackenna's Gold is in Widescreen, this is huge news since the original DVD release it's been very hard to find a Widescreen copy of the film.SONY did a pretty good job on this collection and selecting the films. There are two disks with no special features included. The only movie that isn't in Widescreen is, "The Mountain Men" which is in Full frame. This is a pretty good collection of these films for the price under $15.The specs of the films included are as follows:-"Mackenna's Gold" (1968/color/Widescreen/123mins)Gregory Peck, Omar Sharif, Telly Savalas, Julie Newmar, Keenan Wynn; Directed by J. Lee Thompson-"A Man Called Sledge" (1970/color/Widescreen/92mins)James Garner, Dennis Weaver, Claude Akins; Directed by Vic Morrow-"The Man From Laramie" (1955/color/Widescreen/103mins)James Stewart, Arthur Kennedy, Donald Crisp; Directed by Anthony Mann-"The Mountain Men" (1980/color/Full screen/100mins)Charlton Heston, Brian Keith; Directed by Richard LangOverall this is a good collection and I would recommend it.

This is a nice set of some of Sidney Poitier film from WB and few MGM's which are owned by WB. Each movie has it's own disk and is in a spindle type holder in a 14mm DVD case. The audio for all DVDs are English mono and French mono and the subtitles vary from English, French and Spanish. The films included are as follows:"The Blackboard Jungle" (1955/b&w/Widescreen/100mins)Glenn Ford, Anne Francis, Louis Calhern, Margaret Hayes, Sidney Poitier; directed by Richard Brooks"Edge of City" (1957/b&w/Widescreen/85mins)John Cassavetes, Sidney Poitier, Jack Warden, Kathleen Maguire; directed by Martin Ritt"Something of Value" (1957/color/Widescreen/114mins)Rock Hudson, Dana Wynter, Sidney Poitier, Wendy Hiller; directed by Richard Brooks"A Patch of Blue" (1965/b&w/Widescreen/105mins)Sidney Poitier, Shelley Winters, Elizabeth Hartman; directed by Guy GreenOverall this is a great collection and is a product I would recommend.

Shout did a pretty good job on this Blu-ray/DVD combo release. Now I also own the Artisan and Shout wins the comparison hand down! Shout's version has brighter, clearer and sharper picture with clear and better sound than the Artisan DVD. I'm really impressed how the quality of the video is a lot brighter than the Artisan DVD. Shout also provided lots of neat bonus features with interviews of Caine, Sutherland and John Sturges. The quality of both disk are great with BD being the best. Overall this is an excellent Blu-ray release and is a product I would recommend.

This is a pretty good Western starring Burt Lancaster as Massai and Jean Peters. This film is presented in color, Full frame and runs for about 1hr 27mins. This movie also stars: John McIntire, Charles Bronson, John Dehner, Paul Guilfoyle and is directed by Robert Aldrich. Burt plays a great Apache and is perfect for the role. Overall this is a good Western and I would recommend it.

This is a great poster of Nina Agdal with very clear picture and a great picture. The poster does look a little bit darker than the stock photo on here, but it makes the poster look great. I would recommend this.

Universal did a great job on this release, despite no special features included with the release. The quality of the video was really good and better than what I expected with clear and sharp picture The audio sounds great with clear sound and is in English DTS-HD Master Audio 5.1. Now there is the original trailer included that is not in HD. The release also includes French audio and subtitles for English and Spanish. The original release includes a cover sleeve of info on the 1970s, but I wish they could've done better with that and have a High Plains Drifter sleeve. Overall this is an excellent Blu-ray release and is a product I would recommend.

This is a cute comedy starring; James Stewart, Barbara Hale, James Gleason, Fred Clark, Alan Mowbray, Patricia Medina and a young Tommy Rettig and Natalie Wood. 20th Century Fox did a great job on this transfer with pretty good picture. The film is presented in b&w, full frame and runs for about 85mins. Overall this is a great film and I would recommend to anyone who is a fan of these stars or fan of old films in general.

What's more to say than this is a great Metal album. Holy Solider won a two Dove Awards in 1991 for this album. All of the songs have great messages with Glam Metal feel to it. If you like Christian Metal or Metal in generally then this album is a must have.

This is a great Christian Rock album with some Hard Rock songs. I personally liked all the songs, but "Carry Me" and "After the Fall" stood out to me with great messages. Legend after this album became known as Legend Seven. Now, if you like Stryper, Whitecross, Shout or pretty much Christian Hard Rock then this is a CD you will like.

This review is on the Blu-ray release. First of all this is a great War time drama starring Burt Lancaster, Montgomery Clift, Deborah Kerr, Frank Sinatra, Donna Reed plus others! SONY did a great job on this release that includes a cover sleeve with original pressing, multiple poster cards inside and a few bonus features on the disk. The quality of the film is quite good with excellent audio and clear picture with hardly no visible distortions. Overall this is a great Blu-ray release and is a product I would recommend.

Catcom did a pretty good job on the transfer of these two films. Both films are on one-sided disk with a few short cartoons. Both movies are Full screen. "Three Guys Named Mike" (1951/b&w/89mins) stars: Jane Wyman, Van Johnson, Howard Keel, Barry Sullivan, Phyllis Kirk, Anne Sargent, Jeff Donnell, Barbara Billingsley, directed by Charles Walters; "The Big Trees" (1952/color/89mins) stars: Kirk Douglas, Eve Miller, Patrice Wymore, Edgar Buchanan, John Archer, Alan Hale Jr., directed by Felix E. Feist. The quality of "Three Guys Named Mike" is quite good and is a little bit better than I though it would be and the quality of "The Big Trees" is really good with original color. Now, don't expect too much since these films are in public domain, but I hope Warner Bros. picks up "The Big Trees." Overall this is a pretty good double feature and is a product I would recommend.

First of all this is one of Fox's Pan&Scan release and is not in it's original Widescreen (1.66:1) ratio. Now since this isn't like a 1.85:1 or 2.35:1 Widescreen the video is quite good without any cutoffs. If you like original ratio then you shouldn't buy this and maybe wait to see if Fox re-releases it. Other than the ratio, this is a pretty good Western starring Van Johnson and Joanne Dru. The film is presented in color, Full screen and runs for about 86mins. This film also stars: Richard Boone, Milburn Stone, Jeff Morrow, Craig Hill and directed by Rudolph Mate. Overall this is a good film and an okay DVD which I would recommend if you don't want a butchered product.

This is a nice set of Wayne films from Paramount. All films are in Widescreen with "In Harm's Way" being in 2.35:1. All three films has their own disk and is in a clear DVD case. Special feature included are Trailers and "In Harm's Way" includes, The Making of In Harm's Way and three Trailers (narrated by Otto Preminger).The movie's details are as followed."Donovan's Reef" (1963/color/108mins)-Wayne, Lee Marvin, Elizabeth Allen, Jack Warden, Cesar Romero, Dick Foran, Dorothy Lamour; Directed by John Ford"Hatari!" (1961/color/157mins)-Wayne, Hardy Kruger, Elisa Martinelli, Red Buttons; Directed by Howard Hawks"In Harm's Way" (1965/b&w/167mins)-Wayne, Kirk Douglas, Patricial Neal, Tom Tryon, Puala Prentiss, Brandon de Wilde, Jill Haworth, Dana Andrews, many others; Directed by Otto PremingerOverall this is a nice set of Wayne films and I would recommend this.

Timeless Media Group did a good job on this Blu-ray. I did do a comparison of DVD from Shout's double feature and there is a difference between them both. The quality of the video is quite clear and sharper than the DVD. After the start of the opening credits the video quality improves. There isn't any old film dust on the BD and the audio sounds great. The audio provided is only English DTS-HD Master Audio 2.0 with no subtitles. The extras on this BD are Trailer, Interview with producer Albert Ruddy and two audio commentaries by the cast and the writers of "Death Hunt." The movie is in Widescreen, color and runs for about 97mins. The cast include; Charles Bronson, Lee Marvin, Andrew Stevens, Angie Dickinson, Carl Weathers, Ed Lauter, Scott Hylands; Directed by Peter R. Hunt. Overall this is a great Action movie and Blu-ray release and is a product I would recommend.

Despite the disk of "The Getaway" as noted by the other reviewer, the menu is not in English and will be hard to figure out. Other than that problem this is a wonderful Blu-ray triple feature of some of the best from Steve McQueen. Each movie has it's own disk and the original pressing does come with a slipcover. All three movies are in Widescreen with "The Getaway" only in 2.4:1 Widescreen and other two 1.85:1. There is English, French and Spanish audio and subtitles along with German, Portuguese, Danish, Finnish, Norwegian and Swedish audio and/or subtitles for "The Cincinnati Kid."The quality of the movies are great and Warner did a good job on the remaster of all three films. The video quality is great on all three. The sound is pretty good in Dolby Digital 2.0 for "Bullitt" and DD 1.0 for the other two films. As for the extras' "Bullitt" has the trailer, commentary by Peter Yates, Vintage Featurette and Documentaries; for "The Cincinnati Kid" I haven't checked yet; for "The Getaway" I don't know since the menu is not English.The movies details are as followed."Bullitt" (1968/color/114mins)-McQueen, Jacqueline Bisset, Don Gordon, Robert Duvall,  Simon Oakland, Norman Fell; Directed by Peter Yates"The Cincinnati Kid" (1965/color/103mins)-McQueen, Edward G. Robinson, Ann-Margret, Karl Malden, Tuesday Weld, Rip Torn, Jack Weston; Directed by Norman Jewison"The Getaway" (1972/color/123mins)-McQueen, Ali MacGraw, Ben Johnson, Al Lettieri, Sally Struthers; Directed by Sam PeckinpahOverall this is a great Blu-ray triple feature if available. I did try to change the my PS3 and Blu-ray language, but "The Getaway" disk still shows that same language on the menu.

I'm glad Shane is on Blu-ray and I applaud WB for releasing this great Western on Blu-ray. The quality of the BD is stunning  with excellent picture quality. The picture is very sharp and clear which brings out the great color with not much static being seen through the film. The audio sounds great and provides French and Spanish audio too. The subtitles included are English, French and Spanish. The special features included are: commentary with George Steven Jr. and associate producer Ivan Moffat with the original trailer. The film included is in color, runtime of 118mins and is in it's original aspect ratio 1.37:1 format. The cast in the film are; Alan Ladd, Jean Arthur, Van Heflin, Brandon De Wilde, Jack Palance, Ben Johnson, Edgar Buchanan, Elisha Cook Jr., Ellen Corby and is Directed by George Stevens. Overall this is an excellent Blu-ray and I would recommend it, especially to Western fans.

This is a pretty good Cary Grant collection with a few of his best with Fox. As noted in past Fox box-sets there design is not the best and sometimes the packaging gets torn and the disks may or will have scratches, but I have bought seven of their collections and I haven't had any problems with them. This collection has two sleeves with three films on Vol 1 and three on Vol 2.The details of the films included as in aspect ratio, runtime, color/b&w, etc. are as followed.Volume 1"Born to be Bad" (1934/b&w/Full screen/62mins)-Loretta Young, Grant, Jackie Kelk, Marion Burns, Henry Travers; Directed by Lowell Sherman"I Was a Male War Bride" (1949/b&w/Full screen/105mins)-Grant, Ann Sheridan, Marion Marshall, Randy Stuart; Directed by Howard Hawks"People Will Talk" (1951/b&w/Full screen/110mins)-Grant, Jeanne Crain, Finlay Currie, Hume Cronyn, Walter Slezak, Sidney Blackmer; Directed by Joseph L. MankiewiczVolume 2"Monkey Business" (1952/b&w/Full screen/97mins)-Grant, Ginger Rogers, Charles Coburn, Marilyn Monroe, Hugh Marlowe; Directed by Howard Hawks"An Affair Remember" (1957/color/Widescreen/119mins)-Grant, Deborah Kerr, Richard Denning; Directed by Leo McCarey"Kiss Them For Me" (1957/color/Widescreen/-Grant, Jayne Mansfield, Leif Erickson, Suzy Parker, Ray Walston; Directed by Stanley DonenOverall this is a pretty good collection with a few great Cary Grant films and is a collection I would recommend.

This is a great Fonda collection of some of his best with Fox. As noted in past Fox box-sets there design is not the best and sometimes the packaging gets torn and the disks may or will have scratches, but I have bought seven of their collections and I haven't had any problems with them. This collection has two sleeves with six films on Vol 1 and four on Vol 2.The details of the films included as in aspect ratio, runtime, color/b&w, etc. are as followed.Volume 1"Jesse James" (1939/color/Full screen/106mins)-Tyrone Power, Fonda, Randolph Scott, Nancy Kelly, Henry Hull; Directed by Henry King"Drums Along the Mohawk" (1939/color/Full screen/104mins)-Claudette Colbert, Fonda, Edna May Oliver, Eddie Collins, John Carradine, Ward Bond; Directed by John Ford"The Grapes of Wrath" (1940/b&w/Full screen/129mins)-Fonda, Jane Darwell, John Carradine, Charley Grapewin, John Qualen; Directed by John Ford"The Return of Frank James" (1940/color/Full screen/93mins)-Fonda, Gene Tierney, Jackie Cooper, Henry Hull, John Carradine, Donald Meek; Directed by Fritz Lang"Immortal Sergeant" (1943/b&w/Full screen/90mins)-Fonda, Maureen O'Hara, Thomas Mitchell, Allyn Joslyn, Reginald Gardiner; Directed by John M. Stahl"The Ox-Bow Incident" (1943/b&w/Full screen/75mins)-Fonda, Dana Andrews, Mary Beth Hughes, Anthony Quinn, Henry Morgan, Jane Darwell; Directed by William A. WellmanVolume 2"My Darling Clementine" (1946/b&w/Full screen/96mins)-Fonda, Linda Darnell, Victor Mature, Cathy Downs, Walter Brennan, Tim Holt, Ward Bond, John Ireland; Directed by John Ford"Daisy Kenyon" (1947/b&w/Full screen/99mins)-Joan Crawford, Dana Andrews, Fonda, Ruth Warrick, Martha Stewart; Directed by Otto Preminger"The Longest Day" (1962/b&w/Widescreen/178mins)-Wayne, Mitchum, Richard Burton, Eddie Albert, Henry Fonda, Robert Ryan, Sean Connery and many more!"The Boston Strangler" (1968/color/Widescreen/116mins)-Honda, Tony Curtis, George Kennedy, Murray Hamilton, Jeff Corey; Directed by Richard FleischerOverall this is a great collection brought to us by Fox and is an item I would recommend.

This is a great Mitchum collection of some of his best with Fox and MGM. As noted in past Fox box-sets there design is not the best and sometimes the packaging gets torn and the disks may or will have scratches, but I have bought seven of their collection and I have not problem with them. This collection has two sleeves with six films on Vol 1 and four on Vol 2. Volume 1 has films from the 50s and Volume 2 has films from 60s.The details of the films included as in aspect ratio, runtime, color/b&w, etc. are as followed.Volume 1"River of No Return" (1954/color/Widescreen/91mins)-Mitchum, Marilyn Monroe, Rory Calhoun, Tommy Rettig, Douglas Spencer; Directed by Otto Preminger"The Night of the Hunter" (1955/b&w/Widescreen/93mins)-Mitchum, Shelley Winters, Lillian Gish, James Gleason, Peter Graves, Don Beddoe; Directed by Charles Laughton"Heaven Knows Mr. Allison" (1957/color/Widescreen/106mins)-Mitchum, Deborah Kerr; Directed by John Huston"The Enemy Below" (1957/color/Widescreen/97mins)-Mitchum, Curt Jurgens, Al Hedison, Thedoore Bikel, Russel Collins; Directed by Dick Powell"Thunder Road" (1958/b&w/Widescreen/93mins)-Mitchum, Gene Barry, Jacoues Aubuchon, Kelly Smith, Jim Mitchum; Directed by Arthur Ripley"The Hunters" (1958/color/Widescreen & Full screen/107mins)-Mitchum, Robert Wagner, May Britt, Richard Egan, Lee Phillips; Directed by Dick PowellVolume 2"The Longest Day" (1962/b&w/Widescreen/178mins)-Wayne, Mitchum, Richard Burton, Eddie Albert, Henry Fonda, Robert Ryan, Sean Connery and many more!"Man in the Middle" (1964/b&w/Widescreen/93mins)-Mitchum, France Nuyen, Barry Sullivan, Trevor Howard; Directed by Guy Hamilton"What a Way to Go" (1964/color/Widescreen/111mins)-Shirley MacLaine, Mitchum, Paul Newman, Dean Martin, Gene Kelly, Bob Cummings, Dick Van Dyke; Directed by J. Lee Thompson"The Way West" (1967/color/Widescreen/122mins)-Mitchum, Kirk Douglas, Richard Widmark, Lola Albright, Michael Witney, Sally Field; Directed by Andrew V. McLaglenOverall Fox did a great job on this collection and putting these great films on it and is a collection I would recommend.

This is a great calendar for a college student. This calendar has some of the best models from Playboy and all images look stunning and in great quality. I really like the spiral ring this way I can save the pictures for later use and not throw it away. Although the dates are small on the bottom, they design looks pretty good. Overall this is a good calendar even if you want to have only five months left of the year.

I agree with few others, the quality of the video was better than some other reviewers and Blu-ray.com were talking about. The video is a lot better than the DVD and the audio sounds perfect. Now I haven't seen the special features so I can't review on that. I watched the whole movie and I had no problem with either video or audio looking or sounding different throughout the movie. I did think they should've done better on the opening credits in which the font didn't look sharper than other Blu-rays released. For the price it is now ($9.99) this is a steal for a great quality Blu-ray. Overall this is a great item and I would recommend this.

First of all the quality of the movie is okay, but not the best and at some points of the movie the picture seems to be blurry. The movie is presented in Widescreen and color. This is a good movie starring Cornel Wilde. Overall this is a good movie but I wouldn't recommend it due to the quality.

The Legend Films DVD version is the best out there. Legend Films has provided the original B&W version and new color version on the same DVD. The color of the movie was good, but I'd prefer the B&W version first. The quality of the movie was quite good and better than I expected. Overall the Legend Films version is the best choice and I would recommend it.
This brings back so many memories watching Baywatch and sounds just like the original version. Jimi from Survivor did a great job and I would recommend this song.

As noted by other reviewers the quality of the movies are excellent. I was first skeptical about Mill Creek due to some DVDs they released which weren't good, but this Blu-ray double feature changed my mind. The video and audio quality of the movies are excellent with some special features. Both of these movies are great and presented in Widescreen and B&W. Overall this is a great buy and I would recommend this.

These are two great Edward G. Robinson Film Noirs despite "The Woman in the Window" in color. Both movies are in Full screen and run for about 95mins to 99mins(1hr 35mins to 1hr 39mins). Both movies video and audio are great and I didn't have any trouble watching them. There isn't any extras besides the movie. If you want "The Woman in the Widow" then I'd recommend getting the MGM DVD that's also listed on Amazon. Overall this is a nice set of Film Noir movies.

This was a gift and I love both movies. First of all these transfers are great. TGG Direct did a great job on these two movies. Both movies are in Full frame format, B&W and there are no special features or other audio language and no subtitles. Plus "Fury at Showdown" has never been on DVD and this is it's first appearance."Along Came Jones" (1945/90mins)Gary Cooper, Loretta Young, William Demarest, Dan Duryea, Frank Sully; Directed by Stuart Heisler"Fury at Showdown" (2957/75mins)John Derek, John Smith, Carolyn Craig, Nick Adams; Directed by Gerd OswaldOverall this is a nice set and I would recommend this to any Western fans or fans of these stars.

Olive Films dis a good job on this release for DVD and I could think the Blu-ray is better but I haven't bought that yet so I can't say. The DVD version is pretty good quality. This is a great War movie starring John Wayne, Susan Hayward, Dennis O'Keefe, William Frawley, Paul Fix, plus others! The DVD is presented in Fullscreen (1.37:1), B&W and runs for about 100mins. Overall this is a great movie and I would recommend this.

Stay way from this and other Digitally Remastered TGG Direct movies, for they probably aren't Remastered. The quality of the movie is horrible and at sometimes is too dark. I have no clue why Amazon would sell something like this when they won't get much for it. Also, I'm ashamed with TGG Direct that they would do this when they should stick to releasing old MGM DVDs to double feature that they have before. Overall this is a no buy.

Finally SONY puts "The Key" on their Choice Collection. This is a great Drama set during WWII with William Holden as a Canadian sergeant brought to England to bring in crippled ships damaged by German torpedoes. This movie also star; Sophia Loren, Trevor Howard, Kieron Moore, Bernard Lee, Bryan Forbes, plus others! The movie is presented in Widescreen, B&W and runs for about 134mins (2hrs 14mins). The quality of the movie is really good and there isn't any special features, subtitles or other audio except English. The only problem I have is that SONY didn't put the time, aspect ratio or color on the back. Overall this is a great movie and I would recommend this.

This is a great Crime/Film Noir movie starring; Lee J. Cobb, Kerwin Mathews, Gia Scala and Richard Boone. This movie was released in 1957, is in B&W, runs for about 88mins (1hr 28mins) and is in Widescreen format. Overall this is a good movie and I would recommend this.

This is a pretty good Survivor album with a little more Rock to it. The best tracks on this album are; Jackie Don't Go, I Never Stopped Loving You, It Doesn't Have To Be This Way and Half-life. If you like Survivor's other albums then I would recommend this.
This is a good Western of the Durango Kid sets. The quality of the movie was better than I expected. The movie ran for about 55mins. If you like other Durango Kid movies then I would recommend this.

This is a great collection of the best and notable movies from Leslie Nielsen. Since WB got the right to release some Paramount titles they released this great collection with all three Naked Gun movies together. All Naked Gun movies are in Widescreen format with Wrongfully Accused is in Full frame, all are in color and runs for about 85mins each. WB did a great job on making this set with each movie has it's own disk. I would recommend this, even if you have any this way you can clear up some space.

Again, TGG Direct doesn't disappoint by putting two great Jack Lemmon and Billy Wilder movies together. Both movies are in great quality and each movie has there own disk with no special features. Also, there isn't any subtitles or any other audio languages besides English. Both movies are in color and Widescreen.-Avanti (1972/140mins)Lemmon, Juliet Mills, Clive Revill, Edward Andrews-Irma La Douce (1963/147mins)Lemmon, Shirley MacLaineOverall these are great MGM comedy movies and I would recommend this.

First of all the quality of the movies is great; although, there isn't any special features or other audio languages except for English and there is no subtitles. TGG Direct did a great job on putting these on DVD.-Valdez is Coming (1970/color/Widescreen/90mins)Burt Lancaster, Susan Clark, Frank Silvera, Jon Cypher; Directed by Edwin Sherin-The Ride Back (1957/b&w/Full frame/79mins)William Conrad, Anthony Quinn, Lita Milan, Victor Millan; Directed by Allen H. Miner-Buffalo Bill and the Indians (1976/color/Widescreen/123mins)Paul Newman, Joel Grey, Geraldine Chaplin, Burt Lancaster; Directed by Robert AltmanOverall this is a nice set of Westerns and I would recommend it.

This is Region 1 DVD and there is English audio, but I haven't checked for other languages. The quality of them are just like buying them separately. All movies except Man of the West, are in Full frame format. There are four disks in this collection and there is just one case that holds all disks.All movies included are:Along Came Jones (1945/b&W/90mins)-Gary Cooper, Loretta Young, William Demarest, Dan Duryea, Frank Sully; Directed by Stuart HeislerMan of the West (1958/color/99mins)-Gary Cooper, Julie London, Lee J. Cobb, Arthur O'Connell, Jack Lord; Directed by Anthony MannThe Pride of the Yankees (1942/b&w/128mins)-Gary Cooper, Teresa Wright, Walter Brennan, Dan Duryea; Directed by Sam WoodThe Westerner (1940/b&w/100mins)-Gary Cooper, Walter Brennan, Doris Davenport, Fred Stone; Directed by William WylerThis is a great collection of some of the best Gary Cooper movies and Westerns. I would recommend getting this collection, for the price of these movies individually will be a lot higher.

Finally Warner Archive re-released this box set into one. There are five disks and it's all in one case and not in five separate cases. It's the same as Randolph Scott: The Warner Archive Classics Collection (Badman's Territory / Trail Street / Return of the Bad Men / Carson City / Westbound), but this has only one case with five for the older version. So I would recommend getting this so you can save space and it would save you money from buying the movies separate. The quality of the movies are great with "Badman's Territory" kind of grainy some times, but is worth watching. There isn't much features except for a few Trailers and there isn't any subtitles or other languages then English.-Badman's Territory (1946/b&w/Full Frame/98mins)Scott, George "Gabby" Hays, Ann Richards, Ray Collins, James Warren; Directed by Tim Whelan-Trail Street (1947/b&w/Full frame/84mins)Scott, Robert Ryan, Anne Jeffreys, George "Gabby" Hays, Steve Brodie; Directed by Ray Enright-Return of the Bad Men (1948/b&w/ Full frame/90mins)Scott, Robert Ryan, Anne Jeffreys, George "Gabby" Hays, Jacqueline White, Steve Brodie; Directed by Ray Enright-Carson City (1952/color/Full frame/87mins)Scott, Lucille Norman, Raymond Massey, Richard Webb, Larry Keating; Directed by Andre De Toth-Westbound (1958/color/Widescreen/72mins)Scott, Virginia Mayo, Karen Steele, Michael Dante, Andrew Duggan; Directed by Budd BoetticherOverall this is a awesome set of Randolph Scott Westerns and I would recommend this to anyone interested in Westerns or fans of these stars in these films.

To clear up, both quality of these movies are great. Sad note there isn't any features or other language/subtitles except English language. "Town without Pity" (1961/B&W/Widescreen/105mins) stars: Kirk Douglas, Barbara Rütting, Christine Kaufmann, E.G. Marshall, Robert Blake, Richard Jaeckel, Frank Sutton, plus others! "Inherit the Wind" (TV Movie/1988/color/Full frame/96mins) star: Kirk Douglas, Jason Robards, Darren McGavin, John Harkins, Megan Follows, Jean Simmons, plus others! Overall this is a great set of Kirk Douglas movies and I would recommend this.

The Blu-ray version is perfect and the video is like your in front of the actors themselves. This is a great Roger Moore movie that is over 2 hours long. This movie also stars: Christopher Lee, Britt Ekland, Maud Adams, Hervé Villechaize, Clifton James, Richard Loo, Lois Maxwell, Bernard Lee and Desmond Llewelyn. Again another Blu-ray isn't a disappointment. Overall this is a great buy and I would recommend it.

All opinion expressed here are my personal.📍 One need to understand that the projector is just shy of 100 bucks, so don't expect it to perform up to the levels of projectors which costs ~$500+.📺 Display 4.5/5 📺📤 A simple way to get a 50 inch plus display for special occasions.📤 A decent enough display which allows you to enjoy movies/matches or videos in the comfort of your home.📤 The projector is not intended to read from the screen, and correctly mentioned in the product spec, not meant for Word , Excel or PowerPoint.📤 A very handy tilt feature which basically allows you to have a rectangular picture even when projecting inclined.🔃 not 1080p display, but 1080i, so quality doesn't match Full HD from TV/laptop screens, but that is not the expectation here.📺 Sound 4/5 📺🔃 noticeable sound from the fan, especially  when no soundtrack in playing. 📌 Recently I have been visiting physical therapy due to pain in my shoulder and upper back, the physiotherapist told me that my whole back is very stiff due to the work and life style I follow. Usually the routing there starts with some warm up exercises and then finally electrical stimulation of upper back and shoulder muscles. Ohh what a relief to stiff muscles it provides.I have recently had a chance to try this Santamedical PM180 pulse massager and I straight away took it for a ride for the same relief and all I can say that this device works well, this is my first week of using it and I will update the review if the device gives me any kind of issues.🏁 All in all, I am impressed with the performance and usage of this device it works like a boon for people who don't get much time to exercise and need some relief from massage.📍 If I had 45 seconds to talk about this product to help making a buying decision I would say📤 light and small, which makes it easy to travel with this device.📤 portable device, works with battery which means you can use it anywhere and you don't need an outlet to use it.📤 powerful, with both pairs of electrodes I couldn't take the device to one third of intensity.📤 timer which can be set of multiple of 10 minutes to a maximum of an hour.📤 eventually you would need to replace the electrode pads after some time but this is something which is common with all massager / simulators.🏁 Neither I am a medical professional not I recommend this device to use as a solution for your long standing problem however if you need a portable massaging solution this is indeed a nice choice.📣 Final Recommendation : Small, portable & powerful pulse massager, such a relief !!🔮 ASIN : B00O9P2VLI📆 Tags : #trymeoncereviews, trymeoncereviews, #tmor, tmor, try, me, once, reviews, B00O9P2VLI,  #EZ_TENS_VIDEO📕 DISCLOSURE: A sample was provided for honest opinion and review. 1:35 Mins🎥 Detailed Video Review for product features & functions 🎥🏁 You will need this device if,- If your car/truck doesn't have Auxiliary sound or Bluetooth or USB input and you would like to play your own music via FM.- You can play the music without messing up the sound system of your car as this doesn't require any car specific installation.🏁 INSTALLATION- Plug in the car charging part of the device into the port.- Device turns on and displays the FM frequency being transmitted.- Turn on the bluetooth pairing mode by pressing the center button for about 5 seconds, blue light starts blinking.- Turn on bluetooth in your phone and look for H1, connect. Once done the blue light would stop blinking.- Tune your car FM radio to the frequency which is showing up in the transmitter display.- You're done!📍 If I had 45 seconds to talk about this product to help making a buying decision I would say :📤 Stylish construction📤 The FM transmitter also rotates to allow you to move it in appropriate position.📤 Red LED based display shows the volume and frequency.📤 Bluetooth range is appropriate to be used in car, so phone is not required to be kept next to the streambot.🔃 FM intensity is okay.📤 Connects to the previous paired device automatically so you don't need to pair your phone again. Just start the car and as soon as the device is powered you will be connected!📤 This also allows you to use your car radio and this device's mic as a handsfree system for calling and safe driving.🏁 RECOMMENDATION FOR FM FREQUENCY SELECTION: You should always search for a frequency which is not being used by radio stations in your area to get a uninterrupted reception. I usually go to either extremities just above 88 or just below 108.📣 Final Recommendation : Enables personal music via FM!🔮 ASIN : B010ZOK1Q8📆 Tags : #trymeoncereviews, trymeoncereviews, #tmor, tmor, try, me, once, reviews, ABDTECH, B010ZOK1Q8📕 DISCLOSURE: A sample was provided for honest opinion and review.
