Shalu is a cute little monkey-bird creature.  He is part of the Bayala World of Fantasy line of toys and is a small sized Schleich figure.  Shalu has a monkey type face and hands, cat like body and tail, round ears, and he has feathers on his head and rump.  Shalu is colored a bright sky blue with green and purple accents.  Schliech describes Shalu as a “Rainbow Monkey” that likes to juggle apples and has extremely ticklish feet.Shalu is a great little sturdy toy that is great for creative play or collecting.  If you like unusual and imaginative creatures, you will love this little guy.  Like all Schleich toys Shalu is a high quality toy that has been hand painted.  This toy is for ages 3 and up.

I was really hoping Amanita would glow.  Her skin is such a light, bright, luminous green it seems to glow – but sadly, she does not glow in the dark.  Amanita Nightshade is the Daughter of the Bad Seed of the Corpse Flower.  She is a bad seed indeed, and I think she has the strangest diary and personality of any Monster High Character.  Amanita speaks about herself in the third person, and she is selfish, greedy and vain.  She is her own BFF.  I have a feeling Amanita is poised to be the next big villain at Monster High.Her personality may be lacking, but her beauty is not.  As mentioned, Amanita has lovely green skin that is perfectly complimented by her long, shiny purple-blue hair.  In addition to her hair, Amanita has purple eyes, eyebrows, and lips.  Surrounding her eyes are a leaf decoration.Amanita is wearing a lovely dress made up of two separate parts.  The main part of her dress is a long dusty lavender-pink, wrap-around gauzy, ghostly dress.  The bottom portion of this dress is petal shaped and decorated with black twisting thorns and leaves, and the dress transitions in color from the dusty pink to green.  This dress is trimmed with black around the neckline, waist, and shoulders.  There is more trim on the front of the dress – dark purple ruffles that run vertically along some of the petal shapes.  Under this overlay she wears a mini dress with a black leatherette skirt and bright green top with a black thorny print.In her hair Amanita wears a black flower that looks like a twisted hibiscus bloom.  On her feet are black open toed heels with a leaf design.  The heel of her shoes is made up of a bulbous flower pod.  Amanita has ankle decorations that look like they are part of her shoes, but are not.  These accessories are flowing, green twisted vines that are decorated with a dark purple flower.  She also carries a black handbag with a flower petal design.Amanitas other accessories include an icoffin, a purple portfolio, her Diary (“The Unlife and Times of Amanita Nightshade Vol. 56), a spiky black bracelet, black dangle earrings, a thorny black necklace, a hairbrush and a doll stand. Amanita is the standard MH doll size, so she should be able to exchange clothing with most of the other ghouls.  Amanita has multiple points of articulation, so she can assume just about any pose.  Amanita is a very pretty doll, with a great color scheme.  I will look forward to finding out more about this unusual character.  (How she came to be sleeping in the DeNile crypt, and her feud with Medusa!)

I am a huge Adventure Time fan, and was overjoyed when I discovered Hambo could be mine.  I love how much Marceline loves Hambo.  Well loved toys are always the best toys.Hambo is only about 8 inches high, so be prepared for him to be a bit small.  His details are perfect, with all of his boo-boo’s from the series.  He has patches, stitches, and stuffing that show his wear and tear.  Hambo’s stitching seems quite sturdy, but he is made of a light weight material and some of his patches are decals.  With this in mind, he will probably make a better collector’s toy than a “lovie” that is carried everywhere.Hambo is one of the most fun toys I have seen in a long time, and is definitely the greatest plushie.  I love my Hambo, and I’m sure you will too.

Ginger Breadhouse is the Daughter of the Candy Witch (Hansel and Gretel), but has no interest in following in her famous mother's footsteps.  Ginger is a "Rebel" that would rather bake delicious cupcakes than think about" luring kids to their candy coated doom".  Ginger bakes the most wonderful sweets, and has the magical ability to bake secret spells into her food.Ginger has extra-long bright candy pink hair that she wears with bangs and two long pony tails.  Ginger's lips are bright pink and match her hair.  She has lovely cinnamon colored skin.  Ginger has light brown eyes (instead of purple like her animated version) and dotted makeup decorations around her eyes.  Ginger is all about candy and sweets.  She is wearing a tan and hot pink dress decorated with a print of ice cream sprinkles and gold glitter sprinkles. Her dress has a gold glitter train and over her dress she is wearing a short black bolo jacket.  Ginger's tights are the best part of her outfit - her tights are brown with light pink icing squiggles.Ginger has several accessories.  She comes with the glasses that she wears in the animated series - oversized round pink glasses that are decorated with lollipops.  Ginger has a really great handbag that is shaped like a black cauldron.  The handle of her bag is made of a golden spoon, and the top of the bag is bubbling over with gold decoration.  Ginger wears a black headband that is decorated with a cupcake.  The cupcake is in a golden wrapper and topped with hot pink frosting.  Ginger is wearing gold candy shoes with heels made of lollipops and ankle straps make of dripping hot pink candy and licorice twists.  Around her neck Ginger is wearing a large turquoise beaded necklace.Ginger comes with a doll stand, a hair brush, and a "bookmark" that tells her story.  Like all EAH dolls Ginger has multiple points of articulation and can be posed in just about any way imaginable. She is made for play, but has many small parts that can be fragile if handled roughly.  As a doll collector, I have been eagerly awaiting Ginger's release.  She is just adorable, and is a super sweet addition to Ever After High.(Please note:  my doll did not come with the pictured bracelet.)

Lorna McNessie is the Daughter of the Loch Ness Monster, and a new exchange student at Monster High.  Lorna has striking bright blue-green colored skin that has a slight shimmer.  Her skin looks fantastic and perfectly complements her bright red wavy hair.  Lorna has bright aqua colored eyes and bright coral colored lips that show the fangs on her lower jaw.  Lorna has the best tail of any of the MH character.  Hers is attached (unlike other tails), can be turned from side to side, and is especially swoopy.  Her tail has multiple fins that imitate photographs of the Loch Ness Monster and her tail ends in a forked fin.  When changing her outfit you will notice that Lorna’s torso is embossed with a Celtic knot design.  This is a hidden detail – but so very cool!  I love it when Monster High includes this kind of surprise on a doll.  Lorna’s other monster attributes include scaled skin, webbed hands, fins on her forearms and lower legs, and ears that are finned shaped.Instead of a “diary” Lorna comes with a passport.  Her passport describes her life in “Rotland”, including details of her family life and her love of photobombing.  Lorna also has a small cardboard doll sized passport that fits perfectly into her handbag.  Her red handbag opens, and is covered with more Celtic knot work and the image of a lake monster.  Lorna is wearing a short sleeved red blouse with a black fish net print.  Her kilt/skirt has a lake monster print in colors of red, blue and black.  Lorna loves plaid, and she is wearing a plaid cap.  On her feet are high heeled shoes with heels made of stacked gray castle stones.  My favorite accessory Lorna has is the lake monster shaped earring she wears on her right ear.Lorna is a little smaller than most of the MH dolls.  She is 14 years old, so she is the little sister size of Howleen, Twyla, and River Styxx.  Lorna comes with the standard doll stand and hairbrush.  I am a long time Loch Ness Monster fan, so I was super excited to add the wonderful Lorna to my doll collection.  The designers did a great job of translating a famous lake monster into an adorable doll and Lorna McNessie is definitely one of my favorite Monster High characters.  Like all MH dolls she has multiple points of articulation so she can be posed in many ways.  She is made for play, but has small parts that could be lost or broken if she is not treated gently.Lorna is a great new character that will make a wonderful addition to any Monster High collection.  I won’t spoil it for you - you will have to read her passport to find out about the Three-Eyed Dusky Dragon Owls.  Look for her as part of the new “Monster Exchange” line of dolls.

Fans of Ever After High will be familiar with the Beanstalk Bakery Café – a favorite hangout for the EAH kids.  This playset has a storybook theme, and everything you need for a successful coffee shop.  A pastry display case holds some goodies – cupcakes, a croissant, and a slice of cheesecake.  The set also comes with a cup and saucer and a travel coffee mug.  Guest to the café can sit at a table with a top made of books on a purple chair decorated with vines.The daily offerings at the bakery are advertised with a “chalkboard” sign that hangs from a giant silver beanstalk.  The beanstalk is topped with a hanging purple lantern.  No coffee shop would be complete without an espresso machine (blue) and a laptop computer (gold).  Also included is a small book topped table with an opening cover.This is a great playset that will be fun for kids and collectors - perfect for play or display.  Like all Ever After High accessories this is full of small fairytale details that are so visually appealing.  Everywhere you look there are vines, leaves, and swirls incorporated into the designs.  This set is made for play but has many small parts that could be lost or broken if it is not treated gently.  The Beanstalk Bakery is for ages 6 and up.

Fans of Ever After High know that Ashlynn Ella (Daughter of Cinderella) is naturally obsessed with shoes.  She fuels her love of footwear by working at the Glass Slipper Shoe Shop.  The new playset is so much fun, and is a perfect accessory for your EAH dolls.The main part of the set is the shoe display.  This display is made of golden branches covered with twining vines and topped with magical woodland carvings that showcase a clock that is about to strike midnight, and a crystal chandelier.  The base of the display has an opening drawer, and on each side of the display is a small shelf with a cloche to display an individual shoe.Of course this playset comes with shoes – five pair of shoes.  The shoes are: a pair of purple heels with silver spikes (obviously for Raven Queen), red heels with gold bows (perfect for Apple White), pink heels with gold wings (just right for Cupid), a pair of purple boots, and a pair of translucent pink heels.  This playset also includes a gold ottoman/footrest that opens for storage and a gold foot sizing tool.The second display is a table made up of several parts – books topped by a pillow, topped by a golden shoe, topped by a table top, topped by a golden branch, topped by pink lovebirds.  Pure Ever After High.  Last, there is a magic mirror in a blue translucent frame where the dolls can see how they look in their new shoes.The Glass Slipper is a great playset for Ever After High that kids and collectors will recognize and love.  The set is made for play but has many, many small parts and pieces that could be lost or broken if it is not treated gently.  This set is for ages 6 and up.

The new Monster High “Haunted” dolls are ghost versions of some favorite monster high characters.  This ghost version of Twyla is my favorite – her color scheme and styling are just perfect.  Twyla still has light purple skin and wispy smoke tendrils on her forearms and lower legs.  Her hair is mostly the same seafoam green color she usually has, but this time she has streaks of light lavender in her hair and it looks amazing.  Twyla has purple eyes and frosty pink lips, and in her ghost version she has a metallic seafoam green mask painted over her eyes.The “Getting Ghostly - Haunted” dolls, including Twyla, come with a doll stand that makes them appear to float.  The stands are made of a translucent blue plastic “chain” and the stand holds the doll beneath the arms instead of around the waist.  This is a bit different than the standard MH doll stand.  The hairbrush she comes with has also been restyled into a ghost theme.Twyla is wearing a sleeveless dress in mint green with a lavender cobweb and spider print.  The neck and waist of the dress have a sheer floaty lavender overlay.  Twyla’s high heeled shoes also have a cobweb theme, and the shoes are a ghostly translucent blue.  Twyla’s accessories include a silver chain belt, a silver headband and blue bracelet .  Like all Monster High dolls, she has multiple points of articulation and can be posed in just about any way you can imagine.  She is made for play, but has small parts that can be lost if not handled with care.I just love this version of Twyla.  She really does make the perfect ghost  - a great fit for the Daughter of the Boogey Man.

The Gloom and Bloom floral theme is perfect for Venus McFlytrap, and this version of her doll really shines.  The Monster High ghouls are throwing a party to celebrate the blooming of the corpse flower - something that only happens once every 1,300 years. So, Venus is ready with her party dress and gardening tools.  This version of Venus comes with a vine covered watering can and a potted venus fly trap plant.Venus is wearing her signature colors of hot pink and green, and the theme of this doll is definitely the venus flytrap.  Venus has a flytrap hair ornament that is fixed to her high ponytail, and she also has flytrap ankle bracelets that look like they are part of her shoes.  The skirt and bodice of her dress are printed with open venus flytrap plants, in shades of pink, green, black and white.  This print is wonderful, and couldn’t be more perfect for this doll.  The dress also has long black sleeves, a black belt, and a twining vine decoration that reaches from her shoulder to her waist.  Venus’s other accessories include green vine bracelets, a black necklace, and black dangle earrings.  A “diary”,  doll stand, and hairbrush are also included with this doll.Like the other versions of her doll, this Venus has pointed leafy ears and lovely mint green colored skin.  Venus has her usual hair colors of hot pink and green.  She has a little bit of a conservative hairstyle with her hair pulled into a ponytail.  She still has part of her pink hair shaved and flocked, but this time her head is shaved on the back of her head and is mostly out of sight.  Venus has bright blue eyes with pink, blue, and green eye makeup.  Her multiple fangs are painted visibly on her hot pink lips.  Venus is a doll made for play, but has small parts that could be lost or broken.  Like all Monster High dolls she has multiple points of articulation and can be posed in just about any way imaginable.

Werecat Catrine DeMew is one of my favorite Monster High ghouls, so I am always excited to see a new version of her.  Gloom and Bloom Catrine has a floral theme, and we see her in her signature color purple.  Catrine is wearing a purple sundress in shades of purple with a lily print.  Her hair and makeup are in darker shades than her previous dolls.  Her lovely lavender hair is in a long loose style, and has dark purple streaks that are almost black.  Her lips are also a very deep shade of purple.  Catrine is wearing a dark blue headband that is decorated with flowers.  Her blue high heeled sandals are decorated in a similar way, and around her ankles are large purple blooms that look like they are part of her shoes.Because this line of dolls has a garden theme, Catrine comes with a gardening claw and a green flower pot that holds a purple topiary shrub.  The shrub is blooming with little pink skull shaped flowers.  Catrine comes with a six page “diary” that is full of artwork and pictures of her.  It also mentions that a corpse flower is about to bloom.  This only happens every 1,300 years, so the ghouls are dressing up and throwing a party to celebrate the blooming of the flower.  This doll comes with a doll stand and hairbrush.

The Monster High "Inner Monster" Spooky Sweet / Frightfully Fierce doll is so much fun with many innovative, playful features.  This doll has the same basic body type as many other monster high dolls, and is the same size.  She is a blue skinned girl, with an exposed purple brain.  Her brain is a toggle switch that will allow you to cycle through her eye colors/changes when the brain is pressed.  (She has pink heart shaped irises, green and purple flower shaped irises, and round dark blue irises.)  This feature is so much fun and really changes the look of the doll.  The eyes are well set into her head, change smoothly and do not look like they are obviously inset.The next fun feature of this doll is her changeable emotion filled torso.  The doll comes with eight different emotion charms and a transparent blue plastic torso that comes apart to hold the charms.  Those new to MH dolls might be alarmed by how easily the dolls come apart.  They are made to have removable arms, legs, hands, etc.  This helps with clothing changes, and modifications (there are many Create-A-Monster "CAM" sets with parts, heads, and clothing that can be swapped between dolls).  To change out the charms you need to remove the dolls arms at the shoulder and legs at the hips, and then gently pry the torso apart.  (My torso was quite difficult to open the first time, so parents might want to be present to help little hands the first time.)  When the torso is off the doll has a bright yellow spine, ribcage and pelvis with four round openings for the pegs on the back of the charms to fit into snuggly.This doll also comes with an extra face plate that snaps onto her head and can be used to change her look.  I thought the face plate might look bulky or obvious, but this is not the case.  The face plate fits closely and when she has her wig on you have to look very closely to even tell it is there.  There are two small depressions on the side of the dolls head near her temples, and the face plate has two small tabs that lock it into place on the head.This doll comes with quite a few accessories.  She has a bright blue wig that is a little different than the monster high CAM wigs.  This wig has tabs at the base of her skull that hold the wig in place, instead of on the top of the head like the CAM sets.  She has a dress made up of a halter top and peplum skirt.  She has two large accessories to change her look.  The first is a set of large pink bat wings that fasten over her shoulders and around her waist.  The next is a peacock tail with a matching peacock headband - the tail fastens around her waist.  She also comes with a hairbrush, handbag, saddle type doll stand, and two pairs of shoes.I was really pleased with all of the features on this doll.  I am an adult collector and I would have loved to have this doll as a child.  It is so easy for kids to change and customize the look of this doll, and I think they will appreciate the ability to do this.  I think kids will also love the "Inner Monster" concept that allows them to change the "Monster" from the inside with the emotion charms.I would highly recommend the accessory "Mood Packs" that are available for each "Inner Monster" doll.  Although all the Inner Monster parts are interchangeable, there is a pack for each doll that matches its skin color - so in this case a blue doll has an accessory pack with another blue face plate that perfectly matches the doll.  (The accessory packs come with a hard plastic wig, face plate, emotion charms, an additional outfit, shoes and other accessories).  The Mood Pack for this doll is the Monster High Inner Monster Spooky Sweet Mood Pack.

Lizzie Hearts is an Ever After High Royal, the Future Queen of Hearts and of Wonderland.  Lizzie feels a little misunderstood – she doesn’t know why everyone thinks she is a villain, and her friends Kitty and Madeline are “literally” the only people at Ever After High that understand her.  (I suspect like Madeline she speaks in a form of the Wonderland language “riddlish”.)Lizzie’s colors are black, gold and red.  Lizzie has long black hair with large streaks of red, and her hair has been styled into a high split beehive.  (Please note:  Lizzie’s hair is not styled as high and defined as in her promotional photos, but is still well groomed and lovely).  Lizzie is wearing dark red lipstick and she has bright blue eyes that have a heart shaped highlight on her pupils.  One of her most striking features is the large red heart shaped birthmark that surrounds her left eye.Lizzie is wearing a modernized Elizabethan collar – hers is red and the ruffles are edged with hearts.  (The collar is made of plastic.)  She wears a sleeveless peplum dress the top of which is black with a red and gold filigree heart pattern.  Like her hair, the heart on the bodice of her dress is split.  The layered sides of her dress feature a gold and red harlequin pattern that is covered in gold micro glitter.  Lizzie wears fantastic black tights that are patterned with red hearts bordered with gold.  Lizzie also wears black gloves with lacey heart trim.  Her gloves/hands are made of black molded plastic and cannot be removed.  She also wears red high heeled shoes that have gold playing card details on the front of the shoe.Lizzie’s most obvious and royal accessory is her gold crown with red heart details.  (Her crown is fastened on in several places with ties and bands).  Her other accessories include gold heart dangle earrings, a large gold ring with all of the playing card suits, and a heart shaped handbag.  Like all core EAH dolls Lizzie comes with a doll stand, key shaped hairbrush and a “bookmark” with more details about her and her story.Lizzie is a fun doll with all the right details.  She has huge crossover appeal for collectors of EAH, Wonderland and storybook dolls.  I was very excited about the release of Lizzie and she is a perfect addition to Ever After High.  Like all EAH dolls she is made for play, but has many small parts that can be lost or damaged if not handled with care.  She also has multiple points of articulation so she can be posed in just about any way imaginable.

Twyla the Daughter of the Boogey Man is ready for the new Scaremester at Monster High.  Twyla is a small ghoul with light purple skin and wispy silver smoke that travels up her arms and curls up her legs.  Twyla has pink lips and pink and purple eyes (this version of Twyla does not have the glowing eyes of her original release).  Twyla’s hair is styled with bangs and long locks of seafoam green and bright blue hair.  She is wearing the cutest minidress – it is purple and black and is covered with a pattern of seafoam green and metallic blue bedbugs.For her accessories Twyla has dangling cobweb earrings, multiple bracelets, a black and seafoam colored handbag with bug details, and high heeled seafoam and black mary jane shoes.  Her school supplies include a purple folio that is also covered with creepy crawlers.  Instead of a diary, Twyla has a day planner that outlines her schedule of activities and also shows a school map of monster high.  Twyla comes with a doll stand and hairbrush.This doll is a great version of one of my favorite Monster High characters.

Prince Dexter Charming is an EAH Royal that seems to have a thing for the Rebel girls.  He has had a huge crush on Raven Queen forever after, but lately Cupid seems to be gaining some of the attention she has been dreaming of.  Dexter Charming lives up to his name.  Here we have the handsome prince that spends most of his time hiding behind his glasses (they help to block his “enchanting eyes”.)  His eyes are vivid blue and he has brunette hair and thick eyebrows.Dexter comes with the aforementioned glasses that have thick black frames (with no lenses).  He is wearing a gold crown (the crown is attached to his head with small removable tags).  Dexter also wears a blue checked blazer with gold trim and hems, a blue and white striped scarf, gray jeans, an emblem print t-shirt and gray high topped sneakers.  He is wearing a gold medal on his lapel and has a gold wallet chain hidden beneath his blazer.  Dexter carries a black backpack/bookbag that has molding that features badges and buckles.Dexter comes with a doll stand and bookmark that has details of his royal story.  Like all EAH dolls Dexter has multiple points of articulation for posing any play.  It is so nice to have another EAH boy character doll available – and Dexter is perfect.  (A note to parents – Dexter has quite a few extra plastic tabs that you might want to remove before playtime – check his crown and his scarf).

Invisi Billy is the Son of the Invisible Man.  Billy is one of the good guys (he only uses his invisibility super power for good), he is a Student Ambassador at Monster high, he makes friends easily, and he is crazy about his girlfriend Scarah Screams.Billy is one of the most handsome of the MH boys.  He has the palest blue skin and his doll features him in mid-change – from his calves to his feet he is a translucent ice blue color that shows him in transformation.  Billy has gray eyes and black and midnight blue shoulder grazing hair that is streaked with chunks of royal blue.  Billy wears a lot of silver jewelry – he has silver stud earrings, a silver chain necklace and bracelet, and a silver watch.  His other accessories include a white studded belt, a gray portfolio and a translucent gray messenger bag that he wears across his body.Billy is wearing a slouchy cerulean blue hat (that is temporarily sewn on) and long blue shorts that have a white and blue pixelated pattern.  He also wears his signature hoodie that is striped with different shades of blue and gray.  On his feet are black and white loafers that have asymmetrical coloring.Invisi Billy is a great doll and a great MH character.  This doll has multiple points of articulation and can be posed in just about any way imaginable.  Billy is made for play, but like all MH dolls he has small parts and accessories that can be fragile if not treated with care.  Billy comes with a detailed diary, a doll stand and a hairbrush.

Cedar Wood, the daughter of Pinocchio, is ready to attend Madeline Hatter’s Hat-tastic Tea Party.  The fairytale heroines of Ever After High are hoping this party will put the “wonder” back in Wonderland Grove.Just like Cedar’s initial basic doll, in this version her entire body is covered in a carved wood grain pattern.  The grain also extends onto her jawline and forehead but is much more delicate on her face.  A very nice detail that is included on Cedar is that her joints are made to look like they are held together with round wooden pegs.  Cedar has brown eyes, purple eye makeup and lips that are painted pink in the center (in a similar manner to EAH Cupid).  Cedar has wavy light brown hair with large streaks of lavender throughout.  The lavender in her hair is more prominent than on her basic doll.Because she is going to a “Hat-tastic” party Cedar is wearing a coral alpine hat that is decorated with a purple feather.  Cedar has several other accessories to go with the tea party theme.  She has a “wooden” teapot and two teacups with saucers.  The teapot has coral decorations and the wood teacups have coral colored saucers.  Cedar is carrying a black forest themed carved wooden handbag that has a lavender braided handle.  The earrings she wears are small golden buttons topped with a bow.Cedar is wearing a lovely little cocktail dress.  The top of her dress has short puffed black net sleeves and the peplum bodice is a coral faux bois pattern.  (One odd feature of this dress is a high black plastic collar, it looks perfect, but the plastic was a surprise.)  The skirt of her dress is made up of a purple floral print that is trimmed with a print of teacups and framed crickets.  Cedar is wearing lavender mary jane shoes with golden scrolling heels.  She also wears thin white mid-calf stockings that are trimmed in coral.  Finally, Cedar has permanent black decorated gloves (her hands are cast in black), with white lacey “teacup” cuffs.Like all EAH dolls she has multiple points of articulation for posing and play.  She is made for play, but has many small parts that need to be looked after so they are not lost.  Her hands are made so they can be removed for a change of outfit.  She comes with a hairbrush and doll stand.  This version of Cedar is sweet and adorable.  The tea party theme is perfect for the girls of Ever After High.

Neighthan Rot is one of the new students at Monster High.  Neighthan is one of the new hybrid monster students – Neighthan’s father is a zombie and his mother is a unicorn – and as far as he knows, he is the only “zombicorn” in the world.  Neighthan likes to wear bright colors to camouflage his spills – he is a clumsy fellow.  Neighthan has a big heart, he loves studying Monster Psychology, his favorite foods are fried pickles and brain-puffs, and he has a huge crush on Frankie Stein.I was secretly hoping Neighthan would have some kind of cloven hooves hidden under his yellow shoes, but he did not.  He has regular monster boy feet, so he can swap footwear with the other MH boys.  Neighthan’s most striking features are his long mane and (rooted) tail and his translucent blue unicorn horn.  The horn is slightly flexible and his black mane and tail are streaked with bold chunks of blue, yellow and red.  Neighthan has horse ears, blue eyes, and gray zombie skin.  Neighthan seems to be missing skin in some areas and his musculature is showing.  The musculature shows prominently on the left side of his face, his left arm and hand, and his right leg.  Neighthan also has muscles that show on his torso and his torso is asymmetrical with different muscles showing on each side.Neighthan is wearing a shirt made up of primary colors that is printed with a ribcage and some internal organs.  One leg of his pants is black and the other has an abstract muscle print that is also in primary colors and matches his shirt.  Neighthan’s accessories are a ball cap and tennis shoes, both of which are bright yellow, but have tiny blue dots of color incorporated that can be seen under close inspection.  His cap has cut outs to accommodate his ears and his horn and the top of the hat is decorated with five spiral mini unicorn horns.  Neighthan also comes with a detailed diary, a hairbrush and a doll stand.Like all MH dolls, Neighthan has multiple points of articulation for posing and play.  His hands can be removed for clothing changes, but that is not necessary with this doll – his clothes do not fit tightly and have Velcro closures.  I am a huge Monster High fan, and a unicorn girl – so I was jumping for joy when I learned about Neighthan Rot.  This unicorn/zombie is my favorite of the Monster High boy dolls – he is the perfect doll for me – and I hope others feel the same way so this is not the only Neighthan doll that will be produced.  I hope all Monster High collectors, and zombicorn fans have the chance to add him to their collection!

Werecat Toralei Stripe is the Left Wingback for the MH Soccer Team the Monster High Nightmares.  Her signature move is a tail flip (it is not illegal to touch the ball with her tail) that is “almost impossible to block”.  Toralei is at practice 5 days a week and she is up to speed on all the rules of “monster soccer”.  The Physical Deaducation booklet that comes with this doll details her career highlights, memories, practice schedule, rules, and her signature move.Toralei has her hair styled with bangs and a high ponytail.  There is an orange and black streak in her auburn hair, and this streak is twisted together and incorporated into the ponytail.  Toralei has bright green cat eyes with black cat-eye eyeliner to accent them.  She also wears some bold purple and aqua eye makeup and fluorescent red lipstick.  Toralei is ready for practice and has all the gear she needs.  Her best accessories are her shin guards – they are black studded cats that hug her legs.  She has an aqua colored soccer ball, a fluorescent red plastic net ball bag, and a cold blue drink.Toralei is wearing an aqua blue and white striped tank top that is covered with a black net half shirt with the number “9” on it.  She wears black shorts that have a pink and black checkerboard waist.  The short shorts help show off Toralei’s leg stripes.  She has one black (painted on) glove and tiny pink stud earrings in her pointed cat ears.  We will have to trust her that her footwear is appropriate for sports – her shoes are studded fluorescent red and look like high heels – minus the heel.Toralei can be one of the harder to find Monster High ghouls – she is something of a villain, but everyone loves her.  She has a removable cat tail, and multiple points of articulation for posing and play.  Along with her notebook, she comes with a hairbrush and doll stand.  Like all MH dolls she is made for play but has small parts that can be fragile so she should be handled with some care.  This Toralei doll is part of the new line of “Ghoul Sports” Monster High dolls.

Lagoonafire is the result of the fusion of Lagoona Blue (Daughter of a Sea Monster) and Jinafire Long (Daughter of a Chinese Dragon).  Lagoona and Jinafire are both well-loved Monster High characters, so Lagoonafire is an outstanding fusion with several elements of each ghoul’s traits shining through.  This doll has Jinafire’s dragon scaling on her body, her long dragon tail, well defined eyebrows, slit pupils and love of fashion.  She has Lagoona’s arm and leg fins, freckles, webbed hands, finned ears, and sweet expressive face.  Lagoonafire’s skin is the palest shade of blue gray and is covered with a gold luster that shines in certain lighting.  Lagoonafire’s fins and the flared part of her tail are all a shade of metallic gold.  She has yellow and green eyes, coral and gold eye makeup, and her lips are painted a bright shade of coral.  Lagoonafire’s hair is bright easter egg yellow and chartreuse with some unique styling.Lagoonafire has some amazing accessories.  My favorite is her large fluorescent pink jellyfish handbag – definitely one of the coolest handbags I have ever seen a MH character tote around.  Her next prominent accessory is her elaborate coral colored headdress.  The headdress covers most of the top of her head and encompasses a large piece of her hair that has been styled into a large (chartreuse) victory roll.  I can’t decide what this headdress is all about.  I’m not sure if it is some kind of kraken or mermaid gear – it has tentacle like appendages and what looks like pearl netting – this thing is just crazy.  Lagoonafire is wearing a bright coral colored top with a high collar and some black net detail on the sleeves.  Her mini skirt is black with a red and turquoise floating jellyfish print and green net detail.  She has hot pink heels to match her handbag and a large golden Jinafire inspired belt that covers her entire midriff.  There is something bold and bright to look at on every part of this unique doll.According to her bio – Lagoonafire is attempting to bring together her fire and water elements and this is presenting something of a challenge – but you would never know it by looking at her.  This doll comes with a diary detailing the ghoul’s adventures while fused together.  She also comes with a bright yellow doll stand and hairbrush.

Ever After Royal Blondie Lockes is a nominee for this years “Thronecoming Queen”.  The theme for Thronecoming is the “Enchanted Forest Masquerade” and all of the court have an animal themed mask and gown.  How could Blondie dream of anything but bears for her inspiration?Blondie’s mask is a golden bear, but there are many other bear details incorporated into her elaborate formal dress.  The top of her dress has “fur” shoulder straps and the blue satin overlay skirt of her dress is printed with golden metallic designs of bears with bows and heart-shaped flourishes.  The underskirt of her dress is two layers of buttercup yellow fabric and is printed with metallic gold dots and bows.  The dress is very princess/prom queen – perfect for Thronecoming – young doll collectors will go crazy for this dreamy design.  Blondie’s other accessories include blue dangle earrings, a blue and gold handbag, open toed heels, and a golden bracelet/corsage.  To match her dress, Blondie is wearing blue elbow length formal gloves.  (These gloves are not removable, her hands and lower arms are molded in blue.)  The gloves are topped with a lacey golden cuff.Blondie’s buttercup and lemon yellow hair has been streaked with golden metallic strands.  Her hair is styled with bangs and into two Princess Leia buns that cascade down to her shoulders.  Blondie has decorated her face with some blue diamonds and twinkles (all the Thronecoming girls have different face decorations).  She has bright blue eyes, bright pink lips, and light pink eye makeup that is highlighted with gold glitter.  With all of her glitz, glitter and bows Blondie makes a perfect fairytale princess.Blondie comes with a doll stand and a bookmark / storybook.  Like all EAH dolls she is made for play but has many small parts that may be lost or broken if she is not treated gently.  She has multiple point of articulation for endless posing and play.  Blondie is made for play but is so lovely I can’t image her anywhere but on display with other collectable dolls.

I have some experience crafting felted dogs and I own several books and a felt dog making mold.  I am always on the lookout for a book with some new techniques and patterns.  I love this new book - Felt Dogs by Mitsuki Hoshi – it has great advice, instruction and inspiration and the dogs are very cute with their own unique look.The books starts out with adorable photos of the completed dogs that the book covers – the miniature dachshund, welsh corgi, miniature schnauzer, pug, chihuahua, labrador retriever, shiba, maltese, beagle, toy poodle (favorite!), boston terrier and miniature pinscher.  The books next covers the materials, supplies and tools that are needed to complete the projects.  Almost all of the supplies are common and available at most craft supply stores.  Next are the general instructions and techniques that are shown step-by-step with photographs detailing construction of a basic dog (the corgi).  The instructions are clear and easy to follow.  The last part of the book has a detailed page for each dog breed including specific material lists, ear patterns and notes that cover posing, attachments and detailing.This book has included some techniques that are new to me, and also some I don’t think I have seen in any other felting books.  Some of these are mouth embroidery, prepping clear eyes, nose attachments and using a loop yarn (instead of roving) for curly coated dogs like the poodle.  This little book is short and sweet and will make a great addition to the crafting library of those interested in felting, dogs and cuteness.  This book is probably best for those with a little previous experience creating needle felt projects.  But, everyone has to start somewhere – and why not start off with a cute little dog?

Where is the true Vampire Queen?  What secret is Robecca Steam hiding? Will Draculaura gain her vampire powers?  Who is Veronica Von Vamp?  All these questions will be answered in the new Monster High movie Frights, Camera, Action! – a movie filled with new friends, exciting mysteries and surprise destinations.The vampires have been without a queen for 400 years and Draculaura is surprised to learn that she has been chosen by an ancient jewel, The Vampire’s Heart, to be the next Vampire Queen.  Draculaura, Robecca Steam, Cleo De Nile, Clawdeen Wolf (and stowaway Hoodude) head to the castle of the vampire court in Transylvania in the company of the evil Lord Stoker to attend Draculaura’s coronation.  Once the ghouls reach their destination, Draculaura uncovers Lord Stoker’s plot to use her as a puppet queen so he can continue his villainous rule in the absence of the true queen.  Determined to stop Lord Stoker and find the rightful queen, the Monster High gang search the castle until they find a mysterious letter that holds the first clue in their adventure.From Transylvania the gang travel to Londoom and meet up with Clawdeen’s older sister Clawdia Wolf, who is there to study dramatic writing.  Clawdia soon joins the search and helps to find the next clue that will take them to New Gorleans.  While searching the ghost ship “The Bijou on the Bayou” in New Gorleans the gang meets Honey Swamp – who is onboard working on a student film.  Their next stop is Hauntlywood, and the gang continues their quest while being pursued by Lord Stoker’s minion Igor.  Hauntlywood is their final destination, and here the gang meets the makeup artist Viperine Gorgon who introduces them to the famous actress Veronica Von Vamp.  Veronica is the key to the mystery and has the final clues to help the Monster High ghouls solve the puzzle.While Draculaura and the others are on their journeys, back at Monster High there is a raging debate over which male lead of the Vampire Majesty movies is cuter.  Is it Edweird of Alucord?  The matter can only be decided in Cute Court with Twyla as the judge presiding over the matter.Like all Monster High stories, this movie is full of positive messages for the viewers.  There are themes of courage, selflessness, open mindedness and friendship throughout the story.  I believe this movie is appropriate for all ages.  Kids will love this movie; it is full of their favorite Monster High characters, including some of the minor players.  This is a movie made for kids, but will also be enjoyed by adult cartoon watchers.  (A couple of highlights are a few funny references to jazz hands and the movie director in Hauntlywood is named “Scarentino” who is looking to “dig up an old star and resurrect their career”.)  This movie runs 1 Hr. 14 Mins. and also includes three animated shorts – Crime Scream Investigation, Games Ghouls Play, and Monster Morphoseas.

Takkiti is an adorable little ice unicorn creature.  I love to collect animal replica figures – especially the unique approach Schleich has towards unconventional unicorns.  Takkiti is pleasant departure from the traditional type of unicorn with a short face, painted deer like nose, thick winter coat and frosty blue accents.  This figure is on the small side - foal sized.  Like all Schleich figures it is well made and sturdy for play and collecting.  The photo is a good representation of the actual figure.

I love Schleich animal figures – especially the imaginative fantasy figures like this little fairy fox.  The photo is a very good representation of this small figure.  Misamee is a long eared magical creature with crystal stones on her head.  This is a unique and beautiful little creature and will make a great addition to any animal replica collection.  My only complaint is that it was not packaged well and when I received it the paint had been scraped off the nose and paws.

I like kitchen tools and recently became interested in making doughnuts at home.  I thought I would give this affordable doughnut maker a try.The construction of this dispenser is very lightweight – aluminum and plastic.  It seems like it will work for very occasional use, but I don’t think it could stand up to frequent use.  Overall, I think this tool is more trouble than it is worth.  The hopper that holds the batter is quite small and if you use it for pancakes you will have to constantly refill it.  This doesn’t seem worth the trouble considering the cleanup.  It did produce doughnut like shapes, but they were not uniform.  I tried the recipe for old fashioned doughnuts that came with the dispenser and it was completely off.  Even with tweaking the recipe so it could pass through the dispenser, the results were not doughnut like at all.  I would recommend skipping the included recipes all together.I am afraid this little gadget is destined to either sit on the pantry shelf or wind up in a garage sale.

If you have reasonable expectations, I think you will be happy with this product.  It works very well on small pores, and really does make them appear to vanish.  It does not take much product for coverage and it feels very nice on the skin.  It will not cover large deep pores or blackheads.  Baby Skin is a nice alternative for those of us that cannot afford the more expensive department store products.  (My skin is very, very pale, and “normal” – so my review is for similar skin types.)

I collect animal figure replicas. I bought this because I love dinosaurs, but also because I have recently read the excellent "The Untold Story of Champ" by Bartholomew and one of the monster hunters in the book is convinced that Champ is a surviving Tanystropheus.This is a fun little model with a wire reinforced neck that allows you to change his neck shape and repose him. I have the feeling that he is a tad fragile and his neck should not be moved repeatedly. I think frequent movement will eventually break down his neck and he will lose posing ability.  Overall very cool for collectors but might not stand up to play when it comes to kid collectors.

0:10 MinsGhoul's Alive Deuce Gorgon. The lever on his back moves the snakes on his head, his arm raises his glasses, his eyes glow and flash and he makes a mysterious noise. This video shows his action twice.

I have a fairly large collection of plastic animal replicas, and this weedy sea dragon is my favorite.  Looking at it reminds me of when I saw a weedy at an aquarium and I will never forget it – the most beautiful aquatic creature imaginable.People that have seen the toy at my home have no idea what it is, which is not that surprising.  As I understand it, the Weedy Sea Dragon is endemic to Australia and is a near threatened species.  This makes me think that this replica would be a great teaching tool for kids that are interested in sea creatures.  As far as play goes – this seems to be a quite sturdy and well-made toy – as are most of these kind of plastic replica toys (Safari Ltd., Schleich, Papo).  This toy is a decent size – several inches long – I found that to be a surprising bonus.  I love my weedy sea dragon and I am sure others that collect and play with replica toy animals would be happy to add this to their collection.

Operetta is all about retro glam.  This time she has traded in her rockabilly style for elegant art deco.  I know many collectors were excited for the release of this version of Operetta, and she is gorgeous in her art deco inspired ensemble.  Her dress is very unique - a metallic red halter bodice trimmed in lace, a wide black belt with printed piano keys and a black and white skirt of stylized art deco inspired piano keys over a red net petticoat printed with musical staves.  Operetta has light gray eyes with silver and taupe eye makeup and bright cherry red lips.  Operetta's hair is two tone - red and black.  She has black bettie bangs and a high black side pony tail.  The rest of her bright red hair is left long and loose.  She is wearing a fascinator that is a white dice/heart and is trimmed in black net lace.Operetta's other accessories include black cobweb peep-toe heels, piano key chandelier earrings, piano key bracelet, backstage pass necklace and a piano key fan shaped handbag.  Her forearms are covered with non-removable painted on opera gloves - one black and one white.  She also comes with a camera for taking pictures at the movie premiere she is attending.  This doll comes with a doll stand, hair brush and diary (detailing her romance with Holt Hyde).  This doll is a Walmart exclusive (I purchased for $19.99) so if you are not buying her there you are purchasing on the secondary market.
Completely broke the second time I used it.

Very beautiful flag, with vibrant colors.  I have been using decorative house flags for many years, and Toland's are some of the nicest I've ever seen.  Very pretty artwork, and nice quality flags.  I'm sure as some reviewers have said, they will fade over time.  But that is the case with any flag.  Trust me, I've used many different kinds of flags over the past 15-20 years, and when left out in the elements, they ALL fade from sun, wind, and moisture exposure.  Many of the ones that are sewn together will rip at the seams if left out on a windy day.  I like Toland's because there are no sewn seams to worry about; the art is printed on one solid piece of cloth.The only way to ensure that they last longer is to bring them in when it rains or snows.  That just got too much of a hassle, so now I just toss them when they get really worn out.My only real gripe is that the tabs that connect to the flagpole are not really long enough to attach to both ends.  I solve this problem by sewing a little loop of ribbon on one end, inside the pole sleeve, that extends a bit further out than the one provided.  Works for me.
It was okay while it lasted.  It dried up pretty quickly.

The chunks in this are way too big.  I've been using Soil Moist for years, and the smaller containers have finer chunks that work much better.  I tried to save money by buying a whole pail of it, and that wasn't a great decision.  When they get wet, these chunks billow out into very big gelatin hunks in your garden.  What I have left over for next spring, I am going to have to find a way to grind it up a bit more before using it.  Maybe a run through my food processor would do the trick.  It's really a shame; a section of my newly planted garden got ruined because this stuff was just ground too big.  It's too bad, because I'm actually a huge fan of Soil Moist, in general.  It has helped my garden survive many a drought.

I agree with others. These were the best kitchen scrubber in the history of scrubbers. Thankfully, I bought two boxes of them before they got discontinued. I still use them and treasure them like gold. If I ever fall on hard times, I'll come here and sell them for $250 apiece. :)PLEASE bring this great product back!!!

Don't even bother ordering this if you're looking for "Fragrance Free."Dove has discontinued the FF one.  I called them and was informed.I guess the only recourse is to complain to them, as if it will do any good.I tried ordering FF from Amazon twice, thinking maybe I'd get an old stockpile of it.But no... they send you the "Sensitive" one instead, which clearly has fragrance.I've tried twice and received Sensitive.  So long, my favorite brand.Guess I'm in search of a new FF one.  Any suggestions?

These came in sealed foil pouches, three to a pouch, and on the outside was a sticker that said it was fragrance free.Open a pouch, it was Dove for sensitive skin inside - which is NOT fragrance free!  Open two more, and the same thing (I ordered 5 three-packs). So sent them all back.I called Dove and learned that the fragrance free has been discontinued, and they suggested Sensitive in lieu. No thanks. I want fragrance free. My husband & I both use only fragrance free products.What a shame!!!  I've used this product for many years and I dread having to test drive others.

I needed to take a good probiotic due to long-term treatment with antibiotics.  I really had no experience with them, but in reviewing the ingredients of several kinds carried by CVS, I bought a bottle of this because it didn't contain some of the objectionable "inert" ingredients in the others.  Later, I couldn't find it locally anymore, so I've been buying it here.The makers recommend mixing it with your favorite juice, but quite honestly... I just do a shot of it straight. It's really not that bad. I chase it with a bit of water, and I'm done. I like that it's in liquid form.  I feel like it probably goes to work a lot faster in your gut than the pill form probiotics.It keeps my colon healthy and that's pretty much all I care about.I do recommend it!  I've had my holistic Doctor look at it, and he said that the good bacteria it contains is all very good stuff!  Although he did wish that it was disclosed how many of each was in a single dose. It says "billions" on the bottle, but doesn't really say how much of it you have to consume to get billions.  Confusing labeling aside, I love it and it works for me so I'll keep using it!
The verdict's still out on these.
I like this book a lot, because I'm clueless when it comes to identifying weeds. I found it helpful.

Although the color is not as pictured (as stated by other reviewers), I was quite pleased when I opened my order. Both the blue and the green ones that I ordered arrived in perfect condition and the colors are beautiful. They are very bright though, not muted as shown. Definitely not the turquoise of 100 years ago, but still pretty.I cannot attest to their use for canning, as I don't intend to use them that way. I'll be storing seeds from my fall harvest in some of them, and some dry goods in my pantry with others. I don't think rust will be an issue in my dry pantry. I'll be storing the seeds with desiccants on a shelf in my cellar. It can get damp down there if we have a lot of rain or snow, but if the rust develops I won't really care because I'm not storing food in them. I can buy more caps next year, or use the jars for something else.All in all, I'm pleased with this purchase.

I expected it to be bigger, but I'm not disappointed. It's my fault because I didn't pay attention to the dimensions when ordering.Although it's small, it is a perfect little cutter. It will be great for making homemade doggie treats. As a previous reviewer suggested, the treats will be perfectly sized for small dogs or perhaps as a training treat for larger breed puppies. If you are looking to make treats for larger adult dogs, you may want a bigger cutter.But I'm very happy with it, as my plan is to make treats of various sizes.

I bought many bags of this in spring '14. Repotted all my 20+ year old indoor plants with it, all my outdoor potted plants got planted with it, and I used a lot of it in my garden too.Instant infestation of fungus gnats everywhere!  I didn't know where these critters were coming from or how they were getting into my house. It took me months to figure it out!And those suckers BITE!  I had an allergic reaction to them and wound up with scarring from them, all over me!One day I lifted an opened bag and moved it with a wheelbarrow. The next day, my arms and belly had bites all over them. I tried to think of what I did different and BINGO - I had picked up a big bag of this!  That made me put 2+2 together and wonder if the MG potting soil could have anything to do with my infestation of gnats.I googled "MG potting soil and gnats" and discovered that the web is FULL of complaints about this!  I decided that I had to discard my plants. I had some very old, very large plants that were too numerous to repot. I was going through other stuff in my life and wasn't able to take on that huge project at the time. So I had to haul them all to the dump.I called the company to discuss it.  I was told by a representative that they had had "many complaints" about fungus gnat eggs in their potting soil. I told her about what I'd been going through and she offered to refund the money I'd spent on the soil and to put in a claim for the plants I'd lost. I told her the money didn't matter to me. How do you put in a claim for a gigantic 20 year old jade tree?  I told her that my body is covered in scars from these things biting me, and that they carry bacteria that can be transmitted to humans.  I told her that I am calling to INFORM them that my life has been a living hell thanks to these creatures and the agony for months of trying to figure out where they were coming from. I told her that what I hoped would come out of my phone call is that the company would FIX the problem and start sterilizing their soil to kill the eggs, so that no one has to go through what I've been going through all summer. She said she'd pass the suggestion along.I'm writing this review for the same reason. So that YOU don't have to live the summer of hell that I just lived.And forget about those yellow sticky traps. I had them in several places and only caught one fungus gnat all summer. However, like fruit flies you can trap them if you put out a little bowl of Apple cider vinegar with a drop or two of liquid Dawn mixed in. Sometimes I'd catch four or five of them overnight. (And yes I did give them to a pest control professional and had them identified.)Save yourself heartache and go to a nursery and get a good quality potting soil there. Check it for eggs and if you see any, return it. That's what I'll be doing from now on.Oh and BTW. I told the MG rep that I'd been buying their potting soil for all of my adult gardening life, and never had this problem.  I told her I've bought my last bag!  NEVER AGAIN!

I bought two dozen of these these last year at my local grocery store, for two bucks each. Within a month, half of them were dead. I didn't even bother putting them out this past summer.This is one case where you get what you pay for. The lights I spent eight bucks apiece on lasted several years.So, I'm going for a better product next summer.

I like to have dehydrated veggies on hand, to throw into an impromptu soup (when I don't have any fresh veggies on hand and I don't feel like going out to the store). They are also a great way to add veggies to your diet - throw a handful into rice or quinoa while it's cooking, or reconstitute some and add to a meatloaf you are making, etc.Ideally I'd love to buy the pre-made soup starter, but since I'm allergic to peppers I have to buy carrots, onions, celery, and tomatoes separately and make my own blend.  I ordered all four, and two of them came to me with the safety seals broken - one of them was completely ripped off and stuck up into the cap, and the other had a tear and hole in it. After 45 mins in the phone with A--z--n  trying to get a replacement or refund, and getting nowhere, I contacted the manufacturer directly. They were nice enough to ship replacements to me in time for the easy post-Thanksgiving turkey soup that I've got planned for this weekend.The other two arrived fine, safety seal intact.I've already used them a few times, and I've concluded that Mother Earth makes a nice product that they stand behind. I put carrots, tomatoes, and celery in yesterday's plain rice and it made a nice confetti rice side dish. I also threw some dried tomatoes in a chicken lentil soup I made last week - also yummy. Earlier this week, I made some homemade doggie treats that called for carrots. Since I didn't have any fresh carrots, I reconstituted some dried ones in hot water, and added them to the recipe. The treats came out great, and after gifting them to a relative for her dog, I got a text saying that her pooch went crazy for the treats! So two thumbs (and paws) up!!

Good quality, and they met my needs perfectly. No complaints, I'm very pleased and will buy these again.
Yes, they are tiny, but I knew that going in. They are exactly what I needed for a craft project. Very nice and good value.  Great quality.
