This may have something to do with the particular Android ROM configurations loaded on the tablet.PerformanceThe processor is incredibly slow and requires considerable time to open apps that open almost instantly on any other tablet from the US market. Kindle requires 10 to 15 seconds to open. Netflix requires up to a minute to open then another minute to load the movie thumbnails. The tablet itself takes up to 2 minutes to boot and become responsive. Despite the specs for this tablet, the performance is abysmal and truly seems like it's being run by a very outmoded, underpowered CPU rather than a 1.6GHz Cortex A9 dual-core Rockchip CPU. Android System Info confirms that it is a Rockchip CPU.The WiFi seems to get a strong signal, but is abysmally slow. Some apps that are less than 1MB still require 2 minutes to complete downloading from Play Store. A 166MB game has taken 10 minutes and is still only 75% done.RAM is a real problem on this tablet. The OS requires some 400-500mb just to boot and run at idle. Simple tasks such as Settings take 2 to 3 times the memory footprint of the exact same programs running on a certified version of Android. Although the specification states that it has 1GB DDR3 RAM, it in fact only has 804MB available, which means that there is a problem either with the ROM or with the hardware itself. The tablet therefore runs out of memory frequently and kills cached processes because every app (and I do mean, every app) opened ends up with the system running out of memory. Frequently, after a few apps (Settings, Browser, Play Store) have been opened and the system has started killing cached processes, new apps or switch-to apps end up freezing or crashing. Settings and "All Apps" screens crash often after a few minutes of normal use. When any background task is underway (such as a file downloading or a web page rendering) the notification window is unresponsive; you cannot swipe to remove notifications, nor switch to another task, until the background task has completed, freeing up system resources. Occasionally the entire system locks up and the only way to correct it is a hard shutdown (hold power button for 10 seconds) as all soft keys and the physical "escape" key are unresponsive. I have tried three different memory management applications, including the TaskMan app that is pre-loaded and running on the device by default, and none appear to make any difference in the device constantly running out of memory, causing app crashes, slow open/re-open of all apps, or with the entire system hanging. In HD mode, these issues only seem to be worse, as the high-resolution icons add even more RAM consumption to the idle footprint, and creating an even bigger mess as the system trips over itself to kill cached and even active background processes to make space for running apps.I know this is from a bad ROM or bad hardware (not sure which) because even on my old Acer Iconia A500, which has a 1GHz single-core CPU and 512MB of RAM, Android 4.0 opens in about 30 seconds, runs with an idle footprint of about 200MB, and can open any number of apps including browsers, movies, and 3D games, and run them VERY smoothly and stable. In theory, the N90 is a vastly more powerful device but it chokes itself even on basic tasks like checking email, installing apps, or browsing the web.The AnTuTu score was deceptively good, at 9395, but the 3d renderings were choppy. This is irrelevant if you cannot access desired games (such as Captain America, HEAT 7, Dark Knight Rises, etc) anyway. I managed to load GTA III, but the app requires over a minute to start; upon "Click to Continue", the app crashes after attempting to validate the license. The respectable AnTuTu score also does not reflect in the performance of starting the tablet, opening apps, or playing video.ConclusionOverall, this device is not recommended. There are other offerings even in the overseas markets with the same excellent panel but far superior ROMs that are far more stable and effective at managing memory. Because of the filters in Android Market, none of the common games and relatively few of the most useful apps in the US market are available. Although some of this tablet's competitors in the Asian retail markets share some of its deficiencies (such as the excessive RAM consumption by the OS, very slow boot time) none so far have the same challenges with stability of the OS or the ability to run common tasks. When looking for an acceptable role for this tablet in day-to-day life, this may be good for checking email or reading e-books (not at the same time). It is capable of playing MP3s, even streaming MP3s. It is not recommended for taking videos, video playback, gaming, or any `active' user who would want to multitask on the tablet quickly and efficiently.

I never came back and reviewed this, but I played this game last year (2012) and enjoyed it thoroughly. It's creepy, well made, an engrossing demented adventure! It is definitely an adult game and was a little too memorable in the few clips my (at the time) 3-year-old son watched me play. For grown-ups, or near-grown-ups, this is worth it. I'm typically interested in FPS/TPS and occasional RTS games. Pretty vanilla. This was one of those very creative, bizarre, but well-made alternatives to military shooters. WELL worth the play!

This was great out of the box, quiet and very warm. It replaced another space heater we'd had for years. On the old ceramic heater the fan was loose (bad bearings) inside the unit to the fan 'rattled'. I was very happy with this new one, especially at its price point, but found that after only about four months of intermittent (light) use the fan has come apart in this one. It now rattles miserably - going in the trash. The old heater was just an ordinary K-Mart one, and lasted for the better part of a decade before it just wasn't usable. This one only lasted for a few months. Unacceptable. I don't know what other type to recommend but the basic point is, you would likely be better served buying any common space heater from Walmart or Target, or buying a more premium one from Amazon. No need to waste money on this unless you really only expect a few months' useful life out of it.----------------------Update 1 year later: the second space heater. For just a few weeks of use last season and a few weeks this season the fan bearing is bad, and the fan is annoyingly noisy. These fans are not intended for regular use. If you're looking for something that will heat a room you use often - daily, or even weekly - this is a waste of your money. If you only intend to use it for 20 or 30 hours, that's about it's useful life, so you should be fine.

I bought three of these to put LED strips under our kitchen cabinets. After three weeks of relatively frequent use the power supply died. I think a transistor or relay went bad. I had to order another one (which worked) and toss the broken one. I do not know how long any of them should be expected to work, but certainly more than 75 to 100 hours of use. There's not much more to say about a power supply than "it works" or "it doesn't work". Right now they're batting a .75 average... after only 3 weeks.

I went from an old entry-level GT (Aggressor 2.0) with aluminum hard tail frame, caliper brakes, etc. Gears were getting worn. This was on sale around Black Friday so I sprung for it rather than having a new gear set installed. WOOPSE!The old bike has a LOT of mileage and a LOT of thrashing on it. Warp in the front wheel, bull bars, scratches, dirt, everything is worn. Last couple of years I've primarily just used it for taking the kids for rides in a trailer. But it's an old trooper.This Mongoose is just an embarrassment to itself. Let me enumerate the unfortunately lengthy list of things that are wrong right out of the box, and some inherent design flaws:1. One of the tire tubes (rear, as it turns out) was leaky from new. A 3-mile ride and the tire is down when I pumped it up just before I left. (Fixable, but should not be the case.)2. The front brake caliper's inner brake pad rubs against the rotor when the axle is properly seated in the fork. (Fixable, but should not be the case.) (Update: Adjusted the inner brake pad, cable tension, but it appears the front rotor is warped as well, it squeals in cycle with the front wheel rotation while riding.)3. The crank shaft squeaks and creaks, sounds like dry or just bad bearings.4. The derailleur is either mismatched or improperly adjusted; the chain derailed three times during my inaugural ride. (Update: further riding indicates that the gears just don't shift quickly/smoothly relative to better sets. Adjusting cable tension helped only incrementally but still could no solidly land a gear, especially when moving across several sprockets quickly.)5. The gears are either misadjusted or mismatched and could not be shifted when under load; the chain could not slip even when the derailleur was tugging at it. Only shiftable under light load or freewheeling. If you either do any real riding or have to haul along 80+ pounds of trailer and children, don't plan on shifting while climbing.6. Gears are mismatched to bike/wheel size. The climbing gear (first) is clearly in a ratio designed for a 24" or at most 26" bike. It's utterly useless. Of course, on my old (26") bike I could go up seriously steep climbs with the trailer attached, this thing was just utterly hopeless. I would not even attempt to take a real ride (i.e., trail or mountain) with this thing. Overall, please understand the gearing is a total mess, a colossal catastrophe on this bike. It's not "designed"; it's a set of mismatched, cheap components welded/bolted together without any overall rhyme or reason.7. This is a mere matter of preference / performance, but the bike is VERY heavy. At 46 pounds, it's a full 10 pounds heavier than my Aggressor, even though it's supposed to also have a welded aluminum frame. I'd not be surprised if the frame only has one aluminum pipe and the rest is made out of chro-moly (and filled with lead?).In general, if you're a light/occasional, casual rider, you could order this, take it to a bike shop for a full tune-up, and be OK. Even as a casual rider, you won't want this thing if you're in an area with a lot of hills/mountains. As a serious or semi-serious rider, this thing is a pretender. It LOOKS cool and the feature list SOUNDS good, but in practice, it's just... well, it's what you'd expect for <$300. Garbage. It's a mess of low-quality frame and assembly and mis-matched components that end up in a disastrous riding experience.I will readily admit, I probably had too high hopes/expectations. GT bikes (as with many other high-end manufacturers) are high quality, great bikes. I've had three GTs and loved them all so for my purposes, I'll likely just fork out what I have to to either replace the complete gear set on my old frame or just get a new GT. As I said, if you aren't a 'serious' rider and live in a relatively flat area, this bike may be OK for you with some adjustments. But for anyone who puts any real load on the bike, really rides, what you pay is what you get. Just take my review as a cautionary tale - caveat emptor - for folks who might, as I was, think: maybe you really CAN get a steal, get all the features and functions of a high-end bike for an entry-level price!No. You cannot.UPDATE:After a couple more rides it is clear that this thing is just very heavy and geared improperly. I can't get nearly as much torque in first gear with this thing - maybe half as much.Also, the frame ends up being about 16" (center of crankshaft to top of seat tube). I have the seat extended to its absolute maximum height and it's still about an inch and a half shorter than it should be for proper posture. I'm only 5'11 and with the seat at maximum height, my knee is still bent when the pedal is fully extended. You can see how downward-sloped the top tube is. If you're 5'10 or shorter this should be fine but it's simply not big enough for anyone my height or taller.The lack of lockout on the front and rear suspension is a killer. With 29" tires and spongy suspension it obviously soaks up rocks and roots really nicely as long as the trail is relatively flat. But when you need to climb a hill, the efficiency on this bike is just abysmal. True torture! No need to put yourself through it. Rather than upgrading all of the components as an earlier reviewer recommended, you could just buy an entry-level hardtail Specialized or GT for $100 more.Update 2:Note that the frame has a 16" (small) seat tube and that there are no size options available. I am 5' 11" and cannot get the seat high enough for a proper riding posture. This bike is not made for riders over 5' 9" or so unless you don't mind a very inefficient posture (I.e., seat is too low relative to handle bar, leg is not fully extended on power stroke, have about 4-5" of stand-over room). Just another way it has proven an ill match for me...

Actually, my husband loves it.  He tends to use a wallet until it literally falls apart, so this was the perfect time to replace the mangled one with one of style and sit-on softness.  As another reviewer already stated, there are 9 pockets all total, some quite snug, but that is a good thing to prevent cards from getting lost.The feel of this wallet is one of quality leather and workmanship.  I hope it lasts a little longer than the ones he usually buys!

Oh, is this thing fun!That is, now that I have figured it out and learned from initial mistakes.I am an artist and crafter who loves to design and create unique and one-of-a-kind items.  I also hail from Germany, and so far I have had to write sentiments and such by hand because there is no such thing as a pre-fab stamp.When Amazon.com offered this Brother ScanAndCut machine for review I was at first a bit hesitant.  I own the original Cricut but don't use it anywhere near as much as some people, so would this machine also be a bit of a waste?  I went on YouTube and other sources to see what sets this machine apart.Ta-Daaaa!!!!!  I can hand-write a sentiment in any language, scan it into the machine, and get a perfectly cut paper image the quality of a very dainty die.  How cool is that?The mistakes I referred to earlier have been getting the correct placement to minimize waste, and the correct size and thickness of pen used so as to not over-tax the machine's capabilities.  Once those little glitches were ironed out this machine has become major fun for me.Oh, I know that the possibilities are endless, and others have written about them and also the setup in detail.  I just wanted to highlight what it has done for me personally.  Of course it can fuzzy-cut, so having to buy expensive dies to match certain stamps just to cut the outlines is a thing of the past.  You can use ANY stamp in your collection and get the ScanAndCut to cut it out perfectly.If this machine is on your wish list for Christmas, move it to the top of the list.  Have fun with it!As for me, I have to get back to working on my Christmas cards...

When it comes to pictures, print quality matters a great deal to me.  I used to be a die-hard Canon fan but was put off by the ridiculous ink cost and printers gobbling it up during each start-up cleaning cycle (should have been labeled ink eating cycle).Then I got introduced to an Epson printer and was sold.  Not only was start-up time cut down to a mere few seconds, print quality was also true to what I saw on the screen.  There is nothing worse than seeing one thing on the computer screen and getting something entirely different upon printing.None of my current printers feature double trays, however, so printing pictures requires a lot of manual setup.Enter the Epson PictureMate.  Ready when I need a picture, and fast for what Iam used to.  Print quality is impressive.  Colors are true, no more wasted ink and paper.  The prints are supposed to last 200 years, something impossible to prove unless I reincarnate a few times.  But given how terrible some prints from 10+ years ago have deteriorated I have high hopes that Epson's pictures will hold up to the test of time.In a nutshell, for pictures up to 5x7" this printer is ideal.  Prints are crisp and clear and true to what the camera saw.  Cost is a little high, but since I have no waste from off-color prints and can count on each print to be a success the cost per print is definitely worth it.One request, however:  Epson, please offer matte and satin paper in your sets. I would much prefer those over high gloss any day.

I have medium sized female,hands.  Dealing with hot foods is always a problem, and the stiff blue silicone mitts I bought a few years back have always been more dangerous than useful because I could not get a good grip on the item.  So I had high hopes with these gloves.The problem is that they are too large.  Too much room left in the finger tips, so again there might be the issue of hot meats hitting the floor.  The improvements are that this is a more flexible silicone and the gloves have ridges all over to aid in gripping.I do not understand why these gloves are so huge, however.  They seem to have been made to fit a man's hand, and given that this seems to be a constant issue I find that almost sexist.  What, women don't handle hot food?  Why not make a glove that fits ME?This could be the perfect glove if it were to come in different sizes...

I bought this oil primarily to help heal t ehuge scar across my head from recent brain tumor surgery.  But I have to wait a little longer until the glue flakes off completely.  I, the meantime, however, I decided to try this oil on my rough cuticles.  It works beautiully and absorbs relatively fast, leaving my nails with a healthy sheen as well.This oil has no scent.  But the rose water from Teddy Organics has a heavenly rose scent and is on my shopping list together with this oil.  I am not a,fan of perfumes, but I love, love, love the heavenly light scent of their organic rose water!Very highly recommended!

If you own an older house, measure your door openings first before ordering this baby gate.  We do, and much to my dismay most of our doors are a bit too narrow for the gate's required 31/5" width.  So I had to do some swapping around to finally get to utilize this beauty.No babies here, just two dogs I am trying to keep out of certain areas and the basement.  Baby gates do the trick.  But they can also be cumbersome when I have to walk with both hands full and no table anywhere to put things down.  So the idea of a foot pedal to "open sesame" a little easier was a dream come true.After some swapping around, I finally managed to get this gate mounted and put in action.  Love it.  New learning curve for us because the rail across the floor is a tripping hazard until we learn to pick up our feet.Handsome, clean lines, but I agree, it looks almost black. Pretty, though.  Definitely recommended.I subtracted one point for medioce instructions.

I love jade.  Both pearls and jade are in my birthstone line, but jade is a clear favorite.  The beads of this set are about 1/4" for the jade and 3/16" for the white pearls.  They are strung tightly together, no gaps, and the jade is a very pretty translucent pale apple green.Ever since my Carpal tunnel surgeries I have had trouble with clasps, but these oversized spring ring clasps are easy enough to manipulate even with my compromised thumbs.The bracelet, according to the description, measures 7.5", but the inside circumference is a little less due to the size of the beads.  I usually wear a 7 1/4" bracelet and this fits comfortably with room to spare.The earrings are plain jade bead studs, no frills, but pretty.You won't go wrong with this set.  The size of the beads is big enough to make them visible yet not clunky and bulky.  It is a set that can easily bridge daytime to a night on the town.

If the appetite persists I will up my rating, but I don't like to jump into 5-star ratings prematurely.We  have a terier mix who likes to clean out everybody else's bowls if they are not eating fast enough.  So mixing her food with a lower calorie food made sense.  Usually such food is shunned because with it comes cardboard flavor.Apparently Eukanuba has managed to create a food that controls weight AND tastes decent, yayy!

Maggi Fondor is one seasoning I cannot be without.  There simply is nothing else like it out there. Same with the original Maggi Wuerze, these are standbys in my kitchen whenever I cook German meals.  Years ago I could find Maggi at Shaw's, but not anymore, so now it is online ordering only.  I am just glad that Amazon.com offers such a huge selection of what are absolute essentials for me!

Downgraded my rating from 4 to 2 stars:Battery life has been horrible, not even 3 hours and the watch is dead!  I wonder if Huawei reads these reviews and acts on them or if I have to jump through hoops for more of the same.  I had been so excited over getting this watch and am now so terribly disappointed!  I cannot in good conscience recommend this watch based on such a lousy battery life.  I can't even take it shopping with me because it will be dead halfway through.  Talk about a fun killer...I am new to smart watches, so unlike some other reviewers  I really have nothing to compare this watch to.Setup was super easy, and while the watch was charging I played with it and then read the instructions.  Pairing the watch with my phone was easy as well, just download the app and follow the instructions.The reason I am giving it four stars is that there are no instructions on how to add more apps.  They show up in the app's menu, but since they are already installed on my phone the only options I am given are Open or Uninstall.  If anyone knows how to add them to the watch, please comment!No read glowing screen so far, so hopefully mine is not a dud.  I love the Google Now feature, talking to my watch is kind of fun and nerdy all at the same time.Since I am still learning all this watch can or can't do I will probably add to this review later on.  First order is to figure out how to get the Music app to play decent music and not that weird stuff the watch has selected thus far.It is a gadget for sure.  Hopefully the Fit feature will get me to walk more...

Trying to find white peppercorns in local and regional stores is about as easy as finding a chicken with teeth.  White pepper is such a basic staple in German that it never occurred to me that American stores don't carry it.  Good grief!Amazon.com to the rescue...I ordered the cheaper add-on version -- pepper is pepper  -- and am very happy with it.  White papper has a much more sublte distinct flavor.  Most light colored recipes in European cooking specifiy white pepper.Most definitely very highly recommended!

In my family the women tend to be "blessed" with way too much unwanted hair.  I have never shaved, rather, Ihave always gone after the roots of the hairs to thin out regrowth.  I have also tried NoNo but found it to be useless for me in that this device truly DID burn off the hairbut did not reach below the skin surface which made for stubbles the next day.  So, back to the epilators.This device intrigued me.  It promises permanent hair reduction (note that it does not promise that no hair will grow back).  The booklet is detailed and spells out the Do's and DON'Ts as well who should not use this device.  (If you have a pacemaker or other item implanted, do NOT use this device.The other reviewer reported burned hair.  Maybe she missed the part where it says that hair must be removed first before using this device.  iluminage goes after the hair follicle, not the hair itself.Protocol is once a week for 7 weeks, then touch-ups as needed.It is way too early to review the EFFECTIVENESS of this device.  I will update this review i about 2-3 months since that will give me enough time to fully evaluate this device's effectiveness.

These are paper towels, the kind you find in public restrooms in hospitals and other places.  Functional, a bit rough, not the best at being absorbent but does the job.Or craft...  Which is what i am uing one roll for right now.  The rest will come in vrey handy during my constant hand washing while I hand feed my wildlife orphans.

It just so happens that recently I searched through all my older microphones to see if one might fit my cell phone and had no luck, none had a 3.5mm plug.  The wind noise this time of year can really interfere with videos.  So when the mind readers at amazon.com offered up this microphone for review I didn't hesitate.I tried it out immediately upon receipt.  It was very windy this afternoon with lots of dry leaves rustle as well.  The microphone performed beautifully with my voice being clear and easy to understand.  This will also come in super handy when I film in my noisy rehab room.Monitoring a recording via a headset is super easy because the microphone's plug has a built-in headphone jack, so there is no need for constant plugging and unplugging.  This is a well thought-out little detail!Built, while dainty, feels solid.Longivety is yet to be determided, and if there are issues I will amend this review.

As other reviewers have stated, this unit tends to disconnect at random intervals.  This is more than just annoying when a reliable feed is necessary.Aside that flaw, the picture is quite good, even at night. When it works, it is  pleasure to have.I hope the company will offer a bug fix for this soon.

Oh thank goodness they finally came out with this!  The waterproof housing (which I don't use underwater but in snow and rain) always completely drowned any sound, and overall the sound quality of the clips has been mediocre.  I do a lot of narrating, so this makes just soooo much sense to me!I cut a tiny slot in the waterproof housing so Ican plug in the microphone, and Voila!, SOUND!!!This is not a microphone that picks up an entire group, it is meant to single out a person.  Great when outside beause it also won't pick up all the unwanted road noise.Clarity of sound is impressive.  I just wish the cable was longer than just 5 feet.  An extender would be nice (hint, hint!!!)Love it.

I don't speak router.  All I know is if something works or not, or if I notice a measurable improvement or not.This unit provides a measurable improvement.  3 bars went up to 5.  The dreaded afternoon slump of a non-Fios (not available here yet) high speed snail's pace internet has gotten better as well.  Too bad this router can't reach through the phone lines and choke Verizon into improving our internet access...Setup was indeed easy, otherwise I would not be writing this review but hide from a very angry husband.Time will tell how reliable the router is.  I haven't used all the fancy customizable functions because if I do I'll screw things up.  It works.  I am happy.

My nose is hypersensitive when it comes to colognes and perfumes.  If someone bathes in that stuff it gives me an instant headache.  Also, I can't wear colognes around my wildlife so as not to spook them.  I do, however, like a classy, light-on-  the scent hint of scent.This Eau de Toilette hits a home run on all counts.  It is not sweet.  It does not give me a headache.  It has a pleasant, fresh scent that strikes me as a mix of wood bark and dainty flower.My husband judges a cologne by how long the fragrance remains detectable for his nose.  I just sneaked in the bedroom and sniffed his wrists without waking him up.  It's there, whisper light and pleasant.  I could sniff on this all night...But the deciding vote lay with my husband, and with the simplicity of a guy he declared that he likes this.Oh goodie, I am married to the best smelling man in town!Very highly recommended!

These gloves are awesome.  I can scrub my cages wtih them and they don't rip unless I really snag a corner and skin goes with it.  Luckily, that doesn't happen too often.  I even used them to scrub black walnuts, and those can really discolor the skin badly.  The gloves protect from that perfectly.Fit is a bit tight but still better than the next size up (medium) which fits a tad too loosely.  Too bad they don't make an in-between size, that would be perfect for me.Highly recommended.

Phew, getting our two cats to eat and not raise hell because they don't like the food has been tough.  Both have urinary issues, and the regular vet diet has been met with nothing but complaints.  So we had to step it up to the better food which costs a fortune, but at least they eat it.  Now that both are stable I am searching for alternatives I can sneak in to cut down on the cost a bit.  I decided to give this food a try since it seems to have much better ingredients than the store bought "what on earth is this stuff?" canned food that may or may not contain anything even remotely resembling meat or fish.If this works out and I don't notice any ill effects from substituting a can of this every other day I will definitely be ordering more of this.

I had bought its predecessor a while back when my Eureka didn't quite bite the dust but broke off an essential clip so now the pads can't be attached anymore.  I love the Bissell line in general for their quality, performance, and ease of use.  Their carpet steamer for pets is exceptional.This newest machine is no exception. What I love about it is that the tank part is detachable and the unit come with a long steam hose and plenty of attachments to do above-floor cleaning.  Great to get the scum off and behind faucets where it is hard to reach with sponges.  The machine also heats up fast and leaves the floors merely damp.  They dry within minutes due to the residual heat.Best of all,  this Bissell uses the same pads as its predecessor, so I didn't have to jump online and buy a bunch of new ones.  The pads are high quality and will last.  As far as I know. there are no generic pads available.  The generic ones listed with the predecessor did not fit.So now the predecessor is in the wildlife rehab room  (a lot quieter than the old Eureka and does a better job), the Eureka went to recycle heaven, and this new baby cleans all my floors and kitchen and bathrooms upstairs.  Wonderful!

This is a little light strictly designed to illumate book pages or a small work area.  Its battery does not last past 4 hours, but that is usually enough for most people.  It charges fully relatively quickly, which is a plus.For what it is designed to do, it works very well.  But if you need more illumination and longer runtime, look at its big cousin which is an outstanding performer.

How does one rate a product one hopes to never have to use?  I am not about to shock myself, and I haven't looked for any volunteers either.This thing is LOUD when switched to Stun, so only a complete moron would continue to come forward...  I can only hope that its bite is as powerful as its audio level.I chose a four star rating because I am not certain as to this device's performance.  If I ever have to use it and it works, I will change my rating accordingly.

These stamps make large cookies.  There is a bit of a learning curve to get the amount of dough rolled in a ball right, but that is just a matter or practice.  Impression is deep and clean.  The handle is hardwood  The set has an antique feel about it, it is lightweight yet solid.  Comes in a box nice enough for gift giving

My first impression of this head lamp is "Wow!"  I have several by now, for different applications.  In the house I love my Petzl Tikka which is perfect for crafting and lightweight enough to not give me a headache.  For outside at night I use either my Northbound Train or Energizer when I need a green or red light.  The Energizer is the least comfortable because it is front heavy and needs to be strapped tighter = headache.In fact, weight is a major factor for me, so when I got the chance to review this Maxcraft LED Mini Headlamp I jumped at it.This is indeed a lightweight.  It does feel a bit weird at first because the front part of the little flashlight is a bit heavier and that is noticable when I first put it on.  The light has five modes:  it starts with the highest beam, then medium, next click fairly low, then fast flash, then SOS.  The end cap absorbs light and helps locate the light in the dark, but the light has to be exposed to good light during the day for that to happen.  The head band is large enough to accommodate the biggest noggin' and adjusts very easily.There are no hard plastic parts digging in my forehead, another big plus.  The part that holds the flashlight is soft silicone, and that wraps around the back where it touches the forehead.  It might feel a bit sweaty in hot weather, but that is a minor concern since it is a narrow strip.It is too early to comment on longevity, so I will update my review later on if something should malfunction.  I hope the light will last a long time.I think this light will join my list of favorites.

The net itself is good quality, but come on, an additional $60 for the pole?  That is highway robbery! And the end of the net is made in such a way that you can't fashion another pole and make it work.

This is my second Tikka.  The first one started loosening up the center battery which of course killed the light, and there is no contact to bend back into place to fix that.  I hope this won't happen with this one.  I like these llights because they are not a flame thrower and can be used in the house for reading or crafting without going blind.  They are also very comfortable to wear and lightweight enough where I don't have to keep the headband so tight that I get a headache.  I own several headlamps, but in the house this is my go-to lamp.

I use it to light up the inside of cages so I don't have to use the flashlight on my cameras.  It's perfect for that because it floods the area.  Love that I can adjust from low (quite bright) to brilliant.  Can't beat the price for what this light does.

Thank you to all the reviewers who raved about this mower.  it is just perfect for our front yard which is small and has a lot of tight spots to navigate.  And it chomps down even the highest crab grass and chops thin woody weeds to smitherines.  The bag holds a surprisingly large amount.At last, mowing is almost fun...

Beats my old one hands down!  So glad I listened to the reviews and got this, thank you!The arrangement of the spider web makes for much faster drying than parallel lines as my old unit had.  Setup couldn't be easier:  undo the knots, put bottom pole into top pole, open up.

Not so sure just yet, the potency of this batch does not seem to last very long.  Within a few days the moths are ignoring the trap.  I have ordered this trap repeatedly in the past, so I don't know if I got a bad batch or if the company is cutting corners.
Oh goodie, I don't have to crank my neck to keep my chin above water anymore!  Soooooo worth it!!!

You really have no idea what goes on in a smoker until you have this thermometer.  This isn't a luxury, it is a must-have.  Sure, you could put a stationary thermometer on as I did at first, but who wants to run out and check on that thing all the time, adjust the temp, and then keep running outside checking?

My only gripe is that the tripod itself does not come with even one of these plates.  Had I known this up front I probably would have looked at other models since it rendered the tripod useless until I had these plates.
Great for 1-2 person household as long as you're not looking to have a lot of leftovers.  This is a quality crock, well made, and the food does not spill out even when the unit is near boiling.

When I first paired this speaker with my phone and heard the voice that it had paired, I didn't expect too much.  Then I turned on Pandora.Call me a blue tooth speaker junkie, I just love those things and have them everywhere:  in my purse, in my car, in the kitchen, in the bedroom, in the living room.  One is not portable (needs to be plugged in) but packs more Ummphh, so this is the one I will compare the Braven to.This speaker really rocks!  Clarity of sound is very high end for such a small unit although this is no lightweight.  You can boost Bass (EQ) by holding the Power and +Volume button simultaneously, cancel it out holding Power and -Volume button.  And it does work without distorting the sound.The Braven is also a Speakerphone AND a charging unit.  If your phone fizzles out during play you just plug it in via its USB cord and recharge directly from the speaker.Without using it as a charging unit, the speaker provides 15 hours of run time.  I haven't verified this, it is still running, and it's been well over 10 hours.  I love that thing!The speaker weighs 830 grams, well over 1 1/2 pounds.  Not bad, at least it won't get blown off the table that easily.  It does, however, have a narrow base and no kick stand.  Size is a little larger than my Grundig YB 400PE radio in that the Braven is a bit thicker and maybe 1/4" longer.  Dimensions of the Braven are 8 3/16" long by 5" tall by 1 13/16" wide (or thick).I like that it has a battery check light, this prevents running out of juice when least expected.The unit is waterproof against rain, splashes, and water jets.  I don't think they mean you should throw it in the pool, though.  But I will have it playing on a table when I am in the hot tub for sure!  I wouldn't do that with other speakers...Another nice feature is that this speaker will remember the last 8 devices it had been paired to, so no constant manual reconnecting.Well, I have to go and hang up some laundry, to the tunes of my Braven...Very highly recommended!

Our inflatable spa, while comfortable, does not have fancy seats with head rests and such.  So these head rests come in very handy and help with relaxing and just staring at the stars without getting half your hair wet.  They are not soft, but the shape makes them very comfortable.

Upn front a warning:  you are buying ONE wiper blade.  The other one is most likely a different size.Having said that, this is a high quality wiper that installs very easily.  We had a rough winter and my other wipers took a beating.No streaking, no noise.  Very nice.

You might think that a tubular shape is not very practical.  It certainly doesn't hold a lot of beans.But it holds the perfect amount for a 12 oz bold cup of flavor-tich coffee.Grinding took a few minutes, but the scent emitting from the ground beans made for a pleasurable task.  And the coffee was delicious!I will be using this little guy quite often!  Just please don't expect to grind beans for a crowd, your arm might fall off.  This is a personal grinder.  And at that it excels.

I am a licensed wildlife rehabilitator and have rehabilitated and released probably over 1,000 squirrels over the years.  This is a terrible box to buy.Cedar fumes are toxic to rodents, so any squirrel that lives in such an environment will eventually die from lung cancer.  I am shocked that this company doesn't know that.Size is way too small for a gray squirrel.  Which is probably the reason birds decided to make use of it, and they probably built up half the depth with twigs  Not a bad use for it in the end.I have developed and used with great success my own squirrel box and am now offering them up for sale as a kit or fully assembled.  Please check them out on my FB page Sigi's Wild Tails.  Since I am fully loaded with wildlife in my care, I can't do a big production as would be needed for Amazon.com.  My boxes work.  Seven have been up in trees around here and have been occupied for over 2 years with litters raised in safety, and we will put up 10 more at an offsite next weekend.

I own two other laser measure made by Bosch, but Stanley TLM99s has set a much higher standard by having the Bluetooth connected Floor Plan app.  It makes me feel like I am a professional builder or an architect.  What could take you hours or days to measure and carefully draw, you can get it done in minutes.  Amazing!I have no problem connecting this laser measure with the app on my tablet using Bluetooth. The manual doesn't help with how the Bluetooth connection works until I saw the video on Youtube (the company should put that video here.) All you have to do is to tap on the line you are measuring on the tablet and the TLM99s transmit the measurement to that line.  This way, you can adjust the floor plan to the precision in minutes.This is a very serious and time saving tool for anyone who is trying to come up with an accurate floor plan, even a complex one.  It's not just a simple laser measure for those who want to replace a tap measure.  It does require you to be a little bit tech savvy. Not much, but a little bit, as to follow the video instructions.This is the state-of-the-art technology on measuring, and it is cheap!  Yes, you have to pay a few buck for each floor plan, but it's still cheap.  This is a high end professional tool at a basic consumer price.I recommend it!

I've used OtterBox cases for a decade and they really kept my phones safe traveling around the world.  One problem has always been THICK and bulky.  This Symmetry series tries the make it as slim as possible without compromising OtterBox's reputation for protection, and it does the job well.The two tone color is nicely chosen.  The case fit snugly.  The interior is softer for better shock absorption.  It's good for the kids, but I think the price has to come down.I recommend it.

I stay and work indoor most of the time, so I take 5000 iu of Vitamin D3 regularly to keep my V-D balanced.  I've used several other brands and what irritates me is that the softgels tend to stick together after awhile.  I noticed with Viva Labs, the softgels stays apart and very convenient to get it out of the bottle in the morning when I take it.The fact that it is made in USA is something I love to support and trust.  As for the quality and result of this brand, I have to wait until my next checkup to see, as I have no other way to determine, except I do feel happy and positive, which could be the result of the serotonin it generates.

Our 500sqf basement does not have cooling or heating system installed, so we put this Commercial Cool WPAC14R 13,500 BTU there as a year round unit for both cooling and heating and it works very well for the purpose.  Installation is easy and straight forward like most other portable unit I have used, with all the hoses and attachments included.The fan is very forceful to make the air circulating in the entire room.  The powerful fan does make the unit sound louder, but you don't have to leave it on high all the time because once the room reaches the desire temperature, you can lower the fan speed to maintain the temperature.The control buttons are conveniently located at the top panel and they are very easy to access. The remote controls also allows you to to make adjustments from a distance.The unit doesn't look fancy.  It doesn't attract attention and doesn't take away the decor of your room.  It blends in very nicely with most room decor.I recommend it!

I own several sports watch like this and most of them are too premature to be on the market because they don't work properly.  Others are great but only useful during certain workouts--not as feature rich.  This TomTom Spark Music + Cardio is the best and feature rich.  I replaced my regular watch because this watch takes care of my needs 24 hours. It tracks my steps, calories burned, sleep, workout time, running distance, and heart rate. It literally covers every activity that I need to track including swimming.  And it shows the date and time without having to press any buttons.Now, you might be curious why I deducted one star if it is so great.  First of all, I didn't receive the headphones, even thought this is supposed to be bundled with headphones (I've contacted Amazon about this).  In the mean time, I paired it with my own LG Tone Pro HBS-750 Bluetooth Wireless Stereo Headset and it paired immediately and smoothly.  I'm very happy to have music without an additional product to carry during workout.As for transferring music to the watch, the Windows app allows you to set up a directory for the watch to search each time it is connected, but it never worked.  It scans the entire computer and after finding the songs, you have the option to either transfer all of them or none.  There are only 3GB of space in the watch, and I don't want all my music to be in there since not all of them are good for workout.  I figured out a simpler way.  I dropped the music I want using the PC folders directly into the watch's folder.  I know the app was to make it easy and foolproof, but it's just too premature to release.The manual is quite poorly written, and it has very little information in there but in many languages, so it looks thick.  It was obviously written by a non-English speaker. It says, "Move LEFT to open the activity tracking screen."  I tried to move the watch left, but it didn't work.  I stepped left wearing the watch, but it didn't work.  I swiped the screen to the left, but it didn't work.  I slid my finger on the square block, and it still didn't work. Well, after a long time of looking stupid, I figured out that it means PRESSING the left edge of the square block under the watch screen.  The word PRESS and MOVE are a world apart.  They should have hired a professional technical writer, or produce a video.The manual does tell me that by covering the watch with my hand, it turns on the back light, so that I can see in the dark.  That's very nice.I'm not satisfied with the sleep tracker.  It tracks how long I slept, but not the quality of my sleep.  I have another watch that tells me not only the length of my sleep but also how deep I sleep.  That's important information because sleeping doesn't always mean sleeping deeply, which is a key for health and wellness.The phone app is not user friendly (I use the Android app for the phone) . I am often lost as to how to make it show the latest information.  I hope they will improve the app soon.Hardware wise, it is very well built and sturdy.  It's very easy to remove the watch from the strap.  At first I felt that the strap appears cheap and flimsy with those spikes, but it turns out to be quite well designed in a way that it keeps the heartbeat sensor constantly stay touched with my wrist.One amazing feature that I like most about is its battery life. I can easily get through a week without recharging.  I have seen no other watch in this category could do that.It's a great watch with the above and other minor bugs.  Of course, the shipping department should not have left out the Bluetooth earphones.  I'm ready to restore the missing one star when these problems are corrected.Bottom line, I recommend it!

This headphone is very basic and basically good.  The size is a little tight for my big head, but it just make it more stable, preventing it from falling off of your head if you are taking it on a run.The cable is rubbery and feels tough enough to endure a long time.  I also like the cable being on only one side of the headphones and the two wires are completely combined. The padding on top of the arc and on the earpieces are comfortable enough.I wish the cable is a little longer.  Other than that, it's a good basic pair of headphones.I recommend it!

This cordless screwdriver is very convenient to have for small tasks, such as opening computer system unit, changing hard drives, etc.  The design is ergonomic and it feels very comfortable in your hand.I like tools with lithium-ion batteries because, unlike Ni-Cad, they don't have memory and last longer.  One star is removed for not having a charging indicator.If you are looking for a small cordless screwdriver, I recommend it!

Even though I have been diabetic for years, my annual physical checkup has always come out great with my heart.  I give credit to taking CoQ10 daily for years.  I recently have learned that, as we grow older, our ability to absorb CoQ10 reduce.  So seeing Viva Labs CoQ10 coming with BioPerine to help absorb CoQ10, I became interested.Even though there's no way for me to prove it's effectiveness until next checkup, I just have to take Viva Labs for their word as a reputable company.  Since I am taking CoQ10 anyway, I might as well take it in a way that I can get the most benefit out of it.

These headphones are very practical to have for general use.  They should not be compared to the expensive headphones.  However, for the price, these headphones are superb, even though the materiel used feels and looks cheap.The cable is long.  The earpiece padding is very comfortable.  I keep it handy next to my computer and use it to watch YouTube  or Facebook videos when I don't want to disturb other people around me.  The sound is a little muffled compared to high end headphones, but good enough for the purpose.It even comes with a volume control.  I wish it also has a mute button.  But, again, for ten bucks, I can't complain.I recommend it!

This TV Cart Stand is very sturdy and strong.  Even thought it doesn't look as pretty as the competitive, it's very simple and stable.  The way the legs and wheels are arranged allows you to easily slide through doors.There are additional wholes in the back for you to attach other things.  In my case I attached a mini pc, hiding it behind the TV, so this TV serves as a full PC for people to plug their USB drives, using the remote to play the slide show or video, without the need of a laptop and cable.I recommend it!

I've used many jump ropes with WEIGHTED HANDLES including one made by SKLZ, which I use most often.  This set comes with WEIGHTED ROPE, which obviously gives me more exercise than weighted handles. The quality of the rope is good, but it is not so flexible. It doesn't straighten immediately if you store it coiled it up.  So I keep is hanging when I don't use it.I removed one star because I'm not quite sure about the 90 degree angle handle.  It feel awkward to jump in varying positions, or swinging your arms wider to get more exercise. Maybe it takes some time to get use to it.The handles are easily removable so that you can buy other ropes of different weights to be used with the same set of handles.For those who like to try new and innovative jump ropes, this is the one worth trying out.

The built quality is outstanding, and the design is very convenient, especially with the handle built in a position that is both easy for carrying and pouring. It appear to be very durable and can handle some serious rough handling on the road.The cap is sealed with a latch to keep the growler completely airtight, preserving the taste and flavor of any beverage you put in.I highly recommend this growler for campers!

I've used many projectors and I still own four other projectors in addition to this one--Epson VS240.  Among all projectors I've owned Epson projectors are my favorite because of their light weight, portability, and brightness.  The one I always carry with me lately is Epson EX7235 Pro (WXGA).I deducted one star because their built quality has not been my favorite.  For the sake of weight and portability, they often chose the light plastic material that often feel cheap.  But, this turn out to be not really a big problem because most of these projectors either die or become outdated before the plastic shells wear out.  I've never broken any of them due to their flimsy container.As for Epson VS240, it is very bright.  The color is very vibrant.  The only disappointment is its being SVGA (800x600), but surprisingly it doesn't compromise much of your presentation.  With HDMI, you can project your video and watch it on big screen reasonably clear and crisp.  As an Epson projector lover, I've no complaints about the image quality.  The price is also very reasonable.I recommend it!

These razors are well made with very comfortable rubbery handle.  They are just too good to be disposable.I normally use electronic shaver, but I keep disposable for emergency situation.  I have some in my office and one always in my car, just in case I forget to shave on my way to an important event.I am not a hairy guy, so I have no complain about these razors.  They do the job very well for my facial hairs and last a long time for me.  The price is right too.I recommend it!

I was curious about this Seagate "Grame Drive", and wonder what makes this special for PlayStation.  It turned out to be that this is just a smart marketing, targeting those who want to upgrade their PlayStation hard drive.  It's the same "Laptop SSHD" as it is clearly printed on the hard drive itself, but the box is labeled for PlayStation.That being said, I think it gives the those who are not sure what drives are compatible a peace of mind knowing that they are buying a product that will work on the PlayStation for sure, as some information I found online said that they were not sure if SSHD would work with PlayStation.  Even thought this drive is priced a little more than other packaging, you are at least paying for a drive that is guaranteed to work on PlayStation.As for the drive itself, I have exactly one like this on my ThinkPad for three years now, and it has been running beautifully ever since I put it in.  It's way cheaper than buying a 1TB SSD, and much faster than a regular 7200rpm hard drive.  The integration of SSD caching and magnetic hard drive is seamless.  So the quality of this drive is proven, at least for me.As for using it on PlayStation, the upgrade process is reasonably easy, even for a non-tetchy.  Upgrade information is available readily on the net as well as on PlayStation website.  So I won't repeat it here.In summary, I am glad the see that SSHD works for PlayStation.  It's a much cheaper option than SSD.  The quality of the driven is proven by my three years of using it.I recommend it!

Nowadays, human beings are advised to avoid grain, but I don't know it is necessarily for the pets.  However, I don't like to feed them what I don't eat.  So the Nutro Company's grain free formula is an option.So far my cats love the food.  They love it so much that they eat none stop for a long time comparing to other food.  They seem to love the fish dish better.  If I were to order only one flavor, I'll choose fish.  I wish they have a variety of fish, but so far I see only Tuna.I recommend it.

We have a dry late summer in North Jersey, and now the early fall hasn't shown more than a couple of rain drops that doesn't even wet the ground.  The Watersmart Plus Coating technology of Scott’s Turf Builder Grass Seed becomes a very helpful feature as we reseed our lawn because even though I try to water it carefully after seeding, any assistance in retaining water during dry season is a plus.After being advised by the experts, I make sure the seeds have contact with the ground, and water lightly twice a day, or sometimes three times if someone is at the house during the day.  In spite of the advanced technology used on these seeds, overseeding is still hard work.  I hope they can come up with an easier way for grass seeds to grow.My yard, both front and back, is about 5000 square foot, and this 40lb bag can cover 8000sqft. So this is bag will leave me some extra to patch the spots that fail to grow, or overseed another layer later.

We have a dry late summer in North Jersey, and now the early fall hasn't shown more than a couple of rain drops that doesn't even wet the ground.  The Watersmart Plus Coating technology of Scott’s Turf Builder Grass Seed becomes a very helpful feature as we reseed our lawn because even though I try to water it carefully after seeding, any assistance in retaining water during dry season is a plus.After being advised by the experts, I make sure the seeds have contact with the ground, and water lightly twice a day, or sometimes three times if someone is at the house during the day.  In spite of the advanced technology used on these seeds, overseeding is still hard work.  I hope they can come up with an easier way for grass seeds to grow.

This charger is solidly built and like its name the design is very basic and simple.  I like it having four AA as well as AAA, unlike the other ones I have that take four AA but only two AAA.  It's also pretty small and slim.I would have given it five stars if the USB charger port is 2 amp instead of just 0.5.I recommend it!

Growing up in Chinese family, goji is a staple ingredient in soup, snack, and herbal drinks.  I never appreciated the value of it because it was cheap and we used it wastefully.  Now maybe because the Westerners have caught up with the benefit of these berries, they suddenly become very expensive.I'm glad to see these USDA Organic goji berries.  The packaging I receive is good.  These berries are big and reasonably fresh, unlike some of those negative reviewer said.  They are not supposed to taste very good by themselves, as they are supposed to be an herbal ingredient of a dish or drink. When put in hot water, or hot herbal tea, it becomes soft and sweet within a few minutes.My parents and grand parents believe goji berries are good for your brain, eyes, and libido.  Well, having a healthier brain is the most important for me.  I can't tell the immediate effect of eating these goji berries because I am also taking other nutritional supplements for my brain and eyes. Nutritional herbs are to be taken regularly long term to reap the benefits.I recommend it!

Thrive Face Balm comes in a soft plastic bottle, but elegantly designed label prevents it from looking cheap.  It took a quite few pumps to get the first squeeze of a thin noodle line of white balm.  The scent is medicinal but pleasant.It feels oily at the beginning but within minutes my face feel smooth soft and no longer oily.  It makes my skin feel both soft and healthy.I recommend it.

I was disappointed with the quality of the construction, different from what I see here on the product image which seems very high in quality.  Even opening the battery compartment is quite hard.  After removing the screw, I still couldn't easily remove the battery compartment cover.  The battery compartment cover on the controller is also very flimsy and difficult to work with.  But, I don't want this to be the deal breaker, since, after all, it is just a toy for kids; rather expensive toy, that is.Ignoring the built quality, the toy is quite entertaining.  It is quite responsive to the control and turns. The speed is fast enough to keep a ten-year-old engaged for a long time.  It survives constant bumps against walls and table legs.

First, this iFrogz Chromatix Earbuds are made of durable material.  The wires are nicely coated with nylon without losing any flexibility.  The magnetic storage idea is very nice. The only problem is the spare earbuds are for larger ears.  The smallest ones are still a little too big for me.Even though mostly use Bluetooth earphones, when it comes to enjoying music, nothing compares to direct connection like this, and you don't have to worry about charging them.  The built in mic and volume control make it unnecessary to take out your phone to answer the call or adjust the volume.I recommend it!

iHealth seems to have cutting edge idea on health devices using the latest smartphone technology, and they are beautifully designed.  However, the functionality and accuracy are poor.  They must be very well funded to keep producing these poorly executed devices.First the device is very sleek in design.  The quality of the plastic is very high.  It comes with a case that holds the meter, the lancet pen, and the test strip bottle, plus a space for other related things such as alcohol pads and extra lancets.The instruction manual is very poor.  I use an Android phone, but the instruction manual mentions only for iOS.  I am technologically inclined, so eventually figured out how to set it up.I was happy to see it worked well and the test results were quite accurate at the beginning.  But, yesterday, I got a very low reading of 79 mg/dl, so, out of suspicion, I took it again and got 178.  I took another test and it gave me 139.  That would make it very hard to judge which number was the true result.Another problem, I have is the app crashes quite frequently.  I assume that if they are serious with their products, we will see a future update that stops crashing.In the same way, they might be able to release a firmware update to improve accuracy.The feature I like most is that it records my test results in my smartphone for easy access and study.

After some serious disappointment with another device I've tried, I feel Nuyu is deserves three stars because at least it works.  The negative part of this device is the appearance and the small letters.First, I don't like the design.  Whoever designed it must be of an older generation.  It's funny that the other device I had was very beautifully designed but didn't perform.  This one performs okay but looks ugly.Syncing with the smartphone is fairly smooth.  The manual doesn't tell you which device that shows up on the Bluetooth is the Nuyu.  Unless you have all other Bluetooth devices turn off, you would not know that it shows up as HNY----.  It took me a few second to figure out thta H is for Health o meter, and NY for Nuyu.  But after the first time syncing, it connects smoothly each time.Performance wise, it records my steps and distance quite accurately.  It also knows when I go to sleep, when I wake up, and tells me the quality of my sleep.  Measuring my sleep quality is what I need most from this device because I have other sports devices that measure my workouts that do great jobs for that purpose.  I like the graph that shows my sleep cycle.  Sleep quality is important because it determines my daytime energy.I hope the digits are bigger, it shows date in addition to time so that I can replace the watch.

This is the device I've been waiting for a long time.  It is a very complete and versatile set of HDMI to VGA converter with sound.  I've bought a HDMI to VGA adapter from another brand (Cable Matters) previously for connecting my computer to a projector using HDMI.  However, that adapter doesn't adapt my computer's 1080p resolution to the projector's resolution, so it keeps projecting off the screen, and it's impossible to make it work properly.This adapter, however, tells the computer that the connected projector is a different resolution (mine being SXGA) so the computer automatically sends the right aspect ratio to the screen, and the PowerPoint and videos appears nicely as if it comes right out of VGA cable.The best part is that now you can wirelessly stream video audio through Chromcast or Apple TV to a projector.  This is a fantastic feature that I didn't expect.I recommend it!

The foil is very strong and heavy duty as promised.  Reynolds Wrap has been part of the kitchen essentials in our family for many years and it continues to maintain the quality as always.With this foil, I was able to cover a large long tray of food securely and transport it to destinations near and far in my car without having to worry about getting torn accidentally and spilling or spoiling the food it covers.If you need some strong foil, this is the one to buy!

It seems strange that we try to feed our pets based on what we learn about human diet.  Yesterday, was talking with an elderly lady about how grain is not good for us, but fat is your friend, and she had a hard time believing me.  For the past 30 years we thought the other way around.  Now we found out that grain is a major contributor to Alzheimer.  As we learn to feed ourselves healthily, we want to feed our pets responsibly.What's most important is the dogs love the food.  I don't think they miss grain at all, since they are not grain eaters, and it is human beings that put grain in their food.  With this food, they get what they are supposed to be eating.  I recommend it!

The size of these pills are huge, but it's about the same size of most fish oil pills, so if you are used to taking fish oil, this shouldn't be a problem.I've been taking the Viva Labs CLA for over a week now and have noticed significant increase in energy and regulation of my blood sugar.  As for body weight, I haven't yet noticed any difference on the scale but people keep telling me that I look slimmer around the waist.This is my first experience with CLA, and I am happy with the result.I recommend it!

Mackie Freeplay is made of good quality sturdy plastic.  It was a pleasant surprise to see the battery pack when I opened the box because I thought it was an optional accessory that you have to buy separately, which would add quite a bit to the cost.  I think it is a wise decision to include the battery.  I wish the carrying bag comes with it too, since I will be carrying this baby to my club presentations.  I found out that the bag is not even on the market yet.Freeplay is feature-rich and well supported with a series of YouTube videos telling you how to use its features.  BlueTooth and the Freeplay Connect App, that function flawlessly, makes me decide to give it five stars even though I feel the volume is a little lacking when I connect it to a wireless microphone.  I have to crank both input and output level to the max to make it loud enough to address a room of about 70 people.  Freeplay promises a crowd of 100.  So if there is such an option, I would have given it 4.5 stars.With two one-inch high frequency drivers and an eight-inch woofer, Freeplay produces a wide range of sounds depending on how you want to use it.  You can adjust it to your satisfaction using the app, or the built-in settings.  The BlueTooth connection is very straight forward and works immediately.  Playing music from your smartphone or tablet for a roomful of 100 people is not a problem (unlike the use of wireless microphone).My usual set up is for PowerPoint presentations.  The wireless microphone goes into line one, and the sound from the computer goes to Bluetooth so that the speaker is completely wireless (with battery pack in it), and it can be place closer to the audience, or even among the audience, to compensate the volume.  The battery lasts about ten hours, so it's more than you need for most presentations. Freeplay serves this purpose perfectly, with the exception of mic volume.  If I had the bag, that's complete.I recommend it!

The watch looks very cool, and that's it.  The user manual also looks cool, but totally useless.  After some attempts to get my phone to recognize it, I found on iHealth website that there are only 8 Android phones listed as compatible. My LG G2, and my wife's LG G3 are not part of it.  After an overnight charge, I gave it another try, and suddenly it got connected with my phone.The first thing it asked you to do after the successful connection was to update the firmware.  It took me 30+ attempts to get the firmware completely installed.  With each attempt, it made about 2% or 3% progress, sometimes none, before it got disconnected from the phone.Yet, the rest of the story is still similar.  The watch stays black and blank until you make a recommended move to make it show the time, but it is erratic, sometimes it will show but sometimes no matter how much you shake it or tap it, it stays blank. It is also impossible to see it in the sun.I wanted a watch like this to track my sleep quality.  I have other watches for heart rate and exercise.  I woke up yesterday morning, to check how I slept, it showed that I slept for zero minutes.  Disappointed.  Then I drove to church, had a big lunch after church, came home and took a nap--a lazy Sunday. After waking up, the watch told me that I had accumulated 3,300+ steps and burned 856 calories.  What a deal!  I love this watch!  With it, I can burn a lot of calories by eating and sleeping, unless going to church really burns that much calories.I can go on and on about my experience with this watch.  Never in my life, have I see so poorly executed product.

Let's start with the box.  It's a brown box with no creativity in presentation.  I was expecting a prettier packing for a luxury item like this. So be it!  Now the product itself doesn't appear to be high quality.  It's more like toy quality.  Still, I don't mine that much, as long as it works.  I already deducted one star for the presentation.So far the Airfloss works well.  I floss regularly with a flosspick, but I know the flosspick doesn't wash between teeth.  So I'm happy to add this Airfloss to my hygiene.  If this one breaks (like some other reviewers said), I wouldn't be surprise because the quality appearance.  But, I'm now addicted to it because it makes my teeth feel really clean.  I hope it lasts and so far it does.Recommended by our family dentist, I use Airfloss with Act Anticavity Fluoride Mouthwash.  This doubles the protection of your teeth.For personal hygiene, I recommend it!

I've been an Oral-B user for over ten years and this is the first time I tried Sonicare, even though I've seen it at the dentists office very often.  My first impression is that the built quality does not appear as good as Oral-B.  Even the brush tip looks cheaper, compared to that of Oral-B.Brushing with it is a different experience.  Because it vibrate many times faster than Oral-B, it feels quite strange, making you wonder if it is really brushing at all.  It has three speeds, and the fastest one really tickles my cheek--you know that uncomfortable itchy feel when you touch something vibrating extremely fast.  It also has a whitening mode.The after brushing experience is different also.  My teeth feel smooth and polished, while Oral-B makes my teeth feel a little rough and clean.It seems that I can't compare them as which one is better because they each does their job in their own way to make your teeth clean.  My dentist cousin recommend Sonicare because it is less abrasive on the teeth. My personal impression is based on the product quality--Oral-B has much quality look, from packaging to the charger stand.  The box that comes with Sonicare is so toughly sealed that you have to have a pair of strong scissors, or a box cutter, to open it--totally lack of creativity.It will take a while to convince me and convert me, but I can say I am happy with both for their own unique technologies.  While the brush tips are more expensive for Sonicare, I found a third party maker selling here on Amazon very cheap.  I've ordered a 20 pack to share it with the family if they want to try.If you are still using manual toothbrush nowadays, it's time to choose an electronic one.  You save money and time on your dentist visit.I recommend it.

This case is very well made, with good quality material and a hard plastic base both to protect impact from the bottom and keep it stand firm.You can fit a DSLR (mine is Sony Alpha A580L) with an average zoom lens very comfortably, with a little room for a small second lens.  I wish it has more room for a wider lens that I have.I also have a Lumix GH3, which fits well with a second lens.  For this it seems a little too deep.Based on the shape, it is quite obvious that it is intended to be used for one camera and lens, without room for additional lens.  I always have a second lens, so it is a little frustrating.I wish this bag is a little shallower and wider.

This frother is such a time saver when it comes to making a cappuccino at home.  It's much faster and convenient than the handheld frothers.  The product is made of good quality material and elegant design.If you've never used one like this, you must read the instruction carefully because the instruction is a little confusing.  Basically, It has thee modes--hot froth, hot milk, and cold froth.  Press the button once for hot froth, twice for hot milk, and hold a few seconds for cold froth.The cleaning instruction is also important.  You can't rinse the jug under the faucet.  You can only wipe it with a sponge.  But, cleaning is easy.  it doesn't disrupt your enjoyment of your cappuccino at all.The resulted froth is very smooth and rich in flavor.  I use whole milk.I recommend it!

I bought this monopod partly because Kodak is a reputable brand.  It turned out to be quite a disappointment. The quality is very poor. Most importantly, I bought it also because of the stand.  It is a total joke.  There's no way to make it stand on it's own at all.  With a light twist, the support is bent into the thin tube of the bottom leg.  Why would anyone make something that is not at all supposed to work?  Kodak, wake up!

Growing up in a third world country, one soap bar was all we had for our hair, face, and body.  Today we've made things complicated with shampoo, conditioner, facial soup, and body wash, etc.  Sometimes, I wished I had an all in one solution.  Now Axe 3 in 1 fulfills my wish.As for performance, it can't be compared to using best quality individual items, but for my busy days, this is time saving and it does the job satisfactorily.If you are a busy man, I recommend it!

The pin that connects the two parts of the head broke.  I hardly used this belt even though I bought it two years ago because I have other belts to use.  I've owned many brands of ratchet belts, but none of them broke apart like this.

Our entire family uses Cetaphil as our favorite lotion because it's gentle and simply works on our skin type.  So when we see Benzac Acne Eliminating Cleanser, we give it a try.The texture of Benzac Acne Eliminating Cleanser is very similar to Cetaphi, except it's cleanser rather than lotion.  One of our daughter is now using prescription formula.  Comparing to the prescription formula, this cleanser has much less active ingredients.  The skin does feel dryer after use because it eliminates oil on the face.For long term minor treatment and prevention, this is a trusted brand to try.

Unlike the color shown in the picture, the Ivory color blanket I received is much whiter, which is not a problem.  The material is better than I expected, soft and weighty, great as a summer blanket.  It's not thin at all.  The patterns, the edges, the feel--everything presents quality and comfort.It's also large enough for two to cuddle in it.  If you don't want to use it for two, you can fold it in half to use it for one, which gives me more weight that I like.I recommend it!

This keyboard case does not fit any of my 10 inch tablets.  I have 3 Asus Transformers and 1 Samsung Galaxy Tab.  Even though you can stretch the tablet holder to make it grab the tablet, the tablets extends outside of the case, making the two edges unprotected.The material and construction is great.  The keyboard is small but comfortable.  The design of the cover using magnet to secure movement is wonderful.If you have a tablet that fits perfectly, this is a good keyboard case to have.

This body wash works great on me.  It keeps my skin smooth and hydrated. The scent is also manly.  It gives you a lift in your wellbeing after the wash.The quantity is generous and you don't have to use much to cover the entire body.I recommend it!

The color and design is very elegant but the fabric is somewhat crude if you look closely.  It's good for occasional use but it doesn't seem to last if you use it regularly.  It's make of polyester but it looks like linen and have a nice weight for it to stay put on the table.  If you don't look closely, it does give a good appearance for your table setting.For occasional use and for the reasonable price, I recommend it.

Preen Garden Weed Preventer is very effective in preventing weeds from growing.  It's easy to apply and water activated.I wish it will prevent the weeds from growing for more than 3 months allowing prevention for the entire season. But, applying once every three months is not a big deal.It's not pet safe.  So if you have pets, you need to keep them away especially at the beginning of the application.I recommend it!

This is a very practical mouse.  I was expecting a little more sleek design and classy finish, but it appears a little crude and clumsy.  Other than that the functionality is unquestionably great.It works on all kinds of surfaces I tried on--light, dark, with or without mouse pad, on a plastic or glass table top.I like the fact that I can adjust the resolution of the mouse by just pressing the + and - buttons on the mouse next to the wheel.  When I need it to move fast, I use higher resolution, and when I need to draw a detail graphic, I use the lower so that it moves slower.There are also two additional buttons on the right for forward and back movement on the browser.After all, it's a very practical mouse and it does the precise job I need it to do.I recommend it!

This SOL Republic Shadow Wireless In-Ear Headphones is very well made with rubbery coating throughout and the cables to the ear pieces feel strong and durable.  It's also waterproof, which is a big plus.The sound excellent, with good bass to enjoy.It should be a great pair of earphones.  Unfortunately, I happen to own a pair of LG Tone, so I ended up comparing them.  LG has a smart feature of allowing you to hide the ear pieces magnetically parked in the neck piece, so the head phones are virtually invisible when you don't need to use them.  I miss that feature on Shadow, even though Shadow has better sound output.Another problem is Shadow is not designed to stay put on the neck and more likely than Tone to fall off your neck if you are active.  If you take this to a theme park of some active adventures, you would likely to lose it.  LG Tone is not so easy to fall off.In general, I still like the feel, style, and sound of Shadow and ignore its weaknesses for the enjoyment of the music. Those weaknesses can be major or minor depending on how you want to use Shadow.  One star is deducted for those weaknesses.For its great sound, I recommend it.  If you are very active, avoid it.

This monitor is very convenient for figuring out what electrical device is using how much electricity.  It's much more easier than figuring that out using a multimeter.I like the fact that you can input the KW/H cost and it calculates the cost for you.It can also be an educational device to teach the kids how much each of their devices is spending and help them develop a habit of energy conservation.The device is well made with pleasant colors.I recommend it!

Purell 9121-03-EC Hand Sanitizing Wipes are the best sanitizing wipes I've ever used.  Even though they are scented, the scent is very mild and it won't disrupt other fragrance that you might be using.  The wipes are very soft but smooth, but strong enough to stay intact even when you use it with some force.I also like the size of the container It's just about the size of Venti Starbucks coffee, making it easy to store in your car, bag, or any places that you would imagine.I recommend it!

I subscribe to Pure Protein chocolate bars and I get 21 grams of protein and they taste fine as protein bars.  I was excited to see these fruit and nut bars, hoping that it will taste much better.  However, they don't reach my expectation. They don't taste bad, but I just don't like to combination of tastes and the softness of the bars.The major concern is the price.  If you can afford to pay more than 4 bucks for a snack bar, go for it.  I will stay with their chocolate bars at a buck a piece with more protein.

This STIGA Supreme Racket is much lighter than I expected.  I also have a much cheaper performance series racket, STIGA Pure.
