Some have dismissed these books as "chick lit," but how laughably wrong they are.  I am a male--an alpha male--and these books speak to my soul.  You see, I too am a billionaire--an obsessed billionaire, tortured by an unsolvable riddle from my youth--a shifting maze of mystery, forever just beyond my grasp.This is my obsession.On one side is a world of perfect order, as pure as white linen.  The fruit of my labors since childhood, this is the world of my dreams, the world I long to share with you.  But be careful, reader, for beyond this untrammeled realm lie my demons.Despite all my wealth, I cannot master these blues.  They flash like shadows through the corners of my mind, yet try as I might, I cannot take the pieces and make them whole again.  Every time I think I have the answer, it slips through my fingers like water.  Oh, reader, kiss my eyes--my sparkling blue billionaire eyes--that they might see through this terrible enigma!The blues scatter as my thoughts turn to green--the green of greed, of money, of bottomless envy. Can you possibly understand? Even with all my billions, I cannot gather enough green to satisfy my terrible need. Oh, curse the day this horrible obsession seized me!Red! Now all I see is red! The color of passion, of unquenchable desire. It courses through my veins like hot, throbbing lava.  My fingers fly in frenzied motion, probing the scarlet mysteries, seeking consummation, only to find--to my horror--that I have violated the one pure realm!Take it from me, reader!  Take this obsession!In a rage--an obsessive rage--I hurl it against the wall, smashing it into a thousand pieces.  Damn! Damn this Rubik's Cube! It is destroying my soul!

Do you have a taste for luxury?  Then perhaps you'll appreciate the Rolex Yacht Master II.  Inspired by the entrepreneurial spirit of the Middle Passage, this extraordinary timepiece will literally tell you what time it is, day or night.  Why $38,000?  It's made of gold--priceless gold.  And while gold is currently priced around $1200 an ounce and this watch weighs only an ounce and a half, will gold tell you what time it is?  This watch will.  This timeless expression of time is backed by a three-year warranty.  That's value.  And long after the warranty has expired, this watch will continue to express your values.  That's luxury.

First off, let's dispense with the polite fiction that these are meant for cooking.  I know they have to market them that way for legal reasons, but honestly, if you're hungry, throw a Hot Pocket in the microwave.  If you want to defend your home, reach for a frying pan.I believe you can't have too much protection.  I keep a sauté pan strapped to my thigh for conceal-and-carry, a wok in our closet, an omelet pan by the front door, and a waffle iron under my pillow.  I may wake up with grid marks on my face, but I don't lose sleep over home invasions.My wife has a 10 inch saucepan.  It's a lady's skillet, sure, but it's a solid piece of iron, and she knows how to handle it.  We take it to the range regularly--not to cook, mind you, but to develop wrist control.  That's the thing about frying pans--if you're going to draw one in anger, you better know how to use it.  If the perp gets control, you'll be the one with the dented forehead.As the primary protector of our home, I need to be able to face down any griddle fight.  That's why I invested in this 20-inch, 23-pound peacemaker.  Just the sight of it will make an assailant crepe his pants.  And this cast-iron monster will go through doors.  It will lay an intruder out cold.  A little backswing, and you'll be washing his face off with Palmolive.Some people say I'm crazy, keeping this much cookware in the house.  But as for me, I'd rather have a 23-pound skillet and not need it, than need it and not have it.

When my wife suggested this Baby Einstein series, I said no way--no way am I wasting my hard-earned dollar on that gimmicky crap.  And no way is listening to Mozart on a xylophone gonna turn our kid into some kind of super-genius.  Boy was I wrong.It started slowly.  First, my wife noticed an increase in her sight words.  Next, the nanny said she was talking in complete sentences.  Then I started seeing it.  I'll never forget the first time she said, "May I have my nubbie?"  "May I".  Like she's from England.  I thought it was cute.But from there, it got completely out of hand.  I used to do this thing with her, where I held my hands up to my face, then took them down again, and she'd giggle.  The last time she laughed at me was when I mispronounced "restaurateur".I used to read to her, to help put her down.  Five minutes of Green Eggs & Ham and she was out like a light.  Now it's two hour of Kierkegaard, followed by questions--questions I can't answer.  What do I know about the "infinite qualitative distinction between man and God"?  I'm a broker!The other day, I take her to the playground, and I forget her juice box.  Big deal, right?  "Waa waa waa," she goes--she's three.  I say "I'll make it up to you."  "With interest," she says.  "Fine," I say.  Next thing you know, she's built an abacus out of Cheerios and I apparently I owe her a crate of Sunny D!I drew the line.  I told her "No.""Why not?" she says."Cuz I'm your father," I say.  "It's the principle."She says, "No, dumb-dumb--it's the interest."  What the hell?  I can't win over here!Look, I just wanted what's best for my kid--to be happy and healthy and get into a competitive pre-school.  But this super-genius stuff I can do without.  I'm sending this back and ordering the purple dinosaur.  I want my dumb kid back.

I am not normally one to write reviews like this, but I'm making an exception for this shampoo, for reasons I will explain shortly.  First off, it's great shampoo.  It lathers really well, so you don't have to use that much of it.  It also smells great, without being too perfumy.  And it somehow keeps your hair from getting tangled.  I don't know if they put conditioner in it or what.  All I know is it works.I bought this back around 2007-2008.  I was solo backpacking through Indonesia.  Obviously, I had to travel light, which is why I got the travel size.I was staying mostly in hostels with communal bathrooms, and the Fructis went with me everywhere.  Then, on my last couple days on Wowoni, I must have left it in the bathroom in a hostel.  I don't know the exact day.  But it was almost definitely the second or third to last day of my stay.  It was at one of two hostels-- one was called the Tropical something or other, and the other one I think used to be a banana plantation.By the time I got to Wangiwangi, I couldn't find it, so obviously, I left the Fructis in one of the above-mentioned bathrooms.  It was about half-full.  It also had my name-- RAY-- clearly printed on the bottom.I checked with both of the hostels shortly after returning to the states.  One of them said they didn't have the Fructis (though I'm not totally convinced they knew what I was talking about, due to the language barrier) and the other place straight-up refused to check (wtf?).If anyone picked it up, I would REALLY appreciate its prompt return.  If you used a little bit, that's okay, since I know a lot of people assume the shampoo in those hostels is communal.  But obviously, mine was not communal because it had my name on it.  If it's a lot more than half used, I'm not going to be thrilled.  Not that I'm looking to get anyone in trouble.  I just want my shampoo back.I know it's been a little while.  I meant to post about this earlier, but to be honest, I've got a lot of other stuff going on.  I can't devote my entire life to tracking down this shampoo.  Nor do I think I should have to.  This is pretty cut and dried.To recap:  Fructis, 3.4 oz. bottle, half-used, in a hostel in Indonesia around 2007-08.  Please, leave your information in the comments section.  (And if this has anything to do with my missing Juicy Fruit, I'm going to be seriously p!$$ed.)

Greetings from the South Pole!I am thrilled to be spending the winter here, observing an isolated colony of Emperor penguins from my tiny shelter.  Think of it-- the only human being on this vast, vanishing terrain--just me and the penguins.  I will learn things about their winter behavior patterns that no one has ever known!  Humbling.I was able to recover the supplies from the airlift the other day.  Can't believe that's the last contact I'll have with civilization for three months!  Thanks for all the canned peaches and the brownies.  No doubt they will give me cheer during the long, sunless winter.  Am I crazy to be looking forward to this?BTW, something is wrong with the toothbrush you sent-- it makes an annoying sound when you try to brush with it.  It works, though, so why am I complaining?*****(Week 2)Hi, again.  South Pole here.Boy, they weren't kidding when they said it gets dark down here.  Almost no light at all.I've been studying the penguin colony through infrared goggles.  It seems the females have transferred the eggs to the males, who are huddled around them.  They stand in a big circle, sheltering themselves from the wind.  It's cold as f#$! down here, that's for sure.I finally figured out what was wrong with the toothbrush.  It's apparently "music" coming out of the darn thing-- a woman singing what sounds like a nursery rhyme, only more repetitive.  I tried wrapping the handle with gauze to muffle it, but the sound keeps coming out.  The singer refers to herself as "J.B."-- remind me not to listen to her when I get back!  Ha ha.Anyway, am continuing to use the toothbrush, as I have been very much enjoying the brownies and canned peaches!  They are keeping my spirits up.  And if I can discover anything to help this penguin colony increase their reproduction rate, it will have all been worth it.*****(Week 3)South Pole here.  The blackness is total now.  The cold, bitter.I can barely make out the penguins, even with the infrared.  They keep their backs to me, as if protecting some dark secret.Have stopped using the toothbrush.  It's not worth it.  Still enjoying brownies and peaches, though.Just ten more weeks to go.*****(Week 4)South Pole.I have a terrible toothache, probably from the brownies and canned peaches.  I tried to start brushing again, though it is terribly difficult.  Even when it is not playing, the song remains in my head for hours-- perhaps days.  No way to tell in this dark hell.  Her voice haunts my dreams.The penguins appear menacing.*****(Week 5)The tooth has gone septic.  The pain is excruciating.I have been forced to use the toothbrush again.  It is my only contact with the human world-- yet the voice seems to not only lack humanity, but to mock it.The "music" is insipid to the point of actual cruelty, as if you paired a ringtone of elevator music with a Hallmark card translated from Japanese.  A computer has tried to keep the singer within the proper key, but her horribly reedy, flat and lifeless voice is, if anything, less human than the computer.  It drones on and on like a mockingbird from an apocalypse.I fear for my sanity.*****(Week 6)I have buried the tooshbruth-- is that the right word?  Wait, no, toothbrush.I have buried it, thrown away the brownies and peaches, and will last the winter on penguin meat.  I think this is the right thing to do.*****(Week 7)Penguins running low.  Dug up the toothbrush, and have started listening to it again.  I kind of like it.*****(Week 8)Penguins gone. Have made a coat from their hides.  I am the Penguin Emperor now.Have been listening to the song over and over and over and over.  I will fly to the Land of Summer where the Toothbrush Lady lives.  I love you, J.B.  I la la la la la la la la love you.The time is now.*****(Coda)Capt. Marvin Gillespie's body was recovered 50 yards from his encampment on the Larsen Ice Shelf, his body draped in a horrific moo-moo of penguin pelts, his hands still clutching the toothbrush, which continued to play Justin Bieber's "Love Me."  Said Sgt. Phil Bradmoore, who discovered the scene the following spring, "It was horrible.  I don't think I'll ever get it out of my head."

I just put down Ann's latest manifesto, and I am trembling with a heady mix of rage, indignation, and conservative ire (itself a combination of indignation and rage). Once again, Ann has brewed a steaming cauldron of truth, into which she gleefully tosses socialists, teachers, underly-conservative conservatives, overly-conservative conservatives, bleeding-heart firemen, pre-K freeloaders, race-baiting non-whites, gay supremacists, Santa-bashers, and those most cynical of media-seeking crones--the 9/11 widows.  Reading this stream of semi-consciousness is like listening to the rants of a recent divorcee, or sitting next to a madwoman on a bus-- incisive and hilarious!Here at last is a lawyer willing to stand up to the special interests of lawyers; a pundit who lays bare the vapid gravy train of punditry; a political intellectual who tirelessly attacks the political intellectuals who only know how to attack; a New York media millionaire who isn't afraid to expose the New York media millionaires' hypocrisy. By being the very thing against which she rails, Ann holds up not one but TWO mirrors to the liberals' extremist hellscape, creating an infinite fractal of self-perpetuating hate-thought. What a gift.These meticulously re-published screeds are classic Coulter. Whether she's roasting FDR for his bungling of national security; bravely naming President Clinton's obvious homosexuality; or skewering the Canadians for their disastrous invasion of Vietnam, Ann is always in command of the facts. She practically invents them.Some have questioned how a cocktail-swilling 50-something spinster has become a champion for traditional family values. These are the typical ad hominem attacks spewed by anti-American baby-hating liberal fascists. The only thing keeping Ann from her dream of maternity is the mirthless sarcasm she mistakes for wit, serrated vaginal teeth, and breast milk that is genetically indistinguishable from cobra venom. While these traits have kept her from suckling her own pit of wriggling youngsters, they didn't keep her from serving as wet-nurse to the Cheney family, when a young Liz was angrily demanding the teat.For those brainwashed by the "facts" of the liberal lamestream, the America Ann presents will be hardly recognizable. You will probably look back with as much embarrassment as I did at the good will you used to feel toward your fellow Americans, and cringe at the optimism of our shared struggle to create a more perfect union. Was that really me? Yikes!Thanks to Ann, I've learned to mistrust those who I'm told have ideas different from the ones I've been told to have. I turn a deaf ear to those too arrogant to listen to my point of view, and whose minds are filled with a hatred and suspicion that I can hardly comprehend. I imagine the things I would say to these people, had Ann not warned me against talking to them.The left-wing hate machine will never understand the simple but profound beauty of Ann's message, but we on the right know that Ann is a gift, all too fleeting in this world. Souls like hers appear only once in a millennium, if that. Someday, she'll shed her mortal coil, claim her reward and vanish into a warm, glowing hereafter. But until then, she's our own little piece of hell on earth.**********Hey team!  And by team, I'm not including Democrats, who would never play on a team unless it was a team playing against itself because they hate themselves and are totally STUPID and terrorists!  LOL!  Plus they're gay (ske-dooosh!)But seriously.  I took some totes justified heat for not including enough specific facts from Ann's book in my rave review.  It's just that there are so many of them, and unlike Ann, I only have a normal-sized brain (twice as big as a Democrat's, though!  Zing!)Anyway.  So here are a few real parts of history that I learned from reading Ann's AMAZINGLY well-researched, informative book.  Like, remember Republicans' Southern Strategy, where they took advantage of the fact that Johnson had signed the Civil Rights Act to woo angry Southern white voters who didn't want black kids attending their schools, drinking from their fountains, and swimming in their pools?  And how the parties subsequently realigned, and the formerly Democratic South has been solidly Republican ever since, catered to by Republicans through racist dog whistles like "states' rights"?  Well, neither does Ann!  Cuz it DIDN'T HAPPEN, STUPID!!  Invented by liberal "historians."  There is NO RACISM left in the South!  All those people died AGES AGO!!!  Except for racist Democrats, of course.  So why do blacks vote 90% Democratic?  Because they're STUPID, STUPID!!!  They'd have to be-- they're Democrats!!  Snap!Or here's something I learned.  The National Rifle Association was started to protect blacks from Democrats-- and the only reason Democrats want gun control is so that blacks won't be able to protect themselves from racist homicidal Democrats!  That's a fact!  Don't believe it?  Then you're STUPID!!!By the way, the book is full of HILARIOUS slams on blacks and latinos, and how if Ann had her way, we'd only let Europeans into our country.  But that DOESN'T MEAN ANN'S A RACIST.  CUZ THEY'RE JOKES!!!  Get it?  If not, you're a stupid Democrat!  Pow!Oh oh oh, before I forget.  Here's an AWESOME joke from Ann about racism.  She says the O.J. verdict made us even for slavery!!  Isn't that clever???  OMG, I was laughing so hard when I read that!  (It's even funnier the way she tells it-- BUY THE BOOK!!!!)Ann also totally rips the lid off every Democrat's favorite Democrat-- John Edwards! Too soon?  Think again.  This ripped-from-last-decade's-headlines story gets a fresh take from Ann, who thinks he was wrong and dishonest.  Take that, Democrats!  Still want to run him in 2016?  Kaboom!!!And speaking of timely commentary, Ann devotes several chapters to why you should have voted for Romney.  Why are these articles relevant in a book published one year after the election?  BECAUSE SHE TOLD YOU SO, STUPID!!!  What are you, a Democrat?  LMAO!!!!Also, I didn't know until I read this book that Reagan was actually mean, just like Ann-- that's how he destroyed the Soviet Union.  It had nothing to do with a collapsing oil market that drained the coffers of an over-extended and horrifically managed ideological dinosaur, causing it to collapse under the weight of its own stifling oppression.  It was Reagan's mean-face!  And his one-liners!  If you don't know that, you're a STUPID DEMOCRAT!!  Ha ha!!Oh oh oh, another thing.  Ann points out how Occupy Wall Street hooligans were STUPID and smelly and ugly and didn't know what they wanted.  On the other hand, Tea Partiers are super smart and polite and politically astute.  So TRUE!!!!  You never saw shockingly stupid, racist, uninformed people at Tea Party rallies.  NOT ONE!!!!  And if you ever want cogent political analysis and smart, workable solutions to complex political problems, just turn a camera on one of these tri-pointed patriots.  They want the government out of Social Security.  Who doesn't?!  They want their taxes lowered!  And don't tell me taxes under Obama have been lower than they ever were under Reagan.  That's totally missing the point!  The point is that Obama WANTS to raise your taxes!  How do we know?  He's a DEMOCRAT!!!  Read the book, STUPID!!!!This is just the tip of the iceberg-- there are so many amazing facts that you will NEVER hear anywhere else.The dummy Democrats are always trying to put their spin on Ann--as an intellectual snake oil peddler, pandering to the prejudices of a sinking lower middle class; a scorned high school nerd trying to break into the mean-girl crowd three decades too late; or an aging blond barfly, telling off-color jokes for the dwindling attention of the 2 a.m. set.  But that just shows how STUPID you are, Democrats!She's not really blond!!  SKEDOOOSH!!!!!!

Thank you, Jeanette!  What a lovely sweater.  I haven't worn one like this since George and I were in Ireland, right before Dennis was born.  That was our last trip abroad, wasn't it George?  Well, thank you.  What a treasure.Okay, let's see  who's next?  Oh, here's one for Dennis.  A nice big box for Dennis.  There are you, Dennis.  What do you think's in it?  My goodness, you ARE giving that a good shake, aren't you?  Why don't you open it?  Just open it, Dennis.  All right, don't throw the paper, Dennis.  Watch the elbows--Aunt Jeanette is sitting right next to you.  That's better, okay.  What did Santa bring you?  That's right, it's a Peepee Doll!  Just like the one from the birdyplane.....Because it's what he wanted, George....Well, you're not the one who has to spend 16 hours a day listening to him scream "Peepee Doll", are you?....Well, I don't think any of us knows "how this is going to end", and you're being needlessly negative.Jeannette, Dennis saw it in SkyMall and became a little obsessed.  And now you have it, don't you, Dennis?  Your very own Peepee Doll.Now let's see what old Kris Kringle brought for Aunt Jeannette... Dennis, what are you doing?  Dennis don't do that.  Not in front of guests, Dennis. Not ever, and especially not in front of guests.  Yes, you have one too.  Now put it away.  Of course yours is bigger-- because that's a doll baby and you're 42.  Put it away, Dennis.  All the way.  Jeannette does not want to see it, Dennis.  Look at her face, look at the cues.  Does she look happy?  I think she looks frightened.  Put it away.  There we go.  Good choice.Okay.  Now let's see what old Kris--Dennis, don't do that.  Don't put those in your mouth.  Those are not for putting in your mouth.  Dennis?  No one cares how many you can put in your mouth, Dennis.  It's not funny.  If you're the only one laughing, it's not funny.  Put them back in the box.  Don't throw those at Aunt Jeanette.  I don't think she's enjoying it.  Dennis, if you can't play nice with the Peepee Doll, Daddy will have to take it away...George, you most certainly WILL get in the middle of this...because you are his father...Dennis, put the penises back in the box.  Dennis!  Do not throw the penises into the fire.  Dennis?  Dennis!  That's it.  That's enough.  George, take the Peepee Doll from Dennis.  Right now.  You just lost the Peepee Doll, Dennis.  No more Peepee Doll for Dennis.  Grab it, George!  Both arms, dear, hold on with both arms.  Let go of it, Dennis.  Let go.  Let go.  Let your father have the Peepee Doll.  Good...okay.  Are we all calm now?  Dennis?  All right, that's good.Now, let's see, what did old--Dennis!  Put down the tree!  Dennis, you put down that Christmas tree this instant!  Put it down!  Don't you even think about putting that in the fire, Dennis.  George!  George, give Dennis back the Peepee Doll!  Put down the tree, Dennis, and Daddy will give you the Peepee Doll.  There we go.  Okay. Let's all take a deep breath.  Everyone just, just take a deep breath and calm down.Well, my goodness.  We've certainly had some excitement, haven't we?  Now, let's see what Kris Kringle--Dennis, don't look at your Aunt Jeanette like that.  Staring is very rude, Dennis.  Dennis, sit down!  No licking, Dennis!  We don't lick our guests!  Don't--Put Jeanette down, Dennis!  Put Aunt Jeanette down this instant!  George, get the shot!  Dennis, no licking!  Get the shot, George! Go limp, Jeanette!  Go limp!  We don't lick guests, Dennis!  George, the neck!  It has to be in the neck!There...there...there he goes.  There goes Dennis.  Okay.  Bedtime for Dennis.  Good night, Dennis.  Okay.  Leave him there, George.  He's perfectly all right.  It's just a mild horse sedative.  He'll be fine a few hours.Well, my goodness.  Is everyone all right?  Jeanette?  Everyone's all right, okay.  Let's just... let's all have a seat.  Scone, Jeanette?  No?  Okay.  Let's all just...stop crying.  George, please stop crying.  There.  There, that's better.Okay.  Now, where were we?  Ah, yes.  Let's see what old Kris Kringle has brought Aunt Jeanette...

I want to start this off by thanking Kleenex for selling these in 36-packs.  I've put it on subscription, and if they want to start selling a 72-pack, sign me up.  I have three reasons for needing this much Kleenex, and their names are Liam, Samuel and Hank.This is how it goes in this house.  First the Kleenex disappears.  Then the toilet paper.  Then they go for fabrics.  And you don't want it to get there, unless you're ready to invest in a five gallon drum of Fabreeze.This used to be a good Christian home.  But it's not about moral judgment anymore.  I'm way beyond that.  I'm in survival mode.  If I don't supply absorbent paper products, I'm going to find my dish towels hidden in the basement, stiff as aluminum.  The other day, I almost cut my hand on a sock.  I am sorry to speak so frankly, but with three teenage boys, a woman has got to be practical.The funny part is, they think they're being sneaky, with their 45 minute showers and sudden need for "privacy", as if I'm going to walk in on them journaling.  They slink around the house like unfixed cats, while I try to announce my location at all times.  No one needs to ask me to knock anymore.  I knock on the walls.  I practically wear a cow bell.  I'm not looking to catch anyone by surprise, believe me.  I'm just trying to get through this.The other day my husband was watching me unload the groceries, and he asks me, all sweetness and light, "Honey, what're you doing with all that Kleenex?"I about knocked him off his chair.

[THIS REVIEW IS SATIRICAL, AND NOT AN ENDORSEMENT OF ACTUAL AXE MURDER.  DON'T DO IT.  IT'S WRONG.]I really like this axe.  It's got a nice solid piece of hickory in the handle, and the head's high carbon steel--it needs some sharpening out of the box, but then it keeps its edge.  I don't know how it would hold up against a tree, but it works great on people.I'm an axe murderer.  By which I mean, I kill people with an axe.  If you have a problem with it, drop it in the comments section below and know that I will never read it.  I'm not trying to win a popularity contest.  It's just who I am.Who do I kill?  I don't have a type.  I think guys who'll only kill blondes or Asians are creepy.  Personally, I'm more interested in what's on the inside.  Like a great sense of humor.  Check this out.  The other day, I'm in the library, loading up on a bunch of early Phillip K. Dick (The Man in the High Castle, The Three Stigmata of Palmer Eldrich, etc.--if you have a problem with dystopian sci-fi, again, leave it in the comments).  Anyway the librarian--this low-key hipster chick in hornrims--says, real dry, "What's with all the old Dick?  Having a lemon party?"  I died laughing.  We both did.

Product works well, but marking down because picture is misleading. This clearly shows the 2 different length extension bars, and I didn't even think to read the specs which says it is just the 3" one.

I have purchased these jeans 4 times, the first 3 pairs were purchased at a levis store, and were the exact same jeans, fit, style and everything except that I chose 3 different "washes" (colors) and then this one purchased from amazon was the 4th time purchasing these, though it was the same wash as one of the others I had bought before. Now the issue is this: All 4 of these jeans I have purchased have fit and warn very differently from each other. 2 of the 3 I purchased in store this spring were the perfect length (they were all supposed to be 38/29) where the third one dragged on the floor a lot and I had to take it to get hemmed. This pair from amazon was the longest of all 3 and I can fold up a few inches and they still touch the floor. 2 of the previous pairs shunk majorly after the first wash and ended up being like skinny jeans, thile the third and the Amazon pair have stayed loose and baggy, and again the Amazon ones are the most loose and baggy of the 4.I think I may be switching brands as these are just too inconsistent.

I had heard a lot of bad things about this from a critic for many of our papers here in town, and also from a local radio station, so I was hesitant to watch it, and my wife had no intention of watching it, but because of the plot and my love for the video games I decided to go ahead and rent it one night and didn't tell my wife what we were watching. We actually both ended up liking it quite a bit. It is not actually directed by Adam Sandler so it doesn't have a lot of his cheesy reoccurring jokes and characters and really he is just quite tamed down in it, so that is good.The plot is a bit weak, and they jump to the thick of it without much build up, but really it was quite a bit of fun, and some good laughs.

These locks are great! they work amazingly, and even though it is a bit annoying at first to have to grab the magnet every time, and at first we were thinking we might have rather had the latch kind so you don't have to grab a thing any time you want to open something, after you get used to it they are the best. Also they are better than the latch kind because they are so low profile, you cant even tell they are there.The reason I marked down one star is because of how they are may/work/ shaped, there are many drawers (at least in our house) that wouldn't work for them, so we were only able to use them on cupboards. The reason being that the drawers have a ledge piece that meets flush inside of the cabinet when closed and that ledge is right in the middle of where these need to be installed, so there is no way to attach them. Most low end modern cabinetry is built this way, so I think drawers may be a problem for just about anyone.

These work very well! They are really good at eliminating the background noise so you don't have creepy/annoying humming all night, I also love that you can turn the screen off and have just sound while you sleep. It also has a function that will alternate between the 2 cameras every few seconds and that is nice.The sound and picture quality is good, but as others mentioned not like full HD like it looks in the picture. This was perfect for us since we have twins, so we can keep one camera on each crib, but you can also still hear both of them in alternating mode since the mic's are so good. The night mode is good to, and you can see the kids very well in the dark.These are ridiculously easy to set up, basically you just turn them all on and they find eachother, I had one time where I had turned one camera off, and it didn't find automatically when I turned it back on, so I just had to push this "find" button that is on the front of the camera. Also I found that if both cameras are on first then you turn on the receiver it reconnects everything easies without ever having to use the find/pair button.
Wow! I was very surprised at how thick and quality this case was. Hands down this is the best holder I have bought, and much cheaper than others that were very thin.

I really like these things. Were we live we always had a ring in the bowl after just a couple of weeks, even if we didn't use tone of the bathrooms at all. Using these it is several weeks or at least until it shrinks down all the way that the toilet bowl doesn't get a ring. The main thing I like though is that they have a very strong scent and keep the bathroom smelling like it was just deep cleaned al the time, particularly for the first 2 weeks, and on the first 2 or 3 days you can even smell it when you walk in the house.Others have rated bad because I think they expect the thing to clean the toilet for them but that is not the point. If you just want something to help with hard/ didrty water rings, and to keep a fresh scent these are great.I had tried the blue ones as well and liked them, I think the scent of these is more pleasant/welcoming and less overpowering cleaner
Great soap, but a bit smaller than expected. obviously I could read the size, but I didn't pay attention because in the past I have ordered this and it was a bigger one for the same price
Socks work well, they are nice and thick, but they are much longer than expected

I can not for the life of me get or keep these things lit! I've used a couple other brands of lump charcoal and first of all the others had more consistently sized pieces, all a good medium size and this one they are either huge or most of them are very tiny little chips.I have tried several methods including a Weber chimney I have and they will not get hot for me, I once left them in the chimney for over 45 min and kept going out and re-doucing and lighting them and even after that time only a handful in the heart of the chimney were red and the rest were completely cold.I also once started up a bag of the match light briquettes and put some of these mixed in and on top of those and was smoking a shoulder for 8 hours, and as far as I could tell not a single piece of these charcoals started up, and certainly never got white. Once I dumped out the bed, everything was dust except about the same amount of these I put in looked just like they did out of the bag.I purchased this brand because it had by far the best reviews on Amazon, and the brand I normally buy from my hardware store ("cowboy" I think) were rated poorly, I will be sticking with that other brand from now on as they have always worked well for me, and they also produce a more aromatic burn, almost enough to smoke something without chips.

such a cute little outfit. it is good quality, and looks dashing on my son
this is a really cute dress. it is quality, and fits my daughter great

This item is basically densely packed cardboard with a textured paper coating. It looks good from several feet away, but looks quite cheap up close, also only one side of the wood/cardboard mixture is covered in the textured wood paper, where the other side of all the pieces is covered with a brownish paper. I purchased this item with confidence because the Amazon reviews were really good, and a lot of people said it was really high quality.I am still on the fence whether the purchase was worth it, but I’m leaning towards no. One huge thins i was upset about was that a couple reviewers specifically mentioned that this item was very easy to set up, holy crap that could not be further from the truth! I have been building IKEA furniture for the last several weeks, as we just furnished our entire house, and those things are 5 million percent easier to put together, and their instructions don’t even have words on them! I’m not lacking in skill either, i have fully renovated several houses, i could literally build and entire house, but this thing was a pain in the @ss!The instructions were sooooo unclear, they didn’t ever specify which way to face thing, or point out key attributes of a part so you know which way to face it, or what holes to drill it through, for example step 5 was more than 75% of the entire assembly, so all of the small steps to getting the entire thing put together were squashed into one picture with everything stacked on top of each other, and like 3 paragraphs of text above. I got all the way to the end and realized that I had put the whole assembly essentially backwards, so rather than undo everything (which im sure would have also resulted in shredding the cardboard parts to bits) I went ahead and drilled my own holes in a couple of spots.Perhaps my mind was just set with the simplicity of the IKEA instructions, but seriously this was the worst piece of furniture I have ever had to assemble.Honestly the thing has a pretty decent look and feel now that it is all together and in the right place, but I am not at all confident that it will last very long. Another thing I wanted to point out is that the bottom board that makes up the entire bottom shelf is also the same cardboard/particleboard material as described above, though unlike the countertop there is no support that goes across underneath it. They really should have invested in some cross bars, or at least one more cross board to go across the middle underneath, because it is not very strong stuff, and I don’t think I’d be able to store anything on that bottom shelf that weighs more than a couple of pounds.

Not a huge fan of the wing sauce, i bought it after doing an online search for a good wing sauce, but really its just like franks red hot mixed with mayo and other seasonings. I have had it just a couple times, it tastes pretty good but i just cant get over the mayo flavor, its just not a good combo in my opinion. I was thinking it was a bit sweeter because some reviewers of the restaurant it comes from said that it is, but i was lookign for something more alon the lines of Wingers Amazin Sauce, cause i cant find that online.

These curtains are awesome! they are thick and high quality, and are just beautiful! I cant believe the quality of item i got for the price i paid, and they were like the only curtains that i could find that came in a set. i actually paid slightly less for these than i did for the cheap, plain, seethrough ones i got from Walmart. I am just using them as a "closet door" as the house i am turning had terrible quality accordians, and these things really class up the space.i would highly recommend these to anyone and will be buying them again once i need to do the window coverings for our new house.

No kidding, within the first 2 minutes of playing the game, on the first little demo piece where you play a long haired templar, the game was glitchy like nothing ive ever seen. I was runnin into invisible objects, not jumping to obvious objects like the scaffolding out the window, instead i jumped through it and into the water which i could not get out of, all of the walls that appeared to have something to climb on to would not let me climb. then there was a spot in the water where i was walking several inches over the water, but i was finally able to use this to climb a wall. Byut kept getting back into that same water when i would try to jump on to the scaffolding because instead of grabbing the edge i was grabbing the air underneath the middle of the scaffolding! not a great first impression.Other than that and the people who i can run through, or the other charicters are constantly walkign through i havent noticed any other glitches, but i only played for about 20 minutes.The only reason i gave it 2 instead of 1 is because it is very beautiful and the graphics are amazing! I am really just getting tired of the Assassins creed franchise, as they are all basically the same. Black Flag was nice because it added the whole ship battle into it so it was a new and fun!.I really thing that they need to do something totally different with the franchise like either Ninja vs Samurai with a tenchu feel, or like american west. Im sure the game is building up to things like american west and/or present day, but i think they should just skip right forward to refresh things.Those ones could be fun because they are all new settings, eauropeans and people with british accents are just getting old! I think Ninjas would be fun because it is the more sneaky unseen assassin rather than the face head on and fight style. And i think that the american west or present days could be fun because it is a whole new world not only for the franchise, but with the exception of Red Dead, no one has really tapped the potential of a great western game! And something like splinter cell with an assassin twist would be great too!Anyway thats just my pointless rant about the franchise just to say that essentially this game is going back a few installments to the style of the days of Ezio rather than forward to something new. I feel like im playing Revelations again with a bit better graphics.

The flavor of this soda is NOTHING like Dr. Pepper! like seriously it is a t otally different drink, and the flavor is no good. Like how the Mr. Pibb is sooooo much sweeter than Dr. Pepper except it at least still tastes like it, this one is like 10 times sweeter than wither and you can just barely tell that it is intended to taste like Dr. Pepper. I have been happy with every other flavor of "Sodamix" i have tried up until this point.I would not recommend this at all, and will never purchase this flavor again

Im having a great time playing this game. I love the story line, which is not to full on itself, and not too packed with useless details, and i really like most of the gameplay. There have been quite a few glitches i have ran into over the last couple of weeks, and the gameplay is basically similar to Assassins creed but not quite are robust, more like the very first assassins creed where you are limited to only climbing certain things, and its not super intuitive. Like you have to always press x (even if you are holding it already) to get on top of a wall or platform, and you often come up to a wall while being chased by a band of Urucks and you don’t naturally jump on to the wall, but have to make a few approaches to actually get the game to realize that you are trying to go up the wall. One other issue is that a lot of the object in the world are "larger" than they actually are, meaning that a torch sitting there on the ground takes up much more invisible space than the visible part of the image, this makes for annoying getaways and just moving about as well, i have run myself into an invisible corner more than once in a opening that should be plenty big enough for me and or my Catagor.Other than those few minor glitches, i am really forgiving because i have seriously been addicted to every other aspect of the gameplay. I really like the Saurons Army feature, where your gameplay determines who makes up the army, and no matter how you play it can be all kinds of different outcomes! Most of the combos, and special abilities and Runes aren’t quite as deep, game changing and robust as i would like them to be, but again could be because of the comparison to other games with a similar gameplay and function like Assassins Creed, and Infamous.I really hate move games, especially those that follow the plotline to the "T" (Spiderman movie games, Iron Man…) but when a game takes an original spin on an existing universe, this game has made me realize that is Gold! Of course it help that  am a huge Lord of The Rings fan, but that said I did not care much for any previous lord of the rings video game, because the gameplay is unexciting because you already know the outcome. With this game, It basically falls between the events of The Hobbit, and the Trilogy, and though we know what becomes of Sauron and his army, I’m anxious to see how our protagonist plays into the whole picture!This game really makes me with game makers will do similar universe expansions on other epic novels and movies. Much like the force unleashed series, the prospect of some new stories to a universe that I already love is just awesome to me!

I love this Drone! i have never had one before, and have been itching to get one for quite some time. After about i month of research and contemplating, I settled on the X5C over the various other options in the category. I used user reviews from Amazon and other sites, YouTube videos and other sources to determine which one i felt was the best bet. It sounds like many in this price category are well matched in flight, and in fact a couple of the YouTube videos I had watched suggested that a WL Toys, and UDI model may possible have better outdoor flight capabilities, but that the X5C was far and away the best camera amongst the competition, and since that was more or less the primary reason i wanted a Drone that was my deciding factor.There was also a few days spent in confusion about the difference between the "X5C" and the "X5C-1", but after much digging I can say that the key differences are 1: the "-1" has a better stabilizer, and is less wobbly in flight, and can hover in place better, and 2: with the X5c"-1" you can do the 360 flips with the camera mounted on the chopper.I can says for certainty though the description on this item does not specifically specify, that this item is in fact the "X5C-1", because of the following performance differences (i can do flips with the camera on) and also because of the box it came in, and a YouTube video i watched showed that the "X" and the "2.4 GHZ" printed on the copter are in red, where on the other they are in white.I was hoping to get lucky like some other reviewers and receive a bonus third battery, but no such luck! There was one inside of the chopper, and one inside of the box.Even though it was unclear in the description and packing list, i also had a set of spate blades come with mine, and I’m assuming that because of the fact that the packaging has a mold out in the plastic for them that all of this item comes with the extra set of blades.Because of adverse weather i have yet to fly my drone outdoors, but the flights that I have had have been awesome, and I have been able to easily pick up the hang of it, though there is a learning curve, and I still often crash into things, I was also trying to navigate down my spiral staircase last night, and took a massive tumble down the stairs with no damage whatsoever to the drone.I have been able to do successful 360 flips in every direction in just an 8 foot ceiling room without smacking the ceiling or floor with some practice (though I smacked both and other obstacles many times in the process)I really wish that there was some way to pack some more battery life into this thing, because really I cant get enough play time in even with the 2 batteries to really learn some maneuvers and tricks. I did order a pack of 4 of the slightly better batteries, but really 5-10 minutes of flight time is just sad. It makes sense and that is why it did not affect the star rating I gave, but man I wish a new technology could come out that would provide a small drone like this with a half hour or so!Ill say that I am a little afraid to fly the thing outside, and hope that I don’t lose it the first time I try. Someone here in my town had posted to a local forum that they lost their $1200 GoPro mounted drone in a wind burst, and was hoping someone found it, so I am sure that this thing would just be gone baby gone if I’m not careful!This will be a first step for me, and I hope to buy a really nice one in the future once I get the hang of flying this copter, I have decided to use “mode 1” for now, because I thought mode 2 would be better, but after flying it for a while it was less intuitive for me.I would recommend this Drone to anyone looking for a fun beginner Quadcoter, it is a lot of fun, and the camera does a pretty good job.

This device is much better than any of the other harmony remotes i have owned! The biggest issue i have had with others is that when you dont touch the remotes with enough delecacy they get reset and then you jsut have to do everything manually. The also always have issues not quite turning on or off all of the devices they are supposed to. With this one, both of those issues are a non-issue because the device itself is stored away in a cabinet, and the RF transmitter can be put anywhere and just bounce the signal around the room until it does what it is supposed to. Furthyermore the "Basic Remote" it comes with is super nice and significantly sturdier than other harmony smart models.The reason i only gave it 4 rather than 5 stars is because i basically only use the basic remote because thwe app on the smartphones and iPad are terrible. Not only are their interfaces (i have used it on android, iPhone and iPad) just terribly designed and super un-intuitive to navigate, they also limit many basic functions that even the basic remote as, and the bigges issue is the delay. You swipe up, or tap the button up to move or change the channel and the delay is a good 2 seconds or more!Basically how it works is you can put the "Smart Hub" somewhere either out of sight in a cabinet, or you can display it if you want, then you plug in the RF transmitter which is a little dongle on a 6ft cable. I am unsure whether you can use the smarthub without the RF transmitter, and you may be able to if you dont have it in a cabinet, but i do so it doesnt work without the dongle. Then you set up the app on your smart device, which is actually pretty difficult to set up. I did transfer over my activities and info from an old remote, but the setup still has you go through some steps to make sure it is all working properly. Then you can either use your device to make your commands or the remote is comes with. The RF transmitter will bounce the signal around your room so it really doesnt need to be placed very stratigically, but the type of room you are in may affect this. There was one spot i initially placed mine and it would turn on everything but my TV (i really think it was more because my TV has a weak reciever) but then i moved it a few inches and that did the trick, plus everywhere else i messed around with putting it except for the one spot worked fine.Another added bonus is that it has bluetooth, and though it has told me that it doesnt work for the PS4 (Yet?) it does woprk with the PS3, and the one that i was happy about it that it lets you use the keayboard feature for the Apple TV so you dont have to "type" with the joystick navigation.I would highly recommend this device to anyone, and though it has a few quirks i think it may be one of the best Harmony devices, plus its a bit cool to show your friends that you can control everything with just your smartphone!

Great quality screen protector. This came with a lot of great things to help put the screen protectors on including a soft cloth, a squeegie type thing to help put the screen on and also these "hinge" stickers. I used the hinge method to put the protectors on and it was far an away the best method ive seen to put on these non-water using type of screen protectors.I will point out that this is more of a plasticey type protector rather than the rubbery "shield" ones, but this has help on better and was applied easier than any other of this type of protector i have used in the past.Even though i typically prefer the rubbery "shield" type of screen protectors i would recommend this product to a friend.

The device iteslf is pretty good, and the lenses seem to work, though im not too impressed with the macro lense thus far. My main issues with it are these: First of all it upsets me that if you are not logged in to prime the price says "$6 + $5.99 S&H" wheareas if you are a prime member it says "411.99, PRIME Shipping" which is just lame!!! so basically you are just paying for the shipping within the marked up price, wow glad i pay for that membership when others dont!My second issue is that the clip part istelf is made out of a not super durable plastic, where it looks metal in the pictures, I am not too sure how long this plastic will hod up.And my last issue is that the first one i ordered was missing the wide angle lense, so i had to wait till Amazon recieved my item back to get a refund to reorder the item.Overall i am not too implressed with the quality, but for the price it works pretty good. I did just order a second brand that says that the fisheye doesnt have the dark circle around the image like this one does, so i may recommend that one over this once i get it, ill let you know once i have gotten it and used it.I

This hamper is very nice! the quality of the materials and metal is top notch and high end. The wheels are very heavy and quality and roll smoothly though i just keep it locked in place. The canvas hamper bags are very thick and quality, and the metal is not thin cheap alunminum like i was worried they may be, but are like the thicker stainless steel that the costco style stainless wire shelves are made out of.I would recommend this item to a friend.

The only reason im giving it 2 stars instead of one is because it was inexpensive. This thermostat does not keep the tempurature well regulated. I purchassed this to replace the only analog dial looking one that was on the wall, and so far wish i hadnt. It is fairly easy to get set up and to program, but the thing just turns on and off the heat whenever the heck it feels like it. For example: i may have it programmed to just stay at 70 degrees all the time, and it may be 60 degrees in the house and you cannot get it to turn on the heat, then other times when the heat is running it will keep the heat at 78 degrees for several hours and wont turn the heaters off!Im assuming unless all 3 i got (2 from Aamzon one from Walmart) of the same exact model are all lemons that it is just terrible, because all 3 zones that i have in my house are doing the same thing.

Love these sheets, they are super soft and look great. I have other sheets of the same thread count that are not as comfortable, so it must be the quality and ply that is better on these. They also breathe weel and stay cooler at night.

I love this show! there is a bit of unneccesary nudity at times, and really it just annoys me when show throw that in at times that it just doesnt make sense or need to be there. I love the plot and all of the actors and charichters are just perfect for their roles and very skilled and believable. Makes me want to go back and be a pirate!

Like other reviewers i was pleasantly surprised with the size of this product, it is much larger than it looks. I was a bit worried that the Black Marble might look a little cheap, and really wanted to purchase the fossil marble one they sell, but this one went better with my decor so i went against my instinkts and purchassed it, and really i couldnt be happier! it looks awesome, and is very good quality. Really heavy and it really a conversation starter.I am a bit worried about how long the swivel mechanism will last, as metal glued into rock (which is how im assuming the swivel pin is installer) usually doesnt hold up for too long.

I cannot say how much i love this thing!!!!!!! I while back i got the "Swivel Store" product and have just been not too happy about it because of its akwardness in fitting in camibest and around other things. really it was just more of a storage shelf i had to take out to use.I recently saw a commercial for this and knew i had to have it! The package somes with 2 shelf units, which if you count the shelf surface below it makes a 3 tier shelf, the cubbord that was litterally stuffed with spices and could not fit a single one more, and in order to find something i had to take it out now has plenty of space for more, is wide open, easy to find things and just looks great! I have had several people over since purchassing it, all of which loved it and went to purchase their own!I would highly recommend this product to anyone, and it is all made of good quality materials, and seems durrable, and is certainly sturdy. (though the name is pretty dumb)I will be buying a couple more to organize some other areas as well.

holy crap! for what was seamingly (from previews) a family movie, there are about 10 F-bombs and a naked man jacking off to porn within the first 5 minutes! Not sure what happens after that because we turned it off, but i severely regret paying for this film.

Dont know whether it's been a long while between the time it got published and when I read it, the key theme in the book* has become quite common sense when even the biggest manufacturing country in the world PRC is drastically losing its ground. Some may argue that companies differ from countries. Yet, the problem is just the same. Everyone is facing unprecedented competition like never before. In short, unless you are totally unfamilar with concepts of business strategy, differentiation, focus etc., you may still find some value in it. Otherwise,......If it were not for the good writing skills of the authors, I might have rated it a one star.* In a world where supply is growing ever more efficient while demand is flatterning or even contracting, understanding demand becomes the new imperative for how companies will compete and win.

I had mixed feeling about this book. Whilst I did enjoy reading it for the author's good writing skills and well picked stories, the concepts/laws covered are common sense, though common sense is not that common nowadays. In short, if one had already read three or more leadeship books beforehand, please give this a pass.p.s. Below please find some favorite passages of mine for your reference.Balancing optimism and realism, intuition and planning, faith and fact can be very difficult. But that’s what it takes to be effective as a navigating leader. Pg41One measure of leadership is the caliber of people who choose to follow you. – Dennis A. Peer pg81Who you attract is not determined by what you want. It’s determined by who you are. Pg104You cant move people to action unless you first move them with emotion….The heart comes before the head. Pg115It may sound corny, but it’s true. People don’t care how much you know until they know how much you care. Pg122You can do what I cannot do. I can do what you cannot do. Together we can do great things. – Mother Teresa pg129To push people down, you have to go down with them. Pg150Great leaders always seem to embody two seemingly disparate qualities. They are both highly visionary and highly practical. Pg158Mission provides purpose. Vision provides a picture. Strategy provides a plan. Why? What? How? Pg159No written word nor spoken plea can teach our youth what they should be. Not all the books on all the shelves. It’s what the teachers are themselves. Pg160A good supervisor is a catalyst, not a drill sergeant. He creates an atmosphere where intelligent people are willing to follow him. He doesn’t command, he convinces. – Whitley David pg161We should work on changing ourselves before trying to improve others. Pg162People want to go along with people they get along with. Pg173They are many things that will catch my eye, but there are only a few things that will catch my heart. – Tim Redmond pg209Leaders should get out of their comfort zone but stay in their strength zone. Pg210

My review title says it all. In case you want to read advanced knowledge/solution in layman terms on memory loss, depression, overweight, anxiety, personal crises, Alzheimer and so on. This is a great read. For those who expect to read something like a common self help or spirtual book, please give this a pass.p.s. Below please find some favorite passages of mine for your reference.How to be adaptable pg49-Stop repeating what never worked in the first place.-Stand back and ask for a new solution.-Stop struggling at the level of the problem – the answer never lies there.-Work on your own stuckness. Don’t worry about the other person.-When the old stresses are triggered, walk away.-See righteous anger for what it really is – destructive anger dressed up to sound positive.-Rebuild the bonds that have become frayed.-Take on more of the burden than you think you deserve.-Stop attaching so much weight to being right. In the grand scheme of things, being right is insignificant compared with being happy.You are becoming more adaptable when pg51-You can laugh at yourself-You see that there’s more to the situation than you realize-Other people no longer look like antagonists simply because they disagree with you.-Negotiating starts to work, and you genuinely participate in it.-Compromise becomes a positive word-You can hang loose in a state of relaxed alertness-You see things in a way you didn’t before, and this delights you.As the brain shifts, reality follows. Depressed people live not just in a sad world, Sunshine is tinged with gray; colors lack luminosity. But those who have no mood disorder imbue the world with livelier qualities. A stoplight is red because the brain makes it red, although red green color blind people see the same stoplight as gray. Sugar is sweet because the brain makes it sweet…....Facts are personal, in fact. The radical part is that nothing escapes the process of reality making. Every quality in the outside world exists because you create it. Your brain is not the creator but a translational tool. The real creator is mind. Pg60-1It's good to be aware, but self-awareness is even better. “I am angry” gets you only so far if your aim is to control your anger. Knowing where your anger comes from adds the component of self-awareness. It allows you to see a pattern in your behavior. It takes into account that past outbursts haven’t worked out so well. May be a spouse has left you in the past, or someone called the police. Once you bring in self-awareness, reality shifts. You start to take control; the power to change is dawning……Of course, this awareness of being aware is also made possible by the brain……While the brain produces feelings and thoughts that you identify with, super brain calls upon  your ability to be the observer, or witness, who is detached form the thoughts and feelings delivered by the brain.  Pg86When you are aware, you could be anybody. But when you are self-aware, you become unique. I am feeling X turns into What do I think about X? Where is it taking me? What does it mean? Someone who is angry can stop there, with almost no self-awareness. Pg88

Whilst this book is exceptionally informative, I am quite disappointed for two reasons. First, I agree with many reviewers here that a scientific book of this sort should provide ample reference to the theories discussed. Second, rarely a book can be so poorly written that I had to go back and forth within a chapter to make sure I truly understand the core messages. In short, for this may be good for professionals and for those who are used to take notes. For amateurs and leisure readers, please give this a pass.

The author’s previous work "Reality Check" enchanted me. This book did not. IMHO, he had tried to satisfy too many different audience in one volume and failed to deliver something insightful and practical which he is capable of. A bit disappointed!p.s. If it were not for the excellent quotes and the following passages, I might have rated it a two star.The difficulty lies, not in the new ideas, but in escaping from the old ones, which ramify, for those brought up as most of us have been, into every corner of our minds. – John Maynard Keynes pgxviiYou have first to experience what you want to express. – Vincent van Gogh pg1When Karin Muller, filmmaker and author, was in the Peace Corps from 1987  to 1989, she dug wells and built schools in a village in the Philippine. One night, 12 members of the New People’s Army, came to her hut to interrogate her….When the NPA arrived, she exclaimed, “Thank God you’re here. I’ve been waiting all day. Please have some coffee. Leave your guns at the door. “Her reaction baffled the leader of the group, but he took off his gun and sat down for a cup of coffee. She avoided an interrogation or something worse because, according to Muller, “you cant interrogate someone you’re having coffee with.” Muller did not react with anger, indignation or panic (which is how I would have reached). Instead, she touched an emotion in the leader of the group and transformed the situation from brute force and intimidation to conversation and communication. She delighted him wither unexpected hospitality and changed his heart, his mind, and his actions. In short, she enchanted him. Pg1-2Some cause happiness wherever they go; others, whenever they go. – Oscar Wilde pg9Communicate a cause in an “easy to swallow, easy to follow” manner. Pg45There is no abstract art. You must always start with something. Afterward you can remove all traces of reality. – Pablo Picasso pg55Explaining your cause in terms of something familiar (anchoring) but then giving it a different meaning (twist). This is a favorite technique of movie producers and book authors: “It’s like Dirty Harry but set in the year 2100” or “it’s How to win friends and influence people brought up to date. “ pg59“Priming the pump”, a research by University of Leicester – The market sold forty bottles of French wine and eight bottles of German wine to French music. With German background music, it sold twenty two bottles of German wine and twelve bottles of French wine. The researchers interpreted these results to mean that music can “prime related knowledge and the selection of certain causes if they fit with that knowledge.“ Pg61To fly we have to have resistance. – Maya Lin pg70Diplomacy is the art of letting somebody have your way. – Daniele Vare pg81Richard Branson polishes my shoe and makes me a Virgin America customer for life. pg102The function of muscle is to pull and not to push, except in the case of the genitals and the tongue. – Leonardo da Vinci pg135So much of what we call management consists in making it difficult for people to work. – Peter Drucker pg154Priority is a function of context. – Stephen Covey pg166The plural of anecdote is not data. – Ben Gold acre pg177

I picked this up because I wanted to know what the 0.5 strength of the "12.5 Strengths" in the subtitle is. Quite disappointing, it's only a gimmick of the author who simply named every last point x of his dos and donts as point x.5. Even worse, I found the ideas quite repetitive around page 50 and I had tried really hard to finish the whole book. In short, not recommended! For those who aspire to sharpen their leadership skills, "The Leader's Guide to Speaking with Presence: How to Project Confidence, Conviction, and Authority by John Baldoni" would be a more suitable choice.p.s. Pg24Morale is not a problem. Morale is a symptom. Pg36If you don’t like your lifestyle, look at your results.If you don’t like your results, look at your actions.If you don’t like your actions, look at your attitude.If you don’t like your attitude, look at your philosophy. Pg41If you think you don’t have a personal philosophy, think again! You have one. Like an old book, it may be hidden in the attic of your psyche, dusty and untouched.Discovering your own personal philosophy will help build your self-belief. Being inaccessible 3. Responding or deciding slowly 4. Reprimanding in public 5. Not keeping promises (or breaking them) 6. Not telling the truth 7. Playing favorites 8. Being in an inconsistent mood 9. Being out of technological touch 9.5 Assigning the wrong task to the wrong person pg60-2

My review title says it all. It's been a long time that I could enjoy a fluently written and productive communication book like this. In short, recommended!p.s. Below please find some favorite passages of mine for your reference.There is never enough time to do everything, but there is always enough time to do the most important thing. – Brian Tracy pg3Great minds have purposes, others have wishes. – Washington Irving pg23It’s not a conversation if only one person is talking. – Charles Schwab pg31In the 20 minutes leader time frame, you would:- Expectations and importance 1-3 min.
