The shower has a bench in the corner furthest from the shower head, and it's convenient to put one's leg up on the bench in order to have better access to one's...er...nether regions.However, with the stock hose our handheld wouldn't reach that far so I went looking for alternatives. The local box box (blue and orange) stores carry cheap-y plastic hoses, and they aren't any longer than the stock hose (about 5 ft.).Luckily, I found this one on Amazon and it was also available via Prime. It's 8 ft long, the coiled hose is stainless steel, and the fittings are brass - significantly higher quality than the typical plastic-with-chrome-like-finish that one finds, and also how our original hose was made.Bottom line is that I will be buying one of these in the future every time I put in a handheld shower - highly recommended.

This vacuum has become an essential part of our housekeeping routine. It does a great job on hard floors, and a passable job on our medium-pile carpeting, and works great for a quick clean-up. We typically use this vacuum over the entire floor 2-3 times a week, and then do a deep cleaning with our Miele canister once or twice a month.We have two dogs who shed like crazy, so staying ahead of the dust bunnies is a full time job, and the convenience of this vacuum makes it a great asset. I can roll this thing out and go over the entire downstairs in less than half the time of lugging around our canister vac. This Hoover doesn't do nearly as complete of a cleaning job, but that's not really what we need most of the time - we just need to stay ahead of the mess, and this works perfectly in that role.I've been impressed with the battery life - I can easily vacuum our downstairs (1500 sq ft) twice on a single battery charge, and that's running the roller brush the entire time. That 1500 sq ft is composed of 1000 sq ft of medium pile carpet, 400 sq ft of hardwood or tile floor, and 100 sq ft of low-pile Persian/throw rugs.This is a bagless unit, and emptying the container is relatively easy. There is also a short hose that can be used with attachments, but it's not very long. Note that the trick with the hose is that you can remove the top handle (like a sword from a scabbard), attach that to the hose, and then put the attachments at the end of the handle, which adds another couple feet of cleaning reach. I've seen several online reviews and videos where people were simply using the hose with the attachments attached, without unsheathing the handle, and then complaining about the shortness of the hose. It's still not long, but it's relatively usable with the hose+handle+attachment combination.Bottom line is that we *love* this vacuum, but hate that we still have to use our big canister vac. I'd love to see Hoover make a version of this with more capabilities, and I'd be willing to pay more for a cordless vacuum like that. If you can live with the limitations of this unit, we highly recommend it as a specific tool (reasonably good cordless vacuum) for a specific purpose (convenient day-to-day cleaning).

We used these hangers this Christmas to hang our family stockings on the mantle, and they worked perfectly. They have soft, rubbery coatings at the contact points, which helps prevent scratching or marring of the mantle wood. They are also sturdy and stable, meaning they don't come loose and don't bend or flex with a heavy stocking.We've used cheap hanging clips before, but we'll never go back after using these, highly recommended.

I have a home office, and for those of you who work remotely you know you're never sure when your work day ends. That means that there's never a 'turn-out-the-lights' moment to my day in the office, and I often ended up leaving my lights on for days at a time, or at least for several hours longer than necessary if I turned them off when shutting down the house for bed time.I tried a 'motion sensing' switch from a big box hardware store, but it wasn't sensitive enough to detect my presence in the office if I were sitting relatively still, like if I were concentrating on something for a long time. However, this Leviton unit is able to detect presence in the office almost perfectly.Also, this model requires that you have access to the 'neutral' wire at the switch location. This allows it to maintain power to the sensor without 'leaking' current through the line. It also allows this unit to properly support low-voltage (e.g. LED) lighting without any issues. They also sell a version of this occupancy sensor that does not require access to the neutral wire, but it 'leaks' voltage in order to get current for the sensor to operate, which will cause LED and CFL bulbs to potentially glow with faint light, and you may need to leave at least one incandescent bulb in the circuit to allow for enough current draw for proper operation.Wiring details aside, this unit works perfectly in day-to-day use. The lights come on instantly when I enter the office, and turn off shortly after I leave (15-20 minutes). There are a lot of settings and options, but what I learned with my first unit at a previous home is that leaving it at the defaults works best for me.The unit even has 'walk-through' logic, meaning that if it senses occupancy for a brief period, and then nothing else, it will shut off after a couple of minutes, assuming it was just a temporary walk through the space.Bottom line is that if need a sensor that is more accurate than the generic (cheaper) ones at the big box stores, this one works great.

My wife and I both have home offices, and I got this lamp for my office. We got a different Quoizel lamp for her office.Both are fantastic. This one has a classic look to it, and works perfectly in my office as a replacement for the generic ceiling fan/light combo that was up previously. I used three 100W-equivalent LED bulbs to provide sufficient light for working.It mounts to a standard round ceiling fixture mount, and wires in as expected - easy to do it yourself if you have any experience hanging ceiling fans or light fixtures.Bottom line is that this is a high quality and beautiful light fixture, highly recommended.

My wife and I both have home offices, and she decorated hers in a New Orleans/French style. We found this light on Amazon and used it to replace the generic ceiling fan/light combo in her office, and it looks fantastic.Note that it came with no instructions, but if you have hung ceiling fans or light fixtures before you should have no trouble. It mounts to a standard round base, and wires 'normally'.We used three 100W-equivalent LED bulbs in order to provide a light level sufficient for working. Bottom line is that this is a well made, beautiful lamp, highly recommended.

Update after 18 months: Well, we recently got an 8-week-old puppy, and our SpotBot is working overtime and still doing a great job. We keep it handy to treat accidents as they occur and it's fantastic - I'd rate it 10 stars if I could!Original Review:The SpotBot is a must for any household with an indoor pet and carpet, in my opinion. We've always had dogs and cats, and even with the most well-behaved animals there are bound to be 'accidents' from time to time. In the past we've attempted to address these spots in various ways - dry shampoos followed by vacuuming, renting big steam cleaners, buying consumer-grade carpet cleaners, etc. None have been fast, convenient, and inexpensive, until this SpotBot.Now, anytime there is an accident we simply clean up any solid-ish and/or liquid-ish material the best we can with paper towels, then grab the SpotBot and put it to work. If I had any complaint about the unit it is that I wish the cleaning area were a larger diameter - like a foot or more. However, the smaller cleaning area just means that for larger spots you may have to move the unit once or twice.So far this thing has been a dream. It's quick and easy to grab, easy to setup and use, easy to drain and put away, and it is allowing us to keep up with 'accidents' without muss or fuss. In addition, the unit can be used for manual cleaning by unwinding the hose and using the attachable head. With the hose and head you can spray cleaning fluid and vacuum it up, and the head has stiff bristles to help with cleaning. Both the hose and cleaning head neatly attach to the unit so you don't have to track or store them separately.Note that a couple of times we were out of their specific carpet cleaning fluid, and I used a dash of our liquid laundry detergent instead, which doesn't foam up or lather and seemed to work just as well as their branded stuff. I'm not sure if that's a good idea with regards to the warranty or unit operation, but it hasn't caused any problems so far.We've been pet owners for decades, and if I had a time machine I'd go take one of these back to my younger self and save myself a lot of hassle. Highly recommended.

I'd give this four stars if it had a method for storing/attaching the different nozzles to the body in some reasonably permanent way. We used this initially to inflate a river tube, and it worked great, however it has now become a game of 'gotcha' to track and find the nozzles every time we need to use it.

We put in new carpet with thick padding, and we also repainted. When re-hanging the sliding closet doors the old white plastic door guides didn't work - they flexed upwards too much in the center, held up by the thick carpet padding.I searched around and found this alternative door guide. Although the current product picture is a line drawing, I found on other sites that this model number has a metal body. The upright door guides are a brownish/reddish soft plastic. They can be adjusted for the thickness of the doors by giving them a half-turn (like a key in a lock) so that they are perpendicular to the doors instead of parallel, which also servers to narrow the channel for the doors.Another nice feature is that the screw mounting holes are not at either far end, but offset to the side and about a 1/4 of the way in from either end (as you can see in the drawing). This makes it both easier to drive the screws and also provides a better mounting plane to hold it in place on carpeting. Meaning, if the screws were at the far ends then there would be much more upward leverage on the center when installed on carpeting.Bottom line is that these work perfectly in our installation, and feel well made. Highly recommended.

If Fall of Hyperion were better I would give Hyperion five stars for being a terrific setup. As it is, it's still a terrific setup, but the payoff is just not there in Fall.If you decide to dive into Hyperion be forewarned that it is *not* a standalone story, there isn't even a mini-climax at the end, just a cliffhanger that is enticing (if the follow-up were equally excellent) or aggravating (if the follow-up were a lesser work), depending on your opinions of Fall.Leaving subsequent books in the series out of it for now, Hyperion itself is fascinating and complex. The characters are diverse, the plot is intricately woven, and the tension ratchets up throughout. At the end of Hyperion I *cared* about these characters and immediately dove into the next book.Fall of Hyperion is not a smooth continuation of the story, or more specifically, of the story-telling. Chronologically it takes up right after the end of Hyperion, but the style of writing is markedly different to the point of being jarring to me. Whereas the characters in Hyperion were dynamic and three-dimensional, the newly introduced characters are flat and passive and I never felt I got to know or care about them.I'll probably continue the series, but after finishing Fall of Hyperion I felt relief at being done slogging through the book, which was markedly different from my excitement after finishing Hyperion.Bottom line is that I would recommend this book due to its unique and interesting composition, but I would also caveat that by warning the reader not to expect an equally brilliant follow-up.

Our family has a variety of tablets and phones (Apple and not-Apple) and we went on a vacation that involved multiple long flights and car rides. We wanted to able to keep everybody 'up and running' with their devices, and these batteries did the trick (there were seven of us).We got two of them (one for mom, one for dad) and also insured we had iPhone-compatible charging cables since the chargers only come with regular micro-USB charging cables that are the universal standard for everyone but Apple.We made sure these batteries were always fully charged before long flights/drives, and they were in almost constant use by kids who somehow couldn't remember to charge their phones/tablets.Bottom line, if you depend on your rechargeable devices and have to spend time away from an outlet, this is a great solution.

We were going on vacation and I wanted to take a bunch of digital media for the long plane flights and for chilling during downtime. This chip took everything I needed and worked without issue. Glad to see the 128GB chips on the market, looking forward to the 256GB ones!

We had a big family vacation with seven of us on the same flight, including our four year old daughter. Travel in groups is always a frenzy, and the last thing we wanted to do was add schlepping a car seat to the mix.I had seen this harness previously and had been mentally tracking it, and as our trip approached I did more research and decided to buy it. Bottom line is that it works like a charm.We were lucky enough to have seats with no row behind us so we did not have to worry about disturbing a stranger for the initial setup, although the impact to the people behind you is only cosmetic (there's a strap going under their tray table when it's in the upright position).One of the flight attendants came by and said that in 20 years of flying she'd never seen one before. I told her that her airline (American) states on their site that they are approved for use on their planes, and they even sell the harnesses there. I was worried she might question the device, but she was merely curious and seemed fascinated by it.Our daughter had no issues with it, which may be in part because it fastens similarly to the straps of a car seat. I'll echo other comments that the lack of a between-the-legs strap seems less safe than having one, but in actual use she felt quite secure.Bottom line, I highly recommend this to parents traveling with kids. It folds up into a small pouch, it's simple to use, and it makes travel significantly easier.

I have a tablet (Surface RT) with a mini-HDMI output port, and when I travel I take a mini-to-normal HDMI cable and usually am able to view my screen on the TV in the hotel room. However, on our latest trip the TVs simply would not show the video no matter what I did, so I got this overnighted in order to be able to share pics/vids/movies/etc with the group.The good news is that it did throw video up on the screen. The bad news is that it was unwatchable for a couple of reasons:First, there was tremendous jitter, flashing, and artifacting of the video.Second, no matter what source resolution I used this device only showed 3/4 of my screen. The video output was not centered on the TV screen but was lowered to the point where the bottom of the video was cut off and the top of the TV had a lot of blank space. Again, no setting changes addressed this issue.Third, even if the above two issues had not occurred, the quality of the video was not acceptable. I knew I wouldn't get true HD video out of this, but things were quite fuzzy and ghosty even when the above two issues were not in play.Bottom line is that I will not be using this device again.

We've been using Magic Jetz Scrubz for years, and we love them - zero complaints. They are tough, and tackle any abuse we throw at them. They're durable, and we typically use them for so long that we end up throwing them out on principle rather than because they're falling apart or getting smelly.Any and every other sponge we've ever used has eventually began to fall apart and/or stink and/or lose the 'scrubby' part through abrasion/erosion. Not these, they just keep working, and do a great job of cleaning.It may seem silly to post a review of a kitchen sponge, but when a product is this good it's worth taking the time to let other shoppers know.

We have a living room and den that are connected with a large opening, and each has a television in it. Many times we are watching the same programs on both televisions, usually via our TiVo DVRs where we pause and rewind the action (think sporting events).We wanted the option for both TVs to show the same output when we wanted them synced, and I found this unit that serves as an HDMI splitter. I connected it to the output of one TiVo, then ran HDMI cables to both TVs, and now they can both show the same output so that folks can wander from room to room watching the same stream.Also, the second TV also has its own TiVo and has that on a separate HDMI input, so both units can also show completely different programming if desired.For ~$20 this is a no-brainer, it does exactly what it says it will do - highly recommended.

I wanted a dart board in the game room, but with a toddler and dogs I didn't want the safety concerns of traditional darts. This dart board fits the bill perfectly!First and foremost, the actual mechanics of play are great. The darts stick to the board with authority. The board itself is well made - it's light-weight, but so far is standing up to use (and abuse) without showing any signs of wear.If you're a hardcore dart player this probably wouldn't be very satisfying, as the 'tips' are actually circular magnets so it's virtually impossible to group darts near each other like you can with traditional needle-tip darts. We only play for fun, so this was not an issue for us.Put it all together and this was a great purchase, great fun, and highly recommended.

This flatware is very beautiful and the heft is substantial without being overly heavy.  We also love the pineapple design, which fits nicely with our decorating theme. We couldn't be happier with our purchase - highly recommended.

We moved into a new house and one of the bathroom doors wouldn't latch closed properly.  I could see that the door was about a sixteenth of an inch too low. The door hinges were 3.5 inches tall and used three screws, so these were the correct shims.I ordered them and once they arrived I had them installed and the problem fixed in about 5 minutes. To explain how they work, if you look at the product photo the actual shim is one third of the white square that you see - it snaps into three identical pieces.  You then use the number of shims stacked on top of each other that adjust the door the appropriate amount.For the three-screw hinges these are designed for, you remove the top and bottom screw from the hinge and loosen the middle screw, but leave it in place. If you see the far-right side of the shim in the picture you can see it has an opening on the right-edge, and this screw that is left in place slides into that notch.Once you've slid the shims into place, the holes at the top and bottom of the shims will align with the screw holes in the hinge and the wall, allowing you to put the two removed screws back into place.These shims won't fix every problem, but if you have slight alignment issues and don't want to take down your trim to re-shim the door frame (and re-paint), these can really do the trick - they are a really ingenious solution.

First and foremost, the good news is that we love this mattress. Both my wife and I have lower-back problems and this mattress is a dream to sleep on and we wake almost every day with no sleep-related back pain.The bad news is that it takes some getting used to and/or modifying to deal with the absolute lack of side support. If you have a relatively conventional mattress you can sit on the edge of the bed without complication, however with this mattress the sides have no added support of any kind, so if you sit on the edge of the bed you sink in and begin to ooze forward and off the bed.The same is true if you sleep anywhere near the edge of the bed - you'll find yourself listing towards the edge due to the lack of structure in the sides. For the first week I always felt vaguely seasick because I was literally sleeping at an angle, with my right-side (closer to the edge) noticeably and visibly lower than my left-side (closer to the center).  My wife experienced the same issue, although to a lesser degree given that she's much lighter than I am.EDGE SOLUTION: The other good news is that I figured out a relatively cheap, safe, simple mod that solves the issue.  I wanted to upload a picture, but for some reason this item does not appear to be allowing customer images at this time.We use our mattress on a platform bed, and the bottom of the mattress rests about six inches below the sides of the bed. I took pool noodles (3" diameter) and lined the left and right inner edges of the mattress platform with a double row of noodles (side-by-side), such that the far left and far right edges of the mattress rest on the two rows of noodles.  This raises the edges up a couple of inches, which is barely noticeable when the bed is made, and creates a bit of support for the sides that prevents list-full sleep.Once I was sure that this solution was working, I took the mattress out and used big, long, fat zip ties to gently secure the noodles in place so that they wouldn't migrate around whenever we moved the mattress (lifting corners for fitted sheets, rotating mattress for even wear, etc).So far this solution is working *perfectly* for us, and although I feel I should ding the mattress a star for this issue I didn't because a) it's so darn comfortable and b) there are people for whom this won't be an issue (e.g. people who sleep alone in the center, very thin/light people, etc).In any case, be prepared for a mushy edge experience and if you can handle it (or fix it) this is a great mattress.

We ordered this for our nearly 4 year old daughter, and it's great. First and foremost, be sure you have the square footage for this thing, because it is not small (9.5' x 8.5'), and note that the position of the slide, ladder, and fold-out desk cannot be reversed, it assembles just like you see it in the picture, period.What you can't see is the fold-out desk that's on the opposite end from the ladder - I didn't even know it came with the desk, and right now we aren't using it but I did go ahead and attach it so that it's there if/when we decide to use it.For us, the bed only went in one specific position in the room because we didn't want there to be a window beside or behind the upper bunk, because no matter what you do kids are going to jump around on this thing and we didn't want anybody accidentally crashing through a 2nd story window.Assembly is a bit of a chore, but pretty straightforward. The delivery box is huge and heavy - I left it in the garage and carried the individual pieces upstairs to the bedroom for assembly rather than trying to move the whole box.  It took a couple of hours, and having a cordless drill with the correct bits made things MUCH easier.With regards to the mattress, they recommend nothing thicker than 6" so that there is still sufficient railing around the bed to prevent roll-offs during sleep, and after seeing the bed I agree. We had to get a different (thinner) mattress to be on the safe side.Now that it's in action our daughter loves it. She uses the slide constantly, and loves to go into the tent and play in the surprisingly spacious underneath area. The bed is solidly built, and feels like it will last well until the time our daughter is too mature and cool to appreciate a tent+slide+bunk bed. :)

I wear reading glasses which requires me to a) have them with me constantly and b) take them on and off regularly. Add to that that I often need to use my glasses while doing home repair projects or other physical activity where they would tend to get pushed out of position and/or fall off.I have used neck chains/lanyards for years, and these are my favorites.  I've been wearing them for a couple of months now, and although they are not perfect, they are the best by far.First, if you set them at the longest setting then they work like a regular lanyard, with the exception that you can't lean back on something (pillow, headrest) without pushing your glasses around, because the underlying wire is fairly stiff.Second, anytime I'm doing home repairs and/or physical activity requiring glasses, I can cinch up the spacers to shorten the wires until they are much closer to the back of my head. They don't get tight enough to actually pull my glasses up to my face, but they leave so little free space that they stay mostly in place.When I go to bed at night I switch to a pair of glasses without a lanyard, because these would be impossible to use laying back against pillows without dislodging your glasses.Overall I like them, they are sturdy, and they work.  Highly recommended.

My wife and I work remotely for the same company and spend anywhere from 3-8 hours a day in meetings and conference calls, and are essentially on-call 7x24x365 and need to be reachable at all times. We moved to a new house and found that our cell coverage was very spotty, and we were missing calls and text and voice mails to a significant degree.In researching I found this item, which had mixed but generally positive reviews, and decided to give it a shot.  Bottom line, it works.Setup is relatively straightforward. This device connects to and uses your internet connection, meaning that your calls/texts/browsing actually go from your phone to the microcell and from the microcell over your internet connection to the cell network, so be sure you have a fast internet connection.  It also means that if your internet goes down so does your microcell.Once the device is connected it needs to find a GPS signal to validate where you're using it, and for that I needed to add the GPS antenna.Once the device is fully activated you can then control it via your AT&T account via the web. You have to tell the Microcell what phone numbers are allowed to connect to and use it, and they have to be AT&T numbers.I had to work with AT&T support because while our calls were working our data was not, meaning we couldn't surf the web, etc, over our cell connections.  They worked for several hours, were knowledgeable, but were unable to solve the problem and told me that the Microcell was bad.  I eventually fixed it myself by changing my internet router and voila, it started working for data.In use this thing works great.  First, battery life is MUCH improved because our phones aren't wasting energy constantly looking for signal and reconnecting. Voice-wise the sound quality is virtually indistinguishable from a normal cell connection. Also, if we start a call at the house and then drive away the call (usually) transfers to the regular towers without issue, but going the opposite way (coming home) almost always results in a dropped call.I didn't like having to spend my money to solve what is, to me, an AT&T problem, but in our situation our livelihoods depended on solving the problem, and spending a couple hundred dollars for it was worth it.

In our house these are referred to as 'Duck and Poop' because they smell like, well, nothing good. The smell literally makes me wretch and I have a high gross-out tolerance. Our dogs LOVE them and bounce around like kangaroos if they think they're going to get some, but we had to move back to the chicken to prevent ourselves from upchucking.

Cars was a lesser Pixar film, and Planes is a Disney-produced spinoff from Planes. What little charm Cars had is reduced even further in this latest effort, and my understanding is that two more Planes sequels are in the works.That being said, this film is inoffensive and mildly watchable, but quickly forgettable and disposable. Our 3.5 year old agreed, and after requesting to watch it a few times Planes quickly fell out of the rotation.

One of our dogs gets an assortment of pills four times a day, and these pill pockets make it a complete non-event. He loves the taste and gulps them down without even knowing or caring that he's also being dosed with medicine. They're a bit pricey, but worth it, highly recommended.

I wish I discovered these laces years ago. I cam across these while looking for some replacement laces for my running sneaks and the idea of not having to tie my sneakers and to have some elasticity in the lace sounded very attractive.  Lets just say that now that I have tried these laces I will never use regular laces in my workout or running sneaks again.  Working out at six in the morning evening tying sneakers can be difficult. I love that can just slip them on and not have to worry about double tying my laces, or hearing long laces flapping around or irritating me during a workout or run, or having to stop because the laces are either too tight or too loose or coming undone.  These laces just give me one less thing to worry about with my running sneakers and they make my sneakers even more comfortable. As far as size, I wear a womans size 9 running sneaker and typically wear just Mizuno's.  I leave the last lace hole free and tie my laces one hole from the top.  I ordered the 36 inch laces and they fit perfectly with just enough room to give some stretch, not be too tight, and allow me to tie off the ends right at the lace hole I prefer.  If any of this sounds good to you give these a try!!

I have used several different OPI foot files and none of them have disappointed.  This foot file does a great job at getting rid of dry skin and helping to keep feet smooth and healthy.  The file is not overly abrasive at all and does not hurt if you want to put a little "umph" into it.  It is nicely shaped and easily glides across the foot.  OPI foot files are far better than the ones you can get in any Walmart or Target.  If you are looking for a good quality foot file that will do the job well and not be useless after just a few uses, I would recommend giving this product a try.

I am an organization freak.  When I discovered these drawer organizers, I ended up purchasing about 10 of them to use in all of my clothing drawers.  They work pretty simply...you squeeze them into a drawer and then the springs expand and the separator expands from one side to another. I haven't had any problems with the 20 or so expanders I have in my drawers.  Sometimes they might shift a little but no big deal. I haven't had any of them break or not work properly.  I use them in all my clothing drawers, to keep stacks of jeans, t-shirts, etc. separated into neat piles and when I pull something from one pile it doesn't disturb the other pile as it stays in place nicely between the separators.  If you want nicely neat and organized drawers these will do the job.

WIN Detergent is the only detergent I have found that can get the stick out of my Under Armour sweat-wicking workout clothes.  Ive tried several others sold on Amazon as well as the brands sold in sport stores, and nothing works better at freshening my clothes than WIN.  I recently purchased this 2 package which included a "green" WIN which I believe is supposed to be fragrance and dye free, and I have seen no difference in the effectiveness of the green WIN over the blue. I feel they both work equally well.  I would recommend anyone who needs a detergent to get sweat or stink of of their clothes should definitely try this product. It is the best Ive found.

Once my neice was about 10 months old and reached the age where she found pleasure in banging on laptop keyboards and opening and closing the laptop screen for enjoyment, I figured it was time to get her a "laptop" of her own play with.  At first this VTech Laptop served the same purpose as a regular laptop...opening, closing, and banging on the buttons. Now 2 months later she is just about 1 year old and starting to actually explore things a little more so she is finding more enjoyment is pressing the buttons to enjoy the sounds, songs, and lights on the laptop toy. This was exactly why I purchased this for her, so as she grew she would be able to use it as a learning tool which is exactly what she is starting to do. This is a great little toy, it's durable and provides plenty of entertainment...not to mention deterring from playing with the big kids laptop!

This cover for the Bose SoundLink III provides a layer of protection and gives the Soundlink a little kick of color. The cover fits snug around the outside of the speaker and zips up along one side to tighten around it. Once you have it on you forget the speaker ever came without it.  This cover is a great way to kick up the look of the speaker and provide a little extra protection from any scratches etc. Very happy with my purchase.

Having a niece that comes to my house all the time, I knew I had to get a couple of cups to keep on hand.  My neice was only 10 months old when I purchased these cups and my sister was amazed on how quick she was able to drink from them since she had only drank from sippy cups prior. Took her 1 night to learn to tip it upward to drink, and best of all, NO MORE JUICE DRIPPING EVERYWHERE!  These cups are very cute, they are GREAT quality, and they do a great job at preventing spills.  They are also very easy to keep clean, you can remove the anti-spill piece from inside the cap when cleaning to make sure every single spot is cleaned well.  Great cups, my sister liked them so much she got some her of her own for her house.

I was in PT for 3 months with multiple tendon injuries from running.  My PT also diagnosed me with a slight case of Plantar Fasciitis.  Nearing the end of my treatment, he had me start doing exercises involving scrunching a towel with my toes to strengthen the tendon along the bottom of my foot.  I knew there had to be a better and easier way to do the exercise and this device was perfect for that need.  I have been using it for about a month and a half, a month of that time being out of PT, and I have noticed a significant difference and no longer have any plantar fascia pain at all.  Once I get back into running I will definitely continue to use this to make sure and keep my feet as healthy as possible.  I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone recovering from Plantar Fascia pain. Great, great tool.

I have 3 different ipods, one being a 2nd generation. When it suddenly struck me I can put cases on them the same way I do my phone, it was harder than I thought to find a case for the 2nd generation since we are now on the 5th generation ipod.  I was able to find this on amazon, a simple pink case.  It fits my ipod perfectly and is very good quality. I have no worries that this will protect my ipod from any scratches or damage. The quality is great and it's cool looking as well.  I am very satisfied with my purchase.

I purchased this for my niece who was 10 months old.  At first it was definitely a challenge to get her used to the head part of the costume, which is separate from the rest and you velcro it under the chin.  I think it felt too heavy on her head or she didnt like the feel of it.  But come Halloween night when my family took my nieces and nephew's trick or treating, it didnt seem to bother her at all. She sat in her stroller as we pushed her around and was completely fine. And of course everyone who saw her got a kick out of the costume with plenty of facebook comments too.  The costume was definitely a hit. It fit well and was good quality. Definitely happy we decided on this.

I purchased this bowl simply to add to my kitchenware to have a nice sturdy plastic bowl.  This bowl is perfect for my plastic bowl needs. The plastic is good quality and I am not worried about it breaking or bending and the choice of colors of the product is just a bonus, as well as the different size options.  I purchased this brand of plastic bowl in 2 different sizes an I am very pleased with my purchase. If you need plastic bowls, whether it be for popcorn movie night or just a mixing bowl, I would recommend these bowls. Great quality and satisfies any plastic bowl needs.

These boot shapers are GREAT at helping boots of all kinds from falling over and losing their shape.  They also help to keep your shoe closet organized as well!! I purchased a few of these in different sizes for my multiple pair of Uggs as well as other tall boots that usually end up slumped to the side in my closet. These are basically just tough, flat pieces of plastic that you curl and form into a tube or tornado shape and insert into the boot. It then expands a bit to hold the boot upright and to hold it's shape the same a leg would.  If you want to retain the shape of your boots and keep your boots upright and organized, these are definitely worth the cost!

I was dealing extremely dry and cracking skin on my pointer finger due to holding a pen and writing so much for my job.  Lotion was not working at repairing and re-moisturizing the skin on my finger so I decided to try this soak.  Within literally 1 time of soaking my hand in this, my finger healed and my hands were extremely soft and healthy.  All it takes is about a teaspoon of this in water and you just stick your hand in a bowl and let it soak and you are left with moisturized, soft, wonderfully feeling hands.  The soak itself smells like orange if you are interested in the smell.  If you're looking for a treat for your hands, or a solution to dry hands, I highly recommend trying out this product. You wont be disappointed!

I have tendonitis in my peronial and posterior tibialis along the bottom of my leg. I actually use Penetrex as a massage cream when working to stretch and massage the tendons.  As a massage cream, it works great and gives good traction along my skin. As far as reducing inflammation, unfortunately I cannot tell. I feel the relief I receive comes from the massage and stretching, the same as when I am working with the physical therapist or massage therapist and they are not using the product.  I do not feel any sort of sensation or anything when I apply it, such as a cooling or warming sensation. Since I need a cream to use for self-massage of my injuries, I just use this and have been for a while. Im not sure if it helps to reduce inflammation at all or not as I have not experienced any miracles or reduced pain and ended up having to go to physical therapy, but if Im going to use something it might as well be this rather than a regular cream. This is my honest review of my experience of the product.

I needed a freezer to keep all my ice packs in so that they were not taking up so much space in my food freezer.  There are not a lot of small freezer's out there but I did find this one.  This bugger is actually more powerfull than my food freezer? As far as being able to keep things frozen, this is more than qualified to do so.  I actually had to turn the freezer settings down a little because it was making my ice packs rock hard.  I keep this in my bedroom and it is extremely quit, I cannot hear it at all other than just a light humming every once in a while for a few moments then it stops.  If there is one negative I can say about it is that it builds up frost fairly quickly if you use it as a freezer.  I have been unplugging it every week or too to shave off the frost that builds up. This appears to be likely due to the hot summer air and humidity surrounding the unit. But this process literally takes me a few minutes to shave off the frost (it actually comes with a little plastic tool for this purpose). But the positive is that this thing gets back to freezing within a couple of hours. The stainless steel look is also much more attrative than a black or white unit. It is really a little power house freezer.  I am very happy with my purchase and if you need a little unit this is a great choice.

This shin wrap would be great...if it stayed cold for longer than a couple minutes. I am talking 5 minutes max that it stays cold after immediate application coming out of the freezer.  I used these on my shins after a work out to help with some tight tendon issues I was having, but they would literally get warm within a few minutes.  Icing requires at least 15 minutes of application to be effective so the fact that they get warm so quickly makes them non-effective if you are using it to ice an injury etc.  It's a great idea...if they could only use material that would remain cold for longer.

I had a pretty bad ankle injury and needed some protection and stabalization. I was surprised to find this type of boot on Amazon as I thought I could only get something like this from the doctor's office.  This aircast boot is about as protective you can get for an ankle injury without a regular cast and crutches.  This is a stepping stone for getting off the crutches and back to normal.  Seeing as though its a heavy boot, I have to say it's pretty comfortable.  You will not walk as though you are completely normal, but it's not hard to do walking around the house or work or whatever with this.  You can adjust the amount of tightness and pressure of the air chambers using a small pump to either increase or depress the amount of air that the chambers hold. So the amount of tightness is really up to your own settings. It's pretty easy to get off and on, once you know exactly how it's done, it can be done quickly.  And the inside lining is washable as well.  I am a size 9 in woman's and my toes barely pop out the end of the boot so it fits well.  This definitely helped in allowing my anklie injury to heel and providing me the mental and physical peace of mind of not hurting it again.  HIghly recommended and now that I have it I plan on keeping it forever...just in case.

This "kit" comes with a regular three blade razor, bikini area moisturizer, as well as the bikini razor.  The bikini razor is basically a razor, with a blade, that has a small comb like head.  So you basically use it the same as you would a regular razor, but the comb prevents you from shaving the area completely.  I would say it works pretty well at keeping the bikini area trim. There are not a lot of options out there for this type of thing, other than a regular sized mens' trimmer, so if you are looking for a cheap and effective option it's worth giving this a shot!

I was looking for hand wraps to go under the new muy thai gloves for use with a heavy bag, without having to get the extremely long wraps that would take longer to put on. Unfortunately, these gel hand wraps were just too thick to fit into my glove. I think you would have to purchase a larger glove than you may otherwise, if you want to fit these in.  I also found that the thumb loop on this glove was pretty small and did not feel comfortable at all, and there was no way to loosen it.  It was way too tight around the base of my thumb, and I am a woman, so I cannot imagine how it would fit for men with larger hands.  Unfortunately, this product did not suit my need as it did not fit in my gloves and the thumb loop was too tight, so I ended up returning and just getting regular hand wraps, which fit fine in my muy thai gloves and wrap much more comfortably around the thumb.

I purchased this to hang a 100 lb heavy bag from the wood beams in my basement.  This hanger is EXTREMELY sturdy.  I will tell you that it was a slight challenge to get the thick long screws that hold this in place fully screwed into the wood beam, just because they are so long and thick.  I used my power drill to get it most of the way in but had more luck using a regular screw driver by hand to finish getting it fully installed.  I opted to go with this hanger over the one sold in the stores for heavy bags simply because this is made to hold more weight.  It has been holding up that 100 lb heavy bag with no problem and can easily absorb any impact or movement of the bag while it is in use.  This is a great quality product and I would recommend it anyone needing a hanger.

I had a mini boy version of this toy (you know, the kind from the 80's) on my fridge as a magnet and my nephew immediately wanted to play with it. I came onto Amazon.com to see if they had these old school toys and sure enough, they had the boy version.  Of course, I cannot get my nephew a new gift without getting his little sister one as well, so I was pleasantly surprised when I found this "Harriet" girl version of this toy.  I was able to get them each their own and my niece Sophia loved being able to make hair-do's on Harriet.  A simply old school toy and great for the price!!

I am a generally healthy person. I work out 90 minutes a day, 5 days a week, and eat healthy on a daily basis. I pay attention more to calories and fat than I do carbs, so I decided to give this a try to see if it would give me an extra boost in my diet by blocking some of those carbs that I dont pay attention to. I have been taking this for over a month, 2 LARGE capsules with every meal 3 times a day, and I honestly have no noticed any difference in my weight.  I am basically taking these just because I paid for the 2 pack but once I run out I will not be purchasing again. If you're already a healthy person it is probably not worth trying this product.

Every since I discovered Drymax socks they are all I wear for white sports/running socks.  Whether you purchase the thicker Drymax sock or the Hyper Thin socks, these are the most durable and comfortable sports socks I have ever worn.  I have probably purchased at least 20 pair of thin, medium, or thick versions, which I wear on a daily basis for my workouts as well as when I wear sneakers outside of working out, and I have NEVER had a single pair get even the slightest bit of a hole or lose string.  They fit nice and snug and are extremely comfortable as well.  If you're looking for the perfect pair of white socks that will last forever give Drymax a try. They are definitely worth the cost.

I have been using Frontline plus on my dog for all of his 6 years of life and he has NEVER had a single flea or tick on him. He attends doggy daycare where they have had flea outbreaks in the past but he has never been effected. Based on this history of the product working well and preventing any flea issues I feel it is definitely worth it to continue to use this product every month. I have also compared the benefits of this product with other flea and tick products and this seems to be the best you can get. The health of and well being of my dog is just as important as my own so I will continue to use this product as it has been successful for my dogs whole life and I have confidence that the product truly works.

This product is a must have if keeping your dogs teeth clean and healthy is a priority.  I use the CET toothpaste on my dog and then I use an oral sponge and dip it in this rinse and clean his teeth and gums with the rinse after using the toothpaste. This not only helps to clean off any remaining toothpaste but it rinses out his mouth, freshens his breath, and gives double assurance to me that I am giving my dogs teeth and gums the best home cleaning possible.  My dog is 6 years old and I brush his teeth at least 4 times a week and his teeth are still white and healthy.

I have been dealing with achilles, calf, heel, and foot pain for almost 2 years.  I finally decided to purchase a night splint to see if that would help with the healing and pain.  This product works well at keeping your foot in dorsi-flex throughout the night, keeping your calf, achilles, and fascia at a stretch to prevent them from shrinking and stiffening up during the night.  The biggest challenge for me is after a couple of hours of sleeping I start to feel like it's squeezing my foot too tight and I suddenly wake up and need to rip it off my foot in urgency feeling like it's cutting off my circulation.  It is not too tight when I initially put it on but the discomfort I feel in the middle of the night makes me take it off.  Unfortunately, this type of boot is really the only way to keep your foot in dorsi-flex while sleeping so I would say its definitely worth giving it a try.  Even though I cannot make it through the full night wearing this, even just the few hours a night I can wear it has helped with the pain I feel when I get out of bed in the morning.

I am not sure if there are any other products out there that are meant to help with administering pills to your pet but there doesnt need to be any other products because these work perfect.  Any time my dog has every had to take medicine, he gladly does so easily when they are hidden in these Pill Pockets.  He enjoys the flavor of all of them...peanut butter, chicken, and hickory smoke, and looks at them just like a treat.  Thanks goodness for this product because when I have tried to hide a pill in his food he just works his way around it.  I have also found that these are much cheaper on Amazon.com then in Petco and PetSmart so I will definitely purchase them here if needed!

Scivation Xtend Intra-Workout Catalyst is the best tasting intra - workout drink I have tried (and Ive tried them all).  My workout consists of a mix of running, elliptical,  and weight training at a high pace over a 90 minute period.  This product quenches my thirst during my workout, keeps me hydrated, and keeps me going throughout my workout without making me feel jittery.  I never thought I would like the green apple flavor but I previously purchased the sample packs and I loved it so I purchased the full sized one.  It has a great green apple flavor without being sour like a jolly rancher.  If you are looking for an alternative to your standard gatorade/powerade products I would definitely give this product a try.  It will do everything you need it to, to keep you going throughout a workout and tastes great at the same time.

I have been using these for a while to freeze meats and have recently taken notice to the fact that my meat products are getting freezer burnt due to the loss of suction in these bags once they are in the freezer. When I initially bad the meat and use the suction cup to suck all of the air out of a the bad, it does just that, but once its in the freezer for a week or too it appears that the suction is being lost and the air in the bag is causing freezer burn. I have since decided to purchase a Foodsaver to seal my products. It is definitely worth the cost and the upgrade and works much better than these. I have also recently realized that all of the stores in my area...grocery stores, Target, and Walmart, which is why I purchased them on Amazon, but Im not sure if they are being discontinued. There are not many choices out there for vacuum products and freezer storage but if you can afford it I would definitely recommend the Foodsaver over this product.

I have been using CET toothpaste on my dog for years.  I have used the chicken and beef flavors in the past but decided to give this vanilla mint flavor a try with him.  Even though I brush his teeth 4 times a week for years, he still gives me a hard time and tries to shrug away every time I have to brush his teeth.  I can honestly say that I swear he actually enjoys this Vanilla mint flavor toothpaste.  He is not giving me as hard of a time when I brush his teeth with this and seems to actually like it.  As far as the effectiveness of the product, I have been using this for years and my six year old dog has whiter teeth than many people, so I would say it's working well when used frequently.  If you care about your dogs oral health definitely give this toothpaste a try. I have found that CET products are the best oral health products that you can find for dogs.

Adora calcium chocolate disks feel more like a treat than a supplement.  It satisfies any chocolate craving while giving the added benefit of being a source of calcium.  I have tried both the milk chocolate and dark chocolate and they both tastes very good.  Most calcium supplements come in the form of chalky tasting chews so this is a great option for anyone who is looking for a calcium supplement and likes chocolate. You would never know this was made to be a supplement product and not just piece of chocolate candy.  No chalky or medicinal taste at all...just chocolate.  Definitely worth trying if you need to add some extra calcium to your diet.

I find this product to be the most effective if I have a headache at night. My headaches are almost always supplemented by sinus pressure and my sinuses completely close up on me which just adds more pressure to my head. This product kicks both the headache and opens up my sinuses at the same time. Note that it is a nyquil product, so it is going to put you into a deep sleep at the same time. As long as you are ok with that, if you need a nighttime headache/sinus product that will kick the pain and help you get a good nights' sleep I would definitely recommend trying this product.Comment

WIN detergent has proven to me to be the best at getting out the stink and sweat from my workout clothes.  I wear all under armour sweat wicking workout clothes and anyone who wears this type of material knows it is great at wicking sweat but can definitely stink after.  Regular detergent just doesnt do the trick with this type of clothing.  I have also tried several other workout clothes detergents and WIN definitely works the best. My stinky sweaty workout clothes come out smelling fresh and clean with no trace of stink at all.These individual packets sold here are purely for either convenience or if you want something easy to bring on the go.  If you are just looking for WIN detergent for at home use I would recommend getting the bottles, simply because it is more wallet friendly and these packets you really have to strain them good to make sure you get all the detergent out and get your money's worth.Either way, WIN detergent is a great product. I would definitely recommend this brand above all others for the purpose of washing any stinky clothing at all.

I have a small dog who is 6 years old and I have never been able to find a small toothbrush that was soft enough to not bother him or cause him discomfort when I brush his teeth.  These oral care swabs have been a life saver. They are sturdy enough to get a good scrub on his teeth and clean them well, yet they are soft enough to not give him the prickly feeling of a toothbrush and cause him to try to run for the hills.  I can get in a good 5 tooth brushings per swab before I throw it out and open a new one.  I am sure these swabs have many uses, for people with mouth or teeth surgeries or sensitivities.  This "Toothette" brand in particular is probably as good as you can find as far as quality goes for this type of product.

I had Dr.s instructions to cover a wound that included using surgical tape, so I came onto Amazon and found this 3M surgical tape.  This tape is very reliable and high quality.  It it slightly stretchy and has a very strong hold.  The portions of the tape that I had to stick to my skin (foot) stayed on extremely well.  It did come off when wet (most tapes will) but other than that it stayed in place and adhered well as I needed it to without having to worry about it coming off. It is also very comfortable on the skin, likely due to the slight stretch it has.  I am very happy with my purchase and will keep this on hand for my future first aid needs.

I have been experiencing heel pain for almost 2 years from achilles issues that have spread into my heel. I have tried every type of insert out there and Dr. Scholl's Hell Pain Relief Orthotics is the only thing that has given me relief.  Especially on days where I am out and about walking around all day, I used to limp around at the end of the day and now, with slipping these into whatever shoes Im wearing they just absorb the impact and provide cushioning to my heels so I can walk around all day and feel no pain at all.  I was so impressed with the relief I experienced with these that I now have four pairs.  If you have hell pad pain I would definitely recommend trying these out. A simple but effective product!!

If you are purchasing this it is most likely because you have the Fluidmaster toilet cleaner installed and need the bleach refills. I would just like to clarify, based on lack of information provided in the listing and conflicting reviews, that this product comes with 2 bleach refills. When I was purchasing the product I did not see anywhere that it specified how many refills came in the package so I am providing this information to hopefully help others. Also just to note, it is extremely easy to install the refill. Just twist the old one and take it out and then insert the refill and twist the top tight. Very easy to replace the old with the new. These do a great job at keeping the toilet bowl clean in between giving it a good scrub cleaning. Ive been using these for a couple of years because I have found they work far better than toilet tabs or other everyday toilet fresheners.

I have had achilles, arch, heel, and ankle pain from running for over a year.  I am finally getting back into running after a year off due to an achilles injury.  When I wake up int he morning Im still dealing with limping around until everything loosens up. These Feetures Plantar Fascitis Sleeves have been a God send at relieving pain in all areas of my feet.  I wear these under my socks after showering in the morning and the compression helps to relieve the pain in my feet.  I wear them most of the day until I run and sometimes at night too.  These also work better than compression socks because compression socks target more of the calf and lower leg than the foot itself.  All I can say is if you have any type of foot pain...plantar fascitis, arch pain, achilles pain, heel pain, or ankle pain, you may want to give these compression sleeves a shot because they have been so effective for me I have 3 pairs and wear them almost every day, and I will continue to do so until I am fully healed from my injuries. Excellent product.

I bought this because I figured it would work with sweet potatoes since it is considered "heavy duty" and other reviewers said they made it work with sweet potatoes.  On my first use, I split the sweet potato down the middle to make it easier to push through the fry cutter.  I didnt have trouble with the effort it took to push the sweet potato through but it did not cut the sweet potato well.  It made it about 75% through and turned the last part of each sweet potato fry into a shredded mess.  Also, the piece of metal that you lay the potato in ended up getting bent on the first shot.  After being left with messy sweet potato fries, I had to figure out how to clean the fry cutter.  The only way to do so was to remove the end piece and when I did that the whole thing came apart.  After my first experience I decided to return the product.  Not only did it not cut sweet potatoes well but it was way too much work for cleaning it afterward and attempting to put it back together.  I ended up getting an email from New Star about why I returned it and when I gave them the information in this review they said that this product was not meant for sweet potatoes and as far as cleaning, it is meant for more commercial use where it would be used in a kitchen etc. where it would be used multiple times before cleaning.  This may cut regular potatoes well but I would not recommend it if your sole purpose is for sweet potato fries.

I am a pretty healthy person but I allow myself a little wiggle room to eat what I want on the weekends. Of course eating take out even once a week or bending the healthy food rules can leave you feeling bloated and icky. This fitmiss cleanse really does what it says it does. If you bend the rules on healthy eating or just feel like you need to flush the toxins out of your body then give this a try. I did not have any side effects from this but the way it "cleanses" you is by making you have to go to the bathroom. I especially found that a day after I take this, when I work out it seems to almost kick this into gear when your body temperature rises. So yes, you will have to go to the bathroom more than usual so plan for that when you take it, but it really does feel like your flushing all the junk out of your body and it also helps to get rid of bloating really well too. I like the results of this so much I bought a second bottle and just use it when I feel I need to flush myself of unhealthy toxins etc.

I am always on the look out for sugar free low calorie drink mixes to add to water.  I have tried everything out there.  One day Target had these boxes on sale for $1 so I decided to try it out.  This is without a doubt my favorite drink mix out there because the strawberry flavor is DELICIOUS.  Yes, the fact that it only comes with 6 packets to a box makes it more expensive than other mixes but to me it's worth it.  Unfortunately, Target did not continue to sell these so I looked on line and stocked up from Amazon.  If you're looking to try a new low calorie sugar free drink mix, and you like strawberry flavor, definitely try this out.  I have to limit myself to only having these on certain days of else I would drink them all week and run out of them quickly. Delicious!!

I have multiple different types of Drymax socks.  I have thick and thin ankle Drymax, no show Drymax, no show with tab Drymax...the are my go to socks for running and working out and when I need white socks to wear with sneakers. Drymax socks are extremely comfortable and very durable, great qualify socks.  I havent had a single pair get a hole in them after over a year's use.  I decided to try out a pair of higher Drymax Run Crew Socks for the winter when I need a sock higher than my ankles.  These socks are just as comfortable and durable as the other pairs I have.  They are thick enough to provide a bit of warmth but still very comfortable and thin enough to wear during a workout and with sneakers.  I have also worn them in my snow boots and they hold up great and dont fall down.  Drymax are the best quality socks I have come across. I highly recommend any socks from their line.

Twingings Green Tea is the best tasting Green Tea in my opinion.  I enjoy it better than Tazo Green Tea. The main reason that differentiates this from others is that it does not have a bad aftertaste.  It is smooth, fresh, and flavorful tasting and is an alternative source of energy and antioxidants if you want a break from coffee or don't drink coffee at all.  I have only drank Twinings Green Tea hot but I can honestly say that I think it would also be very good cold for anyone who enjoys cold green tea.  I would highly recommend to anyone who is searching for a great green tea in k-cup form that you try out this Twinings Green Tea.  This will be the brand I purchase for green tea from here on out.

I have constant tight shoulders and neck.  I have an electric heat pad but sometimes I dont feel like sitting around with a cord hanging off of me. I also needed something more portable that I could throw on at my work desk if needed.  I decided to give this a shot due to the shape of wrap. It is heavy enough that it sits comfortably on your shoulders and neck and won't fall off without having to hold it, even if you walk around with it.  It covers the shoulders and neck area nicely and works well at loosening up muscles.  I put it in the microwave for 3 minutes and that's about as long as I can heat it without it becoming too hot to use.  Once heated it does give off a smell that to me is mostly chamomile scented to me.  It is noticeable but I dont like it or dislike it so it doesnt bother me.  The only negative thing I can say about it is that it only stays warm for about 20 minutes.  I usually like to use it longer so I just reheat it for another 3 minutes if it cools off to much.  That to me is kind of expected if you are going to use a microwavable wrap instead of an electric one.  All in all, I like it and Im glad I purchased it. I think the positives of the product outweigh the fact that I have to reheat it a couple of times to get a good hour of use out of it to help relax my muscles.

It is not necessary to use these freshening discs with the Bissell Steam Mop but I love the way it leaves the room smelling fresh and clean after mopping. These only come with 8 discs per package but I get 2 uses out of each disc to get the most of out them. I just remove the disc from the mop head after mopping and set it aside to put in a clean mop head for the next time.  To me, the fresh clean smell that these leave in the room after mopping is worth the costs and just adds to the clean feeling that is left after using the Steam Mop. I have not been able to find these in any local stores so I buy a couple boxes at a time from Amazon when they are available.  Definitely worth it for the fresh clean smell!

I had 3 Swiffer SwiftJet mop's and all three of them the handle snapped and broke. After the third I decided it was time to upgrade so I decided to try the Bissell Powerfresh Steam Mop. This comes with 2 different mop heads, one with groves and the other with no groves.  They are fairly thick and both machine washable.  It also comes with scent discs that you can slip into the mop head for extra fragrance.  When you plug in the Steam Mop it begins to heat up and probably takes 30-45 seconds to do so before you can choose a steam level preference and start using it.  I always use the highest steam setting as it seems to be the most effective.  Once the mop starts emitting steam you have to give a few seconds for the steam to seep through the mop head cloth and make it wet enough to push around. You do have to be patient with this Steam Mop and move it back and forth kind of slowly to be most effective and allow the steam to penetrate the area fully.As far as performance, this works great at cleaning my floors and the mop head is always very dirty after use.  The steam is especially good at removing any spill spots that may have been missed during clean up.  It is very easy to use, all you do is fill up the water container, put on the mop head, plug in and go.  I do enjoy using the scented discs as well and have purchased more because they leave a pleasant clean and refreshing smell.  The only negative thing I can say about this is the cord is not very long.  I have mop the hallway and kitchen that are connected and I have to end up moving the cord to another plug and then waiting for it to heat back up to finish the room.Other than that, I am far more satisfied with this product than using a Swiffer SwiftJet Mop.  My mother told me she was still cleaning her hardwood floors Cinderella style so I ended up purchasing her one of these for Christmas.  Cleans well and easy to use, all in all a good choice for a steam mop.

I purchased a LeapPad 2 with a couple of games each for my niece and nephew for Christmas.  I immediately though to myself that they could easily lose the games if they had nowhere to put them as they are 4 and 5 years old and the games are very small. I also wanted the to have some protection for their LeapPad and somewhere safe to keep it when they weren't using it.  I purchased a LeapFrog LeapPad Carrying Case for each of them.  First, I want to say that even with the protective gel case over the LeapPad it still fits fine in this case.  That was something I was wondering when I purchased these cases but it does fit fine with the gel case on.  There are six slots for games to be held on the left inside of the case but they have stretchy bands over the slots so I think you could slide at least 2 games in per slot if necessary. The case itself is very good quality and sturdy.  When they opened their Christmas gifts I immediately  helped them unpackage everything and put their games and LeapPad in the case and show them how they should take care of their new presents.  I think they actually liked having the carrying case and being able to take things out and put them back by themselves and carry their little case around.  All in all this is a great product. Very sturdy and definitely a needed supplement to the LeapPad to protect the investment.

If you are someone who finds yourself forgetting to turn off or down the heat when you leave or go to bed, therefore wasting money on oil or gas, then I highly recommend investing in a programmable thermostat.  That is why I decided to purchase this product...after constantly forgetting to turn off the heat at night or when I leave and being frustrated in the morning because I know it's a waste of money.  I decided on this LUX Thermostat due to the high number of positive reviews and I also didnt find it necessary to purchase an extremely expensive product.  I LOVE this thermostat and I wish I would have purchased 2 during the lightening deal I found on Amazon.First, it was super easy to install. I just shut off the power in the room I was installing, removed the old thermostat from the wall and wires, connected the wires to the new thermostat per the instructions (very easy to understand), drilled the backing into the wall, snapped the front panel on...power back on and voila. All I had to do at that point is program it.  It allows you to set a morning, day, evening, and night setting for each day of the week.  You set the time and temperature for each setting, for instance I have mine set for the heat to turn down to 60 degrees at 9:30 (so the heat just turns off and stays off unless the room gets colder than 60 degrees) and then for the heat to turn on to get back up to 68 degrees at 7:30 in the morning. I set mine for a lower temperature during the day when Im not around and then to turn back up to 68 degrees at 6 pm.  You also have the ability to override the programmed settings and change the temperature at any point and it will stay however you put it until the next time setting.This has been a very convenient product to have.  I dont have to worry about forgetting to turn the heat off and wasting money.  It is also much more attractive than a standard thermostat as well.  All in all, this is a great choice for a programmable thermostat and well worth the investment.

I started taking Butterbur extract after reading multiple health articles that said it has been shown to help with migraine's. I get severe migraine's that last a minimum of 48 hours and have been getting them since I was 5 years old. I have been taking this product for over a year and I can honestly say that my migraine frequency and severity has been cut in half AT LEAST, if not more. I cannot speak for the effectiveness of this product for other health issues, but if you are looking into it in regards to migraine prevention and I can say that I have seen an absolute positive effect while using this product, lessening the amount of migraine's I get and when I do get them they are not as severe and they do not last as long. Very happy to have found this product and I will continue to take this to help deter my migraines.

I bought my nephew and niece each a LeapPad2 for Christmas and knew right away I needed to get them a cover to protect the product, the same way I do my ipad and phone.  This Gel Skin is definitely a high quality product.  It is thick and durable and covers the LeapPad enough to prevent scratches on the body of the tablet.  It will also provide SOME absorption of shock if they drop the tablet as it is like a thick rubbery material.  I put it on for them right away when they opened their Christmas gift and it fits nice and snug like a glove.  This is probably as good as it can get for protection of the LeapPad 2 and I highly recommend it for anyone buying the LeapPad for a child, simply to protect the investment.

These wipes work well at cleaning off the lenses of my glasses.  They dont leave any streaks or anything and they make my glasses crystal clear.  The one thing I will tell you is after you wipe your glasses there are wet beads that always remain on your lenses from the wipe so you will need a microfiber cloth or something of that sort to dry them and as long as you use a dry wipe that doesn't leave any residue you will end up with crystal clear lenses. The product is probably as good as you can find for lens wipes though and the single packets work well so you dont end up with dried out wipes. Good product.

I had a work project that was causing me to have to print immense amounts of paperwork.  I had purchased 1 of the regular Epson ink cartridges off of Amazon but when I knew it was going to take me multiple cartridges to get through my project I did some research on Amazon and based on the good reviews of Blake Printing Supply, decided to take a chance and purchase this 6 cartridge remanufactured pack. I will never pay full price for ink cartridges again.  Although this was not prime eligible I still received it within just a few days.  I have gone through 4 of the cartridges and I did not have a single issue with any of them.  They all worked fine in my Epson printer and I saw no difference in the printing quality compared to original Epsom ink.  What else do you need? Good seller, fast shipment, reliable product, and 6 for the price of 1.  I will definitely purchase from Blake printing again next time I run out of ink.

I have problems when I sleep of my nose becoming so dried out that I get nose bleeds, even in the humid summer.  I was looking for a product to help with that so I decided to try this out.  It's a pretty simple product but it works.  I use it to keep the inside of my nose moisturized at night.  I dont notice the product at all and it doesnt cause any irritation or anything. It doesnt even really have a smell. It just takes a dab and the aloe gel just keeps your nose from getting dry.  It's a good product and it does what it's supposed to do.  If have issues with having a dry nose give this a shot.

I have purchased both these shorter and the CEP tall compression socks and I definitely find the tall socks to be more effective.  I thought maybe these would provide more compression in the foot area but the only real compression is around the angle and lower leg.  If you need or want compression in your ankle area this will provide you that, but if you want compression around your foot or calves, these won't work.  At least the tall ones provide compression around the full calf, which is effective during and after workouts to enhance blood flow and recovery.  It all depends on what you're looking for in the product but I was expecting more compression in the foot area but these only compress the ankle area. I still like CEP products a lot but I"ll stick with the tall socks.

I have been struggling with achilles issues for a year now. I was a 7 mile a day runner and had to completely stop running for the past year to allow my achilles to heel.  When I started to slowly run again I could feel the pain coming back so I backed off for a couple months.  I did some research and found this CEP Rx Achilles Brace.  I like CEP's compression products a lot and know they have high quality products so I decided to give this brace a try, despite the steep price. I actually ordered 2 of them, one for each foot.  When I initially tried them on I was surprised that they didnt provide more compression so I contacted CEP and they informed me that this product is more for support than compression and is not meant to be as tight as their socks and other compression products.  The first time I ran with this brace I IMMEDIATELY felt a difference.  The gel material that surrounds the achilles on the back of the brace helps to keep it supported and tight enough to now allow a lot of movement, therefore preventing injury.  It also helps to prevent any irritation of the achilles. I also have not experienced an post-workout swelling or inflammation of my achilles as well. I honestly wish I had found this a year ago.  Not only do I feel the difference during and after my workouts, but I feel more confident wearing this knowing I have the support. This is a great product and definitely worth the price.

I purchased this to add to my tools to help relieve my achilles pain and tightness.  It definitely feels good, is easy to use, and helps to stretch out the tendons and muscles in the bottom of of the foot.  I have tried to put it in the freezer after seeing other reviews that the using it cold provides extra relief but I dont feel it gets very cold and the little amount of cold it absorbs fades pretty fast.  It is smaller than I thought from the picture, about the size of a hot dog bun in length, but it's fine for use on on the bottom of the foot. If you need something to throw on the floor and roll your foot around on to relieve foot tension, plantar fascitis, or achilles pain, this is a nice little tool to have on hand. You can use it at home or throw it under your desk at work or wherever and get a little foot pain relief at any time.

Ive had achilles tendonitis for about a year and getting inserts was one of the things I learned I needed to help support my arch and heel.  Last year, I researched the Superfeet line an ended up getting the berry ones because I thought they were more tailored toward women.  After using them a few months I didnt feel like they were helping so I decided to try Sole inserts.  The Sole inserts you heat up in the oven and they are supposed to mold to the shape of your feet. I liked them at first but the more I wore them the problem I found is that they felt really bulky.  They made my running and workout sneakers tight and uncomfortable. I recently decided to give Superfeet a try again but get the highly rated Green Superfeet after seeing on their website that there actually is a different in the amount of support from Green to Berry. Now I wish I would have gotten Green a year ago.  These inserts have completely extinguished the achilles and heel pain I feel during a workout. I can't even believe it.  They are amazingly supportive but at the same time they do not make my sneakers tight and uncomfortable.  I already ordered a second pair and will probably put them in every shoe that allows for replaceable inserts.

All this is, is a strap with some loops in it. That being said, it is so incredibly helpful to use during stretching exercise.  I am and always have been a very active and healthy individual, but stretching has always been my weak spot.  I finally decided I needed to start integrating stretching into my day for my own good and due to constant tight muscles.  Because I am so inflexible, I decided to get this strap to help me out a bit and now I use it every day.  I use it to help stretch out my legs, calves, quads, and any muscle I can in my legs.  But the biggest help has been with my upper back and shoulder tightness.  I basically go out onto my deck and throw this strap around the deck rail and lean back and put all my weight backward while looping the straps around my arms and it stretches out all of the muscles in my upper back. It has helped with the tightness in my upper back and shoulders IMMENSELY. Far more than even massages have helped, stretching has provided far more relief and this simple strap helps me to do the stretches I can't do on my own.  This is a great supplement to a stretching routine and I highly recommend it.  It's simple but extremely helpful and effective with stretching.

I purchased this Stick to help me with my stretching and loosening up my calf and quad muscles.
